original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: gal te de lta na dag de nyid kyi rgyun las /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dag de nyid kyi rgyun las /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts the example that is well known in the world,

original: 'di la dpe cig yang dag ste //
analyzed: 'di la dpe cig yang dag ste //
translated: where it is said, ‚ÄúThere is one example for this,

original: de ni nam mkha'i khams su brjod //üîΩces 'jig rten na grags pa nyid dper byas pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de ni nam mkha'i khams su brjod // ces 'jig rten na grags pa nyid dper byas pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: which is called the element of space.‚Äù

original: de ni phyogs gcig 'dra ba'i sgo nas dper byas pa ste /
analyzed: de ni phyogs gcig 'dra ba'i sgo nas dper byas pa ste /
translated: That example is given in terms of similarity in one respect.

original: mdo 'di nyid las kyang /üîΩde ltar dper sbyar ba'i don rgyas par ston pa ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las kyang / de ltar dper sbyar ba'i don rgyas par ston pa ni /
translated: And in this very sutra,

analyzed: de kho na nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin te zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe element of space is not a real entity.‚Äù

original: tshig gi don ni @255a * //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni @255a * //
translated: The meaning of the words

original: phal cher shes par zad do //üîΩme'i khams dang 'brel pa'i phyir sa ni mi tshig ste zhes pa'i don ni /
analyzed: phal cher shes par zad do // me'i khams dang 'brel pa'i phyir sa ni mi tshig ste zhes pa'i don ni /
translated: is mostly understood.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis mi 'tshig ces pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis mi 'tshig ces pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe earth is not burned because of its connection with the fire element‚Äù is that it is not burned by the power of its connection with that.

original: sa'i rang bzhin mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i rang bzhin mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: It does not abandon its nature as earth.

original: don 'di yang sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: don 'di yang sngar bstan zin to //
translated: This meaning has already been explained above.

original: rnam pa gcig tu ni smin par byed pa me'i khams kyang sa la tshang ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu ni smin par byed pa me'i khams kyang sa la tshang ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: In another way, the ripening element is complete in the earth.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du mi rtsom ste zhes pa ni de dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa rnams la phan mi 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du mi rtsom ste zhes pa ni de dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa rnams la phan mi 'dogs pa ste /
translated: It does not begin another nature, because it does not help those that exist in the manner of being incompatible with it, not coexisting with it.

original: bye ma rnams ni bye ma'i gnas nyid do zhes pa rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyi gnas yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bye ma rnams ni bye ma'i gnas nyid do zhes pa rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyi gnas yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The sand is the abode of the sand, that is, it is the abode of effects that are similar to it.

original: gzhan yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ni phri ba dang bsnan pas bri ba dang 'phel bar mi mngon pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ni phri ba dang bsnan pas bri ba dang 'phel bar mi mngon pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the sand of the Ganges is not seen to diminish or increase by taking away or adding.

original: chos ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is the Dharma that has become the nature of intuition.

original: sems can gyi sdug bsngal dag gis gzir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi sdug bsngal dag gis gzir zhes pa ni /
translated: It is oppressed by the sufferings of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar bu gcig pa na ba'i pha ma lta bur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bu gcig pa na ba'i pha ma lta bur ro //
translated: It is like a father or mother whose only child is sick.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi ngang gis smon lam gyi bde ba mi 'dor ro zhes pa ni thugs chos kyi dbyings las ma g-yengs par lhun gyis grub pa'i smon lam gyi bde ba mi 'dor te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi ngang gis smon lam gyi bde ba mi 'dor ro zhes pa ni thugs chos kyi dbyings las ma g-yengs par lhun gyis grub pa'i smon lam gyi bde ba mi 'dor te /
translated: The line ‚Äúthe bliss of aspiration is not abandoned in the realm of reality‚Äù means that the bliss of spontaneous aspiration is not abandoned without the mind straying from the realm of reality.

original: sems can gyi sdug bsngal la mtshan mar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab zhes pa ni lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa bstan pa rnams kyang brgyud nas mya ngan las 'das pa mthar thug pa la /
analyzed: sems can gyi sdug bsngal la mtshan mar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro // mya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab zhes pa ni lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa bstan pa rnams kyang brgyud nas mya ngan las 'das pa mthar thug pa la /
translated: This is because there is no observation of the suffering of sentient beings as having characteristics.

original: gzhol zhing 'bab par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhol zhing 'bab par ston pa'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúit flows into nirvana‚Äù means that the vehicles of the gods, Brahma, and so on, which are taught, are shown to flow into and lead to the ultimate nirvana.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa yin pas /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa yin pas /
translated: The line ‚Äúgreat intelligence‚Äù and so on teaches that because the nirvana of the buddhas is permanent,

original: 'khor ba 'dus byas rnams la ldan pa'i don 'ga' zhig /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dus byas rnams la ldan pa'i don 'ga' zhig /
translated: some meaning of the term ‚Äúendowed‚Äù in relation to the compounded things of samsara

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dpe nyid du mi 'jug par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dpe nyid du mi 'jug par ston pa'o //
translated: is not applicable to the transcendent ones.

original: de'i don yang 'khor ba'i 'dus byas pa yin bas /
analyzed: de'i don yang 'khor ba'i 'dus byas pa yin bas /
translated: The meaning of that is that because the compounded things of samsara are impermanent,

original: 'jig pa'i chos can nyid de dag la ldan pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can nyid de dag la ldan pa'i don yin la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúendowed‚Äù is that they have the nature of destruction.

original: de 'dra ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la med ces pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not have such a nature.

original: gal te de ltar na 'khor ba'i thog ma'i mtha' zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'khor ba'i thog ma'i mtha' zhes pa ste /
translated: If that is so, then the beginning of sa·πÉsƒÅra is the end.

original: de la thog ma ni sngon gyi mtha' yin la /
analyzed: de la thog ma ni sngon gyi mtha' yin la /
translated: The beginning is the prior limit.

original: thog ma de'i mtha' ni phyi ma'i mtha' ste de dag shes pa med de /
analyzed: thog ma de'i mtha' ni phyi ma'i mtha' ste de dag shes pa med de /
translated: The end of that beginning is the later limit. He does not know those.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pas /
translated: Therefore, since sa·πÉsƒÅra has no beginning or end,

original: ji ltar 'jig pa nyid 'khor ba la ldan pa'i don du bshad de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig pa nyid 'khor ba la ldan pa'i don du bshad de /
translated: how can the meaning of ‚Äúendowed‚Äù be explained in terms of sa·πÉsƒÅra‚Äôs destruction?

original: tha ma med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: tha ma med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it has no end.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: spyir rigs tsam la thog ma dang @255b tha ma med kyang /
analyzed: spyir rigs tsam la thog ma dang @255b tha ma med kyang /
translated: In general, there is no beginning or end in mere the class of phenomena.

original: dngos po'i dbang du byas na skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos dang 'brel pas so //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang du byas na skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos dang 'brel pas so //
translated: However, from the perspective of things, they are related to the phenomena of arising and destruction.

original: chad pa ni 'jig pa nyid kyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: chad pa ni 'jig pa nyid kyi rnam grangs so //
translated: Annihilation is a synonym for destruction.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor ba la phyi ma'i mtha' med na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor ba la phyi ma'i mtha' med na /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, if sa·πÉsƒÅra has no later end‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar srog chags rnams thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur zhes rgol ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar srog chags rnams thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur zhes rgol ba'o //
translated: How can living beings attain liberation, nirvana?

original: lan gyi don ni khams gsum spyi tsam gyi dbang du byas na 'khor ba tshad med pas phyi ma'i mtha' med kyang /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni khams gsum spyi tsam gyi dbang du byas na 'khor ba tshad med pas phyi ma'i mtha' med kyang /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that, in terms of the general three realms, samsara is limitless, so there is no end.

original: gang zag bye brag pa 'ga' zhig gi dbang du byas na thar pa mthong la /
analyzed: gang zag bye brag pa 'ga' zhig gi dbang du byas na thar pa mthong la /

original: de yang phyin ci log nye bar zhi ba tsam du ma byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log nye bar zhi ba tsam du ma byas pa yin pas /
translated: Moreover, it is not merely the pacification of error.

original: 'jig pa'i chos dang 'brel pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos dang 'brel pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it is not related to the dharma of destruction.

original: / da bas na rnam pa thams cad du 'khor ba la mtha' med ces bya ba'i gtam ni cir yang dgos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / da bas na rnam pa thams cad du 'khor ba la mtha' med ces bya ba'i gtam ni cir yang dgos pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the statement that samsara is limitless in every way is not necessary at all,

original: don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of meaning.

original: don dam par na de dag thams cad rtogs pas brtags pa'i rnam grangs yin zhes pa ste shes par za dang // gang gis gang g'a'i bye mnyam du ;
analyzed: don dam par na de dag thams cad rtogs pas brtags pa'i rnam grangs yin zhes pa ste shes par za dang // gang gis gang g'a'i bye mnyam du ;
translated: In the ultimate, all of those are conceptual imputations, so they should be understood as synonyms.

original: / zhas pa ni /
analyzed: / zhas pa ni /
translated: The line ‚ÄúBy whom, for as many eons as there are sands in the Ganges‚Äù is as follows.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar phyogs 'ga' zhig nas 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar phyogs 'ga' zhig nas 'dra ba'o //
translated: As previously explained, they are similar in some respects.

original: 'jigs med tshul gyis mthar thug pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs med tshul gyis mthar thug pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa'o //
translated: The fearless way is the permanent non-abiding nirvana.

original: nyes pa thams cad ni rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad ni rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All faults are conceptualizations and so forth.

original: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: Then again, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gsal bar ston te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gsal bar ston te /
translated: Impermanence is clarified from another perspective.

original: de'i don yang chos thams cad ni 'di lta ste dge ba dang mi dge zhes pa la /üîΩdge ba ni pha la phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong la dge sbyong du 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i chos dge ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang chos thams cad ni 'di lta ste dge ba dang mi dge zhes pa la / dge ba ni pha la phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong la dge sbyong du 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i chos dge ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: All phenomena are like this, i.e., virtuous and non-virtuous.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las ji skad du bshad ba rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las ji skad du bshad ba rnams te /
translated: Virtuous is the virtuous dharma of apprehending the father as father, apprehending the ascetic as an ascetic, and so forth, up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha, as they are explained in the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras.

original: 'tsho ba nye bar zhi bar byed pas dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba nye bar zhi bar byed pas dge ba'o //
translated: They are virtuous because they pacify the life of samsara.

original: mi dge ba ni de bzlog pa mi dge ba bcu yis bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni de bzlog pa mi dge ba bcu yis bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: Non-virtue is the opposite of that, included in the ten non-virtues.

original: de la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / 'jig cing mi rtag pas 'jig rten te /
analyzed: de la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / 'jig cing mi rtag pas 'jig rten te /
translated: The world is that which is manifestly conditioned by causes and conditions such as those, and the opposite of that, and that which is destroyed and impermanent.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / de las bzlog pa dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang 'brel ba dang / de las bzlog pa dang 'dod pa'i zag pa la sogs pa gsum mam bzhi dang bcas pa dang /üîΩde las bzlog pa dang / sems kyis @256a * //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / de las bzlog pa dang / rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang 'brel ba dang / de las bzlog pa dang 'dod pa'i zag pa la sogs pa gsum mam bzhi dang bcas pa dang / de las bzlog pa dang / sems kyis @256a * //
translated: The world is the five appropriated aggregates, and the opposite of that, and that which is associated with natural and proscribed misdeeds, and the opposite of that, and that which is associated with the three or four attachments such as attachment to desire.

original: zin pa'i dbang po dang / de las bzlog pa rnams so //
analyzed: zin pa'i dbang po dang / de las bzlog pa rnams so //
translated: The world is that which is associated with those, and the opposite of that, and that which is associated with the faculties that are controlled by mind, and the opposite of that.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams kyi don rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams kyi don rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: Great Intelligence,  and so on extensively explains the meaning of those.

original: len pa'i phung po lnga las byis pas dge ba dang mi dge bar brtags pa ni tha snyad tsam du 'jig rten pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: len pa'i phung po lnga las byis pas dge ba dang mi dge bar brtags pa ni tha snyad tsam du 'jig rten pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: The virtuous and non-virtuous conventional phenomena of the world are the virtuous and non-virtuous imputed by the childish in the five appropriated aggregates.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgreat intelligence‚Äù and so on refers to the supramundane virtues.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äústates of meditative absorption‚Äù refers to the meditative absorption of cessation and so on.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du bstan pa'i don ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du bstan pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement that the storehouse consciousness is virtuous or nonvirtuous is as follows.

original: de'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sa bon dang 'brel pas na re zhig de dag dang tha dad med pas /
analyzed: de'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sa bon dang 'brel pas na re zhig de dag dang tha dad med pas /
translated: Since it is related to the seeds of virtue and nonvirtue, it is provisionally not distinct from them.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang sa bon de dag dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi la dmigs pas /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o // nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang sa bon de dag dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi la dmigs pas /

original: ci rigs su dge ba dang mi dge bar gzhag go //
analyzed: ci rigs su dge ba dang mi dge bar gzhag go //
translated: The defiled mind consciousness is also established as being virtuous or nonvirtuous, as appropriate, because it takes as its object the storehouse consciousness that possesses those seeds.

original: mu stegs can gyis brjod ces pa phyin ci log gi lta bas gang zag dang chos kyi bdag tu sgro btags pa'i sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa skad cig ma du ma 'dus pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis brjod ces pa phyin ci log gi lta bas gang zag dang chos kyi bdag tu sgro btags pa'i sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa skad cig ma du ma 'dus pa rnams kyang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdescribed by the tƒ´rthikas‚Äù refers to the consciousnesses of the five sense doors that are imputed by the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô distorted views to be the self of the person and the self of phenomena.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis dge ba'i rkyen du bsgyur ba ni dge ba zhes bya la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis dge ba'i rkyen du bsgyur ba ni dge ba zhes bya la /
translated: The mind with conceptualization that transforms into a condition of virtue is called virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i rkyen du bsgyur ba ni mi dge ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rkyen du bsgyur ba ni mi dge ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind with conceptualization that transforms into a condition of nonvirtue is called nonvirtue.

original: de ltar na rnam pa brgyad po thams cad kyang dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa brgyad po thams cad kyang dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus all eight types of minds are either virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: des na 'brel ba can gyi chos gzhan la ltos nas de ltar 'gyur gyi rang gi ngo bo ni snga ma ltar ming du bstan pa la sogs pa yin pas 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'brel ba can gyi chos gzhan la ltos nas de ltar 'gyur gyi rang gi ngo bo ni snga ma ltar ming du bstan pa la sogs pa yin pas 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are so in dependence on other related phenomena, but their own nature is as previously explained, that is, they are called name and so on.

original: 'dir dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa rnams kyang rjes su mi 'jug pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las bshad pa rnams kyang rjes su mi 'jug pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The specific classifications of virtue and so on explained in the Abhidharmako≈õa are not inconsistent with this explanation.

original: de dag nyid kyi gzhung las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi gzhung las shes par bya'o //
translated: But they should be understood from the Abhidharmako≈õa itself.

original: mdo sde 'di ni gtso bor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gtan la 'bebs pas rgyas par ni mdo de nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di ni gtso bor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gtan la 'bebs pas rgyas par ni mdo de nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Since this s≈´tra primarily determines the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, it should be understood extensively by following that s≈´tra itself.

original: de ltar skad cig ma'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the subject that possesses momentary phenomena,

original: da la yod pa'i chos skad cig ma nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: da la yod pa'i chos skad cig ma nyid ston pa ni /
translated: now, the teaching of the momentariness of phenomena that exist is

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúO MahƒÅmati‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: rgyud kyi rgyun ni lus tha mi dad ces pa ni /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun ni lus tha mi dad ces pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe continuum of the stream‚Äù means the body is not different.

original: de dag kyang rgyud gcig cing rgyun chags su 'byung zhing 'byung la /
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyud gcig cing rgyun chags su 'byung zhing 'byung la /
translated: Those are also one continuum and arise in a continuous stream.

original: byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba ste /üîΩrags pa'i 'jig ba'am /
analyzed: byung nas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba ste / rags pa'i 'jig ba'am /
translated: Having arisen, they also disintegrate.üîΩIt is the disintegration of the coarse,

original: @256b skad cig re re la 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: @256b skad cig re re la 'jig pa'o //
translated: or the disintegration in each moment.

original: gal te 'gags ma thag tu rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ba'i nges pa ni med de /
analyzed: gal te 'gags ma thag tu rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ba'i nges pa ni med de /
translated: If it is said that there is no certainty that another consciousness arises immediately after cessation,

original: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su tshogs drug 'gags ba ni de ma thag tu 'byung ba med par ston ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su tshogs drug 'gags ba ni de ma thag tu 'byung ba med par ston ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: it is like the teaching that the six collections cease in a state such as fainting and do not arise immediately after.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'gal bar 'gyur ba de dag gis de ma thag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la /
analyzed: 'gal bar 'gyur ba de dag gis de ma thag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la /
translated: Because of the contradiction, immediately after those, the foundation consciousness

original: rang rang gi bag chags shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi bag chags shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the nature of the cognition of their own habitual tendencies, and they produce other and other [habitual tendencies].

original: skad cig gi dus su mi gnas zhes pa ni rang gi dus las ma gtogs pa'i skad cig tu mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gi dus su mi gnas zhes pa ni rang gi dus las ma gtogs pa'i skad cig tu mi gnas pa'o //
translated: They do not remain for a moment of time means they do not remain for a moment of time other than their own time.

original: bag chags kyi skad cig pa yin zhes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i bdag nyid ni skad cig ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi skad cig pa yin zhes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i bdag nyid ni skad cig ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: They are momentary due to habitual tendencies means that the contaminated habitual tendencies and the conventional existent nature are momentary.

original: 'di rnams thams cad skad cig ma nyid du byis pa'i skye bo rnams la yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang /
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad skad cig ma nyid du byis pa'i skye bo rnams la yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang /
translated: The reason why all of these are accepted as momentary by ordinary beings is

original: byas pa'am yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs las te /
analyzed: byas pa'am yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs las te /
translated: due to reasons such as being produced or existing.

original: rgyas par ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from the treatises on reasoning.

original: zag pa med pa'i bag chags kyis zhes pa la sogs pas ni zag pa'i gnyen por gyur pa spros pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni skad cig ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bag chags kyis zhes pa la sogs pas ni zag pa'i gnyen por gyur pa spros pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni skad cig ma yin pa'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúbecause of the uncontaminated latent potentialities‚Äù and so on shows that the ultimate nature, which is the antidote to the contaminants, is momentary.

original: de ltar byis pa'i skye bos kun rdzob tu skad cig ba dang / don dam par skad cig pa ma yin pa zung du 'jug pa'i don ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar byis pa'i skye bos kun rdzob tu skad cig ba dang / don dam par skad cig pa ma yin pa zung du 'jug pa'i don ma rtogs pas /
translated: Thus, childish beings do not understand the meaning of the union of the conventional and ultimate truths, which are respectively momentary and not momentary.

original: la la dag sems nyid rig pa skad cig pa'i don kun rdzob tsam du yang med do zhes chad par lta ba nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: la la dag sems nyid rig pa skad cig pa'i don kun rdzob tsam du yang med do zhes chad par lta ba nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Some, therefore, fall into the view of nihilism, saying that the meaning of the momentary mind of awareness does not exist even conventionally.

original: 'ga' zhig ni de las bzlog pa sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni de las bzlog pa sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur te /
translated: Others fall into the extreme of reification, which is the opposite of that.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyang 'jig par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyang 'jig par byed de /
translated: Therefore, they destroy the unconditioned phenomena of nirvana.

original: ma thob pa'i nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will not attain it and will lose it.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa de rnams la ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa de rnams la ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi khyad par ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgreat intelligence‚Äù and so on teaches the difference between the consciousnesses that possess and do not possess the qualities of samsara and nirvana.

original: de la sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de la sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing /
translated: The five sense consciousnesses are not causes of samsara or nirvana because, as previously explained, they are not continuous.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa yang myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa yang myong ba ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, they do not experience the ripening of happiness and suffering.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ba'i rgyu dang bcas pa zhes pa'am /üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa ni tshor ba btang @257a * //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ba'i rgyu dang bcas pa zhes pa'am / mya ngan las 'das pa ni tshor ba btang @257a * //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the cause of not experiencing happiness and suffering.

original: snyoms par 'ba' zhig dang lhan cig pa yin pas /
analyzed: snyoms par 'ba' zhig dang lhan cig pa yin pas /
translated: Nirvana is only concomitant with the feeling of equanimity.

original: de 'dra ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it is also the cause of such a nirvana.

original: yang 'dod pa'i zag pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba bzhi'i bag chags dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yang 'dod pa'i zag pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba bzhi'i bag chags dang ldan pas /
translated: It is also endowed with the latent propensities of the four contaminations, such as the contamination of desire, which will be taught below.

original: 'khor bar 'jug cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Because it would not be the cause for entering into cyclic existence and for attaining nirvana.

original: da las ldog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: da las ldog pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also the opposite of the present.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni rgyun brtan pa'i dngos po byis pas skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i khyab par ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni rgyun brtan pa'i dngos po byis pas skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i khyab par ston te /
translated: By the words ‚Äúgreat intelligence‚Äù and so forth, he shows the pervasion of the thing that is stable continuity being imagined by the childish as a thing that is not momentary.

original: khyad par dag ces pa ni tshigs su bcad pas 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par dag ces pa ni tshigs su bcad pas 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúdistinctions‚Äù will be taught later in the verse.

original: de la mngon par rtogs pa thob pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ye shes la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par rtogs pa thob pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi ye shes la sogs pa ste /
translated: There, the attainment of realization is the wisdom of the path of seeing and so forth.

original: de rnams 'jig pa'i chos can skad cig pa yin na /
analyzed: de rnams 'jig pa'i chos can skad cig pa yin na /
translated: If those are things that are subject to destruction and are momentary,

original: 'phags pa rnams 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then the ƒÅryas would not be ƒÅryas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa gcang ba'i go 'phang ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa gcang ba'i go 'phang ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they would not have attained the state of the permanent, pure nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: tshig 'og ma ni thal ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'og ma ni thal ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The latter part of the verse is the reversal of the reductio.

original: ldem po'i ngag tu bshad pa la mi mkhas zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad skad cig mar gsungs pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams 'khor ba la skyo ba skyed pa'i don du gsungs pa la de ltar ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: ldem po'i ngag tu bshad pa la mi mkhas zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad skad cig mar gsungs pa ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams 'khor ba la skyo ba skyed pa'i don du gsungs pa la de ltar ma shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase unskilled in the interpretable means that the statement that all things are momentary is made in order to generate disgust in childish beings for cyclic existence, but they do not understand it that way.

original: ji ltar brtag ces pa ni spong ba'i sgra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar brtag ces pa ni spong ba'i sgra ste /
translated: The phrase how could it be so? is a term of rejection.

original: de ltar brtag par mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtag par mi rigs pa'o //
translated: It means it could not be so.

original: gal te de lta na gang byas pa'am yod pa de ni skad cig ma yin te zhes bstan pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gang byas pa'am yod pa de ni skad cig ma yin te zhes bstan pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the statement whatever is created or exists is momentary would be untenable.

original: bden mod kyi ngag 'di rnams kyi don ni /
analyzed: bden mod kyi ngag 'di rnams kyi don ni /
translated: It is true, but the meaning of these statements is as follows:

original: don dam par skad cig gi ngo bor yang grub pa med la /
analyzed: don dam par skad cig gi ngo bor yang grub pa med la /
translated: Ultimately, not even an essence of momentariness is established.

original: kun rdzob ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Conventionally, there are two kinds:

original: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob dang / rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob po //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob dang / rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob po //
translated: the conventional of the world and the conventional of the yogi.

original: de la dang po ni 'jig rten tha mal pa'i snang ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'jig rten tha mal pa'i snang ba ste /
translated: The first is the appearance of the ordinary world.

original: de dag gi snang ngo na gser dang rdo rje la sogs pa skad cig ma yin par 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang bas /
analyzed: de dag gi snang ngo na gser dang rdo rje la sogs pa skad cig ma yin par 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang bas /
translated: In their appearance, gold, diamonds, and so forth appear as having the nature of being unchanging and momentary.

original: kun rdzob tu de dag rtag ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de dag rtag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, conventionally, they are called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor ba'i kun rdzob ni de dag gi snang ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i kun rdzob ni de dag gi snang ba ste /
translated: The conventional of the yogi/nƒ´ is their appearance.

original: de'i ngon thams cad skad cig pa nyid du dmigs pas /
analyzed: de'i ngon thams cad skad cig pa nyid du dmigs pas /
translated: Since all of that is observed to be momentary,

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: it is posited in that way.

original: de la 'dir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob de 'dra ba ni log pa'i kun rdzob ces kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob de 'dra ba ni log pa'i kun rdzob ces kyang bya ste /
translated: Here, that kind of worldly conventional is also called ‚Äúfalse conventional.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang de dag yid tshim par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dang mthun par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag yid tshim par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de dang mthun par gsungs pa'o //
translated: However, in order to satisfy their minds, the BhagavƒÅn also taught in accordance with that.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas @257b pha rol tu phyin pa du zhes sngar dris pa'i lan du /üîΩlam pha rol tu phyin pa drug ston pa ste /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas @257b pha rol tu phyin pa du zhes sngar dris pa'i lan du / lam pha rol tu phyin pa drug ston pa ste /
translated: Again, beginning with ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, . . . ,‚Äù the reply to the previous question, ‚ÄúHow many perfections are there?‚ÄùüîΩteaches the six perfections of the path.

original: snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam nyid du bsdu'o //
analyzed: snying po sbyong bar byed pa'i lam nyid du bsdu'o //
translated: They are included as the path that purifies the essence.

original: srid par skye ba'i gnas sna tshogs kyi phyir zhes pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du sbyin pa rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: srid par skye ba'i gnas sna tshogs kyi phyir zhes pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du sbyin pa rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: For the sake of various abodes of birth in existence means that one perfects generosity for the sake of attaining a universal monarch and so on.

original: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: And they are the manifest delight in the five sense objects such as form and so on.

original: mngon par shes pa dag kyang mngon par grub ces pa ni de 'dra ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang byams pa la sogs pa mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dag kyang mngon par grub ces pa ni de 'dra ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang byams pa la sogs pa mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: And they manifest the higher perceptions means that they accomplish the concentration of the dhyanas and the loving kindness and so on that possess such activity.

original: de dag kyang rang rang gi bsam pa la ltos nas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du btags mod kyi //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang rang gi bsam pa la ltos nas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du btags mod kyi //
translated: And they are designated as perfections in dependence on their individual intentions.

original: thabs dang shes rab dam pas ma zin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dngos ni ma yin no //üîΩlen pa la 'dzin pa med ces pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dam pas ma zin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dngos ni ma yin no // len pa la 'dzin pa med ces pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: But they are not actual perfections because they are not embraced by the best method and wisdom.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po'o //
translated: As for there is no grasping in appropriation, appropriation is the foundation consciousness or the appropriated aggregates.

original: de nyid gsal bar ston pa ni rang gi sems dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar ston pa ni rang gi sems dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The clear teaching of that is ‚Äúone‚Äôs own mind and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe non-engagement of conceptuality is the perfection of moral discipline, because it abandons the bad engagement of conceptuality of ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.üîΩThe perfection of patience isüîΩthe patience of one who is not attached to anything.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba ngan pa spangs pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba ngan pa spangs pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the wisdom of one who does not conceptualize the two.üîΩThe perfection of method isüîΩthe method of one who does not abandon samsƒÅra.üîΩThe perfection of aspiration isüîΩthe aspiration of one who does not abide in cyclic existence.üîΩThe perfection of power isüîΩthe power of one who does not abide in the two extremes.üîΩThe perfection of pristine awareness is

original: gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid du rtogs pas /üîΩde 'dra ba'i chos zab mo la bzod pa ni /
analyzed: gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid du rtogs pas / de 'dra ba'i chos zab mo la bzod pa ni /
translated: the pristine awareness of one who does not conceptualize the two.üîΩThe perfection of moral discipline isüîΩthe moral discipline of one who does not conceptualize the two.üîΩThe perfection of patience is

original: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the patience of one who does not conceptualize the two.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom isüîΩthe wisdom of one who does not conceptualize the two.üîΩThe perfection of method isüîΩthe method of one who does not abandon samsƒÅra.

original: rnal 'byor dang mthun par mthong ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa de kho na nyid dang mthun par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang mthun par mthong ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa de kho na nyid dang mthun par rtog pa'o //
translated: The perfection of aspiration is

original: mu stegs can gyi mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin par mi ltung ba ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin par mi ltung ba ste /
translated: the aspiration of one who does not abide in cyclic existence.üîΩThe perfection of power isüîΩthe power of one who does not abide in the two extremes.üîΩThe perfection of pristine awareness isüîΩthe pristine awareness of one who does not conceptualize the two.üîΩThe perfection of moral discipline isüîΩthe moral discipline of one who does not conceptualize the two.üîΩThe perfection of patience isüîΩthe patience of one who does not conceptualize the two.

original: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the one-pointed mind that focuses on the knowledge of all aspects in the relative.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i blos bden pa gnyis kyi chos rab tu phye na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i blos bden pa gnyis kyi chos rab tu phye na /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the discernment of the phenomena of the two truths with a nonconceptual mind.

original: mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa spangs shing /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa spangs shing /
translated: It is the relinquishing of the two extremes

original: gnas gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: and the transformation of the basis.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi shes rab ba ma ye shes rgyun las nyams pa med pa chos kyi sku thob par bya ba'i don du rab tu sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi shes rab ba ma ye shes rgyun las nyams pa med pa chos kyi sku thob par bya ba'i don du rab tu sbyong ba ste /
translated: The wisdom of the eighth bhumi and above is applied to the attainment of the dharmakaya, which is never impaired by the stream of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang 'khor gsum sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i shes rab dang / bsngo ba la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas zin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang 'khor gsum sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i shes rab dang / bsngo ba la sogs pa'i thabs la mkhas pas zin pa ste /
translated: All the perfections, such as generosity, are also embraced by the wisdom that realizes the three spheres to be like an illusion and by the skillful means of dedication and so forth.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang tshe shes rab kyis ni rab tu zin gyur na //
analyzed: gang tshe shes rab kyis ni rab tu zin gyur na //
translated: When it is embraced by wisdom,

original: de tshe mig rnyed @258a * //
analyzed: de tshe mig rnyed @258a * //
translated: then the eye is found

original: gyur cing de yi ming thob po //
analyzed: gyur cing de yi ming thob po //
translated: and the name is obtained.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ma bsngos pa'i sbyin bas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi thob bo zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ma bsngos pa'i sbyin bas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi thob bo zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in other s≈´tras it says, ‚ÄúBy generosity not dedicated to omniscience, the name of the perfection of generosity is not obtained.‚Äù

original: 'di'i don zhib tu ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don zhib tu ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa las shes par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of this should be understood in detail from the noble Perfection of Wisdom s≈´tras and the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention.

original: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas ma spros so //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs pas ma spros so //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not elaborate here.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher shas bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher shas bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the verses is mostly clear.

original: byed pa ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAgent‚Äù is the agent imputed by non-Buddhists.

original: de 'dra ba med cing snga phyi phan tshun byed pa'am /
analyzed: de 'dra ba med cing snga phyi phan tshun byed pa'am /
translated: It does not exist in that way, and it is not that earlier and later [moments] act on each other.

original: don dam pa'i dngos pos dben pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos pos dben pa'o //
translated: It is empty of ultimate entities.

original: skye ba med ces pa la sogs pa'i dgag pa rnams ni thams cad dang don dam pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med ces pa la sogs pa'i dgag pa rnams ni thams cad dang don dam pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The negations such as ‚Äúnon-arisen‚Äù and so on are all intended in terms of the ultimate.

original: dngos po rnams kyis rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis rnam rtog pa //
translated: And things are conceptualized by conceptualization.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan dbang skad cig ma la sogs par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan dbang skad cig ma la sogs par bstan pa ste /
translated: The above and other passages teach that the dependent, which is conceptualized on the conventional level, is momentary and so forth.

original: de 'dra ba'i sems 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa thog ma med pa nas brgyud pa yin te /üîΩdes gzugs la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid du rtogs pa de srid kyi bar du de gnas ci zhes pa gnas sam 'on te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa thog ma med pa nas brgyud pa yin te / des gzugs la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid du rtogs pa de srid kyi bar du de gnas ci zhes pa gnas sam 'on te /
translated: The cause that produces such a mind is ignorance, which has been in continuity since beginningless time.

original: ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: As long as it is not realized that form and so forth are the way things really are, it is asked whether that ignorance remains or not.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyun ni gnas la skad cig ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyun ni gnas la skad cig ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: On the conventional level, the continuum remains, but the moment ceases.

original: gzugs ni dus su zhes pa la sogs pas don dam par gzugs dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu med pas /
analyzed: gzugs ni dus su zhes pa la sogs pas don dam par gzugs dang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu med pas /
translated: Form and so forth do not have a cause ultimately, as is stated in the following.

original: de rnams mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not tenable.

original: dus su mi gnas zhes pa ni don dam par rang yod pa'i dus su yang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dus su mi gnas zhes pa ni don dam par rang yod pa'i dus su yang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: They do not remain for a while means that ultimately they do not remain even for a while when they exist.

original: gzugs gzugs kyi ngo bos stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyi ngo bos stong pa'o //
translated: Form is empty of the entityness of form.

original: log pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The cause of error is ignorance.

original: ji ltar skad cig 'jig par rig / ces pa ni 'jig par dmigs shing grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig 'jig par rig / ces pa ni 'jig par dmigs shing grub pa med pa'o //
translated: It is perceived as perishable, but it is not established.

original: rnal 'byor can gyi snyoms 'jug ces pa la sogs pas ni rtag pa nyid du brtags pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyi snyoms 'jug ces pa la sogs pas ni rtag pa nyid du brtags pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The yogi's meditative absorption, etc. refers to the distinction imagined to be permanent.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the meditative absorption of cessation, etc.

original: 'od snang gnas kyi gzhal med khang ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gzhal med khang ste /
analyzed: 'od snang gnas kyi gzhal med khang ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gzhal med khang ste /
translated: The celestial palace of the abode of light is the celestial palace of the second concentration.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nang gi skyon rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pas phyi rol gyi me'i bskal pas kyang 'jig pa med ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nang gi skyon rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pas phyi rol gyi me'i bskal pas kyang 'jig pa med ces pa ste /
translated: Since there is no internal fault of investigation and analysis in the world, it is not destroyed by the external calamity of fire.

original: bsam gtan dang po man chod me yis lan bdun du zhig kyang de ni mi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po man chod me yis lan bdun du zhig kyang de ni mi 'jig pa'o //
translated: Even though the first concentration and below are destroyed seven times by fire, it is not destroyed.

original: gnas pa rnams ni rgyun du @258b zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag ste nyon mongs pa spangs pas dge slong zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa rnams ni rgyun du @258b zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag ste nyon mongs pa spangs pas dge slong zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The abiders are the persons such as stream enterers and so on, and since they abandon afflictions, they are also called bhik·π£us.

original: thob pa'i chos ni mthang ba'i lam gyi ye shes nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi bar du rtogs pa thob pa rnams skad cig ma nyid du tha mal ba rnams kyis ma mthong bas de'i ngor rtog ces pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i chos ni mthang ba'i lam gyi ye shes nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi bar du rtogs pa thob pa rnams skad cig ma nyid du tha mal ba rnams kyis ma mthong bas de'i ngor rtog ces pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of attainment is the attainment of realization from the wisdom of the path of seeing up to the wisdom of buddhahood. Since these are not seen by ordinary beings even for a moment, it is said that they are conceptual for them.

original: yang dag par ni de rnams thams cad sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: yang dag par ni de rnams thams cad sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad dang 'dra bar /
translated: In reality, all of these are like the eight examples of illusion.

original: kun rdzob tu skad cig ma yin zhing don dam par stong pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu skad cig ma yin zhing don dam par stong pa'o //
translated: They are momentary on the relative level and empty on the ultimate level.

original: 'byung po de dag cas pa ni sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung po de dag cas pa ni sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Those beings are included within the continuum of sentient beings.

original: don dam par gang nas kyang 'ongs pa med cing /
analyzed: don dam par gang nas kyang 'ongs pa med cing /
translated: In ultimate reality, they do not come from anywhere

original: gang du yang song ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang song ba med pa'o //
translated: and they do not go anywhere.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i 'grel pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rgyan las le'u drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i 'grel pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rgyan las le'u drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the sixth chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the TathƒÅgata Essence, called the Explanation of the Intention.

original: // / de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi dgongs pa can gyi don nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gsal bar ston te /
analyzed: // / de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi dgongs pa can gyi don nyid tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas gsal bar ston te /
translated: Now, from ‚ÄúThen again, ‚Äù and so on, the meaning of the above intention is clarified by another method.

original: 'khor gyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dri ba'i don ni dgra bcom pa sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba mi 'thad de //
analyzed: 'khor gyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dri ba'i don ni dgra bcom pa sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba mi 'thad de //
translated: In order to clear away the doubts of the retinue, the meaning of the question is that it is not tenable that the arhats will become buddhas.

original: de ni tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i don du srid par skye ba len dgos pa las /
analyzed: de ni tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i don du srid par skye ba len dgos pa las /
translated: This is because they must take birth in existence in order to complete the accumulations,

original: dgra bcom pa ni srid pa kun du sbyor bzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni srid pa kun du sbyor bzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but the arhats have exhausted the bonds of existence.

original: yang 'dod chen pa rnams ni mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang 'dod chen pa rnams ni mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the extremists have severed the roots of virtue that attain the higher realms,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
translated: how could they become buddhas?

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs na /
translated: Moreover, if the tathƒÅgata did not speak even a single syllable,

original: gsung dbyangs yan lag dug cu dang tshig 'bru bzang po zhes pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pas de ltar bstan pa ni don ci yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsung dbyangs yan lag dug cu dang tshig 'bru bzang po zhes pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pas de ltar bstan pa ni don ci yin zhes pa'o //
translated: it would be untenable to say that he has ‚Äúthe melodious voice of BrahmƒÅ with eighty qualities and excellent words,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdzu 'phrul sprul pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul sprul pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa ni /
translated: The performance of actions such as the miraculous emanationsüîΩis not tenable without a prior mind that motivates them.

original: kun nas slong ba'i blo sngon du 'gro bas rtog pa med par de 'dra bar mi 'thad ces pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa snga phyi tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du ma dmigs pas de ltar bstan pa'i don gang yin zhes pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba'i blo sngon du 'gro bas rtog pa med par de 'dra bar mi 'thad ces pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa snga phyi tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du ma dmigs pas de ltar bstan pa'i don gang yin zhes pa dang /
translated: Since a foundation consciousness and so on are not observed to be a different entity from earlier and later moments, what is the meaning of the teachings that present them as such?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni nyes pa thams cad spangs shing yon tan thams cad rdzogs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni nyes pa thams cad spangs shing yon tan thams cad rdzogs pas /
translated: The body of the TathƒÅgata is free from all faults and is endowed with all good qualities.

original: lag na rdo rje rtag tu phyi bzhin du 'brang zhing bsrung ba mi 'thad na /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rtag tu phyi bzhin du 'brang zhing bsrung ba mi 'thad na /
translated: It is not tenable that VajrapƒÅ·πái always follows and protects him.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the teachings that present him in that way?

original: gsung rab dag las de ltar bstan pa'i don ci yin zhes pa dang / sngar bstan pa ltar 'khor ba'i tha ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'gal bas de'i don gang yin pa dang / lha @259a * //
analyzed: gsung rab dag las de ltar bstan pa'i don ci yin zhes pa dang / sngar bstan pa ltar 'khor ba'i tha ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'gal bas de'i don gang yin pa dang / lha @259a * //
translated: Since, as was previously explained, sa·πÉsƒÅra is endless and nirvƒÅ·πáa is contradictory, what is the meaning of that?

original: sbyin ni yun ring po nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gshed ma dang dgra bor gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa'i bdud dang / de dag gis byas pa'i las te /
analyzed: sbyin ni yun ring po nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gshed ma dang dgra bor gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa'i bdud dang / de dag gis byas pa'i las te /
translated: The Buddha's enemies and murderers for a long time were the demons, as in the statement, The demons are the enemies and murderers of the Tathagata for a long time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la bdud kyis 'phangs pa'i sgyogs kyi zer phog go zhes pa dang / gzhan yang sngon gyi las kyi nyes pas zhabs la seng ldeng gi tshal pa zug ces pa dang / bram ze'i bu mo tsan tsas shing gi gzhong khung lte bar bcug nas dge sbyong khyod kyis nga sbrum du bcug go zhes skur pa btab pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la bdud kyis 'phangs pa'i sgyogs kyi zer phog go zhes pa dang / gzhan yang sngon gyi las kyi nyes pas zhabs la seng ldeng gi tshal pa zug ces pa dang / bram ze'i bu mo tsan tsas shing gi gzhong khung lte bar bcug nas dge sbyong khyod kyis nga sbrum du bcug go zhes skur pa btab pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: And the actions they performed, as in the statement, The demons shot arrows at the Tathagata's feet, and, Because of the fault of his previous actions, a splinter of acacia wood pierced his foot, and, The brahman girl Candika stuck a wooden bowl in her navel and slandered him, saying, 'Ascetic, you have made me pregnant.'

original: bsod snyoms kyi phyir bram ze'i grong s'a la can du gshegs pa las /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi phyir bram ze'i grong s'a la can du gshegs pa las /
translated: And, For the sake of alms, he went to the brahman village of Sala,üîΩbut not finding alms, he washed his bowl and left.

original: bsod snyoms ma rnyed nas lhung bzed bkrus te phyir byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pa 'phags pa chos bcu pa'i mdo las gsungs pa rnams kyi don ji ltar 'thad do //
analyzed: bsod snyoms ma rnyed nas lhung bzed bkrus te phyir byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pa 'phags pa chos bcu pa'i mdo las gsungs pa rnams kyi don ji ltar 'thad do //
translated: The meaning of these statements is as it is found in the Dasadharmaka-sutra.

original: de 'dra ba'i nyes pa dag ma spangs par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i nyes pa dag ma spangs par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory to attain omniscience without abandoning such faults.

original: lan gyi skabs su dgra bcom pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lan gyi skabs su dgra bcom pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan pa ni /
translated: In the context of the answer, it is said that arhats are prophesied to become buddhas.

original: de rnams phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te zag pa med pa'i dbyings la yun ring du gnas pa na /
analyzed: de rnams phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te zag pa med pa'i dbyings la yun ring du gnas pa na /
translated: When they abide for a long time in the sphere of nirvana without remainder, the uncontaminated sphere,

original: rang gi dge ba'i sa bon dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs gyis /
analyzed: rang gi dge ba'i sa bon dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs gyis /
translated: through their own virtuous seeds and the blessings of the tathagatas,

original: de las sad nas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed de tshogs rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas pa la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de las sad nas byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed de tshogs rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas pa la dgongs pa ste /
translated: they awaken from that and generate the supreme mind of enlightenment. Having completed the accumulations, they become buddhas.üîΩThis is the intention.

original: rgyas par ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas par ni sngar bstan to //
translated: This has been taught extensively above.

original: gzhan yang de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po sngar byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po sngar byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Moreover, the purpose of teaching in that way is as follows. Bodhisattvas of dull faculties, having previously generated the supreme mind of enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams lam de yis skyo nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams lam de yis skyo nas /
translated: There are bodhisattvas who, having practiced the bodhisattva deeds, become weary of that path and

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa yod de /
translated: want to attain nirvana by means of the Listeners' Vehicle.

original: de dag las bzlog nas theg pa chen po la rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag las bzlog nas theg pa chen po la rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to turn them away from that and inspire them with enthusiasm for the Great Vehicle,

original: gnas brtan 'od srungs la sogs pa sprul pa'i nyan thos rnams la sprul pa'i sku dag gis sangs rgyas su lung bstan te /
analyzed: gnas brtan 'od srungs la sogs pa sprul pa'i nyan thos rnams la sprul pa'i sku dag gis sangs rgyas su lung bstan te /
translated: the emanation bodies of the Buddha give predictions of enlightenment to the emanation listeners such as the elder Katyayana.

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub de nyid du mthar thug pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub de nyid du mthar thug pa ma yin zhing /
translated: They do this by saying that the listeners' enlightenment is not final

original: sangs rgyas nyid du bgrod par bya ba yin pas theg pa chen po'i lam de nyid la brtson par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du bgrod par bya ba yin pas theg pa chen po'i lam de nyid la brtson par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: but that it leads to buddhahood, so that they will strive on the path of the Great Vehicle.

original: gal te de lta na dgra bcom pa rnams sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dgongs pa can yin pas sngar bstan pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dgra bcom pa rnams sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dgongs pa can yin pas sngar bstan pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the prediction of the arhats to buddhahood is a provisional one and so contradicts the above presentation.

original: skyon @259b med de /
analyzed: skyon @259b med de /
translated: There is no such fault.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings la bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams zag pa med pa'i dbyings la bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par gnas nas /
translated: The arhats abide for an eon or more in the uncontaminated realm,

original: sngar bstan pa ltar sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni nges pa'i don yin pas sngar bstan pa dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni nges pa'i don yin pas sngar bstan pa dang 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: and then, as previously explained, they become buddhas. This is the definitive meaning, so there is no contradiction with the previous explanation.

original: de las gzhan du zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mthong bar byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs par myur du tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byas te /üîΩsangs rgyas pa ni shin tu yang rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de las gzhan du zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mthong bar byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs par myur du tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byas te / sangs rgyas pa ni shin tu yang rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not at all reasonable for them to do otherwise, to see the door of the uncontaminated concentrations and then quickly complete the two collections in the same way as the bodhisattvas and become buddhas.

original: gzhan yang snga ma ltar dus dang rkyen gyi dbye ba ma byas par dgra bcom pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yang dgongs pa can gyi tshig yin te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang snga ma ltar dus dang rkyen gyi dbye ba ma byas par dgra bcom pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yang dgongs pa can gyi tshig yin te ;
translated: Moreover, the statement that without making a division of time and conditions, as in the previous explanation, the arhats become buddhas is also a statement with a specific intention.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: don dam pa dang / gnas skabs dang / mthar thug pa'i dbye ba ma byas par theg pa chen po gcig nyid yin zhes bstan pa'i dgongs pa can gyi tshig nyid du sngar bstan pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / gnas skabs dang / mthar thug pa'i dbye ba ma byas par theg pa chen po gcig nyid yin zhes bstan pa'i dgongs pa can gyi tshig nyid du sngar bstan pa bzhin du'o //
translated: The intention of the statement that there is only one vehicle is that there is only one vehicle in the sense of the ultimate, temporarily and ultimately, as was previously explained.

original: des na skabs kyi don 'di ni sngar bstan pa dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na skabs kyi don 'di ni sngar bstan pa dang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this context is not contradictory to the previous explanation.

original: gzhan yang gal te sprul pa'i nyan thos rnams la de ltar lung bstan to zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba byas pas de las gzhan zhib bgrod pa gcig pu pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur bas sngar bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sprul pa'i nyan thos rnams la de ltar lung bstan to zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba byas pas de las gzhan zhib bgrod pa gcig pu pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur bas sngar bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the disciples who are emanations are excluded by the statement, ‚ÄúThey are prophesied in that way,‚Äù then it would contradict the previous explanation that those disciples who are not emanations, who are solitary realizers, do not attain buddhahood.

original: 'di ni dam pa'i chos pa dam dkar pa las 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa ni sprul pa'i nyan thos yin no zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni dam pa'i chos pa dam dkar pa las 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa ni sprul pa'i nyan thos yin no zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: This is because the statement in the sutra that the great Kashyapa and so on were prophesied as buddhas in the Sutra of the White Lotus of the Sacred Teachings is saying that they are emanation disciples.

original: gsung rab kyi phyogs gzhan dag las nyan thos thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du lung mi ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi phyogs gzhan dag las nyan thos thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du lung mi ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that in other parts of the scriptures it is not taught that all ≈õrƒÅvakas are prophesied to become buddhas.

original: des na 'dir dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas rnams byang chub dman pa de dag tsam du mthar thug cing /
analyzed: des na 'dir dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas rnams byang chub dman pa de dag tsam du mthar thug cing /
translated: Therefore the teaching here that the arhats and pratyekabuddhas are limited to their inferior enlightenment and

original: de las gong du bgrod du med par bstan pa yang drang pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: de las gong du bgrod du med par bstan pa yang drang pa'i don yin la /
translated: that there is no going beyond that is provisional meaning.

original: khyad par du lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs pa'i phung po zad na /
analyzed: khyad par du lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs pa'i phung po zad na /
translated: In particular, it is utterly untenable to assert that when the aggregates projected by past karma and afflictions are exhausted in nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder,

original: nam mkha' la sprin dengs pa ltar 'du byed kyi 'jug pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'dod pa ni shin tu yang mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sprin dengs pa ltar 'du byed kyi 'jug pa thams cad rgyun chad par 'dod pa ni shin tu yang mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar rgyas par bstan to //
translated: like clouds vanishing in the sky, all engagement of compositional activity is terminated. This has been extensively explained above.

original: gal te de ltar byang chub dman pa dang mchog nyid 'jog pa de lta na de dag la spangs pa dang rtogs pa'i khyad par ci yod snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar byang chub dman pa dang mchog nyid 'jog pa de lta na de dag la spangs pa dang rtogs pa'i khyad par ci yod snyam du dogs na /
translated: If the inferior and supreme enlightenments are posited in this way, one might wonder, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between them in terms of abandonment and realization?‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩde'i don ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mngon du rgyu spangs @260a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / de'i don ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mngon du rgyu spangs @260a * //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The cause of the afflictive obstructions being manifest is abandoned.üîΩ

original: par sangs rgyas dang bye brag med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: par sangs rgyas dang bye brag med pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Mahamati, the Buddha and the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, are not the same in regard to the elimination of the afflictive obstructions.üîΩThey are not the same in regard to the elimination of the habitual tendencies.

original: bag chags spangs pa ni ma yin no zhes sngar bstan to //
analyzed: bag chags spangs pa ni ma yin no zhes sngar bstan to //
translated: As was previously explained, they are not the same in regard to the elimination of the manifest causes of the afflictive obstructions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: The obstructions to omniscience are the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis mthong zhing goms pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis mthong zhing goms pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are eliminated by seeing and cultivating the suchness that is the reality of the mind with nonconceptual wisdom, because that eliminates all the habitual tendencies of ignorance that exist in the foundation consciousness.

original: 'dir gang zag la bdag med pa ni bden pa bzhi chos bcu drug gi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir gang zag la bdag med pa ni bden pa bzhi chos bcu drug gi rnam pa ste /
translated: Here, the selflessness of persons is the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i bye brag gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i bye brag gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By seeing it in that way, one becomes purified.

original: de'i don yang phung po lnga la rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs par phyin ci log ba la brten nas chags sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba las /
analyzed: de'i don yang phung po lnga la rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs par phyin ci log ba la brten nas chags sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ba las /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The afflictions such as attachment and hostility arise in dependence on the error of permanence, happiness, etc. with regard to the five aggregates.

original: de las bzlog ste mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par mthong zhing goms pas mngon du rgyu ba spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog ste mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par mthong zhing goms pas mngon du rgyu ba spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By reversing that, by seeing and cultivating impermanence, suffering, etc., the manifest afflictions are abandoned.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir zhes pa yang rtag pa la sogs par byin ci log pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir zhes pa yang rtag pa la sogs par byin ci log pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to reverse the mental consciousness‚Äù means to reverse the mental consciousness that is mistaken with regard to permanence, etc.

original: chos kyi sgrib pa ni chos rnams mthong ba la sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sgrib pa ni chos rnams mthong ba la sgrib pa ste /
translated: The obscuration of phenomena is the obscuration to seeing phenomena.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: It is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: gzhan yang ngas yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs zhes pa'i don ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa'i tshig dang yi ge las ma gtogs pa'i lhag pa cung zad kyang gsungs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ngas yi ge gcig kyang ma gsungs zhes pa'i don ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa'i tshig dang yi ge las ma gtogs pa'i lhag pa cung zad kyang gsungs pa med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúI have not taught even a single letter‚Äù is that, apart from the words and letters taught by the buddhas of the past and future, I have not taught anything else whatsoever.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dgongs don gnyis kyang sngar bstan to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dgongs don gnyis kyang sngar bstan to //
translated: The other two meanings of the intention have been taught above.

original: mi rtog mi dpyod pa 'phrul pa sprul pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i don kyang sngon gyi smon lam la  sogs pa dang / ye shes kyi dbang gis rtog pa med kyang de ltar ston pa la 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtog mi dpyod pa 'phrul pa sprul pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i don kyang sngon gyi smon lam la  sogs pa dang / ye shes kyi dbang gis rtog pa med kyang de ltar ston pa la 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the teaching of the emanation of non-conceptuality and non-investigation is that, by the power of previous aspirations and so on and of gnosis, there is no contradiction in teaching in that way even though there is no conception.

original: mkhyen bzhin du zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi khams dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas de dag gi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen bzhin du zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi khams dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas de dag gi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: With knowledge means that, having known the dispositions and interests of sentient beings just as they are, one acts for their welfare.

original: gal te dran pa ni sngar 'dris pa'i dngos po nye ba ma yin pa'i don la 'dzin pa yin pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dran pa ni sngar 'dris pa'i dngos po nye ba ma yin pa'i don la 'dzin pa yin pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that mindfulness is the apprehension of an object that is not the presence of a thing previously acquainted, it would be conceptual.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: 'das pa'i don la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs bkag pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: 'das pa'i don la phyin ci log gi sgro 'dogs bkag pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: It is merely the negation of the superimposition of error with regard to a past object.

original: de 'dra ba'i rnam pa snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rnam pa snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the appearance of such an aspect.

original: shi 'phos gnyis ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: shi 'phos gnyis ni sngar bstan to //
translated: The two transmigrations have been taught above.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig tu bstan pa dang / 'khor ba thog mtha' med pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i don ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rnam bar shes pa ni @260b dge ba zag pa med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig tu bstan pa dang / 'khor ba thog mtha' med pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i don ni byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rnam bar shes pa ni @260b dge ba zag pa med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the teaching that consciousnesses are momentary and that cyclic existence is beginningless and endless is that the consciousnesses that engage objects of the ordinary beings of the world are not virtuous and are not uncontaminated.

original: de rnams las zag pa 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams las zag pa 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they increase and expand the contaminants.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las /
translated: Thus the Great Nirvana Sutra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Bhagavan said:

original: rigs kyi bu sems can gyi rnam par shes pa lnga ni sems rtse gcig pa ma yin zhing zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can gyi rnam par shes pa lnga ni sems rtse gcig pa ma yin zhing zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, the five consciousnesses of sentient beings are not single-pointed and are contaminated.

original: phyin ci log kyang yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang yin te /
translated: They are also mistaken.

original: zag pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they generate the contaminants, they are called contaminated.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not real by nature.
