original: 'du shes la chags pas phyin ci log pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes la chags pas phyin ci log pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are attached to discriminations, they are called mistaken.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are not the cause of nirvana.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun dang mi ldan pas 'khor ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar rgyun dang mi ldan pas 'khor ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And, as previously explained, they are not samsara, because they are not continuous.

original: yang bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu skad cig ma nyid yin te de la dgongs nas skad cig ma bden pa lta bur bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu skad cig ma nyid yin te de la dgongs nas skad cig ma bden pa lta bur bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, because they arise from the cause of habitual propensities, they are momentary on the conventional level. With this in mind, it was taught that they are like momentary truths.

original: de lta na gang 'khor bar 'gyur snyam na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid mi rtogs na 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta na gang 'khor bar 'gyur snyam na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid mi rtogs na 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur zhing /
translated: If this is so, one might wonder, what is it that cycles in samsara? The causal basis of samsara is none other than the ground consciousness.üîΩWhen it is not realized, it is the cause of samsara;

original: rtogs na mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs na mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ste /
translated: when it is realized, it is the cause of nirvana.

original: 'di'i don ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of this has already been explained above.

original: stong pa nyid kyis g-yengs zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis g-yengs zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdistracted by emptiness‚Äù is merely an illustration.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i blo can rnams kyis dbu ma'i don rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i de kho na nyid mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i blo can rnams kyis dbu ma'i don rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i de kho na nyid mi shes pa'o //
translated: Those who cling to the extremes of nihilism and eternalism do not understand the meaning of the Middle Way, the natural purity of suchness.

original: gzhan yang lag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyi bzhin du 'brang bar byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyis mthong ba ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas nyid yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyi bzhin du 'brang bar byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyis mthong ba ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas nyid yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the childish beings and so forth who see VajrapƒÅ·πái following after the TathƒÅgata are seeing an emanation buddha, not the essential buddha,

original: de ni de dag gis mthong ba'i yul la 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de dag gis mthong ba'i yul la 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter is beyond the realm of their vision.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la de phyi bzhin du 'brang zhing bsrung bar bstan pa ni lag na rdo rjes 'dul ba'i sems can rdzas su bzung ba'am /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la de phyi bzhin du 'brang zhing bsrung bar bstan pa ni lag na rdo rjes 'dul ba'i sems can rdzas su bzung ba'am /
translated: The teaching that VajrapƒÅ·πái follows after and protects the emanation buddha‚Äôs body is the materialization of the sentient beings to be tamed by VajrapƒÅ·πái,

original: de'i sngon gyi smon lam la sogs pa 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sngon gyi smon lam la sogs pa 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: or it is the teaching that his former aspirations and so forth are fruitful.

original: gal te de lta na ngo bo'i sangs rgyas gang gi spyod yul du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ngo bo'i sangs rgyas gang gi spyod yul du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then whose realm is the essential buddha?

original: tshe 'di la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúIn this life‚Äù and so forth is stated.

original: mthong ba'i chos la ting nge 'dzin gyi bde bar gnas pa dang / bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa sa dang po yan chod kyi byang chub sems dpas rtogs par byed pa @261a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la ting nge 'dzin gyi bde bar gnas pa dang / bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa sa dang po yan chod kyi byang chub sems dpas rtogs par byed pa @261a * //
translated: The bodhisattvas from the first stage onward realize the essence of the dharmakƒÅya, which is endowed with the bliss of abiding in samƒÅdhi in this life and with the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma of suffering and so on, which is the direct realization of the thatness of the four truths.

original: ste ; / de yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ste ; / de yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, this is from the perspective of the enjoyment body.

original: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo ni sa brgyad pa yan chod du spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis yul du byed la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo ni sa brgyad pa yan chod du spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis yul du byed la /
translated: The essence of the dharmakƒÅya is taken as an object in a general way from the eighth ground onward.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas nyag gcig go //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas nyag gcig go //
translated: The realization of it just as it is is the exclusive domain of a buddha.

original: chos shes pa'i bzod pas dang po'i gnas skabs yin par yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dang bstan bcos dag las bshad de /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i bzod pas dang po'i gnas skabs yin par yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo dang bstan bcos dag las bshad de /
translated: The stage of the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharma is explained in the s≈´tras and treatises of the perfection of wisdom to be the first stage.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa dang spong ba gang ji snyed pa de ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa dang spong ba gang ji snyed pa de ni /
translated: Whatever knowledge and abandonment there is of a stream enterer,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / bzod pa de yang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde yis sdug bsngal la chos shas pa'i bzod par gsungs pas so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod par 'dus te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / bzod pa de yang 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde yis sdug bsngal la chos shas pa'i bzod par gsungs pas so /
translated: And that patience is said by ƒÄrya Vimuktisena to be the patience of the dharma-discernment with regard to suffering.

original: yang las kyi nyes pa gang ldan par bstan pa ni nges pa'i don du de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: yang las kyi nyes pa gang ldan par bstan pa ni nges pa'i don du de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the faults of karma that are taught are not so in the definitive meaning.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin gyi /
translated: The emanation buddhas are only the appearances of those to be tamed.

original: de dag la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin med la /
analyzed: de dag la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin med la /
translated: They do not have the nature of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: don dam par de las gzhan ma yang de bzhin gshegs pa med de /
analyzed: don dam par de las gzhan ma yang de bzhin gshegs pa med de /
translated: Ultimately, there is no tathƒÅgata other than that.

original: de ltar na de ni sangs rgyas nyid min pas de las kyi nyes pa dang 'brel bar snang yang sangs rgyas ni de ltar ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni sangs rgyas nyid min pas de las kyi nyes pa dang 'brel bar snang yang sangs rgyas ni de ltar ma yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, since that is not buddhahood, although it appears to be connected with the faults of karma, the buddha is not like that.

original: sprul pa nyid las kyi nyes pa dang 'brel bar bstan pa'i dgos pa yang byis pa'i skye bo rnams rnam par smin pa'i lus la skyo ba skyed pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa nyid las kyi nyes pa dang 'brel bar bstan pa'i dgos pa yang byis pa'i skye bo rnams rnam par smin pa'i lus la skyo ba skyed pa ste /
translated: The purpose of teaching that the emanation is related to the fault of karma is to generate disgust for the body of ripening in childish beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang 'di 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal yod na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang 'di 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal yod na /
translated: If the Tathagata has such suffering,

original: gzhan rnams lta ci smos snyam du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams lta ci smos snyam du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: what can be said of others?

original: khyad par du lhung bzed bkrus te phyir 'byung ba nyid du bstan pa ni bsod nams chung ba'i nyan thos rnams kyi yi chad pa spang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: khyad par du lhung bzed bkrus te phyir 'byung ba nyid du bstan pa ni bsod nams chung ba'i nyan thos rnams kyi yi chad pa spang ba'i don du'o //
translated: In particular, the teaching of washing the begging bowl and then leaving is for the purpose of abandoning the discouragement of ≈õrƒÅvakas with little merit.

original: tsan tsas skur ba btab pa bstan pa yang bsod nams chung zhing skur pa mang ba'i dge slong rnams kyi yi chad pa spang bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: tsan tsas skur ba btab pa bstan pa yang bsod nams chung zhing skur pa mang ba'i dge slong rnams kyi yi chad pa spang bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The teaching of Ca·πá·∏ça‚Äôs slander is for the purpose of abandoning the discouragement of monks with little merit and much slander.

original: lha sbyin dgrar 'gyur ba la sogs par bstan pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba dbyung ba'i don du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lha sbyin dgrar 'gyur ba la sogs par bstan pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba dbyung ba'i don du bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching of Devadatta becoming an enemy and so on is taught for the purpose of extolling the greatness of the TathƒÅgata.

original: 'di rnams kyi don zhib tu 'phags pa chos bcu pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don zhib tu 'phags pa chos bcu pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the meaning of these in detail by following the noble Ten Dharmas.

original: rdza mkhan gyi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni de'i bzo rig pa dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis snod sna tshogs 'byung bar snang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni de'i bzo rig pa dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis snod sna tshogs 'byung bar snang ba bzhin du /
translated: With regard to the potter's example and so on, just as various vessels appear to arise from the conditions of the potter's knowledge of his craft and the conditions of the wheel and so on,

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gdul bya @261b sna tshogs kyi don du bya ba sna tshogs ston cing /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyang gdul bya @261b sna tshogs kyi don du bya ba sna tshogs ston cing /
translated: so also emanation buddhas display various deeds for the sake of various trainees.

original: mtshan dang ldan par yang ston mod kyi nges pa'i don gyi gtam bdag gi 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i spyod yul sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid ni mi ston te /
analyzed: mtshan dang ldan par yang ston mod kyi nges pa'i don gyi gtam bdag gi 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i spyod yul sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid ni mi ston te /
translated: They also display the major and minor marks, but they do not display the suchness of the nature of the mind, the object of individual knowledge of the ƒÅryas, which is the discourse of the definitive meaning.

original: sprul pa'i gdul bya ni tha mal pa sna tshogs yin pas de ltar bstan pas 'dul bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i gdul bya ni tha mal pa sna tshogs yin pas de ltar bstan pas 'dul bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the trainees of emanation buddhas are various ordinary beings, and they are not trained by such teachings.

original: 'di rnams kyi don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of these has been explained in detail above.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sprul pa'i gdul bya'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas sprul pa'i gdul bya'i khyad par ston te /
translated: The phrase great intelligence and so forth indicates the special disciples who are emanations.

original: rgyang pan pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni khas mi len la /
analyzed: rgyang pan pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa drug las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni khas mi len la /
translated: Some, such as the Lokayatas, do not accept anything other than the six consciousnesses.

original: drug po rnams kyang 'chi ba'i dus na 'gags pas chad par lta ba ste /
analyzed: drug po rnams kyang 'chi ba'i dus na 'gags pas chad par lta ba ste /
translated: Since the six consciousnesses cease at the time of death, they have a view of annihilation.

original: 'jig rten snga phyi med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten snga phyi med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They say, for example, that there is no world beyond.

original: yang grangs can pa la sogs pas kun gzhi'i 'jug pa kun rdzob tu skad cig pa yin zhing /
analyzed: yang grangs can pa la sogs pas kun gzhi'i 'jug pa kun rdzob tu skad cig pa yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, the Samkhyas and so forth think that the engagement of the foundation consciousness is momentary on the conventional level,

original: don dam stong pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir rtag pa'i dngos por lta ba'o //
analyzed: don dam stong pa nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir rtag pa'i dngos por lta ba'o //
translated: but since they do not realize that ultimately it is emptiness, they view it as a permanent entity.

original: de la sogs pa lta ba sna tshogs pa'i gnyen por bshad pa sna tshogs pa ston par snang ba'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa lta ba sna tshogs pa'i gnyen por bshad pa sna tshogs pa ston par snang ba'o //
translated: It appears that the various teachings were given as antidotes to such various views.

original: blo gros chen po rang gi blo'i zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa mi 'gal ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rang gi blo'i zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa mi 'gal ba nyid du ston te /
translated: The phrase great intelligence, and so forth indicates that the teaching of cyclic existence without beginning or end and the teaching of nirvana are not contradictory.

original: don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning is explained in detail above.

original: rang gi blo'i shes pa la sogs pas byis pa'i skye bos de'i thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma shes par mi rung ba nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi blo'i shes pa la sogs pas byis pa'i skye bos de'i thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma shes par mi rung ba nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: It shows that the beginning, middle, and end of that are not suitable to be known by childish beings with their own cognition, etc.

original: thar pa de nyid bag chags kyis gzhi spangs pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa de nyid bag chags kyis gzhi spangs pa'o //
translated: That liberation is the abandonment of the basis of traces.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni gnas skabs dang mthar thug pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba la ma ltos par theg pa gsum dang / theg pa med pa dang / theg pa gcig nyid du nges par ston pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bye brag ma phye bar sangs rgyas la mya ngan las 'da' ba med ces pa dang /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni gnas skabs dang mthar thug pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba la ma ltos par theg pa gsum dang / theg pa med pa dang / theg pa gcig nyid du nges par ston pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i bye brag ma phye bar sangs rgyas la mya ngan las 'da' ba med ces pa dang /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that without relying on the divisions of the temporary and ultimate, etc., it shows the certainty of the three vehicles, the absence of vehicles, and the oneness of the vehicle, and that without distinguishing the different types of nirvana, it says that the Buddha does not have nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'da'o zhes phyogs gcig tu nges par ston pa dang / dus dang rkyen gyi dbye ba ma byas par 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du lung ston pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral bar bshad pa dang /üîΩyang gsung rab dag las dus dang rkyen gyi dbye ba la ma ltos par dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams mngon par rtogs pa mthar @262a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da'o zhes phyogs gcig tu nges par ston pa dang / dus dang rkyen gyi dbye ba ma byas par 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du lung ston pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral bar bshad pa dang / yang gsung rab dag las dus dang rkyen gyi dbye ba la ma ltos par dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams mngon par rtogs pa mthar @262a * //
translated: The Buddha taught that arhats attain nirvana, that all beings will attain buddhahood without any division of time or circumstance and that arhats are free of all faults such as the latent tendencies of the afflictions.

original: thug pa'i ye shes thob par lung bstan pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyis srid par skye ba len pa med par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: thug pa'i ye shes thob par lung bstan pa dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyis srid par skye ba len pa med par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Again, the scriptures state that without any division of time or circumstance, arhats and pratyekabuddhas are prophesied to attain the gnosis of the final realization and that arhats realize that they will not take rebirth in existence.

original: zag pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob par bshad pa rnams ni zhum pa rnams kyang spro bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob par bshad pa rnams ni zhum pa rnams kyang spro bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: It is explained that they attain the gnosis of the elimination of contaminants and of the nonarising of those contaminants.üîΩThese teachings were given in order to encourage the fainthearted.

original: snga ma ltar rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems zhum nas nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa rnams spro bar bya ba dang / gzhan yang rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par dka' ba nyid du ston pas /üîΩthar pa la sems zhum pa rnams spro ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma ltar rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sems zhum nas nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa rnams spro bar bya ba dang / gzhan yang rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par dka' ba nyid du ston pas / thar pa la sems zhum pa rnams spro ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is for the purpose of encouraging those who are discouraged about liberation by teaching that it is difficult to attain perfect enlightenment.

original: myur ba srid pa gsum gyis grol ba nyan thos kyi byang chub kyang yod do zhes spro ba bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don du dgongs te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: myur ba srid pa gsum gyis grol ba nyan thos kyi byang chub kyang yod do zhes spro ba bskyed pa la sogs pa'i don du dgongs te bshad pa'o //
translated: It is for the purpose of encouraging them by saying, There is even the enlightenment of the Hearers, liberation in three lifetimes, which is quick!

original: de dag gi dgongs don la sogs pa'i bye brag zhib tu ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //üîΩsangs rgyas dag gis zhes pa la sogs pas ni de la nyan thos sam ma byis pa'i skye bos btags pa ltar /
analyzed: de dag gi dgongs don la sogs pa'i bye brag zhib tu ni sngar rgyas par bstan no // sangs rgyas dag gis zhes pa la sogs pas ni de la nyan thos sam ma byis pa'i skye bos btags pa ltar /
translated: The specific topics of the thought of these [passages] and so forth were taught extensively above.

original: rnam par smin pa'i lus 'dor zhing 'grongs pa lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa med par ston te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i lus 'dor zhing 'grongs pa lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa med par ston te /
translated: The line The Buddhas, and so forth, teaches that there is no nirvana like that of the Hearers, which is like the abandonment and death of a ripened body, as imagined by Hearers and childish beings.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas chos kyi sku'i ye shes rgyun dang ldan par skyed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas chos kyi sku'i ye shes rgyun dang ldan par skyed cing /
translated: Having completed the collections, the Buddha generated the pristine wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya in a continuous stream.

original: ye shes de nyid kyis gzigs pa'i lam bshad cing /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid kyis gzigs pa'i lam bshad cing /
translated: That pristine wisdom explained the path of seeing.

original: gdul bya rnams kyang mthar thug pa'i lam de nyid nas 'gro zhing /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyang mthar thug pa'i lam de nyid nas 'gro zhing /
translated: Also, disciples proceed on that very path to the ultimate and

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: attain buddhahood.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Therefore, he does not pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ye shes 'chi med pa dam pa de las gzhan med thob //üîΩces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'chi med pa dam pa de las gzhan med thob // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: From that sublime, immortal pristine wisdom, there is no other.

original: gzhan yang tshig 'di rnams kyis mthar thug la theg pa gcig nyid yin pas gsum la sogs par bstan pa dgongs pa can nyid du yang ston no //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshig 'di rnams kyis mthar thug la theg pa gcig nyid yin pas gsum la sogs par bstan pa dgongs pa can nyid du yang ston no //
translated: Also, these words teach that the ultimate is the single vehicle and that the teachings of three vehicles and so on are provisional.

original: yang 'dis sangs rgyas rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob par bstan pas /
analyzed: yang 'dis sangs rgyas rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob par bstan pas /
translated: Also, this teaches that the buddhas attain great nirvƒÅ·πáa that is not a state of abiding.

original: mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes mtha' gcig tu bstan pa yang dgongs pa can nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes mtha' gcig tu bstan pa yang dgongs pa can nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: The statement that he will not pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa is also shown to be interpretable in meaning.

original: yang sngar bstan pa'i bag chags bzhi po rnams gang yin pa dang / gang la brten pa la sogs pa ni srid pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang sngar bstan pa'i bag chags bzhi po rnams gang yin pa dang / gang la brten pa la sogs pa ni srid pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four habitual propensities taught above are the ‚Äúhabitual propensities for the three realms, the propensities for the two hindrances, and the propensities for the two grasping.‚Äù

original: srid pa'i zag pa dang / 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / gzugs kyi zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa dang / 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / gzugs kyi zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa ste /
translated: The propensities for the three realms are the propensities for the realm of desire, the propensities for the realm of form, and the propensities for the formless realm.

original: 'di rnams kyi don ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meanings of these have been explained above.

original: de rnams kyi bag chags rnam pa bzhi kun @262b gzhi rnam par shes pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pas dngos por brtags pa'i dbang gis bsgos shing gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bag chags rnam pa bzhi kun @262b gzhi rnam par shes pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pas dngos por brtags pa'i dbang gis bsgos shing gzhag pa'o //
translated: These four kinds of propensities are infused and established in the store consciousness by the mental consciousness through the power of its discrimination of things.

original: yid la gnas zhes pa ni de dang 'brel ba'i tshul gyis so //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes zhes pa la sogs pa ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: yid la gnas zhes pa ni de dang 'brel ba'i tshul gyis so // yid kyi rnam par shes zhes pa la sogs pa ni shes par zad do //
translated: ‚ÄúDwelling in the mind‚Äù means in the manner of being associated with it.üîΩThe rest of the passage is easy to understand.

original: thog ma med pa ni kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa ni kun gzhi'o //
translated: The beginningless refers to the store consciousness.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba la mos pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba la mos pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
translated: Interest in nirvana is interest in the nirvana of sravakas and so on.üîΩ

original: phyi rol pas brtags pa'i thar pa la bden par 'dzin cing mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol pas brtags pa'i thar pa la bden par 'dzin cing mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiring to nirvana is to hold that the nirvana of the sravakas and so on or the liberation imagined by non Buddhists is truly existent and to actually aspire to it.

original: 'dod pa chen po rnams sangs rgyas nyid du bstan pa yang dus dang rkyen gyi bye brag la sogs pa la ma ltos par de ltar bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa chen po rnams sangs rgyas nyid du bstan pa yang dus dang rkyen gyi bye brag la sogs pa la ma ltos par de ltar bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la /
translated: The teaching of great desire as buddhahood is also interpretable in meaning, since it is taught without regard to specific times and conditions,

original: dus ring mo zhig na rang gi las kyi sa bon dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de ltar 'gyur ba ni nges pa'i don yin pas sngar bstan pa dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: dus ring mo zhig na rang gi las kyi sa bon dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de ltar 'gyur ba ni nges pa'i don yin pas sngar bstan pa dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: but it is of definitive meaning that it will occur in that way after a long time through the seed of one's karma and the blessing of the tathagatas, and so it is not contradictory to the previous teaching.üîΩIn brief, the path to the definite emergence of buddhahood is twofold, and having extensively taught the perfection of wisdom,

original: de la 'dir sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i lam mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis yin pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyogs rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de la 'dir sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'byung ba'i lam mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis yin pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyogs rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: now the second is taught.

original: da ni byams pa dang snying rje sngon du song ba'i byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: da ni byams pa dang snying rje sngon du song ba'i byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Now, having generated the mind of supreme enlightenment preceded by love and compassion,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa'i phyogs cung zad bsdus te ston pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thabs la mkhas pa'i phyogs cung zad bsdus te ston pa ni /
translated: I will briefly collect and teach a portion of the bodhisattva conduct of skillful means.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva... and so forth.

original: de yang sgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i spyod pa rnam pa gnyis las 'dir khyad par du sha'i zas la dga' ba'i srin po rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du /
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i spyod pa rnam pa gnyis las 'dir khyad par du sha'i zas la dga' ba'i srin po rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du /
translated: Moreover, from among the two types of conduct, the practice and the prohibition, here, in particular, in order to care for the rƒÅk·π£asas who delight in the food of flesh,

original: sha za ba'i nyes dmigs rgyas par bstan pa'i sgo nas snying rje can gyis de nyid dgag par bya ba nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: sha za ba'i nyes dmigs rgyas par bstan pa'i sgo nas snying rje can gyis de nyid dgag par bya ba nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: through the extensive teaching of the faults of eating flesh, it is taught that the compassionate one should specifically prohibit that.

original: 'di rnams dri ba gang gi lan du sbyar ba ni /üîΩtshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis zhus nas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams dri ba gang gi lan du sbyar ba ni / tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis zhus nas zhes pa ste /
translated: To which question these are applied as an answer,üîΩit is said, having asked with verses.

original: sngar dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad kyi skabs su zhus nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad kyi skabs su zhus nas zhes pa'o //
translated: Having asked in the context of the one hundred and eight questions above,

original: chos kyi ro'i zas la mos pas zhes pa ni nang du ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i bde ba'i ro dang / rjes thob kyi gnas skabs na /
analyzed: chos kyi ro'i zas la mos pas zhes pa ni nang du ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i bde ba'i ro dang / rjes thob kyi gnas skabs na /
translated: By being devoted to the food of the taste of Dharma means that, inwardly, one is devoted to the taste of the bliss of meditative concentration in equipoise, and, in the period of subsequent attainment,

original: gzhan don sems dang de yi thabs rnyed dang // zhes pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i ro'i zas so //
analyzed: gzhan don sems dang de yi thabs rnyed dang // zhes pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i ro'i zas so //
translated: one is devoted to the food of the taste of the Mahayana, such as the thought of benefitting others and the discovery of the means for doing so.

original: phan tshun du byams pa thob pa ni khyad par du sa dang po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: phan tshun du byams pa thob pa ni khyad par du sa dang po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The attainment of mutual love is the special period of the first ground and so forth.üîΩBecause of attaining the thought of equality

original: chos dang sems can rnams dang ni //üîΩde yi bya ba sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: chos dang sems can rnams dang ni // de yi bya ba sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: toward phenomena, sentient beings,üîΩand their activities, and toward

original: mchog la sems mnyam rnyed pa'i @263a * //üîΩphyir ; / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog la sems mnyam rnyed pa'i @263a * // phyir ; / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the supreme enlightenment.

original: sa rnams su sbyang bar byas zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyis kun gzhi la yod pa'i lam gyi dri ma sbyangs nas myur du 'tshang rgya ba ste /
analyzed: sa rnams su sbyang bar byas zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyis kun gzhi la yod pa'i lam gyi dri ma sbyangs nas myur du 'tshang rgya ba ste /
translated: Having trained on the grounds means that, by means of method and wisdom, one purifies the stains of the path that exist in the ground of all and quickly awakens to buddhahood.

original: dman pa'i lam sngon du ma song ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i lam sngon du ma song ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of bodhisattvas who have not previously traversed the lesser paths.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ngal so pa ni dman pa'i lam sngon du song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ngal so pa ni dman pa'i lam sngon du song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who rests on the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels is one who has previously gone the inferior path.

original: chos bshad par zhes pa ni bshad pa'i chos rnams las sha za ba'i nyes pa bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos bshad par zhes pa ni bshad pa'i chos rnams las sha za ba'i nyes pa bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase please explain the Dharma means, Please explain the faults of eating meat from among the Dharmas that are explained.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis kyang sha za ba bkag ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis kyang sha za ba bkag ste /
translated: Non-Buddhists also prohibit eating meat.

original: drang srong su gegs smras pa /
analyzed: drang srong su gegs smras pa /
translated: The ·πõ·π£i Sugrƒ´va said:

original: khyod kyis phyugs ni sngon bsad de //
analyzed: khyod kyis phyugs ni sngon bsad de //
translated: You have previously killed cattle

original: khrag gi 'dam rdzab tu byas pas //
analyzed: khrag gi 'dam rdzab tu byas pas //
translated: and made a swamp of blood.

original: gal te mtho ris 'gro 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te mtho ris 'gro 'gyur na //
translated: If you go to the higher realms,

original: gang gis dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: by what means will you go to hell?

original: zhes bstan pa dang / gzhan yang drang srong byas sa smras pa /üîΩgang gis gang gi sha za ba //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa dang / gzhan yang drang srong byas sa smras pa / gang gis gang gi sha za ba //
translated: Moreover, the ·πõ·π£i VyƒÅsa said:üîΩLook at the difference between the twoüîΩof those who eat the meat of what

original: de dag gnyis kyi khyad par ltos //
analyzed: de dag gnyis kyi khyad par ltos //
translated: and those who eat the meat of whom.

original: gcig ni skad cig 'grangs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig ni skad cig 'grangs par 'gyur //
translated: One is satisfied for a moment,

original: gcig ni gtan du srog dang 'bral //
analyzed: gcig ni gtan du srog dang 'bral //
translated: the other is deprived of life forever.

original: 'chi'o snyom pa'i sdug bsngal gang //
analyzed: 'chi'o snyom pa'i sdug bsngal gang //
translated: The suffering of thinking,

original: skyes bu la ni skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: skyes bu la ni skye 'gyur ba //
translated: I will die, arises in a person.

original: rjes su dpag pa de yis ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de yis ni //
translated: and that inference

analyzed: gzhan yang bsrung bar 'os pa'o //
translated: is also suitable for protecting others.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma smras pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma smras pa'o //
translated: Thus he spoke in many ways.

original: 'jig rten gyi mgon po khyod kyis bstan pa zhes pa ni de yi bstan pa lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rjes ro gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mgon po khyod kyis bstan pa zhes pa ni de yi bstan pa lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rjes ro gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Lord of the World means that his teaching, the path and result vehicles, become of one taste through non-apprehending compassion.

original: 'tshal ba mi bzlog ces pa ni gzhan za ba'o //
analyzed: 'tshal ba mi bzlog ces pa ni gzhan za ba'o //
translated: The non-reversal of understanding is the understanding of others.

original: rgyu tshad med pa ni bza' bar mi 'os pa'i rgyu mtshan no //üîΩ'di las zhes pa la sogs par thams cad pha dang ma la sogs par ma gyur pa med pas bza' bar mi 'os pa nyid du ston te /üîΩgnyen pa shes ni chung ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu tshad med pa ni bza' bar mi 'os pa'i rgyu mtshan no // 'di las zhes pa la sogs par thams cad pha dang ma la sogs par ma gyur pa med pas bza' bar mi 'os pa nyid du ston te / gnyen pa shes ni chung ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable causes are the reasons for unsuitability to eat.

original: blo gros chen po spyod pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni mi gtsang ba la sogs par 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis mi bza' ba nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po spyod pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni mi gtsang ba la sogs par 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis mi bza' ba nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: From this and so on, it shows the unsuitability to eat because there is no one who has not been a father, mother, and so on, saying, From this body, this great earth, this great ocean, original: gzhan yang 'byung po rnams sdang bar byed pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis spangs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba spangs pa dang / bsams na dbang po dang mi 'phrod pa dang / dngos grub dang / thar pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung po rnams sdang bar byed pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis spangs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba spangs pa dang / bsams na dbang po dang mi 'phrod pa dang / dngos grub dang / thar pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Furthermore, it causes spirits to become hostile, is rejected by holy beings, is an object of shame, is not suitable for the sense faculties when contemplated, and is an obstacle to spiritual powers and liberation.

original: 'khrig pa'i chags pa la sogs pa 'phel ba dang / 'jig rten skyong ba la @263b sogs pa'i lha rnams kyis spong ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la nyes dmigs mang po dang 'brel bas bza' bar ma gnang zhing bkag ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i chags pa la sogs pa 'phel ba dang / 'jig rten skyong ba la @263b sogs pa'i lha rnams kyis spong ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la nyes dmigs mang po dang 'brel bas bza' bar ma gnang zhing bkag ces pa'o //
translated: It increases attachment to sexual intercourse and so forth, is rejected by gods such as the guardians of the world, and is connected with many faults in the present life. Therefore, it is not permitted to eat meat and is prohibited.

original: de las rig sngags 'chang ba rig bsngags sgrub par 'dod pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba /
analyzed: de las rig sngags 'chang ba rig bsngags sgrub par 'dod pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba /
translated: Among those, a knowledge-mantra holder who wishes to accomplish knowledge-mantras follows Action Tantra and so forth.

original: rig sngags dang gzungs sngags la sogs pa sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags dang gzungs sngags la sogs pa sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
translated: He wishes to accomplish knowledge-mantras, dharani-mantras, and so forth.

original: ngas kha zas ni bu'i sha dang sman bzhin du bshad pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ngas kha zas ni bu'i sha dang sman bzhin du bshad pa zhes pa ni /
translated: I have explained food to be like the flesh of one's son and medicine.

original: sha'i zas bu'i sha dang 'dra ba dang / de las gzhan dang drang srong gi zas 'o ma dang 'bras chan la sogs pa ni phan 'dogs pas sman dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: sha'i zas bu'i sha dang 'dra ba dang / de las gzhan dang drang srong gi zas 'o ma dang 'bras chan la sogs pa ni phan 'dogs pas sman dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The food of flesh is like the flesh of one's son, and the other food of the sages, such as milk and rice, is like medicine, because it is beneficial.

original: de yang rol chags pa'i 'du shes kyis ni mi bza' ste /
analyzed: de yang rol chags pa'i 'du shes kyis ni mi bza' ste /
translated: Moreover, one should not eat with the perception of enjoyment.

original: skye ba 'di dang gzhan du phan pa'i 'du shes kyis bza' ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di dang gzhan du phan pa'i 'du shes kyis bza' ba'o //
translated: One should eat with the perception of benefit in this and other lives.

original: hags dang zhes pa ni 'bru mar skol ba las skyags so pa'o //
analyzed: hags dang zhes pa ni 'bru mar skol ba las skyags so pa'o //
translated: The word vomit means what is vomited up from boiling oil.

original: khanda ni ting krol du byas pa'o //
analyzed: khanda ni ting krol du byas pa'o //
translated: Khanda means what is made into a mess.

original: blo gros chen po sngon 'das pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yid ches par bya ba'i don du sngon gyi gtam rgyud bstan pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po sngon 'das pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yid ches par bya ba'i don du sngon gyi gtam rgyud bstan pa'o //
translated: The words Great Being, in the past, etc. teach the story of the past in order to inspire some special disciples.

original: mi 'os par bstan pa ni bza' bar mi 'os pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'os par bstan pa ni bza' bar mi 'os pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The word unfit means what is unfit to eat.

original: de la dbang pos kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni lha'i dbang pos sngon khra'i gzugs su byas pas /
analyzed: de la dbang pos kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni lha'i dbang pos sngon khra'i gzugs su byas pas /
translated: The meaning of the words even Indra, etc. is that the lord of the gods, having previously taken the form of a hawk,

original: rgyal po zhi ldan gyi bsam pa brtag par bya ba'i don du phug ron gtses par gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po zhi ldan gyi bsam pa brtag par bya ba'i don du phug ron gtses par gyur te /
translated: In order to test the resolve of King Arci·π£mƒÅn, a pigeon was tormented.

original: de rgyal po la skyabs su song ba dang / khra'i gzugs des smras pa /
analyzed: de rgyal po la skyabs su song ba dang / khra'i gzugs des smras pa /
translated: When it went to the king for protection, the form of a hawk said:

original: 'di ni nga'i zas skal te /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i zas skal te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is my share of food.üîΩIf I don‚Äôt get it, I will die.‚ÄùüîΩThe king was troubled by this, and he said, ‚ÄúI will weigh its flesh against the measure of your share and give it to you.‚Äù

original: 'di med na nga ni 'chi ba'i dus la bab po zhes rgyal po de gzir ba dang / rgyal pos 'di'i sha dang mnyam pa'i srang tshad la gcal te khyod la sbyin no zhes pa la sogs pa gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di med na nga ni 'chi ba'i dus la bab po zhes rgyal po de gzir ba dang / rgyal pos 'di'i sha dang mnyam pa'i srang tshad la gcal te khyod la sbyin no zhes pa la sogs pa gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like what is said in some scriptures.

original: srog gi rim gro'i phyir zhes pa ni seng ge mo dang ma 'grogs na de yis gsod par 'gyur bas de dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi rim gro'i phyir zhes pa ni seng ge mo dang ma 'grogs na de yis gsod par 'gyur bas de dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of saving his life‚Äù means that if he did not associate with the lioness, he would be killed by her.

original: khyim bdun pa'i grogs zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang ba /
analyzed: khyim bdun pa'i grogs zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang ba /
translated: ‚ÄúThe friend of the householder‚Äù means that he follows the teachings of the TathƒÅgata.

original: las dang po ba rnams kyis 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas shan pa'i khyim dang / chang tshong dang / smad 'tshong ma dang / bya pa dang / nya pa dang / rgyal po pho brang dang / de las gzhan rngon pa la sogs pa rigs ngan gyi khyim mam /
analyzed: las dang po ba rnams kyis 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas shan pa'i khyim dang / chang tshong dang / smad 'tshong ma dang / bya pa dang / nya pa dang / rgyal po pho brang dang / de las gzhan rngon pa la sogs pa rigs ngan gyi khyim mam /
translated: Beginners should not go to places that are not suitable for going, such as the houses of butchers, liquor sellers, prostitutes, bird hunters, fishers, the king‚Äôs palace, or the houses of other low-caste people such as hunters.

original: yang na log par lta ba'i mu stegs srog gi mchod sbyin @264a * //
analyzed: yang na log par lta ba'i mu stegs srog gi mchod sbyin @264a * //
translated: Or, they should not go to the houses of non-Buddhists who delight in the sacrifice of living beings for their wrong views.

original: la dga' ba'i khyim ste bdun po de dag yod pa'i grong khyer na /
analyzed: la dga' ba'i khyim ste bdun po de dag yod pa'i grong khyer na /
translated: In a city where these seven exist,

original: sha la shin tu bkram zhing /
analyzed: sha la shin tu bkram zhing /
translated: the flesh is spread out.

original: de las gzhan yang rten par mi 'os pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams brten na /
analyzed: de las gzhan yang rten par mi 'os pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams brten na /
translated: Moreover, if one relies on the sense pleasures that are not suitable to rely on,

original: mi'i sha za ba'i phra men pha dang phra men ma ste /
analyzed: mi'i sha za ba'i phra men pha dang phra men ma ste /
translated: one will be a demon or a demoness who eats human flesh.

original: gnod sbyin gyi rigs su gtogs pa'i 'gro ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi rigs su gtogs pa'i 'gro ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is a special type of being that belongs to the class of yak·π£as.

original: sha za ba'i nyes pa yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni re zhig za ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang de 'dra ba yin na /
analyzed: sha za ba'i nyes pa yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni re zhig za ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang de 'dra ba yin na /
translated: The faults of eating flesh and so on are as follows. If the faults of eating and so on are like that,

original: rtag tu bsten cing bsnyen pa'i nyes pa chen por 'gyur bdag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bsten cing bsnyen pa'i nyes pa chen por 'gyur bdag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: What need is there to mention the great fault of always relying on and attending to it?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas mi bza' ba'i rgyu mtshan bsdus pa dang / gzhan dag za bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mchan ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas mi bza' ba'i rgyu mtshan bsdus pa dang / gzhan dag za bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mchan ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat Intelligence, etc.‚Äù summarizes the reason for not eating it, and shows the reason for others to eat it.

original: gsod par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni phal che ba la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: gsod par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni phal che ba la dgongs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt will not be killed‚Äù is intended to refer to the majority.

original: ngag gi rgyun 'og ma rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi rgyun 'og ma rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The following lines of the text explain the reason.

original: blo gros chen po gang nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum dag pa'i sha gang zhig la dgongs te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum dag pa'i sha gang zhig la dgongs te /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat Intelligence, etc.‚Äù refers to the three types of pure meat that are intended.

original: nyan thos rnams la gnang ba bdag nyid kyis srog ma bcad pa dang / gzhan gcod du ma bcug pa dang / ma bsams shing blo yis yul du ma byas par lhung bzed la sogs pa'i snod du /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la gnang ba bdag nyid kyis srog ma bcad pa dang / gzhan gcod du ma bcug pa dang / ma bsams shing blo yis yul du ma byas par lhung bzed la sogs pa'i snod du /
translated: The meat that is not given to the Hearers is that which one has not killed oneself, that which one has not caused another to kill, and that which one has not intended, mentally, to be killed, and which is given to one‚Äôs begging bowl, etc.

original: sbyin bdag la sogs pas bskur ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin bdag la sogs pas bskur ba ste /
translated: by benefactors, etc.

original: de 'dra ba yang dngos sam brgyud pas sems can rnams la gnod par 'gyur pas rung ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba yang dngos sam brgyud pas sems can rnams la gnod par 'gyur pas rung ba ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Such is not proper, either directly or indirectly, since it harms sentient beings.

original: sh'akya'i sras kyi yin no zhes pa ni sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras kyi yin no zhes pa ni sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúson of the ≈öƒÅkyas‚Äù means ‚Äú≈õrama·πáa who is a son of the ≈öƒÅkyas.‚Äù

original: rnam pa mang por rtog pa ni don 'byung ba'i gleng gzhi de dang de dag la brtags nas zhes pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam pa mang por rtog pa ni don 'byung ba'i gleng gzhi de dang de dag la brtags nas zhes pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmany kinds of speculation‚Äù means that, having examined this and that origin of the teaching of the meaning,

original: bslab pa bca' ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa ston par byed pa'i gtam rgyud de da gla brtags pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa ston par byed pa'i gtam rgyud de da gla brtags pa ste /
translated: one should examine the story that teaches the purpose of the precepts, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kun dga' bo la bslab pa phra mo bag yangs su byar yod kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kun dga' bo la bslab pa phra mo bag yangs su byar yod kyis /
translated: The TathƒÅgata said to ƒÄnanda, ‚ÄúYou may relax the minor precepts,

original: da mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus su khyod yis nga la dris shig ces gsungs pas sha'i zas la sogs pa bslab pa phra mo rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo zhes smra'o //
analyzed: da mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus su khyod yis nga la dris shig ces gsungs pas sha'i zas la sogs pa bslab pa phra mo rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo zhes smra'o //
translated: but when I enter nirvana, you should ask me about them.‚Äù Therefore, they say that the Blessed One permitted the minor precepts, such as eating meat.

original: sha za ba'i gtan tshigs su snang ba zhes pa yang don 'di nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sha za ba'i gtan tshigs su snang ba zhes pa yang don 'di nyid dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The passage ‚Äúbecause it appears as a reason for eating meat‚Äù should be applied to this very point.

original: yang na don 'byung ba zhes pa de dag gi mngon par 'dod pa'i don nyid la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na don 'byung ba zhes pa de dag gi mngon par 'dod pa'i don nyid la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or, the meaning of ‚Äúarising‚Äù should be applied to their very desired meaning.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnang zhing rung ba yin na sha thams cad za ba gcad par mi bya ba @264b nyid du 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas gnang zhing rung ba yin na sha thams cad za ba gcad par mi bya ba @264b nyid du 'gyur ba las /
translated: Moreover, if it were the case that the TathƒÅgata allowed and permitted the eating of all meat, then it would be impossible to eliminate eating meat.

original: de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rung zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is not permitted.

original: de ltar na cung zad gnang ba yang med dam snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: de ltar na cung zad gnang ba yang med dam snyam du dogs na /
translated: If one wonders, ‚ÄúIn that case, is there not even a little that is permitted?‚Äù

original: bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo nas /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo nas /
translated: From the wheel of dharma of the four truths

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod kyi bar gyi bstan pa brjod pa de dang de dag las /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod kyi bar gyi bstan pa brjod pa de dang de dag las /
translated: up to the pi·π≠aka of the awareness holders, in all those teachings

original: so sor thar pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi mas rim gyis bca' ba skas kyi gdang bu bre ba'i tshul du rnam pa gsum bcas nas don chen po dang ldan pa gong ma rnams mi nyams par bya ba'i don du nyan thos rnams la gnang ba byas pa'i rnam gsum
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi mas rim gyis bca' ba skas kyi gdang bu bre ba'i tshul du rnam pa gsum bcas nas don chen po dang ldan pa gong ma rnams mi nyams par bya ba'i don du nyan thos rnams la gnang ba byas pa'i rnam gsum
translated: The three types of vows are taken in stages, like the steps of a staircase, beginning with the pratimoksha, followed by the bodhisattva vows and then the vidyadhara vows.üîΩThe three types of vows are of great benefit and are maintained by the masters of the past so that the lower vows are not damaged by the higher ones.

original: dag pa'i sha la sogs pa yang theg pa gong ma rnams su bkag ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i sha la sogs pa yang theg pa gong ma rnams su bkag ste /
translated: The three types of vows are pure because the consumption of meat and so forth is prohibited in the higher vehicles.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis shi ba bcu'i sha ni mi bkag mod kyi /üîΩ'dir srin po la sogs pa rjes su gzung ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis shi ba bcu'i sha ni mi bkag mod kyi / 'dir srin po la sogs pa rjes su gzung ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the meat of the ten types of animals that have died naturally is not prohibited.üîΩHowever, in this case, the meat of all animals, whether it is for the sake of protecting rakshasas and so forth,

original: dngos sam brgyud pas sems can la gnod pa thag bsring bar bya ba'i don srog chags tham cad kyi sha thams cad dus sam gnas skabs thams cad du kun dga' yang bzang ba'i thabs med par ril gyis bkag pa'o //
analyzed: dngos sam brgyud pas sems can la gnod pa thag bsring bar bya ba'i don srog chags tham cad kyi sha thams cad dus sam gnas skabs thams cad du kun dga' yang bzang ba'i thabs med par ril gyis bkag pa'o //
translated: or for the sake of directly or indirectly preventing harm to sentient beings, is completely prohibited at all times and in all situations, because there is no good method for doing this.

original: de la rnag bzhin gyis shi ba bcu ni nyan thos sam /
analyzed: de la rnag bzhin gyis shi ba bcu ni nyan thos sam /
translated: The ten kinds of death like a boil are not deaths caused by being eaten by some shravaka,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa 'ga' zhig za ba'i dbang gis shi ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa 'ga' zhig za ba'i dbang gis shi ba ma yin pa /
translated: bodhisattva, etc.

original: sems can rnams kyi srog yun ring du gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i rkyen phyi dang nang gis bsus pa te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi srog yun ring du gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i rkyen phyi dang nang gis bsus pa te /
translated: They are deaths caused by the internal and external conditions adverse to the longevity of living beings.

original: de la phyi'i dbang du byas na sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i gnod pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la phyi'i dbang du byas na sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i gnod pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: In this regard, from the point of view of the external, there are two kinds of harm, that of living beings and that of non-living beings.

original: sems can ma yin pa yang sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba bzhir snang bas srog la gnod pa sta /
analyzed: sems can ma yin pa yang sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba bzhir snang bas srog la gnod pa sta /
translated: Even non-living beings, appearing as the four elements such as earth, etc., harm life.

original: de lta na phyi rol gyi 'gal rkyen rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de lta na phyi rol gyi 'gal rkyen rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Thus, there are five kinds of external adverse conditions.

original: nang gi dbang du byas na rlung las gyur ba dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang ; / bad kan las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad rnams te /
analyzed: nang gi dbang du byas na rlung las gyur ba dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang ; / bad kan las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa'i nad rnams te /
translated: From the point of view of the internal, there are diseases arising from wind, bile, phlegm, and their combination.

original: de ltar 'gal rkyen rnam pa bzhi dang / tshe zad nas 'chi ba ste mthun rkyen ma chang ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gal rkyen rnam pa bzhi dang / tshe zad nas 'chi ba ste mthun rkyen ma chang ba'o //
translated: Thus, there are four kinds of adverse conditions, and death from the exhaustion of life, i.e., the absence of favorable conditions.

original: de ltar na nang gi dbang du byas pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi dbang du byas pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Thus, there are five types of internal food.

original: thams cad bsdoms pas bcu ru 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad bsdoms pas bcu ru 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When all are combined, there are ten.

original: de yang ji ltar mi rnams mi'i sha mi za yang 'chi ba'i rkyen rnam pa bcu po de rnams kyis mi rnams 'chi ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar mi rnams mi'i sha mi za yang 'chi ba'i rkyen rnam pa bcu po de rnams kyis mi rnams 'chi ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as humans do not eat human flesh, humans die through these ten conditions.

original: rnam pa gsum dag pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod las na dang ga ha dang po la sogs pa bza' bar bshad pa yang 'di rnams kyi nang du 'dus par zad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dag pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod las na dang ga ha dang po la sogs pa bza' bar bshad pa yang 'di rnams kyi nang du 'dus par zad do //
translated: The three types of pure food and the vidyadhara pitaka explain that one should eat the first gaha and so on.

original: nges pa'i don de ni de ltar @265a * //üîΩyin mod kyi /
analyzed: nges pa'i don de ni de ltar @265a * // yin mod kyi /
translated: The definitive meaning is just as it is.

original: 'dir ni sha'i zas za ba tsam la brten nas sems can la gnod par 'gyur ba srid pa dang / snga ma ltar srin po la sogs pa rjes su gzung ba'i don du thams cad bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sha'i zas za ba tsam la brten nas sems can la gnod par 'gyur ba srid pa dang / snga ma ltar srin po la sogs pa rjes su gzung ba'i don du thams cad bkag pa'o //
translated: However, here, since it is possible that harm to sentient beings is based on merely eating flesh food, and in order to care for rakshasas and so on, all are prohibited.

original: chos kyi zas za ste zang zing gi zas ma yin zhes pa ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba thob pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi zas za ste zang zing gi zas ma yin zhes pa ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba thob pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone eats the food of dharma, not the food of material things‚Äù is from the perspective of those who obtain the bliss of samadhi.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa zhes pa ni mkhyen kyang thugs mngon du mi gtod pas mi gzigs pa dag kyang srid pas de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa zhes pa ni mkhyen kyang thugs mngon du mi gtod pas mi gzigs pa dag kyang srid pas de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The phrase all-knowing, all-seeing is not meant to imply that there are some who know but do not see, or see but do not know.

original: sems can thams cad la gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la gzigs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is all-knowing, all-seeing in the sense that he sees all sentient beings.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis ni don snga ma las lhag pa yang ston pas zhu ba lhag tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis ni don snga ma las lhag pa yang ston pas zhu ba lhag tu byas pa'o //
translated: The verses of the request also show that the Buddha's knowledge is superior to the previous meaning, so the request is superior.

original: 'bru mar gyis kyang byug pa yang //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyis kyang byug pa yang //
translated: Anoint with oil and so on.üîΩThe meaning of this is that one should not anoint the body with oil,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni des lus rgyags par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni des lus rgyags par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because it will become too soft, or

original: long 'chos nyid du 'gyur bas so //üîΩgzhan yang shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i khri dra mig tu byas pa rnams kyi steng du nyal bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: long 'chos nyid du 'gyur bas so // gzhan yang shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i khri dra mig tu byas pa rnams kyi steng du nyal bar mi bya ste /
translated: because it will become too heavy.

original: dra mig de dag na gnas pa'i srog chags phra mo rnams de'i bsgul bskyod dang skad kyis 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dra mig de dag na gnas pa'i srog chags phra mo rnams de'i bsgul bskyod dang skad kyis 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not sleep on a bed made of wood and so on, with holes for the limbs, because the small creatures living in those holes will be frightened by the movement and noise of the person.

original: dregs pa ni nga rgyal dang rgyags pa'i cha ru gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dregs pa ni nga rgyal dang rgyags pa'i cha ru gtogs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is a part of pride and intoxication.

original: rtog pa ni mdor phan 'dogs pa'am sdug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni mdor phan 'dogs pa'am sdug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is, in brief, the apprehension of a pleasant sign.

original: 'dod chags kyis ni sems rmongs byed //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni sems rmongs byed //
translated: Desire is the cause of delusion.

original: ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of these and other passages is as follows.

original: 'dod pas ldongs la khrel med ngo tsha med //
analyzed: 'dod pas ldongs la khrel med ngo tsha med //
translated: The one blinded by desire has no shame or embarrassment.

original: ces pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: Or else,

original: gzhan yang / 'dod pas yongs su bslus pa dang // rgya mtsho'i chu nang 'jug par byed //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dod pas yongs su bslus pa dang // rgya mtsho'i chu nang 'jug par byed //
translated: Desire causes one to be deceived, to enter the waters of the ocean.üîΩIt causes one to enter

original: mtshon cha thibs por 'bab pa yi //üîΩg-yul du yang dag 'jug par byed //
analyzed: mtshon cha thibs por 'bab pa yi // g-yul du yang dag 'jug par byed //
translated: the battle of the thickets of weapons.

original: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /üîΩblang bya dang dor bya'i bye brag la rmongs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po 'du bar rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ste / blang bya dang dor bya'i bye brag la rmongs pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po 'du bar rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: And so on.

original: de lta bur skye ba len cing grol bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bur skye ba len cing grol bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of delusion about the distinction between what is to be done and what is not to be done, the contaminated aggregates are brought together, and one is reborn in that way, and does not become liberated.

original: de dag gnyis ka zhes pa ni bsad nas 'tshong ba dang / nyo ba gnyis ka'o 'jig rten gnyis zhes pa yang de dag dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka zhes pa ni bsad nas 'tshong ba dang / nyo ba gnyis ka'o 'jig rten gnyis zhes pa yang de dag dang sbyar ro //
translated: The two of them refers to both the one who kills and sells and the one who buys. The two worlds refers to both of them.

original: yod med pas zhes pa ni spyir sha za ba'i nyes pas dngos su ma bskul yang /
analyzed: yod med pas zhes pa ni spyir sha za ba'i nyes pas dngos su ma bskul yang /
translated: The phrase because of existence and nonexistence means that, in general, the faults of eating meat are not directly enjoined.

original: brgyud nas bskul bar 'gyur bas so //üîΩde la / da dang sangs rgyas dag gis bshad //
analyzed: brgyud nas bskul bar 'gyur bas so // de la / da dang sangs rgyas dag gis bshad //
translated: However, they are indirectly enjoined.

original: ces pa gsung rab kyi phyogs gang las bshad snyam nas /
analyzed: ces pa gsung rab kyi phyogs gang las bshad snyam nas /
translated: With regard to the line the buddhas of the past and present have taught, one might wonder, In which scriptures have they taught?

original: glang po'i rtsal dang sprin chen dang // zhes pa la sogs @265b pa'o //
analyzed: glang po'i rtsal dang sprin chen dang // zhes pa la sogs @265b pa'o //
translated: The line the Hastikakshya, the MahƒÅmegha, and so on lists the scriptures.

original: mthong dang thos dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni de 'dra ba'i nyes pa mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong dang thos dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni de 'dra ba'i nyes pa mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The line what is seen, heard, and so on refers to seeing, hearing, and so on the faults described above.

original: 'dod chags thar pa la bar chad byed ces pa ni khyad par du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: 'dod chags thar pa la bar chad byed ces pa ni khyad par du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: The line attachment is an obstacle to liberation refers specifically to attachment to sexual intercourse.

original: bud med chags pas yid bcings pa //
analyzed: bud med chags pas yid bcings pa //
translated: The line women, attached to whom the mind is bound

original: phyi nas me yis sreg par byed //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi nas me yis sreg par byed // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is explained by the line later they burn like fire.

original: sha dang chang la sogs pa la chags shing bsten pa yang de dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sha dang chang la sogs pa la chags shing bsten pa yang de dang mtshungs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Attachment to and reliance on meat, alcohol, and so on are similar to this.üîΩThe line what is appropriate and what is not

original: ran pa dang ni mi 'phrod par //
analyzed: ran pa dang ni mi 'phrod par //
translated: is explained by the line what is appropriate and what is not is not understood.

original: zhes pa la sngar bstan pa ltar sman dang 'dra ba drang srong gi zas rnams kyang ran pa tsam du bza' zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa la sngar bstan pa ltar sman dang 'dra ba drang srong gi zas rnams kyang ran pa tsam du bza' zhing /
translated: As previously explained, one should eat the food of the sages, which is like medicine, in just the right amount.

original: sha'i zas la ni mi 'phrod pa'i 'du shes kyis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sha'i zas la ni mi 'phrod pa'i 'du shes kyis spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid meat as food, with the perception that it is unwholesome.

original: wa la sogs dang 'grogs bya bas //
analyzed: wa la sogs dang 'grogs bya bas //
translated: One should associate with foxes and so on.

original: zhes pa ni de de dag tu skye zhing de'i rigs dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de de dag tu skye zhing de'i rigs dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: One is born among them, and associates with their kind.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i rgyal mtshan no //
translated: This is the banner of the noble ones.

original: zhes pa ni tshul khrims kyis brgyan cing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshul khrims kyis brgyan cing /
translated: One is adorned with morality,

original: pha rol bdud las rgyal ba'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: pha rol bdud las rgyal ba'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: and this is the sign of victory over the enemy, i.e., the maras.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i 'grel pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rgyan las le'u bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i 'grel pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rgyan las le'u bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the seventh chapter of the Ornament of the Essence, the commentary on the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab zung du 'jug pa'i lam gyis sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab zung du 'jug pa'i lam gyis sangs rgyas nyid du nges par 'gyur ba la /
translated: Then, the Bhagavan said to Bodhisattva Mahasattva Maitreya, ‚ÄúMaitreya, you should understand that the bodhisattvas, the great beings, who are skilled in the methods of the perfection of wisdom, are skilled in the methods of the perfection of wisdom if they possess four dharmas.

original: bar chad 'byung ba bzlog par bya ba'i don du nus pa dang ldan pa'i sngags ston te /
analyzed: bar chad 'byung ba bzlog par bya ba'i don du nus pa dang ldan pa'i sngags ston te /
translated: In order to avert the arising of obstacles, the mantra that has the power to do that is taught.

original: de yang mant'a ces pa'i don ni yid can skyob par byed pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi rtogs ba srung bar byed pa dang bsgrub bya 'gugs par byed pas sngags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang mant'a ces pa'i don ni yid can skyob par byed pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi rtogs ba srung bar byed pa dang bsgrub bya 'gugs par byed pas sngags zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of mantra is that it protects the one who has mind, it protects the realization of thatness, and it attracts the one to be accomplished, and thus it is called mantra.

original: lam gyi yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes a branch of the path.

original: 'dir bdud kyi byed pa yang sa bdun pa man chod du byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par rtogs pa myur du 'jug pa la gegs byed pa dag srid de /
analyzed: 'dir bdud kyi byed pa yang sa bdun pa man chod du byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par rtogs pa myur du 'jug pa la gegs byed pa dag srid de /
translated: Here, the activity of Mara is possible up to the seventh ground for bodhisattvas to obstruct their swift entry to realization.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: sa bdun pa man chod du bdud dam bdud kyi las kyang rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bdun pa man chod du bdud dam bdud kyi las kyang rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Up to the seventh ground, one should know the activity of Mara.

original: de la skabs mi rnyed ces pa ni nyes pa'i go skabs mi rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la skabs mi rnyed ces pa ni nyes pa'i go skabs mi rnyed pa'o //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúdoes not find an opportunity‚Äù means that it does not find an opportunity to create faults.

original: nam mkha' lding ni dud 'gro'i rigs su gtogs pa nam mkha' la spyod cing klu rnams zas su za ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding ni dud 'gro'i rigs su gtogs pa nam mkha' la spyod cing klu rnams zas su za ba ste /
translated: Garuda is a type of animal that moves through the sky and eats nagas.

original: yang dag dbyangs la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las slob dpon klu sgrub kyis ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag dbyangs la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las slob dpon klu sgrub kyis ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Acarya Nagarjuna has said in his commentary on the Prajnaparamita:üîΩThe Bhuta is in the northeast corner.üîΩ The Asura is in the northeast corner.üîΩThe Asura is in the northeast corner.

original: 'byung po ni byang shar gyi mtshams na gnas pa'i 'byung po @266a * //üîΩdbang ldan no //
analyzed: 'byung po ni byang shar gyi mtshams na gnas pa'i 'byung po @266a * // dbang ldan no //
translated: The Asura is in the northeast corner.üîΩThe Asura is in the northeast corner.üîΩ The Asura is in the northeast corner.üîΩThe Asura is in the northeast corner.üîΩ The Asura is in the northeast corner.

original: 'di ni mi ma yin no zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi ma yin no zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: The Asura is in the northeast corner.üîΩThe Asura is in the northeast corner.üîΩ The Asura is in the northeast corner.

original: sgra gcan 'dzin dang / mgul phreng dang / rab rgod la sogs pa'o //üîΩgrul bum la sogs pa ni phal cher yi dags kyi 'gro bar gtogs pa las kyi dbang gis dman pa'i yi dags rnams las khyad par du mthu dang rdzu 'phrul du ldan pa /
analyzed: sgra gcan 'dzin dang / mgul phreng dang / rab rgod la sogs pa'o //üîΩgrul bum la sogs pa ni phal cher yi dags kyi 'gro bar gtogs pa las kyi dbang gis dman pa'i yi dags rnams las khyad par du mthu dang rdzu 'phrul du ldan pa /
translated: The Asura is in the northeast corner.

original: gzhan la gnod pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is associated with the intention to harm others.

original: de la grul bum ni 'bras bu che ba ste bum pa'i tshad tsam dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la grul bum ni 'bras bu che ba ste bum pa'i tshad tsam dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Among them, the kumbhƒÅ·πá·∏ças are of great size, the size of a pot.

original: sha za ba ni rdul khrod dam chab khung gi gnas na gnas pa sha'i zas la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sha za ba ni rdul khrod dam chab khung gi gnas na gnas pa sha'i zas la dga' ba'o //
translated: The pi≈õƒÅcas live in places such as dust heaps and cesspools, and delight in eating flesh.

original: gnon po ni mi rnams kyi gzi brjid dam yid 'grib pa dang gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnon po ni mi rnams kyi gzi brjid dam yid 'grib pa dang gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: The bh≈´tas are those who diminish the splendor or the mind of humans and cause harm.

original: brjed byed ni dran pa 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjed byed ni dran pa 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: The apasmaras are those who steal memory.

original: mdangs 'phrogs pa ni khrag dang khu ba 'dren par byed pas gzi mdangs la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: mdangs 'phrogs pa ni khrag dang khu ba 'dren par byed pas gzi mdangs la gnod pa'o //
translated: The ojohƒÅras are those who harm splendor by drawing out blood and semen.

original: lus srul po ni lus mi 'dra ba dum bzung zhing gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lus srul po ni lus mi 'dra ba dum bzung zhing gzhan la gnod par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The p≈´tanas are those with an incomplete body, who harm others.

original: gzhan ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The others have been explained before.

original: gzhan yang sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi mnga' bdag chen por gyur pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngags kyi tshig 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi mnga' bdag chen por gyur pas /
translated: Moreover, these mantra words were spoken by the TathƒÅgata, the Great Lord of Dharma,

original: sngar bstan pa'i mdo'i brjod bya'i don zab mo ston pa'i tshig tu yang byin gyis brlabs shing brdar byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams rjes su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i mdo'i brjod bya'i don zab mo ston pa'i tshig tu yang byin gyis brlabs shing brdar byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams rjes su 'dzin pas /
translated: And it is also a seal because it is blessed as the words that teach the profound meaning of the subject matter of the sutras taught above, and because it is a seal that is impressed on the bodhisattvas who are to be guided.

original: 'di dag klog par byed pa de yis lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo thams cad bklags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag klog par byed pa de yis lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo thams cad bklags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And by reading this, one reads the entire sutra of the Descent into Lanka.

original: khyad par du yang sngags kyi tshig 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis srin po rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du yang sngags kyi tshig 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis srin po rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs zhes pa ste /
translated: In particular, these mantra words were spoken by the Bhagavat in order to ward off rakshasas.

original: 'bod 'grogs kyi 'khor de rnams la chos bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams ni rjes su 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'bod 'grogs kyi 'khor de rnams la chos bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams ni rjes su 'dzin la /
translated: Those in the retinue of rakshasas who are fortunate enough to receive the teachings of the dharma are guided.

original: de las gzhan pa ma rungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams ni re zhig tshar gcad pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ma rungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams ni re zhig tshar gcad pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: And those who have other, evil thoughts are, for the time being, subdued and so forth.

original: de ltar na 'di ni shal dga' ba'i srin po rnams rjes su 'dzin cing tshar gcod pas le'u snga ma nyid kyi yan lag tu sbyar bar bya'o /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni shal dga' ba'i srin po rnams rjes su 'dzin cing tshar gcod pas le'u snga ma nyid kyi yan lag tu sbyar bar bya'o /
translated: Thus, since this [chapter] is connected to the previous chapter as a branch of it, it is the one that cares for and annihilates the rƒÅk·π£asas who delight in flesh.

original: // / de ltar dris pa dang lan dag gi sgo nas brjod par bya ba'i de kho na nyid rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar dris pa dang lan dag gi sgo nas brjod par bya ba'i de kho na nyid rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus extensively explained the suchness that is to be expressed through the questions and answers,

original: da ni dri ba'i don sngar bstan pa rnams bstan par @266b bya ba dang / bstan pa rnams tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas bsdus te bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'khor gyi gtso bos sngar bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pas slar yang bstod cing /
analyzed: da ni dri ba'i don sngar bstan pa rnams bstan par @266b bya ba dang / bstan pa rnams tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas bsdus te bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'khor gyi gtso bos sngar bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pas slar yang bstod cing /
translated: now, in order to teach the topics of the questions that were previously taught and to summarize the teachings in verses for easy understanding, the principal retinue again praises [the teacher] with the verses that were previously taught and

original: don gyis zhus pa ni /
analyzed: don gyis zhus pa ni /
translated: makes a request with the meaning of the words.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn...

original: 'dir dgos pa lhag pa dang ldan pa dang / zhu ba po de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa khyad par can skyes shing /
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa lhag pa dang ldan pa dang / zhu ba po de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa khyad par can skyes shing /
translated: Here, the one who requests possesses the remainder of the purpose and has given rise to special faith in the TathƒÅgata.

original: de'i yon tan gyi khyad par rnams snga ma de dag tsam du 'dus so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
