analyzed: de'i yon tan gyi khyad par rnams snga ma de dag tsam du 'dus so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the special qualities of that are included in those former ones,

original: tshig snga ma de dag nyid bkod pas zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig snga ma de dag nyid bkod pas zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not a fault of repetition to set forth those former words.

original: sems slu ba'i smig rgyu ba zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul dang / chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i don gsal bar ston te /
analyzed: sems slu ba'i smig rgyu ba zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul dang / chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i don gsal bar ston te /
translated: The way of engaging consciousness and the meaning of the middle of phenomena are clearly taught by ‚Äúthe mind is deceived by a mirage,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di rnams kyi don ni sngar bstan zin to //üîΩrtag tu bag chags dag gis bskyed //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don ni sngar bstan zin to // rtag tu bag chags dag gis bskyed //
translated: The meaning of these has been taught previously.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni kun gzhi la bsgos pa'i bag chags dag gis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sna tshogs su snang bskyed la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni kun gzhi la bsgos pa'i bag chags dag gis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa sna tshogs su snang bskyed la /
translated: ‚ÄúAlways produced by latent propensities‚Äù and so on means that the consciousnesses that engage in the various appearances are produced by the latent propensities that are infused into the foundation consciousness.

original: bag chags kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pas rtsa ba zug cing /
analyzed: bag chags kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pas rtsa ba zug cing /
translated: The latent propensities are taught to be rooted in habituation from beginningless time,

original: de'i rten kun gzhi yang rgyun dang ldan pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rten kun gzhi yang rgyun dang ldan pas bstan pa'o //
translated: and the foundation consciousness that is their support is taught to be continuous.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag kyang bag chags kyi stobs kyis spyod yul sna tshogs su 'khyam zhing g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs de dag kyang bag chags kyi stobs kyis spyod yul sna tshogs su 'khyam zhing g-yo ba ste /
translated: Moreover, those collections of consciousness wander and move in various objective fields by the power of habitual tendencies.

original: khab len gyis lcags g-yo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khab len gyis lcags g-yo ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like iron filings moved by a magnet.

original: kun gzhi de yang sems can thams cad la gnas shing /
analyzed: kun gzhi de yang sems can thams cad la gnas shing /
translated: That alaya is present in all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis ste de'i snying po rtog dang brtag par bya ba las 'das pa'o //üîΩshes dang shes bya rnams spangs shing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis ste de'i snying po rtog dang brtag par bya ba las 'das pa'o // shes dang shes bya rnams spangs shing //
translated: It is the essence of the Tathagata lineage, which is beyond imagination and the object of imagination.üîΩIt is the dharmadhatu, the nature of mind, which is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams gnas gyur nas 'bras bu thob pa'i tshul ston te /üîΩsa bcu las ni rnam byung ba //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas de rnams gnas gyur nas 'bras bu thob pa'i tshul ston te / sa bcu las ni rnam byung ba //
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äúhaving abandoned consciousness and the object of consciousness‚Äù is that, having transformed those, the way of attaining the result is taught.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sa bcu'i ye shes goms pa las byung ba sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / phyin ci log spangs pa'i sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba la 'dris shing goms par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sa bcu'i ye shes goms pa las byung ba sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / phyin ci log spangs pa'i sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba la 'dris shing goms par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äúarising from the ten grounds‚Äù is that by becoming familiar with the wisdom of the ten grounds, one should become familiar with the illusion-like samadhi and the reality of the mind free from error, which is free from conceptual elaborations and luminous.

original: de las rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: From that, the perfect benefit for oneself and others arises.

original: lhun gyis grub ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mdzad pa lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub ces bya ba la sogs pas ni mdzad pa lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi 'chad par gzhan gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: By ‚Äúspontaneously,‚Äù etc., it shows that the performance is spontaneous and that the benefit of others is performed without interruption.

original: 'di rnams thams cad kyi tshig gi don ni phal cher sngar bstan zin to //üîΩrnam par rtog las gud na ni //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad kyi tshig gi don ni phal cher sngar bstan zin to // rnam par rtog las gud na ni //
translated: The meaning of all these words has been explained for the most part above.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas @267a * //üîΩni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid mtha' gnyis dang bral ba dbu ma'i don la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas @267a * // ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid mtha' gnyis dang bral ba dbu ma'i don la /
translated: ‚Äú Apart from conceptualization‚Äù etc.

original: byis pa'i skye bo phyin ci log pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo phyin ci log pa nyid du ston te /
translated: shows that the reality of things, the meaning of the middle free from the two extremes, is taught by the childish as just the opposite.

original: phyogs bslad ces bya ba ni bden pa dang / brdzun pa'i phyogs 'khrugs shing log par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bslad ces bya ba ni bden pa dang / brdzun pa'i phyogs 'khrugs shing log par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The side of perversion‚Äù is the confused and false grasping of the side of truth and falsity.

original: yang na yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis sems kyi rgyud bslad pa rnams yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis sems kyi rgyud bslad pa rnams yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, those whose mental continuum is corrupted by the instinct of grasping at the position of existence and non-existence, etc., grasp at the two extremes of existence and non-existence, etc.

original: gal te yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs sangs rgyas nyid kyis bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs sangs rgyas nyid kyis bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWere not the positions of existence and non-existence taught by the Buddha himself?‚Äù

original: rang bzhin med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [The answer is] ‚ÄúNo intrinsic reality, etc.‚Äù

original: bden pa gnyis kyi dbye ba la ma brten par med pa dang yod pa'i phyogs bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi nges pa'i don ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi dbye ba la ma brten par med pa dang yod pa'i phyogs bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi nges pa'i don ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the positions of non-existence and existence is intentional, not definitive, unless it is based on the division of the two realities.

original: rkyen ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCondition‚Äù is dependent origination.

original: srid pa dang mi srid pa'i stong pa la sogs pa yang sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: srid pa dang mi srid pa'i stong pa la sogs pa yang sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The emptiness of the possible and the impossible, etc., has been taught above.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos thams cad kyi dbu ma'i don de bzhin nyid la thams cad grub pa med pas de kho na nyid du thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos thams cad kyi dbu ma'i don de bzhin nyid la thams cad grub pa med pas de kho na nyid du thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa med mod kyi /
translated: The passage beginning The Omniscient One, etc. shows that since there is no establishment of anything in reality, i.e., in the middle way which is the reality of all things, there is no establishment of the Omniscient One in reality.

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten gyi ston pas sangs rgyas ni 'di'o zhes mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden pa nyid du phyin ci log pa'o //üîΩbrtags pa 'di ni ming tsam ste //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten gyi ston pas sangs rgyas ni 'di'o zhes mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa'i rnam pa bden pa nyid du phyin ci log pa'o // brtags pa 'di ni ming tsam ste //
translated: However, childish beings, by virtue of their error, conceive the Omniscient One, the Teacher of the world, as truly existent in terms of the aspects of the major and minor marks, etc.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning This imputation, etc. shows the imputational and dependent natures.

original: nam mkha'i me tog ces pa la sogs pas phyin ci log ldog par 'gyur ba'i tshul dang / de log pa nyid mya ngan las 'das par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ces pa la sogs pas phyin ci log ldog par 'gyur ba'i tshul dang / de log pa nyid mya ngan las 'das par ston pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning A sky flower, etc. shows the way in which the error is reversed and that the mere reversal of that error is nirvana.

original: stong pa ngo bo nyid med pa //
analyzed: stong pa ngo bo nyid med pa //
translated: The passage beginning The emptiness, etc. shows the perfected nature.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid dang / de nyid rtogs pa'i phan yon ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid dang / de nyid rtogs pa'i phan yon ston pa'o //
translated: The above and other passages teach the thatness of phenomena and the benefits of realizing thatness.

original: de la rtog ge'i mtshan ma rig pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba de nyid 'phags pa ltar lha'i spyod yul te rnam par dag pa'i lha sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la rtog ge'i mtshan ma rig pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba de nyid 'phags pa ltar lha'i spyod yul te rnam par dag pa'i lha sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Therein, thatness, which is free from the elaborations of valid cognitions and objects of valid cognition that apprehend the signs of the characteristics of logicians, is the domain of the noble ones. It is the domain of the pure gods, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the consummate characteristic.

original: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gnyis spangs pa'o //üîΩde la / rnam rig gang yang med pa las //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gnyis spangs pa'o // de la / rnam rig gang yang med pa las //
translated: It is free from the two natures, the imaginary and the other-dependent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de kho na nyid mthong ba dpe'i sgo nas @267b rgyas par ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de kho na nyid mthong ba dpe'i sgo nas @267b rgyas par ston pa ste /
translated: With ‚ÄúIn the absence of any consciousness at all‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth, the seeing of thatness is taught extensively through examples.

original: srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis mun khud du srin bu me khyer la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba med kyang myos pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs su snang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis mun khud du srin bu me khyer la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba med kyang myos pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs su snang zhes pa'o //
translated: By the power of the restraint of prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma, etc., there is no appearance in the form of fireflies, etc., in the darkness, but by the power of delusion, there is the appearance of variety.

original: rkyen rnams yod dang med pa las //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod dang med pa las //
translated: From the existence and non-existence of conditions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa ston pa'o //
translated: and so on, it shows the reason, etc., for establishing the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: lus kyi mthar 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gtso dang zhes pa ni go rims bzhin du ngan 'gro'i lus dang / mtho ris khyad par can no //
analyzed: lus kyi mthar 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gtso dang zhes pa ni go rims bzhin du ngan 'gro'i lus dang / mtho ris khyad par can no //
translated: The end of the body and the chief of the world refer to the body of the lower realms and the special higher realms, respectively.

original: de dag la sogs pa byed pa po dang las sna tshogs su brtags pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa byed pa po dang las sna tshogs su brtags pa ni rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The various designations of agent and action, such as those, are similar to the examples of dreams, etc.

original: sems 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu khams gsum du snang ba sems kyi rnam par 'phrul pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu khams gsum du snang ba sems kyi rnam par 'phrul pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: This mind and so on shows that the appearance of the three realms in the conventional is just the magical display of the mind.

original: 'di dang pha rol zhes pa ni skye ba 'di dang pha rol te /
analyzed: 'di dang pha rol zhes pa ni skye ba 'di dang pha rol te /
translated: This world and the next world means this life and the next life.

original: sems las tha dad pa'i 'jig rten med pa'i phyir de ltar mi rtag ces pa'o //
analyzed: sems las tha dad pa'i 'jig rten med pa'i phyir de ltar mi rtag ces pa'o //
translated: Since there is no world apart from the mind, it is said to be impermanent.

original: mi gtsang gnas kyi tha mar phyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi gtsang gnas kyi tha mar phyin par 'gyur //
translated: One will reach the end of the abode of impurity.

original: zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i tha ma mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i tha ma mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that one will reach nirvana, the end of samsara.

original: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lha'i pho brang 'og min pa'o //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩskye ba'i lha'am /
analyzed: lha'i pho brang 'og min pa'o // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / skye ba'i lha'am /
translated: The palace of the gods is Akanistha.

original: skye ba rnam par dag pa'i lha ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: skye ba rnam par dag pa'i lha ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The gods of birth or the gods of pure birth are the perfect buddhas.

original: gnas de 'am de na gnas pa rnams sdig pa thams cad spangs shing bsod nams 'ba' zhig gi snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnas de 'am de na gnas pa rnams sdig pa thams cad spangs shing bsod nams 'ba' zhig gi snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: In that place or those who dwell there, all evil is abandoned and only the light of merit arises.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'o //
translated: The perfect buddha is the perfect enjoyment.

original: 'di zhes pa ni rdo rje'i gdan byang chub kyi snying po'i shing gi drung 'dir dus phyis 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni rdo rje'i gdan byang chub kyi snying po'i shing gi drung 'dir dus phyis 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase here refers to the tree at the site of enlightenment at Vajrasana, where the Buddha demonstrated the attainment of enlightenment at a later time.

original: don 'di nyid gsung rab kyi phyogs gzhan dag las kyang rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid gsung rab kyi phyogs gzhan dag las kyang rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: This very point is taught extensively in other scriptures.

original: de la sogs pa'i sprul pa dpag tu med pa yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩsna tshogs med las sna tshogs 'byung //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i sprul pa dpag tu med pa yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o // sna tshogs med las sna tshogs 'byung //
translated: Innumerable emanations such as these emerge from the very same body of perfect enjoyment.

original: zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i sku dang gsung sna tshogs med kyang gdul bya'i snang ba la sna tshogs byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i sku dang gsung sna tshogs med kyang gdul bya'i snang ba la sna tshogs byung ba'o //
translated: The line from what is not diverse, diversity arises means that although there is no diversity in the form of the body and speech of the Buddha, diversity arises in the perception of those to be trained.

original: de la byis pa'i skye bo rnams ni rnam par rig pa'i rigs su gtogs pa phyin ci log gi rtog pas bsgribs nas phyi rol gyi ngo bor rtogs shing sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la byis pa'i skye bo rnams ni rnam par rig pa'i rigs su gtogs pa phyin ci log gi rtog pas bsgribs nas phyi rol gyi ngo bor rtogs shing sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi shes pa'o //
translated: In this regard, immature beings, obscured by the conceptual thoughts of error that belong to the class of representations, conceive of the Buddha's body as having an external nature and do not understand the Buddha's nature.

original: gzhan yang lus can kun la gnas pa'i nga  @268a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus can kun la gnas pa'i nga  @268a * //
translated: Furthermore, it is present in all embodied beings.üîΩ

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yang de 'dra ba'i rtog pas g-yogs nas mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yang de 'dra ba'i rtog pas g-yogs nas mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the essence of the Tathagata, which is present in all embodied beings, is also not seen because it is covered by such conceptualization.

original: gal te de lta na da 'dra ba'i rtog pa rgyun mi 'chad pas mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad do zhe na /üîΩsgyu ma nor ba yod mod kyi //
analyzed: gal te de lta na da 'dra ba'i rtog pa rgyun mi 'chad pas mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad do zhe na / sgyu ma nor ba yod mod kyi //
translated: If that is so, then since such conceptualization is uninterrupted, nirvana is not tenable.üîΩThe error of illusion exists,

original: sgyu ma nor ba'i sgyu ma yin //üîΩzhes gsungs te /üîΩphyin ci log gi rtog pa sgyu ma lta bu de ni rtogs pa phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma nor ba'i sgyu ma yin // zhes gsungs te / phyin ci log gi rtog pa sgyu ma lta bu de ni rtogs pa phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'am /
translated: but the illusion of the error of illusion exists.

original: nus pa thogs pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: The erroneous conceptualization that is like an illusion is not the complete cause for the generation of subsequent conceptualization, nor is it unobstructed power.

original: de dag gnyen pos gzhom par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyen pos gzhom par nus pa'o //
translated: It is possible to destroy it with its antidote.

original: 'jig rten dag na zhes pa'i don ni sems slu ba'i sa bon cung zad kun rdzob tu yod pa de ni brtags pa la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na zhes pa'i don ni sems slu ba'i sa bon cung zad kun rdzob tu yod pa de ni brtags pa la rtog pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin the world‚Äù is that the seed of the deception of the mind, which is a slight superficial existence, is conceptualization in regard to the imagined.

original: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gnyis kyis kun gzhi la sa bon bsgos nas /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gnyis kyis kun gzhi la sa bon bsgos nas /
translated: Such a nature is the seed that is infused in the alaya.

original: de las phyin ci log sna tshogs su sprul zhing skyed pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang rnam par rig pa tsa gyi rang bzhin myong bas grub pas dngos po rtog cing rig pa de nyid dang / phung po la sogs par snang ba la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis gang zag dang chos su brtags shing goms par byed pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes rtogs shing goms pas phyin ci log gnas shin tu gyur pa na nga'i sras yon tan thams cad mngon
analyzed: de las phyin ci log sna tshogs su sprul zhing skyed pa'o // gzhan yang rnam par rig pa tsa gyi rang bzhin myong bas grub pas dngos po rtog cing rig pa de nyid dang / phung po la sogs par snang ba la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis gang zag dang chos su brtags shing goms par byed pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes rtogs shing goms pas phyin ci log gnas shin tu gyur pa na nga'i sras yon tan thams cad mngon
translated: From that, the various errors are emanated and produced.üîΩMoreover, the very cognition that conceives of and cognizes things as established by the experience of the nature of mere representations is an error, and the world's imputation of persons and phenomena to the appearances of the aggregates and so on and the habituation to that is an error.

original: par rdzogs pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: par rdzogs pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: By understanding and habituating to that, when the error is completely transformed, it is said that the Buddha declares, This is my son who has actualized all good qualities.

original: drod dang zhes pas byis pa rnams kyis phyin ci log dang / de nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu ston to //
analyzed: drod dang zhes pas byis pa rnams kyis phyin ci log dang / de nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu ston to //
translated: Heat and so on indicate the cause for entering into the error of the childish and that reality.

original: de la / 'khor bar mi bya mya ngan 'das mi bya //
analyzed: de la / 'khor bar mi bya mya ngan 'das mi bya //
translated: Do not enter samsara, do not enter nirvana.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab kyis srid pa la mi gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab kyis srid pa la mi gnas shing /
translated: This means that through wisdom one does not abide in samsara,

original: snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: and through compassion one does not abide in peace.

original: sna tshogs sa bon zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dpa' rlabs nyid spyod yul sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs sa bon zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dpa' rlabs nyid spyod yul sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
translated: The line ‚Äúthe various seeds‚Äù and so forth indicates that the very waves of the foundation consciousness appear as the various objects.

original: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su mngon par chags pa'i byis pa rnams ni skye ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su mngon par chags pa'i byis pa rnams ni skye ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
translated: The childish, who are attached to the duality of subject and object, conceive of them as arising and so forth.

original: rtog pas grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pas grub pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not established by conceptualization.

original: zhes pa ni rtog pas nor pa phyin ci log tu brtags kyang bden par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtog pas nor pa phyin ci log tu brtags kyang bden par ma grub pa'o //
translated: This means that even though conceptualization imagines the error of duality as real, it is not truly established.

original: nam zhig lus la mi gnas na //
analyzed: nam zhig lus la mi gnas na //
translated: When it does not abide in the body,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi rten du gyur pa'i phung po la mngon par mi zhen cing /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi rten du gyur pa'i phung po la mngon par mi zhen cing /
translated: and so forth. The meaning of this is that one should not be attached to the aggregates, which are the basis of suffering.

original: de 'dra ba spangs par gyur pa na nga'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba spangs par gyur pa na nga'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: When one abandons such, one is not my domain.

original: theg pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i gdul bya ma yin zhing /
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i gdul bya ma yin zhing /
translated: One is not a disciple to whom the various vehicles are taught.

original: nges pa'i don 'ba' zhig bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don 'ba' zhig bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: One is to be taught only the definitive meaning.

original: ji ltar rgyal po zhes pas ni theg pa sna tshogs ston pa'i rgyu mtshan dpe'i sgo nas ston pa'o //üîΩde'i don kyang ri dags kyi gzugs @268b 'dra ba'i rtsed mo'i bye brag sna tshogs kyis bu rnams brid cing khyim du rtser 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po zhes pas ni theg pa sna tshogs ston pa'i rgyu mtshan dpe'i sgo nas ston pa'o // de'i don kyang ri dags kyi gzugs @268b 'dra ba'i rtsed mo'i bye brag sna tshogs kyis bu rnams brid cing khyim du rtser 'jug pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as‚Äù indicates the reason for teaching the various vehicles by means of an example.üîΩThe meaning of this is as follows: The king, in order to protect his children from external dangers, etc.,

original: phyi rol gyi 'tshe ba la sogs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'tshe ba la sogs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: lures them with various kinds of playthings that resemble wild animals, and makes them play in the house.

original: de nas de dag cher skyes pa dang khyim gyi phyi rol du khrid nas nags kyi ri dags dngos dang phrad par byed pa ltar /
analyzed: de nas de dag cher skyes pa dang khyim gyi phyi rol du khrid nas nags kyi ri dags dngos dang phrad par byed pa ltar /
translated: Then, when they have grown up, he takes them outside the house and makes them encounter real wild animals in the forest.

original: theg pa sna tshogs kyis brid nas mthar thug pa la so so rang rig pa'i don phyin ci ma log pa nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs kyis brid nas mthar thug pa la so so rang rig pa'i don phyin ci ma log pa nyid ston pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the Buddha lures them with the various vehicles and finally teaches them the reality that is to be personally experienced and is free from error.

original: sngar rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngar rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained in detail above.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas kun gzhi'i 'jug pa nyid rgyas par ston par ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas kun gzhi'i 'jug pa nyid rgyas par ston par ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as‚Äù indicates the extensive explanation of the evolution of the store consciousness.

original: tshig gi don ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of the words has been explained above.

original: phung po la ni bdag med de //
analyzed: phung po la ni bdag med de //
translated: The aggregates are devoid of self.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas dag med pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas dag med pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of non-existence is summarized and taught.

original: shes rab kyis ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yod ma yin //
translated: By wisdom, it does not exist.

original: zhes pas ni shes rab kyis rnam par phye ba'i tshe na med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ni shes rab kyis rnam par phye ba'i tshe na med pa'o //
translated: When analyzed by wisdom, it does not exist.

original: rkyen dang gtan tshigs dpe rnams dang // zhes pa'i don ni skye ba rnam gzhi dang bral ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dang / rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe dang / dam bca' ba ste /
analyzed: rkyen dang gtan tshigs dpe rnams dang // zhes pa'i don ni skye ba rnam gzhi dang bral ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dang / rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe dang / dam bca' ba ste /
translated: The meaning of conditions, reasons, and examples is as follows: The reason is the absence of a basis for arising, and so on. The example is a dream, and so on. The thesis is as follows:

original: de ltar yan lag gsum la brten nas rkyen dang rgyu rnams kyis skye ba de ni ngas bzlog go zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag gsum la brten nas rkyen dang rgyu rnams kyis skye ba de ni ngas bzlog go zhes tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, based on those three parts, the meaning of the words should be applied as follows: ‚ÄúI refute arising from conditions and causes.‚Äù

original: gal te dam bca' ba'i tshig ni bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i yan lag tu ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dam bca' ba'i tshig ni bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i yan lag tu ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow does the statement of the thesis become a part of the understanding of the probandum?‚Äù

original: de las gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i tshig 'jug pas bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i yan lag tsam du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i tshig 'jug pas bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i yan lag tsam du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes merely a part of the understanding of the probandum because the words of the reason and so on are applied to that.

original: nyi zla'i 'od dang myu gu la sogs pa'i dpe'i don ni nyi zla la sogs pa'i 'od ma myu gu dang skye bu la sogs pa'i grib ma snang ba na /
analyzed: nyi zla'i 'od dang myu gu la sogs pa'i dpe'i don ni nyi zla la sogs pa'i 'od ma myu gu dang skye bu la sogs pa'i grib ma snang ba na /
translated: The meaning of the examples of the light of the sun and moon, the sprout, and so on, is that when the light of the sun and moon, and so on, and the shadow of the sprout, person, and so on, appear,

original: de 'dra ba'i grib ma ni grib ma 'jog mkhan gyi skyes du ma la sogs pa'i las skye bar snang yang thogs pa dang bcas shing rdzas su grub pa'i gzugs skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i grib ma ni grib ma 'jog mkhan gyi skyes du ma la sogs pa'i las skye bar snang yang thogs pa dang bcas shing rdzas su grub pa'i gzugs skye ba med pa'o //
translated: the shadow that is like that appears to arise from the action of the person who casts the shadow, and so on, but it is not the arising of an obstructed, substantially established form.

original: 'jig rten gsum la mi gnas pa ni de ltar snang ba yang bden pa'i rang bzhin la brten cing gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum la mi gnas pa ni de ltar snang ba yang bden pa'i rang bzhin la brten cing gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not dwelling in the three worlds means that such appearances do not rely on or dwell in a truly existent nature.

original: mi skye bzod pas ni sa dang po nas so //
analyzed: mi skye bzod pas ni sa dang po nas so //
translated: With the acceptance of nonarising, one attains the first bhumi.

original: phyi rol snang ba'i gzugs can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa tsam gyi tshul rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: phyi rol snang ba'i gzugs can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa tsam gyi tshul rgyas par ston te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúExternal appearances are forms‚Äù and so on extensively teaches the mode of consciousness-only in the relative.

original: gzugs can gyi ngo bo phyi rol tu snang ba ni sems nyid yin pas sems la sems nyid rang snang ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi ngo bo phyi rol tu snang ba ni sems nyid yin pas sems la sems nyid rang snang ba ste /
translated: The essence of form that appears externally is the mind itself, so the mind itself appears to the mind.

original: rang rig pa 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: It is self-awareness alone.

original: 'brel pa ni phyi'i rten 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni phyi'i rten 'brel lo //
translated: The connection is the external dependent origination.

original: shin tu bslabs pas rnam rig gis //
analyzed: shin tu bslabs pas rnam rig gis //
translated: By being well trained in the cognition,

original: 'gro ba sna tshogs byin gyis rlob //
analyzed: 'gro ba sna tshogs byin gyis rlob //
translated: one blesses the various migrations.

original: @269a * // ces pa ni rnam rig tsam gyi tshul la goms par byas pas goms pa mthar thug ste /
analyzed: @269a * // ces pa ni rnam rig tsam gyi tshul la goms par byas pas goms pa mthar thug ste /
translated: This is the culmination of training by becoming accustomed to the mode of mere cognition.

original: thams cad sems kyi snang bar shes pa na /
analyzed: thams cad sems kyi snang bar shes pa na /
translated: When one knows that everything is the appearance of mind,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sprul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sprul par byed pa'o //
translated: one emanates as one wishes.

original: gzhan yang lus la sogs pa'i gzung ba 'dzin cing rnam par rig pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus la sogs pa'i gzung ba 'dzin cing rnam par rig pa ni gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three kinds of cognition that apprehend the apprehended, such as the body:

original: de la yid ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid do //
analyzed: de la yid ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid do //
translated: Among them, mind is the nonconceptual mind.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rig ni sgo lnga dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rig ni sgo lnga dang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The apprehending cognition is the five sense doors and the foundation consciousness.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Conceptualization is a particular mental consciousness.

original: mtshan med gnas shing ngal yang so //
analyzed: mtshan med gnas shing ngal yang so //
translated: Dwelling in the signless, one rests and is also free.

original: zhes pa ni cung zad tsam ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni cung zad tsam ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas shing /
translated: This is dwelling in the bliss of samƒÅdhi for just a little while.

original: srid pa'i sdug bsngal las ngal so ba'o //üîΩbya gag snag tshas bskus pa la //
analyzed: srid pa'i sdug bsngal las ngal so ba'o // bya gag snag tshas bskus pa la //
translated: It is a rest from the sufferings of existence.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang dgongs pa can nyid du ston pa'o //üîΩchos dang gang zag 'phos pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang dgongs pa can nyid du ston pa'o // chos dang gang zag 'phos pa'i phyir //
translated: The passage beginning with the words, ‚ÄúThe crow smeared with ink,‚Äù shows that the establishment of the three vehicles is also intentional.üîΩThe passage beginning with the words, ‚ÄúBecause of the transference of the Dharma and of the person,‚Äù shows that the transformation of the error of such apprehension is the intuition of reality.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log gnas gyur pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes te nyi ma la sogs pa las 'od 'byung ba dang / nor bu rin po che las dgos 'dod 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log gnas gyur pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes te nyi ma la sogs pa las 'od 'byung ba dang / nor bu rin po che las dgos 'dod 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as light comes from the sun, and just as the precious gem produces its desired effect,

original: rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'gro ba'i don sna tshogs 'byung ba'o //üîΩji ltar rab rib can dag gis //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'gro ba'i don sna tshogs 'byung ba'o // ji ltar rab rib can dag gis //
translated: so also the various benefits for the world come forth from the TathƒÅgata without his having any discursive thought.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas log par 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan dpe'i sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas log par 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan dpe'i sgo nas ston te /
translated: The passage beginning with the words, ‚ÄúJust as those with eye disease,‚Äù shows the example of the ground of the error of apprehension.

original: de la ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis dha du ra'i 'bras bu zos pas myos shing 'khrug pa na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis dha du ra'i 'bras bu zos pas myos shing 'khrug pa na /
translated: There, just as someone who has eaten the fruit of thorn apple becomes intoxicated and confused,

original: sa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa gser du snang ba bzhin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa gser du snang ba bzhin zhes pa'o //
translated: Like the appearance of gold in the earth, in beings, and so on.

original: sa bon gcig dang zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log tu snang ba'i bag chags kyi dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: sa bon gcig dang zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log tu snang ba'i bag chags kyi dbye ba ston te /
translated: One seed, etc. shows the different habitual tendencies of mistaken appearance.

original: de las bon gcig pa ni sems kyi chos nyid rtogs shing goms pa mthar thug pas /
analyzed: de las bon gcig pa ni sems kyi chos nyid rtogs shing goms pa mthar thug pas /
translated: One seed is the complete realization and familiarization with the nature of mind,

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu yang rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu yang rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: and the complete purification of even the smallest of the small afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs na gnas ngan len gyi lhag ma tsam lus pa ni sa bon gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs na gnas ngan len gyi lhag ma tsam lus pa ni sa bon gcig pa'o //
translated: At the time of the vajralike samadhi, the mere remainder of negative tendencies is the one seed.

original: de nyid kyang spangs shing kun gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon gnas gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes mngon du byas pa ni sa bon med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang spangs shing kun gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon gnas gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes mngon du byas pa ni sa bon med pa'o //
translated: That is also abandoned, and the transformation of the all-base with its seeds is the actualization of mirrorlike wisdom, which is the absence of seeds.

original: de nyid kyi tshe spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing mi rtogs pas sa bon thams cad mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing mi rtogs pas sa bon thams cad mnyam pa'o //
translated: At that time, since all elaborations are absent and there is no thought, all seeds are equal.

original: yang byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon shas che bas tshe rabs 'dres @269b pa ste /
analyzed: yang byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon shas che bas tshe rabs 'dres @269b pa ste /
translated: Moreover, in the situation of a child and so on, since the seeds of the contaminated are predominant, there is a mixing of lifetimes,

original: srid par skye ba len pa'o //
analyzed: srid par skye ba len pa'o //
translated: that is, taking birth in existence.

original: gzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon 'ba' zhig kun gzhi la 'debs pas na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon 'ba' zhig kun gzhi la 'debs pas na /
translated: Moreover, since the seeds of the contaminated are planted in the foundation consciousness of a child,

original: de ni sa bon thams cad pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sa bon thams cad pa zhes pa'o //
translated: it is called the seed of everything.

original: yang 'di rnams kyi don ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon rnam par dag pa'i dus na zag pa med pa'i sa bon 'ba' zhig pa ni sa bon gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: yang 'di rnams kyi don ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon rnam par dag pa'i dus na zag pa med pa'i sa bon 'ba' zhig pa ni sa bon gcig pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of these is as follows: At the time of the purification of the seeds of the contaminated, the seed of the uncontaminated alone is the single seed.

original: yang shin tu gyur pa chos kyi sku spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i tshe na sa bon med cing mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: yang shin tu gyur pa chos kyi sku spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i tshe na sa bon med cing mnyam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, at the time of the transformation into the dharmakƒÅya, free from all elaborations, there is no seed and there is equality.

original: zag pa med pa'i sa bon shas che zhing zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon cung zad yod pa'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du srid par skye ba len pas tshe rabs 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sa bon shas che zhing zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon cung zad yod pa'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don du srid par skye ba len pas tshe rabs 'dres pa'o //
translated: When the uncontaminated seeds are predominant and the contaminated seeds are slight, the bodhisattvas take birth in existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin shes 'dod la //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin shes 'dod la //
translated: Those who wish to know the nature of things

original: nor pa dag ni mi rtogs so //
analyzed: nor pa dag ni mi rtogs so //
translated: do not understand error.

original: zhes pa ni rtog ge pa dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs par 'dod kyang de ltar ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtog ge pa dag mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis dngos po'i rang bzhin rtogs par 'dod kyang de ltar ma rtogs shing /
translated: This verse says that logicians, with their overweening pride, wish to know the nature of things but do not understand it.

original: rang gi blo nor pa nyid kyang mi rtogs zhes pa'o //üîΩsgyu ma med pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rig pa sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du ston te /
analyzed: rang gi blo nor pa nyid kyang mi rtogs zhes pa'o // sgyu ma med pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rig pa sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du ston te /
translated: They do not understand their own error.üîΩThe verse beginning ‚ÄúIllusion is not nonexistent‚Äù shows that knowledge is of the nature of illusion.

original: de yang don dam par dngos po med par snang ba yin pa dang / kun rdzob tu glog ltar mi rtag pas sgyu ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang don dam par dngos po med par snang ba yin pa dang / kun rdzob tu glog ltar mi rtag pas sgyu ma zhes pa'o //
translated: It is illusion because it appears as things that do not exist ultimately and because it is impermanent like a flash of lightning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skye 'jig tu snang ba tsam ni bzlog par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skye 'jig tu snang ba tsam ni bzlog par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the mere appearance of origination and destruction is not to be stopped.

original: bden pa'i dngos por brtag pa nyid bzlog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos por brtag pa nyid bzlog par bya ba'o //
translated: The imputation as a real thing is to be stopped.

original: rang bzhin med cing zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par rig pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par rig pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
translated: The verse, ‚ÄúWithout intrinsic reality,‚Äù etc., shows the benefit of realizing the reality of consciousness.

original: de tshe ris su gtogs pa'i lus //üîΩbya ba'i 'du byed spangs pa ste //
analyzed: de tshe ris su gtogs pa'i lus // bya ba'i 'du byed spangs pa ste //
translated: The verse, ‚ÄúAt that time, the body belonging to the class,‚Äù etc., shows the benefit of realizing the reality of consciousness.

original: zhes pas ni chos kyi sku'i ris su gtogs pa'i ye shes kyi lus 'dus ma byas pa mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ni chos kyi sku'i ris su gtogs pa'i ye shes kyi lus 'dus ma byas pa mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: The verse, ‚ÄúHaving abandoned the formative forces of action,‚Äù etc., shows the benefit of realizing the reality of the body of truth.

original: thams cad gzugs su snang ba ni ji ltar mos pa'i sku sna tshogs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad gzugs su snang ba ni ji ltar mos pa'i sku sna tshogs su ston pa'o //
translated: The verse, ‚ÄúAll things appear as form,‚Äù etc., shows the benefit of realizing the reality of the body of enjoyment.

original: nor sems thog ma med pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni ye shes kyi lus thob pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor can gyis rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid rtogs pas 'gro ba sna tshogs su snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob cing /
analyzed: nor sems thog ma med pa zhes pa la sogs pas ni ye shes kyi lus thob pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor can gyis rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid rtogs pas 'gro ba sna tshogs su snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob cing /
translated: The verse, ‚ÄúThe mind of wealth, beginningless,‚Äù etc., shows the benefit of realizing the reality of the emanation body.

original: thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i nor pa'i sems bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i nor pa'i sems bzlog pa'o //
translated: It is the reversal of the erroneous mind that has been accumulated since beginningless time.

original: sgyu ma dri za'i grong khyer dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyin ci log 'byung ba dang ldog pa'i tshul bsdus te bstan pa'o //üîΩrnam pa sna tshogs dmigs pa'i sems //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pas ni byis pa @270a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma dri za'i grong khyer dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyin ci log 'byung ba dang ldog pa'i tshul bsdus te bstan pa'o // rnam pa sna tshogs dmigs pa'i sems // zhes pa la sogs pas ni byis pa @270a * //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúLike an illusion, a city of gandharvas‚Äù summarizes the way in which error occurs and the way in which it is reversed.

original: dang ; /'phags pa rnams kyi sems dang mngon par rtogs pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: dang ; /'phags pa rnams kyi sems dang mngon par rtogs pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe mind that observes the variety of things‚Äù teaches the way in which the minds of the childish and the ƒÅryas engage with realization.

original: kun rdzob tu sems yul sna tshogs la 'jug pa bzhin du sems kyi chos nyid nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid kyang rtsig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ci'i phyir mi 'jug ste /üîΩchos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa //üîΩ'di ltar chos yod ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sems yul sna tshogs la 'jug pa bzhin du sems kyi chos nyid nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid kyang rtsig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ci'i phyir mi 'jug ste / chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa // 'di ltar chos yod ma yin no //
translated: Just as the mind engages with various objects on the conventional level, why would the emptiness that is the true nature of the mind, which is like space, not engage with things such as walls?

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúApart from the dharmadhƒÅtu, there are no phenomena whatsoever.‚Äù

original: gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma 'ga' zhig la dmigs nas sems 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma 'ga' zhig la dmigs nas sems 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind engages with objects by observing some external characteristics, then it would follow that the mind is not empty.

original: sems can nyid du mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can nyid du mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable that the mind is a sentient being.

original: de'i phyir sems kyis sems nyid la 'dzin gyi phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu ni gang yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyis sems nyid la 'dzin gyi phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu ni gang yang med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind apprehends itself, and there is no cause of external objects at all.

original: yang don dam par sems kyi chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i stong pa nyid yin pas bag chags la sogs pas gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang don dam par sems kyi chos nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i stong pa nyid yin pas bag chags la sogs pas gos pa med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, ultimately, the mind‚Äôs reality is emptiness, pure by nature. Therefore, it is not sullied by habitual tendencies and so on.

original: yid ni gnyis kar rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: yid ni gnyis kar rgyu ba ste //
translated: The mind moves in both.

original: zhes pas ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes pas ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: This verse teaches that the afflicted mind is neutral.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dge mi dger yang 'gyur ba'o //üîΩlus dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzlas te gsungs pa ni gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas glo bur du lhags pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi don du sngar bstan pa nyid bzlas te gsungs la sdud pa pos kyang de bzhin du bsdus pas zlos pa'i skyon du
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dge mi dger yang 'gyur ba'o // lus dang zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig bzlas te gsungs pa ni gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas glo bur du lhags pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi don du sngar bstan pa nyid bzlas te gsungs la sdud pa pos kyang de bzhin du bsdus pas zlos pa'i skyon du
translated: The mental consciousness can be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe body‚Äù and so on is repeated because the TathƒÅgata taught this previously for the sake of the disciples who arrived later. The compiler also summarizes it in the same way. Therefore, there is no fault of repetition.

original: mdo'i skabs gzhan du yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i skabs gzhan du yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way in other parts of the sutra.

original: 'dir mngon par rtogs pa bstan pa'i don du yin pas zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mngon par rtogs pa bstan pa'i don du yin pas zlos pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: Here, since it is for the sake of teaching realization, there is no fault of repetition.

original: de las gzhan yang sgyu ma'i dpe la sogs pas zab mo'i don rnam grangs du mar bstan pa yang skabs su bab pa'i khyad par de dang de dag la the tshom bsal ba la sogs ba'i don du yin pas zlos par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang sgyu ma'i dpe la sogs pas zab mo'i don rnam grangs du mar bstan pa yang skabs su bab pa'i khyad par de dang de dag la the tshom bsal ba la sogs ba'i don du yin pas zlos par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the profound meaning in many enumerations through examples such as illusion and so on is not repetition, since it is for the sake of dispelling doubts and so on regarding this and that particular context.

original: zhing du 'pho dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: zhing du 'pho dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äútransference to the field‚Äù is explained by:

original: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
analyzed: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
translated: What sequence is there in the absence of appearance?

original: ces pas don 'chad de /
analyzed: ces pas don 'chad de /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: stug po bkod pa'i zhing du 'pho ba'i tshul bstan cing sangs rgyas pa'i rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: stug po bkod pa'i zhing du 'pho ba'i tshul bstan cing sangs rgyas pa'i rtogs pa ste /
translated: The mode of transference to the field of the Dense Array is taught as the realization of buddhahood.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes dang / sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi don dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i sa'i rim pa med de /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes dang / sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi snang ba med pa'i ye shes kyi don dus gsum gyis bsdus pa'i sa'i rim pa med de /
translated: There is no sequence of stages included in the three times for the wisdom of meditative equipoise and the wisdom without appearance of the eighth ground and above.

original: de yang sems tsam du dmigs pa las 'das nas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de yang sems tsam du dmigs pa las 'das nas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Moreover, having transcended the observation of mind-only, it is the result of abiding in the samƒÅdhi of non-appearance.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of buddhahood itself.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs @270b pa kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / med par snang ba byis pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs @270b pa kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / med par snang ba byis pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
translated: The line beginning ‚ÄúVarious aspects‚Äù and so forth teaches the way in which the cognition of childish beings engages with the appearance of existence and nonexistence on the relative level.

original: nam zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi don dngos por ma grub cing /
analyzed: nam zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi don dngos por ma grub cing /
translated: At some point, the nonconceptual wisdom does not establish the meaning as an entity,

original: gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa med pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun ldog pa'o //üîΩbyis pa rnams ni 'dus byas la //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par dmigs pa med pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun ldog pa'o // byis pa rnams ni 'dus byas la //
translated: and since it does not observe form and so forth, the continuum of conceptuality is reversed.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni skad cig ma'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni skad cig ma'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: The line beginning ‚ÄúChildish beings‚Äù and so forth teaches the meaning of momentariness.

original: yod dang med las zhes pa la sogs pas phyi rol pa'i lugs dgag pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod dang med las zhes pa la sogs pas phyi rol pa'i lugs dgag pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The line beginning ‚ÄúFrom existence and nonexistence‚Äù and so forth teaches the refutation of the non-Buddhist systems.

original: kun rdzob tu ni zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The line beginning ‚ÄúOn the relative level‚Äù and so forth is the special explanation of the distinctions.

original: de'i don yang yod med kyi mtha' gnyis spangs pa zung du 'jug pa'i don nyid de kho na nyid kyi don yin la /üîΩde las gzhan du rang bzhin rnam par bkag pa tsam la /
analyzed: de'i don yang yod med kyi mtha' gnyis spangs pa zung du 'jug pa'i don nyid de kho na nyid kyi don yin la / de las gzhan du rang bzhin rnam par bkag pa tsam la /
translated: The meaning of that is the meaning of reality, the meaning of the union that abandons the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: dam pa'i don du 'dod na ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i don du 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that the mere negation of essence is the ultimate,

original: dmigs pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: then the object of observation, essencelessness,üîΩwould be the superficial.

original: snang la rang bzhin med pa'i sgyu ma lta bu nyid kun rdzob tu bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: snang la rang bzhin med pa'i sgyu ma lta bu nyid kun rdzob tu bstan pa yin na /
translated: If the superficial were taught to be just illusionlike appearance without essence,

original: 'di ni mi 'thad pa nyid sngar rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'thad pa nyid sngar rgyas par bstan to //
translated: then this would be untenable, as has been extensively explained above.

original: dngos po brjod pa'i rgyus byung ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni brtsad pa spang ba nyid gsal bar ston te /
analyzed: dngos po brjod pa'i rgyus byung ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni brtsad pa spang ba nyid gsal bar ston te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe arising of things from the expression of words‚Äù clearly shows the rejection of the objection.üîΩIf you assert that the things that arise from the expression of words,

original: chos thams cad dngos por med do zhes dam bca' ba brjod pa'i tshig dang / de las gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa dang / de las don gyi rtogs pas skyes pa'i dngos po brjod pa'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos por med do zhes dam bca' ba brjod pa'i tshig dang / de las gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug pa dang / de las don gyi rtogs pas skyes pa'i dngos po brjod pa'am /
translated: the words that express the thesis ‚ÄúAll phenomena are essenceless,‚Äù the words of the reason that are stated from that, and the things that arise from the understanding of the meaning from that,üîΩhave essence,

original: brjod pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams gal te rang bzhin yod par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: brjod pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams gal te rang bzhin yod par 'dod na ni /
translated: then you would have to assert that the words of the reason and the thesis are also the objects of refutation by reasons.

original: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas thams cad dngos po la med ces bya ba nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas thams cad dngos po la med ces bya ba nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are included in that, the statement ‚ÄúAll things do not exist‚Äù is undermined.

original: 'dir brjod pa dag las byung ba'i dngos po ni brjod pa'i stobs kyis skye bar 'dod pa gtan tshigs kyi tshig dang / de las don rtogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa dag las byung ba'i dngos po ni brjod pa'i stobs kyis skye bar 'dod pa gtan tshigs kyi tshig dang / de las don rtogs pa'i dngos po yin la /
translated: Here, the thing that arises from the expression is asserted to arise by the power of expression. The words of the reason are ‚Äúbecause it is a thing that is understood from that.‚Äù

original: de yang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas med par bstan pa ni /
translated: Since all things are included in that, the teaching that it does not exist undermines

original: de dag rang bzhin yod par khas blangs pa nyams pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin yod par khas blangs pa nyams pa ste /
translated: the assertion that it exists essentially.

original: med ces pa'i tshig thams bstan to //
analyzed: med ces pa'i tshig thams bstan to //
translated: The words ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù teach that.

original: gal te de dag rang bzhin yod par khas mi len na ni /
analyzed: gal te de dag rang bzhin yod par khas mi len na ni /
translated: If one does not assert that it exists essentially,

original: thams cad med ces dam bca' ba'i chig brjod pa don med par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩlan gyi don ni de 'dra ba'i brjod pa don gyi spyi dang 'dres par snang ba'am /
analyzed: thams cad med ces dam bca' ba'i chig brjod pa don med par 'gyur ba'o // lan gyi don ni de 'dra ba'i brjod pa don gyi spyi dang 'dres par snang ba'am /
translated: then the statement of the proposition that ‚Äúall things do not exist‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that such an expression, which appears to be mixed with the universal of the referent or to be the nature of an external object, does not exist even conventionally.

original: brjod par snang ba'i sems kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin zhing /üîΩde las gtan tshigs kyi tshig @271a * //
analyzed: brjod par snang ba'i sems kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin zhing / de las gtan tshigs kyi tshig @271a * //
translated: The mind that appears to express also does not ultimately exist.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The words of the reasonings that arise from it are also like that.

original: de lta na yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa ni kun rdzob tsam du gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug cing de las rtog pa skye ba yod par 'dod pas brjod pa don med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa ni kun rdzob tsam du gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'jug cing de las rtog pa skye ba yod par 'dod pas brjod pa don med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the expression of the relative is the mere relative, and the words of the reasonings engage in that. Since it is asserted that the arising of concepts exists from that, expression is not meaningless.

original: phyin ci log ni dngos yin pas //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni dngos yin pas //
translated: Since error is a thing,

original: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the object of observation does not exist.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i ron ni gzhan gyi dbang phyin ci log gi sems kun rdzob tu dngos po yin pas /üîΩde'i dmigs pa'i yul yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i ron ni gzhan gyi dbang phyin ci log gi sems kun rdzob tu dngos po yin pas / de'i dmigs pa'i yul yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the above is that the dependent consciousness that is error is a thing of the relative.

original: gal te yod na dmigs pa'i blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na dmigs pa'i blo phyin ci log tu gyur pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of observation of that does not exist because if it did, it would be untenable that the mind observing it would be in error.

original: yang gal te phyin ci log don dam pa'i dngos por yod na /
analyzed: yang gal te phyin ci log don dam pa'i dngos por yod na /
translated: If error existed as an ultimate thing,

original: don dam par thams cad ngo bo nyid med ces pa nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par thams cad ngo bo nyid med ces pa nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ultimately all things are essenceless is lost.

original: phyin ci log ni zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi rkang pa gnyis kyi don gsal bar 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩmi rtog rnam par rtog pa yis //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi rkang pa gnyis kyi don gsal bar 'chad par 'gyur ba'o // mi rtog rnam par rtog pa yis //
translated: The meaning of the two lines beginning Error is explained clearly below.

original: zhes pa ni zhi gnas dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhi gnas dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lhag mthong ngo //
translated: Nonconceptuality refers to calm abiding and conceptuality to special insight.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po zhes pa la sogs pas ni log par snang ba'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po zhes pa la sogs pas ni log par snang ba'i dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of an illusory elephant, etc. illustrates false appearances.

original: dha du ras myos pa rnams la lo ma la sogs pa gser dus nang ba'o //
analyzed: dha du ras myos pa rnams la lo ma la sogs pa gser dus nang ba'o //
translated: DhƒÅturƒÅjas grant gold to the intoxicated when they see leaves, etc.

original: gal te mtshan ma skyer zin na //
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma skyer zin na //
translated: If signs arise,

original: zhes pa ni stong pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the apprehension of signs such as emptiness.

original: 'ching dang bcings pa zhes pa la sogs pas mi rtog pas 'ching ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'ching dang bcings pa zhes pa la sogs pas mi rtog pas 'ching ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Bondage, the bound, etc. refer to bondage, etc. by nonconceptuality.

original: de 'dra ba'i bcings pa la ltos nas byis pa rnams kyi thar par brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bcings pa la ltos nas byis pa rnams kyi thar par brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: Since liberation is imagined for the childish in dependence on such bondage,

original: drug po 'di dag thar pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: drug po 'di dag thar pa'i rgyu //
translated: these six are the causes of liberation.

original: zhes pa'o // de ltar na de kho na nyid du bcings pa med pas de la ltos nas brtags pa'i thar pa yang med ces ston pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ltar na de kho na nyid du bcings pa med pas de la ltos nas brtags pa'i thar pa yang med ces ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, since there is no bondage in reality, it is shown that there is no liberation that is imagined in dependence on that.

original: sa rnams med cing de'i yul bden pa la sogs pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: sa rnams med cing de'i yul bden pa la sogs pa med ces pa'o //
translated: The absence of the stages and the absence of the objects of the stages, such as the truths, are mentioned.

original: gang zag rgyun dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par rig pa'i de kho na nyid bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag rgyun dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par rig pa'i de kho na nyid bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe continuum of the person‚Äù and so on summarizes and teaches the reality of cognition.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsal ba'i sgo nas 'jug pas sna tshogs su 'dzin la ;
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsal ba'i sgo nas 'jug pas sna tshogs su 'dzin la ;
translated: Among those, the six collections of consciousness apprehend the manifold by way of engaging through the clarity of the aspects and the objects.

original: sems kyi rigs ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rigs ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: The type of mind is the cause and effect that belong to one‚Äôs continuum.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad po thams cad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad po thams cad de /
translated: All eight consciousnesses

original: don dam par mtshan nyid grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par mtshan nyid grub pa med pa'o //
translated: are ultimately without established characteristics.

original: phung po rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas bdag med pa'i don gsal bar 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas bdag med pa'i don gsal bar 'chad pa'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe aggregates‚Äù and so on clearly explains the meaning of selflessness.

original: gal te 'dir dngos po thams cad kun @271b rdzob tu yang med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad ba la skur par 'gyur bas ji ltar byis pas mthong zhing brtags pa bzhin med la /
analyzed: gal te 'dir dngos po thams cad kun @271b rdzob tu yang med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad ba la skur par 'gyur bas ji ltar byis pas mthong zhing brtags pa bzhin med la /
translated: If one were to say that all things do not exist even conventionally, one would be completely denying the process of affliction and purification.

original: snang tshod tsam du med pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snang tshod tsam du med pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not that they do not exist in the mere way they appear.

original: kun rtog ces pa la sogs pa rang bzhin gsum bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rtog ces pa la sogs pa rang bzhin gsum bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúimagination‚Äù and so on teaches the inclusion of the three natures.

original: de la ming ni don dang bsres nas btags pas rnam par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni don dang bsres nas btags pas rnam par brtags pa'o //
translated: Among them, the name is the imputed nature, since it is designated in relation to the object.

original: rkyen des bag chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen des bag chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conditions are the dependent nature, which is the habitual tendencies and so on.

original: de la mi 'byung zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la mtshan ma de dag mi 'byung ba'o //üîΩrnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas dang zhes pas ni thams cad gnyug mar gnas pa'i ye shes sam /
analyzed: de la mi 'byung zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes la mtshan ma de dag mi 'byung ba'o // rnam par smin pa'i sangs rgyas dang zhes pas ni thams cad gnyug mar gnas pa'i ye shes sam /
translated: The line ‚Äúthey do not arise‚Äù means that those signs do not arise in the context of authentic wisdom.

original: mthar thug pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The line ‚Äúthe fully ripened buddhahood‚Äù teaches that everything is the magical display of the wisdom that abides primordially or the wisdom of the ultimate.

original: de la sems can ni gnyug ma'i ye shes so so rang rig pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems can ni gnyug ma'i ye shes so so rang rig pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ste /
translated: Sentient beings are the magical display of the pristine wisdom of the fundamental nature, self-cognizant.

original: rang gi rig pa'i 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i 'gyur ba las //
translated: From the transformation of one‚Äôs own awareness,

original: dman pa las ni las skyes te //
analyzed: dman pa las ni las skyes te //
translated: the inferior is born from karma.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: phyogs phyogs zhing ni sprul pa'i sku'i zhing khams so //
analyzed: phyogs phyogs zhing ni sprul pa'i sku'i zhing khams so //
translated: The fields in all directions are the buddha-fields of the emanation body.

original: sgyu 'dra'i chos dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi chos sgyu ma dang brag ca lta bu dang / gcig tu 'gyur zhing mang por 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / mchog gi sprul pa rnams kyis sprul pa ste bzo ba dang skye ba la sogs pa'i sprul pa'o //üîΩde kun snang ba mtha' yas kyi //
analyzed: sgyu 'dra'i chos dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi chos sgyu ma dang brag ca lta bu dang / gcig tu 'gyur zhing mang por 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / mchog gi sprul pa rnams kyis sprul pa ste bzo ba dang skye ba la sogs pa'i sprul pa'o // de kun snang ba mtha' yas kyi //
translated: The illusory phenomena and so on refer to the magical display of the phenomena of the expressed and the expresser, which are like an illusion and an echo, and the magical display of the supreme emanations, which are the magical display of emanations such as craftsmanship and birth.üîΩAll of that

original: bde ba can nas byung pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba can nas byung pa'o //
translated: arises from SukhƒÅvatƒ´, the realm of AmitƒÅbha.

original: zhes pa'i don ni bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing khams sngar bstan pa'i 'og min gyi gnas yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing khams sngar bstan pa'i 'og min gyi gnas yin la /
translated: The meaning of that passage is that the world system of Sukhavati is the Akanistha realm of the enjoyment body taught above.

original: der longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bor sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: der longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bor sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: There, the Buddha becomes enlightened in the nature of the enjoyment body.

original: mthar gyis stug por zhugs nas kyang //
analyzed: mthar gyis stug por zhugs nas kyang //
translated: And also, having gradually entered the Dense Array,

original: rnam par sangs rgyas sangs rgyas par //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par sangs rgyas sangs rgyas par // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he becomes enlightened, enlightened as a Buddha.

original: des na rnam pa smin pa'i sangs rgyas kyang bde ba can nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: des na rnam pa smin pa'i sangs rgyas kyang bde ba can nas byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha of Complete Maturation also arises from Sukhavati.

original: yang rnam pa gcig du na de 'dra ba'i zhing khams su sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la snang ba ni ye shes de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin zhing de 'dra ba'i ye shes las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba byung
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig du na de 'dra ba'i zhing khams su sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la snang ba ni ye shes de nyid kyi bdag nyid yin zhing de 'dra ba'i ye shes las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba byung
translated: Again, in one sense, the appearance in the wisdom of the Buddha of such a realm is the nature of that wisdom itself, and the enjoyment body appears from such wisdom in the aspect of the major and minor marks.

original: bas de ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bas de ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught in that way.

original: gal te de ni sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa la sogs pa'i zhing khams gzhan la yang mtshungs pas de dag nas byung ba nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi @272a * //üîΩston ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ni sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa la sogs pa'i zhing khams gzhan la yang mtshungs pas de dag nas byung ba nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi @272a * // ston ce na /
translated: If that is so, then why does he not teach that he was born in other buddhafields such as that of Ak·π£obhya Buddha?

original: de ltar bden mod kyi 'di ni mtshon pa tsam du zad pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi 'di ni mtshon pa tsam du zad pa'am /
translated: That is true, but this is merely an illustration.

original: yang na sangs rgyas snang ba mtha' yas ni khyad par du yang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod las bshad la /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas snang ba mtha' yas ni khyad par du yang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du rig pa 'dzin pa'i sde snod las bshad la /
translated: Or, the Buddha AmitƒÅbha is explained in the VidyƒÅdhara Pi·π≠aka as being the embodiment of the individually discriminating pristine consciousness.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyang //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyang //
translated: The individually discriminating pristine consciousness

original: shes bya kun la rtag mi thogs //
analyzed: shes bya kun la rtag mi thogs //
translated: is always unobstructed with respect to all objects of knowledge.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du //
translated: In all ma·πá·∏çalas of the retinueüîΩhe performs all the enjoyments

original: 'byor pa thams cad mdzad pa dang // the tshom thams cad gcod pa yi //
analyzed: 'byor pa thams cad mdzad pa dang // the tshom thams cad gcod pa yi //
translated: and cuts through all doubts

original: chos chen char ni rab tu 'bebs //
analyzed: chos chen char ni rab tu 'bebs //
translated: and rains down the great Dharma.

original: zhes sa bcu'i mgon po dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las gsungs pas sku dang gsung sna tshogs su snang zhing don byed pa la sogs pa ni ye shes de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhing khams de nyid nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes sa bcu'i mgon po dang / 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las gsungs pas sku dang gsung sna tshogs su snang zhing don byed pa la sogs pa ni ye shes de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i zhing khams de nyid nas byung ba'o //
translated: The various appearances of body and speech that perform benefits and so forth arise from that very buddha field that is the nature of that wisdom.

original: de'i dgongs pa shes par gyis //
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa shes par gyis //
translated: Understand its intention.

original: zhes pas ni ngag 'di rnams kyi dgongs don yang shes par gyis shig ces shugs la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ni ngag 'di rnams kyi dgongs don yang shes par gyis shig ces shugs la bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches by implication that one should understand the intended meaning of these statements.

original: gang yang 'dren pa rnams kyis bshad //
analyzed: gang yang 'dren pa rnams kyis bshad //
translated: What is explained by the guides.

original: cas  pa ni spyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bshad pa ste /
analyzed: cas  pa ni spyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the general explanation by the bodhisattvas.

original: rgyal ba'i bu ni nye ba'i sras rnams yin pas zlos par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bu ni nye ba'i sras rnams yin pas zlos par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since the sons of the victors are the close sons, there is no redundancy.

original: sprul pa dag gis zhes pa ni skye pa'i sprul pa la sogs pa nyid sprul rnams so //
analyzed: sprul pa dag gis zhes pa ni skye pa'i sprul pa la sogs pa nyid sprul rnams so //
translated: The emanations refers to the emanations that are the emanations of birth and so on.

original: chos 'di rnams ni ma skyes pa //
analyzed: chos 'di rnams ni ma skyes pa //
translated: These phenomena are unarisen.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas don dam par ma skyes shing /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas don dam par ma skyes shing /
translated: And so forth.

original: kun rdzob tu bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa thams cad sems nyid yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bcings pa dang thar pa la sogs pa thams cad sems nyid yin par ston pa'o //
translated: The conventional is taught to be the mind itself, with all of bondage and liberation and so forth.

original: rab tu bsdus pa ni kun gzhi la bag chags thams cad bsgos pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsdus pa ni kun gzhi la bag chags thams cad bsgos pa'o //
translated: The complete summary is the infusion of all habitual tendencies into the all-base.

original: don du snang la rnam shes te //
analyzed: don du snang la rnam shes te //
translated: The appearance of objects is consciousness.

original: ye shes yang dag spyod yul can //
analyzed: ye shes yang dag spyod yul can //
translated: Wisdom is the domain of the authentic.üîΩThe suchness of the appearance of objects is consciousness.

original: zhes pa ni don du snang la rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni don du snang la rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa ni ye shes te /
translated: The realization of that is wisdom,

original: yang dag pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i yul can no //
translated: which has an authentic domain.
