original: 'phags pa'i spyod yul zhes pa ni so so rang gi rig pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul zhes pa ni so so rang gi rig pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The domain of the ƒÅryas is suchness that is reflexively experienced.

original: don rab 'byed pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams thob par 'gyur ba'i lam ston pa'o //
analyzed: don rab 'byed pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams thob par 'gyur ba'i lam ston pa'o //
translated: The path that will attain those is taught by ‚Äúthe thorough differentiation of objects‚Äù and so forth.

original: thams cad chos ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni rang bzhin gsum tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad chos ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni rang bzhin gsum tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan pa ste /
translated: All phenomena and so forth teach the three natures from the perspective of another mode.

original: nam zhig ces pa la sogs pas yongs su grub pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: nam zhig ces pa la sogs pas yongs su grub pa ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt some point‚Äù and so forth teach the consummate.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ltas zhes pa ni chos kyi sku mngon du 'gyur ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ltas zhes pa ni chos kyi sku mngon du 'gyur ba'i rtags so //
translated: The sign that follows suchness is the sign of the actualization of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pas ni dngos por 'dzin pa dang bcas pa la grol ba mi @272b 'thad pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pas ni dngos por 'dzin pa dang bcas pa la grol ba mi @272b 'thad pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù shows that liberation is not tenable for those who possess the apprehension of things.

original: dngos po kun gyi smra ba ni phung po la sogs pa la grangs dang go rims la sogs pa'i dngos pos dngos po nyid bden par smra ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi smra ba ni phung po la sogs pa la grangs dang go rims la sogs pa'i dngos pos dngos po nyid bden par smra ba'am /
translated: The ‚Äúproponents of all things‚Äù are those who speak of the aggregates and so on as things that truly exist in terms of their number, sequence, and so on.

original: tha mal pa rnams kyis skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i dngos por phye ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: tha mal pa rnams kyis skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i dngos por phye ba'i sgo nas /
translated: Or, ordinary beings, in terms of the things of men and women and so on,

original: dngos por rtog pa rnams rtag tu tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu skyes pa na yang /
analyzed: dngos por rtog pa rnams rtag tu tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu skyes pa na yang /
translated: those who conceive of things, will always, in other lives and other births,

original: phan tshun gcig la gcig sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog cing /
analyzed: phan tshun gcig la gcig sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog cing /
translated: conceive of things as attractive or unattractive and so on.

original: de las skye ba gzhan du 'khor bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las skye ba gzhan du 'khor bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: From that, they will cycle in other births.

original: ming ni brjad  pa ma byas na //
analyzed: ming ni brjad  pa ma byas na //
translated: Without the designation of names,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa ltar /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa ltar /
translated: As these passages indicate,

original: kun rdzob tu ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i chos brjod par snang ba ma byas na bstan pa nub par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i chos brjod par snang ba ma byas na bstan pa nub par 'gyur bas /
translated: if one does not make use of the conventional expressions of phenomena, such as the lack of essence in the conventional, the teaching would disappear.

original: 'jig rten rmongs par 'gyur zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rmongs par 'gyur zhes ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the world would be confused.

original: ming dang zhes pa la sogs pas ngo bo nyid gsum dbye ba'i sgo nas gsal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang zhes pa la sogs pas ngo bo nyid gsum dbye ba'i sgo nas gsal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The three natures are clearly indicated by the terms name, etc.

original: de yang bum pa la sogs pa'i ming du rtog pa dang / de dag gi don la rtog pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag la sogs par phyin ci log tu rtog pa dang / gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyi lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bum pa la sogs pa'i ming du rtog pa dang / de dag gi don la rtog pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag la sogs par phyin ci log tu rtog pa dang / gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyi lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtog pa ste /
translated: Name refers to the conceptualization of such things as the name pot, the conceptualization of its referent, the conceptualization of its erroneous nature as pure, blissful, and a self, and the conceptualization of the hidden object, the conditions such as the reason.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa dang gsum gyi sgo nas byis pa rnams dngos por rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa dang gsum gyi sgo nas byis pa rnams dngos por rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, childish beings conceptualize things in terms of these three, namely, the conceptualization of the name, the conceptualization of the referent, and the conceptualization of inference.

original: yang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la de dag dang mi mthun par brtags pa ni kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la de dag dang mi mthun par brtags pa ni kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined characteristic is the imagined characteristic that is contrary to the nature of non-cessation, etc.

original: sgyu ma'i dpe rnams dang 'dra ba'i de bzhin nyid dang gnyis su med pa la sogs pa ni 'gyur ba med pa dang phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa'o //üîΩlus dang ngag gi spyod yul brdzun //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe rnams dang 'dra ba'i de bzhin nyid dang gnyis su med pa la sogs pa ni 'gyur ba med pa dang phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa'o // lus dang ngag gi spyod yul brdzun //
translated: The unchangeable and unmistaken perfected characteristic is the suchness that is non-dual with the examples of illusion, etc.

original: zhes pas ni de dag gi rnam par rig byed dam /
analyzed: zhes pas ni de dag gi rnam par rig byed dam /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúThe domain of body and speech is false.‚ÄùüîΩThe indicative form of those or the external entity that is the object of their action does not exist even conventionally.

original: de dag gi las su bya ba phyi rol gyi ngo bo ni kun rdzob tu yang med la rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab dang / des rtogs par bya ba'i don ni bden pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi las su bya ba phyi rol gyi ngo bo ni kun rdzob tu yang med la rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab dang / des rtogs par bya ba'i don ni bden pa ste /
translated: The truth is the non-conceptual wisdom and the object realized by it.

original: de nyid kyis gnyis kyi mthar 'dzin pa rnams spong pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gnyis kyi mthar 'dzin pa rnams spong pa'o //
translated: Just that eliminates the extremes of the two apprehensions.

original: rigs pas rnam par gzhigs na ni /
analyzed: rigs pas rnam par gzhigs na ni /
translated: When analyzed by reasoning,

original: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa 'gag / ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni shes pas don 'dzin par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa 'gag / ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni shes pas don 'dzin par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan mi 'thad de /
translated: The meaning of such passages as ‚ÄúThe cessation of the apprehended and apprehender‚Äù is that the reason for positing that consciousness apprehends objects is untenable.

original: ji skad du myong ba yod pa de don 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes brtags pa na /
analyzed: ji skad du myong ba yod pa de don 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes brtags pa na /
translated: When it is analyzed, how can the existence of experience be the apprehension of objects?

original: skyes pa dang 'das ba dag gis so //üîΩgzung 'dzin @273a * //
analyzed: skyes pa dang 'das ba dag gis so // gzung 'dzin @273a * //
translated: It is said that it is due to the arisen and the past.

original: khas len pa rnams kyis smras pa'i tshe /
analyzed: khas len pa rnams kyis smras pa'i tshe /
translated: When those who assert the existence of apprehended and apprehender say that,

original: de ltar na yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa de ma thag pa yang yul du 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa slob dpon dharma k'irtis bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa de ma thag pa yang yul du 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa slob dpon dharma k'irtis bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: then the immediately preceding consciousness that has a similar object would also be the object.

original: de'i don yang shes pa don las skyes shing don dang 'dra ba'i sgo nas don 'dzin par 'dod pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i don yang shes pa don las skyes shing don dang 'dra ba'i sgo nas don 'dzin par 'dod pa mi 'thad de /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: It is untenable to assert that consciousness arises from an object and apprehends the object by being similar to the object.

original: de ltar na sngon por snang ba'i blo rgyun chags su 'jug pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na sngon por snang ba'i blo rgyun chags su 'jug pa na /
translated: When a mind that appears as blue engages in a continuous stream,

original: blo snga ma rnams phyi ma'i yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo snga ma rnams phyi ma'i yul du 'gyur te /
translated: the former minds would be the object of the latter.

original: snga ma las skyes pa dang de 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma las skyes pa dang de 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they arise from the former and are similar to it.

original: de la sogs pa rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las bshad pa rnams skabs 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las bshad pa rnams skabs 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the explanations in the treatises of reasoning in this context.

original: gal te don du snang ba log pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te don du snang ba log pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the appearance as objects is just a mistake,

original: snang ba sems kyi ngo bor yang mi 'thad dam snyam na /
analyzed: snang ba sems kyi ngo bor yang mi 'thad dam snyam na /
translated: is it not untenable that the appearance is the essence of mind?

original: ji ltar byis pas phyi rol gyi ngo bor brtags pa ltar mi bden gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas phyi rol gyi ngo bor brtags pa ltar mi bden gyi /
translated: It is not true that it is as imagined by the childish as the essence of external objects.

original: kun rdzob tu snang ba sems su bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu snang ba sems su bden pa'o //
translated: It is true that the appearance as objects is mind.

original: pha ma phrad par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor bar 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: pha ma phrad par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor bar 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: The line ‚Äúwhen father and mother come together‚Äù and so on teaches the way of entering into samsara.

original: pha ma phrad cing chags par gyur pa dang ; / de'i dus kyi khu ba dang khrag gi nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skye gnas la chags pa'i yid dang lhan cig la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: pha ma phrad cing chags par gyur pa dang ; / de'i dus kyi khu ba dang khrag gi nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skye gnas la chags pa'i yid dang lhan cig la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When father and mother come together and are passionate, the foundation consciousness together with the mind that is attached to the place of birth enters into the semen and blood of that time.

original: re zhig de las mi thon pa ste mar gyi bum pa'i nang du byi ba zhugs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: re zhig de las mi thon pa ste mar gyi bum pa'i nang du byi ba zhugs pa bzhin no //
translated: For a while it does not come out, like a mouse that has entered a pot of butter.

original: de las rim gyis nur nur bo la sogs pa dang / gzugs dman zhing tshul 'bras mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: de las rim gyis nur nur bo la sogs pa dang / gzugs dman zhing tshul 'bras mi sdug pa ste /
translated: From that, gradually, the embryo becomes a fetus, and so on, and then the body is born, with its inferior form and unpleasant appearance.

original: rkang lag 'gyus shing dbang po ma dod pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rkang lag 'gyus shing dbang po ma dod pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The limbs are twisted and the faculties are not clear.

original: de dag kyang sngon gyi las las byung ba'i rlung rnams kyi khyad par du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang sngon gyi las las byung ba'i rlung rnams kyi khyad par du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: These are the special features of the winds that arise from previous karma.

original: rgyas par ni dga' bo mngal du 'jug pa bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni dga' bo mngal du 'jug pa bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail from the teaching on Nanda Entering the Womb.

original: lnga dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / don snying lnga'o //
analyzed: lnga dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / don snying lnga'o //
translated: The five faculties and so on refers to the five faculties, the five objects, and the five vital organs.

original: yid ni kun gzhi dang lhan cig tu 'jug cing re zhig brgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: yid ni kun gzhi dang lhan cig tu 'jug cing re zhig brgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: The mind operates together with the foundation consciousness, and it is also taught that it sometimes becomes unconscious.

original: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pas don spyi'i rnam par rig cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pas don spyi'i rnam par rig cing /
translated: Moreover, conceptualization cognizes the aspects of the object in a general way.

original: de las brjod par 'dod pa dang / rkan dang mchu'i byed pa la sogs pa las tshig tu rnam par brtags pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las brjod par 'dod pa dang / rkan dang mchu'i byed pa la sogs pa las tshig tu rnam par brtags pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: From that, the desire to speak and the configuration of the throat, lips, and so on arise, and from that, speech is produced.

original: mu stegs smra la brten pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs smra la brten pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who rely on the doctrines of the tƒ´rthikas are those who possess the innate identity view.

original: gnas skabs der theg pa chen po'i snod dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs der theg pa chen po'i snod dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: At that stage, they are not fit vessels for the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: de'i phyir gang zag dang phung po la sogs pa tsam ston pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag dang phung po la sogs pa tsam ston pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha taught them only the mere person, aggregates, and so on.

original: sems can gyi @273b bsam pa dang bstun pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can gyi @273b bsam pa dang bstun pa yin gyi /
translated: He did so in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: ngan par lta ba'i gnas de dag bden pa ni ma yin pa'o //üîΩmgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid zab mo gsal bar byed pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ji ltar 'byung ba sngar dris shing /
analyzed: ngan par lta ba'i gnas de dag bden pa ni ma yin pa'o // mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid zab mo gsal bar byed pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su ji ltar 'byung ba sngar dris shing /
translated: Those who hold such views are not true.

original: yang bsnan te dris pa dang de'i lan gsal bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang bsnan te dris pa dang de'i lan gsal bar ston pa'o //
translated: The question When will the protector . . . ? and so on was asked earlier, and it is asked again here. The answer is given clearly.

original: dus dag 'das nas zhes pa ni lo grangs nyis brgya 'das nas zhes gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las bstan to //
analyzed: dus dag 'das nas zhes pa ni lo grangs nyis brgya 'das nas zhes gsung rab kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig las bstan to //
translated: The phrase after many eons is explained in some scriptures as after two hundred years.

original: dpal ldan zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sam bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sam bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'o //
translated: The word glorious refers to the accumulation of the stores of merit and knowledge, or to nondual knowledge.

original: klu ni ming gi dang po ste klu sgrub snying po'o //
analyzed: klu ni ming gi dang po ste klu sgrub snying po'o //
translated: Naga is the first part of the name of the master, Nagarjuna.

original: 'gro ba kun du zhes pa la sogs pas slob dpon de nyid srid pa'i sdug bsngal las yid byung ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba kun du zhes pa la sogs pas slob dpon de nyid srid pa'i sdug bsngal las yid byung ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In all migrations and so on refers to the master's disgust with the sufferings of existence and so on.

original: shes par zad do //
analyzed: shes par zad do //
translated: This is well known.

original: de lta na theg pa chen po'i rigs can ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na theg pa chen po'i rigs can ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if that is so, he would not be a bodhisattva, you say. Not so,

original: de yis skyo bas rang dang gzhan sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i don du byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yis skyo bas rang dang gzhan sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i don du byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he generated the spirit of supreme enlightenment out of disgust with suffering, in order to liberate himself and others from suffering.

original: rnal 'byor can gyis zhes pa la sogs pas ni bsam gtan gyi mtshan ma dang / de dag la log par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyis zhes pa la sogs pas ni bsam gtan gyi mtshan ma dang / de dag la log par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul ston te /
translated: The yogi and so on teaches the signs of meditative concentration and the way to avoid error in regard to them.

original: tshig gi don ni phal cher sngar bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni phal cher sngar bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the words is for the most part self-evident.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul ltar //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul ltar //
translated: As the domain of the noble ones and so on refers to the domain of the noble ones, which is the object of the noble ones.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'phags pas yul du byas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni 'phags pas yul du byas pa bzhin du /
translated: These and other passages show that the object of the ƒÅryas is not the object of the world.üîΩ

original: de bzhin nyid kyi don bden pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi don bden pa'o //
translated: As such, the meaning of suchness is the truth.

original: yongs su gyur dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel gyi de kho na nyid ston te /
analyzed: yongs su gyur dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel gyi de kho na nyid ston te /
translated: The reality of dependent origination is taught by ‚Äútransformation,‚Äù etc.

original: grangs can la sogs pa thams cad gtso bo'i yongs su 'gyur bar 'dod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa thams cad gtso bo'i yongs su 'gyur bar 'dod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on assert that the transformation of the primal substance is the cause of the world.

original: don go bar zad do //
analyzed: don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is understood.

original: bar ma do dag bsdu ba ni srid pa bar ma'i sems can la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams gsung rab kyi brjod bya nyid du bsdus shing bstan pa la /
analyzed: bar ma do dag bsdu ba ni srid pa bar ma'i sems can la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams gsung rab kyi brjod bya nyid du bsdus shing bstan pa la /
translated: The intermediate state is included in the previously explained beings of the intermediate state and so on.

original: dngos por rtog pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la mkhas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos por rtog pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la mkhas pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who conceive things as real are not skilled in the meaning of suchness.

original: don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyal bas ma gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyal bas ma gsungs te /
translated: Ultimately, the Victor did not teach dependent origination.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi rten 'brel 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam pa'i chos stong pa nyid mtshon pa'i brda ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi rten 'brel 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam pa'i chos stong pa nyid mtshon pa'i brda ste /
translated: However, when there is this dependent origination of mere appearance, the expression ‚Äúwhen this exists, that occurs‚Äù and so on is a symbol that illustrates the ultimate truth of emptiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na rten @274a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // des na rten @274a * //
translated: By engaging in dependent origination, one engages in the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: 'brel du snang ba'i brda las tha dad du gyur ba'i dngos po ni ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel du snang ba'i brda las tha dad du gyur ba'i dngos po ni ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, a thing that is different from the symbol of dependent origination is unborn and unceasing.

original: gzugs brnyan chu bo'i chu 'dra bar //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan chu bo'i chu 'dra bar //
translated: Like a reflection, like a river‚Äôs current,

original: zhes pa ni rdzas su ma grub cing rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdzas su ma grub cing rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o //
translated: it is not substantially established but occurs in a continuous stream.

original: theg chen nga yi theg pa min //
analyzed: theg chen nga yi theg pa min //
translated: The MahƒÅyƒÅna is not my vehicle.üîΩAnd so on.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni de kho na nyid du /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni de kho na nyid du /
translated: In reality,

original: theg pa med cing 'gro ba med //
analyzed: theg pa med cing 'gro ba med //
translated: there is no vehicle and no going.

original: ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: bden pa ma yin thar pa min //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin thar pa min //
translated: It is not true, it is not liberation.

original: zhes pa ni bden pa dang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i thar pa ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bden pa dang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i thar pa ma grub pa'o //
translated: This is the non-establishment of the truth and the liberation of the realization of the truth.

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ni theg pa chen po'i theg pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ni theg pa chen po'i theg pa ste /
translated: However, in the conventional, it is the vehicle of the Mahayana.

original: de 'dra ba'i lam nas 'ongs shing de nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lam nas 'ongs shing de nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: One comes from such a path and abides in thatness.

original: skye ba dag ni mdor bshad de //
analyzed: skye ba dag ni mdor bshad de //
translated: The arising is explained in brief

original: 'gog pa nyid ni rgyas par ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa nyid ni rgyas par ro //
translated: and cessation itself is explained in detail.

original: zhes pa ni skye ba ni blo rags pa'i yul du bsdus te bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni skye ba ni blo rags pa'i yul du bsdus te bstan nas /
translated: This is the arising that is included in the domain of coarse mind and is taught.

original: de nyid don dam par 'gog pa ni rtogs par dka' bas theg pa chen po'i gsung rab las rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid don dam par 'gog pa ni rtogs par dka' bas theg pa chen po'i gsung rab las rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: Thatness, which is the ultimate cessation, is difficult to realize, and therefore it is taught in detail in the scriptures of the Mahayana.

original: skye ba bkag pa'i stong pa nyid ni gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa'i stong pa nyid ni gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The emptiness that refutes arising is twofold.

original: mi skye ba'i stong pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang / yang sems tsam pa la sogs pas rten 'brel don dam pa'i dngos por grub pa nyid gzung 'dzin la sogs pas stong par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i stong pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang / yang sems tsam pa la sogs pas rten 'brel don dam pa'i dngos por grub pa nyid gzung 'dzin la sogs pas stong par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of nonarising is the unmistaken meaning that is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, and the CittamƒÅtra and so on assert that dependent origination is an ultimately established entity that is empty of subject and object and so on.

original: de 'dra ba ni tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas 'jig cing mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni tshad ma'i gnod pa yod pas 'jig cing mi bden pa'o //
translated: Such a view is destroyed and untrue because it is undermined by valid cognition.

original: mdo sde 'dul ba zhes pa la sogs pas sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshig gis brjod pa'i brtags pa sna tshogs la brten nas /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dul ba zhes pa la sogs pas sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshig gis brjod pa'i brtags pa sna tshogs la brten nas /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe s≈´tras, the vinaya‚Äù refers to the various concepts based on the words of the twelve branches of excellent speech, which are included in the three scriptural collections.

original: kun gzhi'i dri ma rnam par dag par rtog cing /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i dri ma rnam par dag par rtog cing /
translated: They conceive of the purification of the stains of the foundation consciousness.

original: bdag med pa'i don rtogs shing goms pa las rnam par dag par mi 'dod pa rnams ni phyin ci log yin pas bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par dag pa'i don la blo gros mi gnas shing mi 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don rtogs shing goms pa las rnam par dag par mi 'dod pa rnams ni phyin ci log yin pas bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par dag pa'i don la blo gros mi gnas shing mi 'thob pa'o //
translated: Those who do not assert that the meaning of selflessness is realized and cultivated and that it is purified are mistaken. Therefore their minds do not abide in and do not attain the meaning of the pure reality of selflessness.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As is said:

original: gang zhig sgra yis chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sgra yis chos bstan pa'o //
translated: The dharma is taught by means of sounds.

original: sgra de la ni gang chags pa //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra de la ni gang chags pa // zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are attached to those soundsüîΩand so on.

original: rkyen gyis yod par ma bsgrubs zhes pa la /
analyzed: rkyen gyis yod par ma bsgrubs zhes pa la /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe existence of things is not established by conditions‚Äù is as follows.

original: dngos por smra ba 'ga' zhig de ltar 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dngos por smra ba 'ga' zhig de ltar 'dod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do some proponents of entities not assert that?

original: de'i 'dod pas de ltar 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'dod pas de ltar 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is established in that way by the desire of that.

original: de ltar yong par ma grub pas de la ltos pa'i med pa yang mi 'grub cing /
analyzed: de ltar yong par ma grub pas de la ltos pa'i med pa yang mi 'grub cing /
translated: Since it is not established in that way, the non-existence that depends on that is also not established.

original: gal te yod pa sgrub na de'i ltos pa med pa yang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod pa sgrub na de'i ltos pa med pa yang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If existence is established, then its non-existence is also established.

original: de la yod @274b med nyer mi 'gro //
analyzed: de la yod @274b med nyer mi 'gro //
translated: One does not approach existence and non-existence.

original: zhes pa ni yod med kyi mthar 'dzin pa nyid du mi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yod med kyi mthar 'dzin pa nyid du mi ltung ba'o //
translated: This means that one does not fall into the extremes of grasping at existence and non-existence.

original: de la 'ga' zhig ni snang ba'i ri bong gi rva bzhin med pa'i mthar rtog pa yod la /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig ni snang ba'i ri bong gi rva bzhin med pa'i mthar rtog pa yod la /
translated: In this regard, some conceive of the extreme of non-existence, like the horns of a rabbit, which is an appearance.

original: gzhan ni yod pa'i mthar rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni yod pa'i mthar rtog pa ste /
translated: Others conceive of the extreme of existence.

original: de dag gnyis ka yang nor ba'o //üîΩzab yangs zhes pa la sogs pas ni bshad pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka yang nor ba'o // zab yangs zhes pa la sogs pas ni bshad pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: Both of those are mistaken.üîΩThe profound and vast...

original: de la zab pa dang rgya che ba'i ye shes ni go rims bzhin du ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la zab pa dang rgya che ba'i ye shes ni go rims bzhin du ji lta ba dang ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: In this regard, profound and vast wisdom are the wisdoms of knowing the mode and extent, respectively.

original: yangs pa ni de gnyis ka yang the tshom la sogs pa'i 'dzer dog med pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa ni de gnyis ka yang the tshom la sogs pa'i 'dzer dog med pa'o //
translated: Vast is that both of those are free from the narrowness of doubt, etc.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i zhing ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing khams ye shes dag pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i zhing ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing khams ye shes dag pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúperfect realm‚Äù is the pure appearance of the pristine consciousness of the sambhogakƒÅya buddhafield.

original: rgyu med pa'i rnam rtog ni de kho na nyid du gzhan dbang gi rnam rtog rgyu las ma skyes pas /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i rnam rtog ni de kho na nyid du gzhan dbang gi rnam rtog rgyu las ma skyes pas /
translated: The ‚Äúconceptualization without a cause‚Äù is the conceptualization of the dependent nature that is not produced from a cause in reality.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa'o //
translated: It is not established as such an entity.üîΩ‚Äú

original: snang la byis pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pas ni byis pa rnams kyis snang ba la rtag pa dang bdag la sogs par brtags la /
analyzed: snang la byis pa rnams zhes pa la sogs pas ni byis pa rnams kyis snang ba la rtag pa dang bdag la sogs par brtags la /
translated: Although they appear, fools‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on. Fools imagine that appearances are permanent, a self, and so on.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams ni de las bye brag tu mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams ni de las bye brag tu mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba ste /
translated: ƒÄryas, such as ≈õrƒÅvakas, view them as impermanent and so on.

original: byis pa la ltos na 'phags pa'i lta ba dag pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa la ltos na 'phags pa'i lta ba dag pa ste /
translated: Compared to fools, the view of the ƒÅryas is pure.

original: de yang rnam par thar ba gsum thos bsam gyi rtogs pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par thar ba gsum thos bsam gyi rtogs pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That also arises from the realization of hearing and contemplation of the three gates of liberation.

original: de la de dag gi lugs kyis rnam par thar pa gsum las stong pa nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa stong pa dang bdag med pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: de la de dag gi lugs kyis rnam par thar pa gsum las stong pa nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa stong pa dang bdag med pa gnyis yin la /
translated: In their system, from among the three doors of liberation, emptiness is the two aspects of the truth of suffering, emptiness and selflessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni lam dang 'gog pa'i rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni lam dang 'gog pa'i rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Signlessness is the eight aspects of the truths of path and cessation.

original: gang mchan ma med pa 'gog pa dang gang gis mtshan ma med pa lam gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gang mchan ma med pa 'gog pa dang gang gis mtshan ma med pa lam gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Signlessness is the aspect of the truth of cessation and the aspect of the path that is signlessness.

original: smon pa med pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa lhag ma gnyis so //
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa lhag ma gnyis so //
translated: Wishlessness is the four aspects of the truth of origin and the two remaining aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: thams cad chos la ma chags pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos la'o //
analyzed: thams cad chos la ma chags pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos la'o //
translated: Nonapprehending all phenomena is nonapprehending afflicted phenomena.

original: ma brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni gzung ba'i rtog pa spangs pas thob pa'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni gzung ba'i rtog pa spangs pas thob pa'o //
translated: The result of nonexamination is obtained through abandoning the conception of apprehended objects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang rgyal ba rnams ni phyi rol gzung ba'i rang bzhin ni brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang rgyal ba rnams ni phyi rol gzung ba'i rang bzhin ni brtags pa yin la /
translated: For that reason, pratyekabuddhas conceive external apprehended objects to be imputed.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni grangs can gyi 'dod pa ltar bdag las skye bar 'khrul pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni grangs can gyi 'dod pa ltar bdag las skye bar 'khrul pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The other-dependent is not the error of production from self, as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert.

original: gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is asserted that it is produced from another.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i sems 'ba' zhig rgyun chags su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i sems 'ba' zhig rgyun chags su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, only the apprehending mind is engaged in a continuum.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la @275a * //üîΩyang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la @275a * // yang sbyar te /
translated: These are also applied to the bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyang phyi'i don kun rdzob tu mi 'thad cing rnam par rig pa tsam gyi gzhan dbang kun rdzob tu gzhan las rgyun chags su 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang phyi'i don kun rdzob tu mi 'thad cing rnam par rig pa tsam gyi gzhan dbang kun rdzob tu gzhan las rgyun chags su 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they assert that external objects are not tenable conventionally and that the other-dependent, which is mere representation, arises in a continuum from another conventionally.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag gi rnam par dbye ba la log par rtogs pa sel ba ni bcu po pa ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag gi rnam par dbye ba la log par rtogs pa sel ba ni bcu po pa ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The elimination of misconceptions about the classification of persons such as ≈õrƒÅvakas is set forth in the tenth chapter.

original: sngar rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: sngar rgyas par bstan to //
translated: This was previously explained extensively.

original: dngos po rnams ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i thabs ston te /
translated: The method of attaining the samƒÅdhi of the absence of appearances is taught by ‚ÄúThings do not appear to the mind,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po'i snang ba med na /
analyzed: dngos po'i snang ba med na /
translated: If things do not appear to the mind,

original: de la ltos pa'i dngos med du snang ba yang med de /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i dngos med du snang ba yang med de /
translated: The appearance of non-entity in dependence on that also does not exist.

original: de dag mnyam zhing phan tshun rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mnyam zhing phan tshun rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: Those are equal and mutually seal each other.

original: gal te dngos bo dang dngos po med pa 'gal ba ji ltar de dag mnyam pa nyid du byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te dngos bo dang dngos po med pa 'gal ba ji ltar de dag mnyam pa nyid du byed ce na /
translated: If entity and non-entity are contradictory, how are they made equal?

original: gang gi tshe na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù is stated.

original: phyi nang gi yul la g-yo ba'i sems mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gi yul la g-yo ba'i sems mi shes pa ste /
translated: The mind that moves to external and internal objects is not known.

original: de 'dra ba'i sems mi dmigs pa de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med par 'dzin pa 'jig par byed cing sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang thob pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems mi dmigs pa de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med par 'dzin pa 'jig par byed cing sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang thob pa'o //
translated: When such a mind is not observed, at that time the apprehension of entity and non-entity is destroyed and the equality of mind is also attained.

original: gzhan yang kun rdzob pa'i dngos po nyid don dam pa'i dngos por med pas de dag 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang kun rdzob pa'i dngos po nyid don dam pa'i dngos por med pas de dag 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, since the entity of the relative itself is not an entity of the ultimate, those are not contradictory.

original: yang dngos por 'dzin pa ji ltar ldog ce na /
analyzed: yang dngos por 'dzin pa ji ltar ldog ce na /
translated: Again, how is the apprehension of entity averted?

original: thog ma med ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thog ma med ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚ÄúFrom beginningless time‚Äù is stated.

original: byis pa rnams gang zag gi bdag tu 'dzin pas sems kyi rgyud g-yogs pa la /
analyzed: byis pa rnams gang zag gi bdag tu 'dzin pas sems kyi rgyud g-yogs pa la /
translated: The continuum of the mind of childish beings is covered by the apprehension of the self of persons.

original: gzer chung dus gzer chen po 'byin pa ltar /
analyzed: gzer chung dus gzer chen po 'byin pa ltar /
translated: Just as a small pain can cause a great pain,

original: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por bstan pas brid nas /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por bstan pas brid nas /
translated: having enticed with the teaching of things such as the aggregates,

original: gang zag tu 'dzin pa rnam par bzlog la /
analyzed: gang zag tu 'dzin pa rnam par bzlog la /
translated: the apprehension of a person is to be averted.

original: phung po la sogs par 'dzin pa yang stong pa nyid du bstan pas bzlog cing /
analyzed: phung po la sogs par 'dzin pa yang stong pa nyid du bstan pas bzlog cing /
translated: And the apprehension of things such as the aggregates is also to be averted by the teaching of emptiness.

original: stong pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa yang nges pa'i don gyi mdo 'dir zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu'i don bstan pas bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa yang nges pa'i don gyi mdo 'dir zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu'i don bstan pas bzlog pa'o //
translated: And the apprehension of the sign of emptiness is also to be averted by the teaching in this sutra of the definitive meaning, the meaning of the illusion-like unity.

original: de'i rgyu can de la dmigs //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can de la dmigs //
translated: The cause of that is that,

original: zhes pas ni rnam shes 'jug pa'i tshul rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: zhes pas ni rnam shes 'jug pa'i tshul rgyas par ston te /
translated: This passage teaches in detail the way in which consciousness engages.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni kun gzhi las byung zhing kun gzhi la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni kun gzhi las byung zhing kun gzhi la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The engaging consciousnesses arise from the alaya and focus on the alaya.

original: yid ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: yid ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The mind is the afflicted mentality.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs te /
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs te /
translated: The mind is the collection of the six consciousnesses.

original: de'i rgyu kun gzhi rang gi rigs phyi ma yang des 'byin par byed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu kun gzhi rang gi rigs phyi ma yang des 'byin par byed ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is the alaya, and the subsequent type of that is also produced by that.

original: rnam par smin skyes zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par shes pa'i khyad par rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin skyes zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par shes pa'i khyad par rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarisen from karmic maturation‚Äù and so on refers to the superknowledge that arises from the karmic maturation of a specific consciousness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mar me phul bas spyan @275b dang ldan //
analyzed: mar me phul bas spyan @275b dang ldan //
translated: By offering a lamp, one obtains eyes.

original: rol mo'i sgra yis rna thob 'gyur //
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra yis rna thob 'gyur //
translated: By offering music, one obtains ears.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
translated: And so on, as previously explained.

original: byin rlabs ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis gnang ba ste /
analyzed: byin rlabs ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis gnang ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessing‚Äù refers to the permission of the buddhas.

original: de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis thob pa'i mngon shes so //üîΩris dang 'gro ba rnams dang byung //
analyzed: de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis thob pa'i mngon shes so // ris dang 'gro ba rnams dang byung //
translated: The superknowledge obtained through their blessing.üîΩ‚ÄúThe realms and destinies arise from it.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i ris sna tshogs rnams kyang kun gzhi las byung zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i ris sna tshogs rnams kyang kun gzhi las byung zhing /
translated: The various realms of the destinies arise from the foundation consciousness.

original: de rnams la las kyis thob pa'i mngon par shes pa yang de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams la las kyis thob pa'i mngon par shes pa yang de las byung ba'o //
translated: The superknowledge obtained through karma in those realms also arises from it.

original: rmi lam du ni gang rnyed dang // zhes pa ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gnyid kyis bslad pa'i gnas skabs na yang don ji lta ba bzhin snang ba'i mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam du ni gang rnyed dang // zhes pa ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gnyid kyis bslad pa'i gnas skabs na yang don ji lta ba bzhin snang ba'i mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd in dreams‚Äù refers to the superknowledge of the way things really are, which appears even in the state of sleep affected by dreams, through the blessing of the gods of the Pure Abodes.

original: de ltar mngon shes rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon shes rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus there are four kinds of superknowledge.

original: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pas de dag nyid gsal bar bstan pa'o //üîΩmngon shes rnam smin skyes de min //
analyzed: gang yang zhes pa la sogs pas de dag nyid gsal bar bstan pa'o // mngon shes rnam smin skyes de min //
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúAnd also‚Äù clarifies those.

original: zhes pa ni mngon shes de dang 'gro ba'i ris rnams la yod pa sngon gyi las las byung ba gnyis gcig pa nyid du dogs pa sel ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mngon shes de dang 'gro ba'i ris rnams la yod pa sngon gyi las las byung ba gnyis gcig pa nyid du dogs pa sel ba ste /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe superknowledge born of retribution‚Äù shows that the superknowledge born of retribution and the superknowledge that exists in the destinies of beings and arises from previous karma are not the same.

original: las las thob pa ni bsod nams kyi las ma yin pa gang yang rung ba rnams las thob pa ste /
analyzed: las las thob pa ni bsod nams kyi las ma yin pa gang yang rung ba rnams las thob pa ste /
translated: That obtained from karma is obtained from any karma whatsoever, not just meritorious karma.

original: dmyal ba dang yi dags rnams la yang pha rol po'i sems dang / chod pa la sogs pa'i don shes pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang yi dags rnams la yang pha rol po'i sems dang / chod pa la sogs pa'i don shes pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the minds of others and of the meaning of clairvoyance that occurs even in the hells and among hungry ghosts.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni sngon gyi bsod nams kyi las dang 'phral gyi 'du byed pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni sngon gyi bsod nams kyi las dang 'phral gyi 'du byed pa las byung ba ste /
translated: That arisen from karmic maturation is from former meritorious karma and from present compositional activity.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga po rnams so //
translated: The five superknowledges are from that.

original: de rnams kyi las kyi sa bon dang de dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i las kyi sa bon kyang kun gzhi la bsgos shing de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi las kyi sa bon dang de dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i las kyi sa bon kyang kun gzhi la bsgos shing de las byung ba'o //
translated: The seeds of their karma and the seeds of karma empowered by them are infused in the all-base and arise from it.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes ni sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi gnas skabs yin pas /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes ni sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi gnas skabs yin pas /
translated: The superknowledge of the exhaustion of defilements is the state of the eighth ground and above.

original: de las byung ba'i nges pa med do //üîΩgzhan yang kun gzhi las de rnams 'byung ba'i tshul rgyas par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i nges pa med do // gzhan yang kun gzhi las de rnams 'byung ba'i tshul rgyas par bstan pa ni /
translated: So there is no certainty that it arises from that.üîΩMoreover, the way those arise from the all-base is taught extensively:

original: bag chags kyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the power of the habitual tendencies of the two

original: snang ba dag ni mi snang ba //
analyzed: snang ba dag ni mi snang ba //
translated: The appearances of the two are not seen.

original: zhes pa de kho na nyid du gnyis kyi rnam pa la sogs par snang ba med de /
analyzed: zhes pa de kho na nyid du gnyis kyi rnam pa la sogs par snang ba med de /
translated: In reality, the appearances of the two aspects and so on are not seen.

original: gang zag gi snang ba dang / rgyu ci las byung ba dang / yul ci zhig snang ba'am /
analyzed: gang zag gi snang ba dang / rgyu ci las byung ba dang / yul ci zhig snang ba'am /
translated: The appearances of the person, the cause from which they arise, and the object that appears

original: rang gi ngo bo ci zhig zhes brtags na ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ci zhig zhes brtags na ma grub pa'o //
translated: If one examines what its own nature is, it is not established.

original: de ltar gnyis snang gi dri ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnyis snang gi dri ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the absence of the stain of dualistic appearance,

original: sems ni rang bzhin dang ba ste //
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin dang ba ste //
translated: the mind is naturally clear light.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is what is taught by the above and other passages.

original: kun gzhi yis ni 'dor bar byed //üîΩces pa @276a * //
analyzed: kun gzhi yis ni 'dor bar byed // ces pa @276a * //
translated: The alaya is what is to be abandoned.üîΩThe meaning of this and other passages is that the latent tendencies of karma that exist in the alaya are activated by the moisture of craving, which is the attachment to the error of the appearance of objects.

original: la sogs pa'i don ni de la las kyi bag chags yod pa rnams yul du snang ba'i phyin ci log la mngon par chags shing 'gro ba rnams su smon par byed pa'i sred pa'i rlan gyis gsos btab nas byis pa'i skye bo 'khor ba'i gnas su 'dren par
analyzed: la sogs pa'i don ni de la las kyi bag chags yod pa rnams yul du snang ba'i phyin ci log la mngon par chags shing 'gro ba rnams su smon par byed pa'i sred pa'i rlan gyis gsos btab nas byis pa'i skye bo 'khor ba'i gnas su 'dren par
translated: This leads childish beings to the abodes of cyclic existence.

original: byed pa'o // nga'i sems ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni gdams pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa'o // nga'i sems ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni gdams pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúMy mind is‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on teaches suchness in the manner of an instruction.

original: bsam gtan pa'i yul dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar las sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa dang / de dag gi gnyen po bsam gtan bsgom pa'i dmigs pa'i yul dang / de rnams ston pa'i sangs rgyas kyi che ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab ces pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa'i yul dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar las sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa dang / de dag gi gnyen po bsam gtan bsgom pa'i dmigs pa'i yul dang / de rnams ston pa'i sangs rgyas kyi che ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab ces pa'o //
translated: Thus, the various migrations are accomplished by various actions, and the object of the contemplation of the antidotes to those is the greatness of the Buddha who teaches them.üîΩThe future, etc.

original: ma 'ongs zhes pa la sogs pas rdzas su ma grub pa'i don rnams kyang kun rdzob nyid du bshad cing /
analyzed: ma 'ongs zhes pa la sogs pas rdzas su ma grub pa'i don rnams kyang kun rdzob nyid du bshad cing /
translated: This explains that even objects which are not substantially established are conventional.

original: de las gzhan rdzas su grub bar snang ba rnams kun rdzob tu yod pa lta ci smos zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan rdzas su grub bar snang ba rnams kun rdzob tu yod pa lta ci smos zhes ston pa'o //
translated: What need is there to speak of those which appear to be substantially established and are conventionally existent?

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni phyin ci log nye bar zhi ba tsam yin pas rdzas su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni phyin ci log nye bar zhi ba tsam yin pas rdzas su ma grub pa'o //
translated: Here, nirvana is not substantially established, since it is merely the pacification of error.üîΩThe person who belongs to a class, etc.

original: ris su gtogs dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gang zag ston te /
analyzed: ris su gtogs dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gang zag ston te /
translated: This teaches the person who has the view of the person and of the dharmas.

original: ris su gtogs pa sangs rgyas pa'i skye bo dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba'i lta ba gcig la gnas shing /
analyzed: ris su gtogs pa sangs rgyas pa'i skye bo dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi gang zag gi bdag tu lta ba'i lta ba gcig la gnas shing /
translated: are the same.

original: yang kun rdzob sems tsam gyi tshul la rmongs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: yang kun rdzob sems tsam gyi tshul la rmongs pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who are confused about the conventional, the ChittamƒÅtra system,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po la rtog pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po la rtog pa ste /
translated: conceive of external things.

original: chos kyi bdag tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag tu rtog pa'o //
translated: They conceive of the self of phenomena.

original: rmi lam na ni zhes pa la sogs pas de las bzlog pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags ston te /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni zhes pa la sogs pas de las bzlog pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags ston te /
translated: The reverse of that is taught to be the sign of irreversibility for bodhisattvas.

original: de'i don yang dbang bskur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang dbang bskur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The empowerment is the tenth bodhisattva ground.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: That is also called ‚Äúbuddhahood.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni //
analyzed: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes ni //
translated: Having gone beyond the ninth ground,

original: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //
translated: through that gnosis one abides on the ground of buddhahood.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa //
translated: That is the bodhisattva

original: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: ground that should be known as the tenth.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas zhes bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes pa dang / stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas zhes bya'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no zhes pa dang / stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang //
translated: And the Ornament of the Dense Array says:

original: brgyad pa yan chad dag 'gyur te //
analyzed: brgyad pa yan chad dag 'gyur te //
translated: From the eighth ground onward,

original: dgu la bsam gtan spyod yul lo //
analyzed: dgu la bsam gtan spyod yul lo //
translated: on the ninth, the domain of meditative concentration,

original: bcu la sangs rgyas sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: bcu la sangs rgyas sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: on the tenth, the buddhas confer

original: dbang bskur rgyal @276b bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur rgyal @276b bar 'gyur ba'o // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: empowerment, and they become kings.

original: de rnams rmi lam du mthong na byang chub kyi sa bon 'phel ba ste phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: de rnams rmi lam du mthong na byang chub kyi sa bon 'phel ba ste phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags so //
translated: If they see these in dreams, the seed of enlightenment increases, and this is a sign of irreversibility.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: khams gsum dag la rmi lam na yang mi 'dod cing //
analyzed: khams gsum dag la rmi lam na yang mi 'dod cing //
translated: In dreams, they do not desire the three realms,

original: sangs rgyas rnams mthong 'gro la chos kyang ston byed pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams mthong 'gro la chos kyang ston byed pa //
translated: see the buddhas, and teach the dharma to beings.

original: de ni mi ldog lung bstan yin par rig par bya //
analyzed: de ni mi ldog lung bstan yin par rig par bya //
translated: This is known as the irreversible prophecy.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: gal te rang rgyal ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir mthong ba de dag dngos po la yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang rgyal ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir mthong ba de dag dngos po la yod dam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether those four types of appearances exist in things,

original: yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin te /
translated: they do not exist.üîΩIn what place or time do those four types of appearances exist for those

original: yul lam dus gang na 'phags pa de dag rnam pa ji ltar yod pa dang / rgyu gang las byung ba dang / de ltar yin pa ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yul lam dus gang na 'phags pa de dag rnam pa ji ltar yod pa dang / rgyu gang las byung ba dang / de ltar yin pa ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: ƒÅryas? From what cause do they arise? Why is it so?

original: de 'dra ba'i shes byed kyi tshad ma la sogs pa ma grub pas de ltar mthong ba ni /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i shes byed kyi tshad ma la sogs pa ma grub pas de ltar mthong ba ni /
translated: Since the valid knowledge that proves such is not established, those

original: sems nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa bzhi yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa bzhi yin zhes pa'o //
translated: appearances are the four illusions of the mind itself.üîΩAmong those, delusion about the cause is the ignorance of being

original: de la rgyu la rmongs pa ni las rgyu 'bras la rmongs pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu la rmongs pa ni las rgyu 'bras la rmongs pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: deluded about the cause and effect of karma.

original: rang bzhin med pa dang stong ba ni nye tshe ba'i stong pa yin pas de skad smra ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa dang stong ba ni nye tshe ba'i stong pa yin pas de skad smra ba ni /
translated: Since the absence of nature and emptiness are temporary emptinesses,

original: skye bar smra ba'i lta ba'o //üîΩ'gro gcig tha dad gnyi gar yang //
analyzed: skye bar smra ba'i lta ba'o // 'gro gcig tha dad gnyi gar yang //
translated: those who speak in that way have the view that arises.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúone going, different, and both‚Äù and so on is that the

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni phyi rol pa rnams kyis 'gro ba thams cad rgyud gcig pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni phyi rol pa rnams kyis 'gro ba thams cad rgyud gcig pa'am /
translated: tƒ´rthikas say that all migrating beings are one continuum, different, or both.

original: tha dad par 'dod la de yang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: tha dad par 'dod la de yang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'am /
translated: The assertion of difference is also a fabrication, whether one accepts that [the mind] is produced by conditions such as a divine creator,

original: 'dod rgyal ba nyid du khas len pa ni brtags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod rgyal ba nyid du khas len pa ni brtags pa ste /
translated: or that it is [simply] the result of chance.

original: kun rdzob tu yang ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang ma grub pa'o //
translated: [The mind] is not established even conventionally.

original: de lta na kun rdzob tu de rnams gang las byung zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na kun rdzob tu de rnams gang las byung zhe na /
translated: If that is so, one might wonder, What is the origin of those [phenomena] on the conventional level?

original: 'khor ba'i sa bon zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sa bon zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: [The root verse] states, [the origin] is the seed of samsara.

original: phyi dang nang zhes pa la phyi ni phung po la sogs pa phyi'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: phyi dang nang zhes pa la phyi ni phung po la sogs pa phyi'i chos rnams so //
translated: The outer [phenomena] are the outer phenomena, such as the aggregates.

original: nang ni rkyen te srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: nang ni rkyen te srid pa'i yan lag rnams so //
translated: The inner [phenomena] are the conditions, the links of existence.

original: de rnams kyi chos nyid la rnal 'byor gyis bsgom zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos nyid la rnal 'byor gyis bsgom zhes pa'o //
translated: The yogi meditates on the nature of those [phenomena].

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: One might wonder, How do [phenomena] originate from the seed of consciousness?

original: bag chags kyi bye brag mi 'dra ba dag gis 'bras bu sems kyi bye brag mi 'dra ba bskyed cing /
analyzed: bag chags kyi bye brag mi 'dra ba dag gis 'bras bu sems kyi bye brag mi 'dra ba bskyed cing /
translated: [The root verse] states, [The seed of consciousness] produces the various results, the different aspects of mind, through the different aspects of habitual tendencies.

original: bag chags dang bag chags kyi rten kun gzhi ni tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bag chags kyi rten kun gzhi ni tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The habitual tendencies and the foundation of the habitual tendencies are not different.

original: rnyog pa spangs pa'i sems ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba so so rang rig pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rnyog pa spangs pa'i sems ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba so so rang rig pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The mind free from defilements is the pristine wisdom of self-cognizance, free from the adventitious defilements.

original: chos thams cad bsdus pa'i don shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad bsdus pa'i don shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it knows the meaning of the totality of phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas nyid yin zhing phyin ci log gi yid zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid yin zhing phyin ci log gi yid zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: it is buddhahood itself, and it turns away from the mistaken mind.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni @277a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni @277a * //
translated: Nirvana

original: yongs su dag pa'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i zhing ngo //
translated: is the totally pure realm.

original: lus 'di nyid du bshad pa yin //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid du bshad pa yin //
translated: This is explained as the body.

original: zhes pa ni sems kyi lus sam tshogs yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems kyi lus sam tshogs yin pa'o //
translated: This is the body or collection of mind.

original: mtshan nyid dang ni rtogs pa de //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni rtogs pa de //
translated: The characteristics and the realization

original: nga yi skye ba rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: nga yi skye ba rnam gnyis so //
translated: are my two kinds of birth.

original: zhes ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi sku rtogs pa'i ye shes gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skye ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi sku rtogs pa'i ye shes gnyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skye ba yin la /
translated: The two kinds of birth of the Tathagata are the enjoyment body, which is the nature of the major and minor marks, and the wisdom of the realization of the truth body.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin pas ma smos pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin pas ma smos pa'o //
translated: The emanation body is not mentioned because it is only the appearance for those to be trained.

original: bshad pa'i tshul bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshul bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The explanation of the way of teaching is fourfold.

original: rigs par bstan pa gcig dang / grub pa'i mtha' gsum mo //
analyzed: rigs par bstan pa gcig dang / grub pa'i mtha' gsum mo //
translated: One principle and three tenets.

original: de la rigs pa gcig ni mthar thug gi theg pa gcig pa dang / don dam par theg pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de la rigs pa gcig ni mthar thug gi theg pa gcig pa dang / don dam par theg pa med pa ste /
translated: One principle is the one ultimate vehicle and the nonexistence of vehicles ultimately.

original: de bzhin du rigs pas gcig nyid du bsdu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs pas gcig nyid du bsdu'o //
translated: Thus, the one is subsumed by the principle.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni theg pa gsum ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni theg pa gsum ste /
translated: Three tenets are the three vehicles.

original: gdul bya'i bsam pa bzhin bshad kyi /
analyzed: gdul bya'i bsam pa bzhin bshad kyi /
translated: They are explained according to the inclinations of those to be trained.

original: de ltar rigs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not like that according to the principle.

original: gal te gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na gsum du rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na gsum du rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is according to the situation, is it not reasonable to have three?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not,

original: gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na /
translated: because if it were according to the situation,

original: lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa grangs thug pa med pa nyid du sngar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa grangs thug pa med pa nyid du sngar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would be said that there are innumerable vehicles such as the vehicle of the gods and the vehicle of Brahma.

original: rtag pa ther zug zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po chos kyi sku'i rigs dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log pa ni 'gyur ba med pas rtag pa ther zug pa yin la /
analyzed: rtag pa ther zug zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po chos kyi sku'i rigs dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log pa ni 'gyur ba med pas rtag pa ther zug pa yin la /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúpermanent, stable‚Äù shows that the essence of the tathiigatagarbha, the reality of the nature of things, is unmistaken, and so is permanent and stable.

original: de yang sems dang rnam par shes pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: de yang sems dang rnam par shes pa las grol ba'o //
translated: And it is free from mind and consciousness.

original: dngos po med na zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de 'dra ba med na rnam par dag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa mi 'thad pa ston pa'o //üîΩde bzhin nyid ni nor ba tsam //
analyzed: dngos po med na zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de 'dra ba med na rnam par dag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa mi 'thad pa ston pa'o // de bzhin nyid ni nor ba tsam //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf there were no reality‚Äù shows that if there were no such tathiigatagarbha on the conventional level, then complete affliction and complete purification would be untenable.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyin ci log la sogs pa'i chos dang / de bzhin nyid chos nyid ni de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyin ci log la sogs pa'i chos dang / de bzhin nyid chos nyid ni de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par ston pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúSuchness is just a mistake‚Äù shows that the dharmata of suchness and mistakenness and so on cannot be said to be either the same or different.

original: 'du byed mthong ba ni de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid mthong bas phyin ci log spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mthong ba ni de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid mthong bas phyin ci log spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Seeing the formations is seeing their suchness, and so mistakenness is eliminated.

original: de ltar spong bar 'gyur ba'i tshul bsdus te bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de ltar spong bar 'gyur ba'i tshul bsdus te bstan pa yang /
translated: The way to abandon them is summarized and taught:

original: sems tsam la ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind only, the non-existence of the external object,üîΩThe non-existence of the subject, and the existence of consciousness,üîΩThe non-existence of all things, and the existence of non-existence,üîΩThe non-existence of non-existence, and the existence of the pure object.

original: 'di rnams kyi don ni drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na gzung ba rang bzhin med pa'i sems tsam gyi rtog pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don ni drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs na gzung ba rang bzhin med pa'i sems tsam gyi rtog pa la gnas nas /
translated: The meaning of these is as follows: At the time of heat and peak, one abides in the mind only, the concept of the absence of intrinsic existence of the object,üîΩand does not investigate external objects.

original: phyi'i don la mi brtag cing yang rim gyis mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na /
analyzed: phyi'i don la mi brtag cing yang rim gyis mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na /
translated: Then, gradually, at the time of the path of seeing,

original: @277b 'dzin pa'i sems kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la gnas nas 'dzin pa'i sems su mngon par zhen pa las 'da' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: @277b 'dzin pa'i sems kyang don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yang dag pa'i dmigs pa la gnas nas 'dzin pa'i sems su mngon par zhen pa las 'da' bar bya ba'o //
translated: one abides in the correct object of observation, the ultimate absence of intrinsic existence of the mind that is the subject, and one transcends the manifest adherence to the mind as the subject.

original: sems tsam las 'das nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes snang ba med pa la re zhig gnas de las kyang 'da' bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems tsam las 'das nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes snang ba med pa la re zhig gnas de las kyang 'da' bar bya ba ste /
translated: Having transcended mind only, one abides for a while in the non-appearance of the wisdom of meditative equipoise of the path of seeing and so forth. Then one transcends that.

original: rjes thob kyi gnas skabs su sa'i yongs su spyang ba la sogs pas sa de dang de dag rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes thob kyi gnas skabs su sa'i yongs su spyang ba la sogs pas sa de dang de dag rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: At the time of the subsequent attainment, one perfects those stages by means of the thorough clearing of the stages and so forth.

original: de las gzhan rtag tu snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas na /
analyzed: de las gzhan rtag tu snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas na /
translated: If one abides in a concentration that is always devoid of appearance,

original: nyan thos ltar sems can smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs ma rdzogs bas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa chen po mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos ltar sems can smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs ma rdzogs bas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa chen po mi mthong ba ste /
translated: then, like the ≈õrƒÅvakas, one will not see the MahƒÅyƒÅna, which is the nature of the result, because the accumulation of merit‚Äîmaturing sentient beings and so on‚Äîwill not be complete.

original: mi thob ces pa'o //üîΩdes na rjes kyi gnas skabs su sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub cing /
analyzed: mi thob ces pa'o // des na rjes kyi gnas skabs su sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub cing /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúone will not attain it.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log zhi ba dang / de 'dra bas yongs su zin pa'i khyad par du sems bskyed pa dang / smon lam dag gis kun gzhi'i dri ma sbyangs nas /
analyzed: phyin ci log zhi ba dang / de 'dra bas yongs su zin pa'i khyad par du sems bskyed pa dang / smon lam dag gis kun gzhi'i dri ma sbyangs nas /
translated: Therefore, in the subsequent period, the spontaneously present wisdom that realizes the illusion-like will purify the stains of the foundation consciousness through the special generation of the thought of awakening and through the power of aspirational prayers.

original: bdag med pa'i ye shes mchog tu gyur ba chos kyi sku spros pa dang bral ba mngon du byas pa de'i tshe mtshan ma thams cad mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ye shes mchog tu gyur ba chos kyi sku spros pa dang bral ba mngon du byas pa de'i tshe mtshan ma thams cad mi mthong ba'o //
translated: When the supreme wisdom of selflessness, the dharmakƒÅya free from elaborations, is actualized, at that time all signs will not be seen.

original: yang ji lta ba phyi'i don la mi rtog cing sems tsam las 'da' bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji lta ba phyi'i don la mi rtog cing sems tsam las 'da' bar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one transcend mere mind and not conceive of external objects as they are?

original: sems kyi spyod yul phyi rol lta bur snang ba la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul phyi rol lta bur snang ba la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis blta bar bya ste /
translated: The domain of mind that appears as if external should be seen with authentic wisdom.

original: de ltar bltas pas phyi'i don brdzun pa nyid du mthong ba na de la mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bltas pas phyi'i don brdzun pa nyid du mthong ba na de la mi rtog pa'o //
translated: When one sees external objects as false by looking in that way, one does not conceptualize them.

original: yang so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul sems kyi rang bzhin la yang /
analyzed: yang so so rang rig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul sems kyi rang bzhin la yang /
translated: Moreover, the domain of the wisdom that is individually self cognized is the nature of mind.

original: shes rab kyi sa de bzhin du bltas pas sems kyis chos nyid stang pa nyid shes rab kyi spyod yul ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sa de bzhin du bltas pas sems kyis chos nyid stang pa nyid shes rab kyi spyod yul ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba na /
translated: When one sees the emptiness that is the nature of mind, the domain of wisdom, just as it is,

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid de kho na nyid la mi rmongs pas sems tsam du dmigs pa las 'da'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid de kho na nyid la mi rmongs pas sems tsam du dmigs pa las 'da'o //
translated: one transcends the observation of mind only, since one is not confused about the reality that is the nature of phenomena.

original: de dag gi spyod yul gang yin zhe na /üîΩsdug bsngal gyi bden par rtogs pa sems can skye ba dang skye ba'i gnas phyi rol lta bur snang ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi spyod yul gang yin zhe na / sdug bsngal gyi bden par rtogs pa sems can skye ba dang skye ba'i gnas phyi rol lta bur snang ba ni /
translated: What is the domain of those two?

original: sems kyi spyod yul yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul yin la /
translated: The domain of mind is the appearance of sentient beings and the external places that appear as if external, which are realized to be the truth of suffering.üîΩThe domain of wisdom is the nature of phenomena, which is seen just as it is.

original: sems pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa kun 'byung gi bden par rtogs pa sems kyi ngo bor gyur ba ni ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa kun 'byung gi bden par rtogs pa sems kyi ngo bor gyur ba ni ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The mental action and the afflictions are realized as the truth of the origin of suffering, and they are the essence of the mind, which is the domain of wisdom.

original: 'bras bu thob pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The attainment of the result is the result of stream-entry and so forth.

original: mig dang zhes pa la @278a * //
analyzed: mig dang zhes pa la @278a * //
translated: As for eye and so forth,

original: sogs pas kun rdzob tu rnam shes skye ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sogs pas kun rdzob tu rnam shes skye ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: they are the causes of the arising of consciousness in the relative.

original: de la nam mkhas ni go skabs phye ba'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkhas ni go skabs phye ba'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa skye ba'o //
translated: Among them, space gives rise to consciousness by providing an opening.

original: 'dzin pa dang 'dzin byed ni go rims bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang 'dzin byed ni go rims bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang dbang po'o //
translated: The grasped and the grasper are consciousness and the sense faculties, respectively.

original: de la ming ni mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: de la ming ni mi 'byung ste //
translated: Name does not arise from them.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni ming dang don rang dga'i 'dod pa'i sbrel ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni ming dang don rang dga'i 'dod pa'i sbrel ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: As for name and so forth, they are merely the connection of the individual desires.

original: de las gzhan phan tshun du 'brel pa ni med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan phan tshun du 'brel pa ni med ces pa'o //
translated: Other than that, there is no mutual connection.

original: rgyu dang rgyu med pa las byung ba'i dngos por rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don la bden pa nyid du mi rtag ces pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu med pa las byung ba'i dngos por rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don la bden pa nyid du mi rtag ces pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the investigation by the conception of things arisen from causes and without causes is not real.

original: stong pa dang ni stong pa'i don //
analyzed: stong pa dang ni stong pa'i don //
translated: The emptiness and the meaning of emptiness

original: byis pas ma mthong rnam par rgyug /
analyzed: byis pas ma mthong rnam par rgyug /
translated: are not seen by the childish, who wander.

original: ces pa ni stong pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la byis pas de ltar mi rtogs pas mngon par 'dod cing tshol ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni stong pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la byis pas de ltar mi rtogs pas mngon par 'dod cing tshol ba'o //
