translated: The childish do not understand that form, etc., is of the nature of emptiness, and so they desire and seek it.üîΩMoreover, the explanations of the childish, etc., are seen to be the positing and teaching of the meaning of reality, i.e., the way things really are, by means of words, due to their own conceit.

original: gzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyi bshad pa 'jug pa yang rang rang gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis bden pa de kho na nyid kyi don tshig gis rnam par 'god cing ston pa nyid du mthong bas na brtags pa'i ni bshad pa yinüîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyi bshad pa 'jug pa yang rang rang gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis bden pa de kho na nyid kyi don tshig gis rnam par 'god cing ston pa nyid du mthong bas na brtags pa'i ni bshad pa yin zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus, the explanations are conceptual.

original: rtog pa'i gzung ba sgro gtags su bshad pa la bden pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bshad par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i gzung ba sgro gtags su bshad pa la bden pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bshad par zhen pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the reification of the apprehended by thought is the attachment to the explanation of the real characteristics.

original: gcig po rnam pa lngar grub ces pa la sogs pas ni phung po zhes gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lngar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gcig po rnam pa lngar grub ces pa la sogs pas ni phung po zhes gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa lngar 'gyur la /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe one is established as five aspects‚Äù and so forth shows that the aggregates, which are posited as one, are five in number.

original: de rnams re re yang sngar bstan pa ltar du mar 'gyur bas bden pa'i rang bzhin spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams re re yang sngar bstan pa ltar du mar 'gyur bas bden pa'i rang bzhin spangs pa'o //
translated: And each of those is multiple, as previously explained. Therefore, they are devoid of a nature that is truly existent.

original: de ltar ma grub bzhin sna tshogs su spro zhing rtog pa ni bdud kyis yongs su gzung pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma grub bzhin sna tshogs su spro zhing rtog pa ni bdud kyis yongs su gzung pa'o //
translated: To expand and conceptualize in that way, even though it is not established, is to be held by MƒÅra.

original: yang gzhan dag dbang phyug rtag pa la sogs pa 'gro ba skyed par byed pa dang bcas par 'dod pa ni 'gal ba khas blangs pas rtsod pa 'jug pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag dbang phyug rtag pa la sogs pa 'gro ba skyed par byed pa dang bcas par 'dod pa ni 'gal ba khas blangs pas rtsod pa 'jug pa'i rten yin no //
translated: Moreover, others assert that ƒ™≈õvara, who is permanent and so on, is the creator of the world. Since they accept a contradiction, they are the basis for engaging in debate.

original: des na bden pa'i mchog mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'i don sgra dang rnam rtog gi yul ma yin pa ni phyin ci log mtha' dag 'gags pa na mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na bden pa'i mchog mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'i don sgra dang rnam rtog gi yul ma yin pa ni phyin ci log mtha' dag 'gags pa na mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the supreme truth, the meaning of the middle that is free from the two extremes, which is not an object of words or conceptuality, is seen when all errors have ceased.

original: yid dang mtshan nyid dngos po la //
analyzed: yid dang mtshan nyid dngos po la //
translated: In the mind, characteristics, and things,

original: rtag dang mi rtag rlom sems med //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag rlom sems med //
translated: there is no conceit of permanence or impermanence.

original: ces pa ni de dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos por bzung ba'i sgo nas sems kyi khengs pa med pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mar bzung ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: ces pa ni de dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos por bzung ba'i sgo nas sems kyi khengs pa med pa'o // de bzhin du skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mar bzung ba'i sgo nas /
translated: This means that the mind is not inflated by apprehending those as things such as permanent or impermanent.

original: rnal 'byor @278b pa ni rlom sems pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor @278b pa ni rlom sems pa med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the yogi/nƒ´ is not conceited by apprehending the signs of arising and non-arising, etc.

original: don gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: don gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The two objects are the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: yang kun gzhi la byung ba'i sems kyi don gcig la /
analyzed: yang kun gzhi la byung ba'i sems kyi don gcig la /
translated: Moreover, with respect to the single object of the mind that arises in the ƒÅlaya,

original: sems gnyis kyis ni mi shes mi 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems gnyis kyis ni mi shes mi 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúthe two minds do not know it.‚Äù

original: gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi ngo bor ma grub cing mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi ngo bor ma grub cing mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is not established and is not observed as the entity of the two, the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: yang na sems gnyis pa gzhan zhig gis mi 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sems gnyis pa gzhan zhig gis mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Or, another mind does not apprehend it.

original: de yi myong ba gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de yi myong ba gzhan yod min //
translated: Its experience does not exist elsewhere.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is empty of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: zhes sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As explained above.

original: lta ba'i dra ba ni sdud cing 'ching bar byed pas dra ba ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i dra ba ni sdud cing 'ching bar byed pas dra ba ste /
translated: The net of views is a net because it binds and ties.

original: lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the sixty-two views, and so on.

original: lta ba de rnams kyis bden par brtags pa'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
analyzed: lta ba de rnams kyis bden par brtags pa'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams gang nas kyang 'ong ba med cing /
translated: The conditions of ignorance, etc., imagined to be real by those views do not come from anywhere,

original: gang du yang 'gro ba med la phyi rol pas brtags pa dbang phyug dang rang gi sde pas 'dod pa'i phung po la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang 'gro ba med la phyi rol pas brtags pa dbang phyug dang rang gi sde pas 'dod pa'i phung po la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: and they do not go anywhere.  The creator imagined by non-Buddhists and the aggregates, etc., asserted by our own schools do not exist.

original: 'dod chags med cing zhes pa la sogs pas ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las 'dus byas pa dang / las kyi sa bon sred pas mthu dang ldan par byas pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'dod chags med cing zhes pa la sogs pas ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis las 'dus byas pa dang / las kyi sa bon sred pas mthu dang ldan par byas pa yang med de /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no desire‚Äù and so on indicates that there is no karma compounded by the condition of ignorance, and there is no potentiation of the seed of karma by craving.

original: sngon yang med ces pas ni de dag tshe snga mas bsdus pa yang med ces pa'o //
analyzed: sngon yang med ces pas ni de dag tshe snga mas bsdus pa yang med ces pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNor was there before‚Äù indicates that they are not subsumed by a previous life.

original: las med byed med ces pas ni phyi rol pas brtags pa rnams kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: las med byed med ces pas ni phyi rol pas brtags pa rnams kyang med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no karma, no agent‚Äù indicates that the imputations of non-Buddhists do not exist.

original: byas pa med cing 'dus byas med //
analyzed: byas pa med cing 'dus byas med //
translated: There is no creation, no compounded phenomena.

original: ces pas ni da ltar gyi dus na rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / de rnams snga ma snga ma rnams kyis 'dus byas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ces pas ni da ltar gyi dus na rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / de rnams snga ma snga ma rnams kyis 'dus byas pa med pa'o //
translated: This shows that in the present time there is no such thing as consciousness, name-and-form, etc., nor are they produced by any of the former ones.

original: mtha' yang med cing chags pa med pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' ste sred pa dang len pas ma 'ongs pa'i ming dang gzugs 'grub par byed pa'i sa bon mthu dang ldan par byas pa dang / de las ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yang med cing chags pa med pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' ste sred pa dang len pas ma 'ongs pa'i ming dang gzugs 'grub par byed pa'i sa bon mthu dang ldan par byas pa dang / de las ma 'ongs pa'i phung po 'grub pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Nor is there any end, nor any attachment, which is the end of the future, since there is no seed of future name-and-form, made potent by craving and grasping, nor any future aggregates, etc., produced from that.

original: thar pa ni srid pa lugs las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa ni srid pa lugs las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the reversal of the order of existence.

original: chos ma yin pa ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: The non-Dharma is the non-virtuous.

original: dus med mya ngan 'das pa med //
analyzed: dus med mya ngan 'das pa med //
translated: There is no time, no nirvana.

original: ces pa ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i dus dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i med pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i dus dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i med pa'o //
translated: This shows the non-existence of the time and nirvana imagined by the non-Buddhists.

original: log dang mya ngan 'das pa med //
analyzed: log dang mya ngan 'das pa med //
translated: There is no reversal, no nirvana.

original: ces pa ni 'khor ba las log cing mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni 'khor ba las log cing mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: This shows the reversal from cyclic life and nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
translated: The Buddhists investigate.

original: lta ba thams cad spangs pa ni lta ba'i yul bkag pas sna tshogs su brtags pa thams cad sems yin zhes pa'o //üîΩlus @279a * //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad spangs pa ni lta ba'i yul bkag pas sna tshogs su brtags pa thams cad sems yin zhes pa'o // lus @279a * //
translated: Since the objects of views are refuted, all the various imagined things are mind.

original: ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The body is the truth of suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi lam ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi lam ni kun 'byung ngo //
translated: The afflictions and the paths of karma are the origin.

original: lus la sogs pa rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bas de ltar snang ba sems yin zhing /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bas de ltar snang ba sems yin zhing /
translated: Since the body and so on are like dreams and so on, appearances are mind.

original: sems yang don dam par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: sems yang don dam par ma grub pa'o //
translated: The mind is ultimately not established.

original: de 'dra ba'i sems kyi chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis su brtags pa phyin ci log nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩsa snang rgyu byung nges pa ni //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems kyi chos nyid rtogs pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis su brtags pa phyin ci log nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba'o // sa snang rgyu byung nges pa ni //
translated: Because of realizing the dharmatƒÅ of such a mind, the two extremes are seen as mistaken imputations.üîΩThe appearance of the earth and so on is definitely a cause.

original: zhes pa ni sa la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam par nges pa dang / yul dang dus nges par mi rnams la snang ba ni bag chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yis byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam par nges pa dang / yul dang dus nges par mi rnams la snang ba ni bag chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yis byung ba ste /
translated: The definite appearance of the earth and so on as colors and shapes and the definite appearance of the country and time to humans arises from causes such as traces.

original: kun rdzob tsam du sems kyi ngo bo bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam du sems kyi ngo bo bden pa'o //
translated: The essence of mind is true, merely conventionally.

original: sems ni snang ba med pas byung //
analyzed: sems ni snang ba med pas byung //
translated: The mind is non-apparent, arising from its own previous type.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni khyad par du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gsal ba med pa'i rang gi rigs snga ma las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni khyad par du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gsal ba med pa'i rang gi rigs snga ma las byung ba'o //
translated: By such statements as these, the special alaya-vijnana arises from its own previous type, without a clear aspect.

original: mi rnams kyi ni zhes pa la sogs pas snga ma de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni zhes pa la sogs pas snga ma de nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
translated: The previous statement is elaborated by of humans, etc.

original: gzhan yang sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni bag chags la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri mas mi mdzes pa ste /üîΩdkar po'i ras la dri ma snang zhing mi mdzes la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni bag chags la sogs pa glo bur gyi dri mas mi mdzes pa ste / dkar po'i ras la dri ma snang zhing mi mdzes la /
translated: Moreover, the mind, which is pure by nature, is not beautiful because of the stains of adventitious habitual tendencies, etc.üîΩIt is like a white cloth, where the stains appear and are not beautiful.

original: dri ma la ni dkar po med cing mi snang ba dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma la ni dkar po med cing mi snang ba dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The stains do not exist in the white, nor do they appear.

original: gzhan yang nam mkha' glo bur gyi sprin gyis bsgribs shing mi snang ba bzhin du sems kyi chos nyid kyang mi mthong bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang nam mkha' glo bur gyi sprin gyis bsgribs shing mi snang ba bzhin du sems kyi chos nyid kyang mi mthong bar byas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, just as the sky is obscured by adventitious clouds and does not appear, the reality of the mind is also made invisible.

original: de ltar sems la bag chags kyis bsgos shing de nyid ji ltar ldog par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar sems la bag chags kyis bsgos shing de nyid ji ltar ldog par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Thus, if one thinks, The mind is stained by habitual tendencies, and how will those be reversed?

original: sems ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mind, etc.

original: tshig gi don ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni sngar bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the words has been explained above.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum //
translated: The bodhisattvas are of three kinds.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub dman pa sngon du btang nas dus ring mo zhig nas sangs rgyas par 'gyur pa dang / dbang po rnon po de 'dra ba sngon du ma song bar myur du tshogs rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub dman pa sngon du btang nas dus ring mo zhig nas sangs rgyas par 'gyur pa dang / dbang po rnon po de 'dra ba sngon du ma song bar myur du tshogs rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: This means that after having previously been a bodhisattva of lesser enlightenment, one becomes a buddha after a long time; and that one of sharp faculties, who has not previously been such, quickly completes the collections and

original: 'tshang rgya ba dang / 'dod chen pa dang gsum du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba dang / 'dod chen pa dang gsum du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: becomes a buddha; and that there are three kinds, including the one of great desire.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Another enumeration has also been explained above.

original: skar ma dang ni sprin lta bur //
analyzed: skar ma dang ni sprin lta bur //
translated: Like stars and clouds, etc.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sprin gyis ma bsgribs pa'i dus na skar ma dang nyi zla'i gzugs dang 'od snang bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar bag chags las byung ba'i sems nyid sna tshogs su snang la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sprin gyis ma bsgribs pa'i dus na skar ma dang nyi zla'i gzugs dang 'od snang bar 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar bag chags las byung ba'i sems nyid sna tshogs su snang la /
translated: This means that just as the forms and lights of the stars, moon, and sun appear when they are not obscured by clouds, so the mind itself, which arises from habitual tendencies, appears in a variety of ways.

original: de 'dra ba'i dri mas bsgribs pa ni sems kyi de bzhin nyid mi snang ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dri mas bsgribs pa ni sems kyi de bzhin nyid mi snang ste /
translated: The suchness of mind is not seen when it is obscured by such stains.

original: sprin gyis bsgribs pa na /
analyzed: sprin gyis bsgribs pa na /
translated: When it is obscured by clouds,

original: nyi zla la sogs @279b pa mi snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyi zla la sogs @279b pa mi snang ba bzhin no //
translated: the sun and moon, etc. are not seen.

original: smig rgyu ba dang lnga yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu ba dang lnga yin no //
translated: The five are like a mirage.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid ji lta ba bzhin du song ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid ji lta ba bzhin du song ste /
translated: In this way, the differentiation of phenomena is just as it is.

original: de la 'dir sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnam pa bzhi dang / de rnams kyis mtshon pa rdzas dang btags pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: de la 'dir sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnam pa bzhi dang / de rnams kyis mtshon pa rdzas dang btags pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Here, the four examples of illusion, etc. and the five substances and imputed forms that are illustrated by them

original: lnga po de dag gis sgyu pa la sogs par chos mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga po de dag gis sgyu pa la sogs par chos mtshungs pa'o //
translated: are similar to phenomena such as illusion.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na 'byung ba bzhi'i gzugs dang / nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na 'byung ba bzhi'i gzugs dang / nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa ste /
translated: Again, in one way, the forms of the four elements and the single color of spaceüîΩare similar to illusion, etc.

original: rdzas dang btags pa'i gzugs rnam pa lnga ni sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas dang btags pa'i gzugs rnam pa lnga ni sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The five types of substantial and imputed form are similar to illusion, etc.

original: 'dod pa can ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: 'dod pa can ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: The desirous are of five types.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni gnas skabs kyi rigs can lnga po de nyid khams gsum gyi bde ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pas /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni gnas skabs kyi rigs can lnga po de nyid khams gsum gyi bde ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pas /
translated: The five types of beings who are of the type that is temporary, because they desire to attain the happiness of the three realms and nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: 'dod ba can lngar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'dod ba can lngar 'gyur zhing /
translated: become the five who desire.

original: de 'dra pa'i 'dod pa thob par byed cing rigs sbyong bar byed pa'i theg pa yang lnga ste /
analyzed: de 'dra pa'i 'dod pa thob par byed cing rigs sbyong bar byed pa'i theg pa yang lnga ste /
translated: The vehicles that cause them to attain the desired goal and purify their type are also five:

original: lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
translated: the vehicles of the gods, BrahmƒÅ, and so on, as previously explained.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa drug ni nyan thos dang / rang rgyal ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gsum la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa drug ni nyan thos dang / rang rgyal ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gsum la /
translated: The six types of nirvƒÅ·πáa are the three nirvƒÅ·πáas of ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tathƒÅgatas.

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa gnyis gnyis su phye bas rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa gnyis gnyis su phye bas rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They become six types because each is divided into two: with remainder and without remainder.

original: gal ta bzhin gshegs pa la de ltar 'byed pa mi 'thad do snyam na skyon med de /
analyzed: gal ta bzhin gshegs pa la de ltar 'byed pa mi 'thad do snyam na skyon med de /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that the TathƒÅgata has such divisions,‚Äù there is no fault.üîΩIn the S≈´tra of Golden Light

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa las /
translated: it says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis la brten nas /üîΩphung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis la brten nas / phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya la /
translated: The Tathagata also, in dependence on the two kinds of form body,üîΩis said to have a nirvana with remainder of aggregates.üîΩ

original: chos kyi sku la brten nas ni lhag ma med pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la brten nas ni lhag ma med pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathagata is said to attain nirvana with remainder in dependence on the two kinds of form body and without remainder in dependence on the dharmakaya.

original: phung po tha dad nyi shu bzhi //
analyzed: phung po tha dad nyi shu bzhi //
translated: The aggregates are differentiated as twenty four.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po brgyad dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la sogs pa tshor ba drug dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po brgyad dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la sogs pa tshor ba drug dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The form aggregate is eight, the eight collections of consciousness are eight, the six kinds of feeling such as feeling conditioned by eye contact are six, and the two kinds of discernment aggregate and formation aggregate are two.

original: de ltar na nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus there are twenty four.

original: gal te gzugs kyi phung po ni mngon pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa nas bco lnga la sogs par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi phung po ni mngon pa'i bstan bcos la sogs pa nas bco lnga la sogs par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't the form aggregate said to be fifteen in the Abhidharma and so on?

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: 'dir rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs rnam pa bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs rnam pa bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, the four kinds of form that are causes and the four kinds of form that are effects

original: nang gzugs can gyi dbang po @280a * //
analyzed: nang gzugs can gyi dbang po @280a * //
translated: are included in the internal form of the sense faculties.üîΩThe internal form of the sense faculties is included in the four primary elements,üîΩand the four primary elements are included in the four forms of form.

original: rnams kyang gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang reg byas bsdus pas de dag tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rnams kyang gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang reg byas bsdus pas de dag tsam du zad de /
translated: Thus, the four primary elements are included in the four forms of form.

original: sgra ni 'dir gzugs su bgrang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni 'dir gzugs su bgrang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Sound is not counted as form here.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: This should not be doubted, because it is also stated in the ƒÄrya-dharma-sa·πÉgƒ´ti-s≈´tra.

original: de las gzhan du bstan pa ni cung zad spros te rnam par phye ba'am /
analyzed: de las gzhan du bstan pa ni cung zad spros te rnam par phye ba'am /
translated: The teaching in other s≈´tras is a slight elaboration or an analysis,

original: grub pa'i mtha' ngan pas brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ngan pas brtags pa yin no //
translated: or it is a hypothesis of a bad philosophical theory.

original: de ltar phung po nyi shu rtsa bzhi po de rnams nyid sangs rgyas nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: de ltar phung po nyi shu rtsa bzhi po de rnams nyid sangs rgyas nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin te /
translated: Thus, those twenty-four aggregates are the twenty-four buddhas.

original: de'i don yang chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam grangs su sngar bstan pa dang / mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang /
analyzed: de'i don yang chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam grangs su sngar bstan pa dang / mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang /
translated: And in other sutras it is said:

original: rtag tu skye med chos ni de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rtag tu skye med chos ni de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathagata is a phenomenon that is always unborn.

original: chos rnams kun kyang de bzhin gshegs dang 'dra //
analyzed: chos rnams kun kyang de bzhin gshegs dang 'dra //
translated: All phenomena are like the Tathagata.

original: zhes gsungs pas phung po 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas yin pas de ltar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas phung po 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas yin pas de ltar gsungs pa'o //
translated: Since the nature of these aggregates is unborn and unceasing, it is natural nirvana, buddhahood, and that is what is taught.

original: yang sbyangs pas rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid sngar bstan pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang sbyangs pas rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid sngar bstan pa rnams te /
translated: The buddhahood of purification through training is the three kayas that were taught above.

original: sangs rgyas rnam pa du ru brjod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam pa du ru brjod //
translated: How many kinds of buddhas are there?

original: khyod kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu //
analyzed: khyod kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu //
translated: What is their nature?

original: zhes dris pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The reply to that question is as follows.

original: rgyal po'i sras ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: rgyal po'i sras ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: There are two kinds of princes.

original: zhes pa ni rigs la gnas shing sems bskyed pa so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / sa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rigs la gnas shing sems bskyed pa so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / sa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva who is an ordinary being, who has generated the Thought, and who is endowed with the family, and who has entered the stages.

original: tshul brgya rtsa brgyad ni sngar bstan pa'i tshig gi tshul brgya rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: tshul brgya rtsa brgyad ni sngar bstan pa'i tshig gi tshul brgya rtsa brgyad do //
translated: The one hundred and eight modes are the one hundred and eight modes of expression that have been taught above.

original: nyan thos rnam pa gsum ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos rnam pa gsum ni sngar bstan to //
translated: The three kinds of disciples have been taught above.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing gcig ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing gcig ste //
translated: The Buddha-fields of the Buddhas are one.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sbyangs pas rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing ni ye shes yongs su dag pa'i snang ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sbyangs pas rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing ni ye shes yongs su dag pa'i snang ba ste /
translated: In this and the following verses, the Buddha-field of the Buddhas, who are purified by the purification of the process of elimination, is the appearance of the complete purification of intuition.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gcig pa'o //
translated: It is one, being of the nature of intuition.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas nyid kyang sku sna tshogs su snang pa yang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa yin pas de'i rang bzhin ni dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas nyid kyang sku sna tshogs su snang pa yang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa yin pas de'i rang bzhin ni dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa gcig nyid do //
translated: In the same way, even though Buddhahood appears as a variety of bodies, it is of the nature of the non-arising of the Buddha, and so its nature is the oneness of the ultimate realm and intuition, which are inseparable.

original: don dam par ni gcig dang tha dad ba la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni gcig dang tha dad ba la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: In the ultimate, it is free from the conceptual elaborations of one and different, etc.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la dbye ba mi 'thad pas gcig nyid du 'gyur zhing /üîΩnyi shu rtsa bzhir phye ba ni @280b chos can tha dad la ltos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin la dbye ba mi 'thad pas gcig nyid du 'gyur zhing / nyi shu rtsa bzhir phye ba ni @280b chos can tha dad la ltos te /
translated: Likewise, the Buddha, who is by nature in a state of nirvana, is also a unity, since it is not tenable that the nature of the dharmadhatu is divided.

original: kun rdzob tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The division into twenty-four is taught conventionally in dependence on different phenomena.

original: rnam par grol ba de bzhin gsum //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de bzhin gsum //
translated: The three kinds of liberation

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sems nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba ni byang chub rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sems nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba ni byang chub rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: The meaning of the above passage is as follows: The three kinds of enlightenment are the liberation of the mind from the afflictive obstructions.

original: sems kyi rgyud ni rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The continuum of the mind is of four kinds:

original: kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the foundation consciousness, the afflicted intellect, the mental consciousness, and the five sense consciousnesses.

original: nga yis bstan pa'i bdag med pa rnam pa drug ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: nga yis bstan pa'i bdag med pa rnam pa drug ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: The six kinds of selflessness that I have taught are the bases for the superimposition of self, which are the six collections of consciousness.

original: kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can ni rgyu cha phra bas byis pa'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can ni rgyu cha phra bas byis pa'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The foundation consciousness and afflicted intellect are subtle and not objects of ordinary beings.

original: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i gzhi ma yin no //
translated: The alaya and the afflicted mind are not the basis for the reification of self, because they are subtle and not the domain of ordinary beings.

original: de ltar dgag bya sgro 'dogs pa'i rten drug yin bas de dag bkag pa'i chos kyang rnam pa drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dgag bya sgro 'dogs pa'i rten drug yin bas de dag bkag pa'i chos kyang rnam pa drug ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the six are the basis for the reification of the object of negation, the phenomena that negate them are also said to be six in number.

original: shes par bya ba bzhi ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ba bzhi ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four things to be known are the four noble truths.

original: shes bya thams cad de rnams su 'dus pa dang / gzhan yang spang bya rgyu 'bras dang / blang bar bya ba'i rgyu 'bras shes pas 'phags pa rnams kyi dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes par bya ba ni de dag tsam du zad do //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad de rnams su 'dus pa dang / gzhan yang spang bya rgyu 'bras dang / blang bar bya ba'i rgyu 'bras shes pas 'phags pa rnams kyi dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes par bya ba ni de dag tsam du zad do //
translated: Since all that is to be known is included in these, and since the intentions of the noble ones are fully accomplished by knowing the causes and effects that are to be abandoned and the causes and effects that are to be adopted, these are the only things to be known.

original: rgyu rnams dang ni 'bral 'gyur ba //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni 'bral 'gyur ba //
translated: The causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.üîΩThe causes and effects that are to be adopted are the four noble truths of the path and cessation.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyi rol pas brtags pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba theg pa chen po'i rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: The causes and effects that are to be abandoned are the four noble truths of suffering and its origin.

original: skye ba dang ni mi skye ba //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni mi skye ba //
translated: Arising and nonarising

original: rnam pa brgyad dang rnam dgur 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad dang rnam dgur 'gyur //
translated: are eight and nine types.

original: zhes pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos slob pa bdun te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos slob pa bdun te /
translated: These are the seven noble learners.

original: 'bras bu dang pho la zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'i bar bdun po rnams ni kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa med pas srid par skye ba len pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang pho la zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'i bar bdun po rnams ni kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa med pas srid par skye ba len pa yin la /
translated: The seven from the path of seeing who have entered the result of stream entry up to the path of seeing who have entered the result of arhat are learners who take rebirth in existence because they have not abandoned all the fetters.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pas mi skye ba nyid du pha rol pos brtags pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pas mi skye ba nyid du pha rol pos brtags pa ste /
translated: The one who abides in the result of arhat is investigated by others as being nonarisen because he has abandoned all the fetters.üîΩThus there are eight types.

original: de ltar rnam pa brgyad dang / rang sangs rgyas mi slob pa yang mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa brgyad dang / rang sangs rgyas mi slob pa yang mi skye ba ste /
translated: The pratyekabuddha who is a nonlearner is nonarisen.

original: dgu ru 'gyur ba'o //üîΩgcig dang rim gyis rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: dgu ru 'gyur ba'o // gcig dang rim gyis rtogs pa ste //
translated: Thus there are nine types.üîΩOne and gradual realization

original: grub pa'i mtha' yang gcig nyid do //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' yang gcig nyid do //
translated: and also the tenets are one.

original: ces pa ni dbang po rnon po de kho na nyid zab mo cig car bstan pas rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rtul po gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni dbang po rnon po de kho na nyid zab mo cig car bstan pas rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rtul po gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This verse shows that those of sharp faculties will understand through the profound teaching of thatness all at once, while those of dull faculties will understand through the stages of the selflessness of the person and so forth.

original: de ltar dngos sam brgyud pa'i sgo nas @281a * //
analyzed: de ltar dngos sam brgyud pa'i sgo nas @281a * //
translated: Thus, whether directly or indirectly,

original: rtogs par bya ba'i don mthar thug pa ni rig pa dang stong pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i don gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i don mthar thug pa ni rig pa dang stong pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i don gcig nyid yin no //
translated: the ultimate meaning to be understood is the meaning of the union of awareness and emptiness.

original: gzugs med khams ni rnam pa brgyad //
analyzed: gzugs med khams ni rnam pa brgyad //
translated: The formless realm is of eight types.üîΩThe concentrations are of six types.

original: bsam gtan tha dad rnam pa drug / ces pa ni rgyu snyoms 'jug gis bsdus pa rnam pa bzhi dang / 'bras bu skye bar gtogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan tha dad rnam pa drug / ces pa ni rgyu snyoms 'jug gis bsdus pa rnam pa bzhi dang / 'bras bu skye bar gtogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: This verse shows that the concentrations are of eight types: four that are included in causal meditative equipoise and four that are included in resultant birth.

original: de ltar brgyad du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar brgyad du 'gyur la /
translated: They are of six types

original: bsam gtan gyi dbang du byas na nyer bsdogs dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i dngos gzhi rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩrnam pa drug tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dbang du byas na nyer bsdogs dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i dngos gzhi rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩrnam pa drug tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: when considered in terms of the concentrations: the access to the first concentration, the special first concentration, and the four actual bases of the concentrations.

original: de las sngar bstan pa'i byis pa nyer spyod kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa bzhi ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de las sngar bstan pa'i byis pa nyer spyod kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa bzhi ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The four concentrations, such as the concentration of the childish who enjoy the objects of the senses, which were previously explained, are included in the special concentration.

original: rang rgyal sras po rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: rang rgyal sras po rnams kyi ni //
translated: The children of the pratyekabuddhas

original: 'byung ba rnam pa bdun du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnam pa bdun du 'gyur //
translated: are sevenfold.

original: zhes pa ni rang rgyal ba rnams kyang mthar thug pa la sangs rgyas kyi gdung sob par byed pas sras po nyid ces bya la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang rgyal ba rnams kyang mthar thug pa la sangs rgyas kyi gdung sob par byed pas sras po nyid ces bya la /
translated: The pratyekabuddhas are called ‚Äúchildren‚Äù because they are the descendants of the buddhas in the ultimate sense.

original: des mya ngan las 'das par 'byung ba'i lam ni bdun te /
analyzed: des mya ngan las 'das par 'byung ba'i lam ni bdun te /
translated: The path of their emergence into nirvana is sevenfold:

original: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ste rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ste rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, the four aspects of the path of seeing, and the path of cultivation.

original: dus gsum po yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: dus gsum po yang yod ma yin //
translated: The three times do not exist.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas gang zag la sogs pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa de rnams thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas gang zag la sogs pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa de rnams thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ston te /
translated: This teaches the suchness of all those who are taught by distinguishing the person and so on.

original: de rnams thams cad kyang dus gsum gyis bsdus pa don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad kyang dus gsum gyis bsdus pa don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: All of these are not ultimately existent, subsumed within the three times.

original: de lta na de rnams kyi snang ba yin pas sems kyi ngo bor ston nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na de rnams kyi snang ba yin pas sems kyi ngo bor ston nam zhe na /
translated: In that case, since they are appearances of those, is the nature of mind being taught?

original: sems kyi snang ba dang bral zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems kyi snang ba dang bral zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúFree from the appearances of mind,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan yang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas yum gyi rum du 'jug pa dang / rum nas skye ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / skye rgan 'chi la yid byung nas khyim nas mngon par 'byung ba dang / de dag gi sngon du dga' ldan gyi gnas na dam pa tog dkar po'i tshul du bzhugs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas yum gyi rum du 'jug pa dang / rum nas skye ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / skye rgan 'chi la yid byung nas khyim nas mngon par 'byung ba dang / de dag gi sngon du dga' ldan gyi gnas na dam pa tog dkar po'i tshul du bzhugs pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the emanation of a buddha entering the womb of his mother, being born from the womb, turning the wheel of dharma, being disgusted with birth, old age, and death and leaving the home life, and prior to those, abiding in the form of the sublime Sitatapatra in the abode of Tushita,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du gshegs par snang ba yang de ltar bden pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du gshegs par snang ba yang de ltar bden pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: and the appearance of going to other buddhafields is not true in that way.

original: gzhan yang bya rgod phung po la sogs pa'i gnas phan tshun du 'pho bar snang ba dang / grong khyer du ljongs rgyu zhing sems can gyi drung du gshegs shing de dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos ston pa dang / tha mar grong khyer rtsva mchog @281b tu mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang bya rgod phung po la sogs pa'i gnas phan tshun du 'pho bar snang ba dang / grong khyer du ljongs rgyu zhing sems can gyi drung du gshegs shing de dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i chos ston pa dang / tha mar grong khyer rtsva mchog @281b tu mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa dang /
translated: Moreover, he appears to move from one place to another, such as from Vulture Peak, he appears to travel to towns and go before sentient beings and teach them the Dharma that will tame them and he appears to attain nirvana in the town of Kushinagar.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / 'dul bar bya ba'i zhing rtogs pa rnams kun rdzob tu zag pa med pa'i las sam /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / 'dul bar bya ba'i zhing rtogs pa rnams kun rdzob tu zag pa med pa'i las sam /
translated: The realization of the four truths and the realization of the fields to be tamed are projected by uncontaminated karma or

original: bsod nams kyi las kyis 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las kyis 'phangs pa'o //
translated: meritorious karma on the conventional level.

original: gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du sku 'chag pa lta bur ston pa dang ; / dka' thub kyi nags tshal du gshegs shing der snyoms par 'jug pa khyad par du sbyong bar ston pa dang / de 'dra ba'i mu stegs sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar du sku 'chag pa lta bur ston pa dang ; / dka' thub kyi nags tshal du gshegs shing der snyoms par 'jug pa khyad par du sbyong bar ston pa dang / de 'dra ba'i mu stegs sam /
translated: Moreover, he appears to walk to the edge of the trichiliocosm, he appears to go to the forest of austerities and to demonstrate the special training of meditative concentration there and he appears to demonstrate the attainment of enlightenment and the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: gzhan yang rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod la sogs pa'i drung du gshegs shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod la sogs pa'i drung du gshegs shing /
translated: Moreover, he went to the presence of Udraka, RƒÅma, and others.

original: der bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin thob par ston pa dang / de dag nas 'phos nas bdag med par rtogs pa dang / theg pa'i bye brag gong nas gong du thob pa dang / 'bras bu mthar thug pa thob par bstan pa'i spyod yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: der bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin thob par ston pa dang / de dag nas 'phos nas bdag med par rtogs pa dang / theg pa'i bye brag gong nas gong du thob pa dang / 'bras bu mthar thug pa thob par bstan pa'i spyod yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The domain of his teaching that he attained the concentrations and formless absorptions there, that he transcended them and realized selflessness, that he attained the various vehicles in stages, and that he attained the ultimate result is inconceivable.

original: don dam par de lta bu'i ngo bor grub pa med pa'o //üîΩzla ba skar ma zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: don dam par de lta bu'i ngo bor grub pa med pa'o // zla ba skar ma zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: In the ultimate, there is no such nature that is established.

original: sa dang skar tshogs ji lta bu //üîΩrgyal po 'khor los sgyur rnams dang // drang srong dri zas kun bkang ba //
analyzed: sa dang skar tshogs ji lta bu // rgyal po 'khor los sgyur rnams dang // drang srong dri zas kun bkang ba //
translated: The lines beginning ‚ÄúThe moon, the stars, and so on‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: are to be applied as the answer to the question:üîΩ‚ÄúHow are the earth, the hosts of stars,üîΩthe universal emperors, the sages, and the gandharvas all filled?‚Äù

original: yang gzhan dag dgra bcom pa la sogs pa las dang sred pa'i rgyu las ma byung ngo snyam du sems na ;
analyzed: yang gzhan dag dgra bcom pa la sogs pa las dang sred pa'i rgyu las ma byung ngo snyam du sems na ;
translated: Others think that arhats and so on are not produced from karma and craving.

original: de dag kyang bsam gyis mi khyab bsgyur pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang ldan pa de srid du thag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsam gyis mi khyab bsgyur pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang ldan pa de srid du thag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags las byung ba'o //
translated: Moreover, they are the karma that is not bound up with the inconceivable transformation of death and transmigration, and they arise from the latent impressions of the afflictions.

original: ba lang lug dang zhes pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba'i spyod pa'i khyad par sngar bstan pa las lhag tu ston te /
analyzed: ba lang lug dang zhes pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba'i spyod pa'i khyad par sngar bstan pa las lhag tu ston te /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúCattle, sheep, and so on‚Äù teaches the distinctive conduct of the bodhisattvas that is superior to what was taught previously, being embraced by their skill in means.

original: de yang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i spyod pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de yang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i spyod pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Moreover, it is the distinctive conduct that is included within the category of renunciation.

original: zhing gi dngos por rnam par rtog / ces pa ni zhing rmod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhing gi dngos por rnam par rtog / ces pa ni zhing rmod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Imagining things as fields‚Äù refers to plowing fields and so on.

original: dge slong la sogs pas de dag thams cad spang par bya ba'o //üîΩsa la yang ni mi bsku'o //
analyzed: dge slong la sogs pas de dag thams cad spang par bya ba'o // sa la yang ni mi bsku'o //
translated: Monks and so on should abandon all of these.

original: zhes pa ni mi rnams yongs su spyod pa dang / dkon mchog gi pho brang la sogs par dri ma ngan pa mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi rnams yongs su spyod pa dang / dkon mchog gi pho brang la sogs par dri ma ngan pa mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Nor should one spit on the ground‚Äù means that one should not discard impure substances in places where people frequent, such as temples of the Three Jewels.

original: gzhan yang khyim pa'i rtags spang bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyim pa'i rtags spang bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: Moreover, in order to abandon the signs of a householder,

original: snam bu sngon por btses pa dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang sa dang @282a * //
analyzed: snam bu sngon por btses pa dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang sa dang @282a * //
translated: one should dye blue cloth with cow dung, earth,

original: 'bras bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i tshon gyis dkar po'i gos rnams dur smrig gi kha dog du bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa'i tshon gyis dkar po'i gos rnams dur smrig gi kha dog du bsgyur ba'o //
translated: and the colors of fruit, leaves, and so on, and make it the color of a monk's robes.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba'i bzo dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa bslab par mi bya pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba'i bzo dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa bslab par mi bya pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not study crafts, arts, and so on, which become obstacles to cultivating yoga.

original: 'on kyang de dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la mngon par dga' ba'i khyim pa rnams kyis bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la mngon par dga' ba'i khyim pa rnams kyis bya ste /
translated: However, householders who delight in the qualities of desire should do those.

original: de yang thabs dang shes rab kyis zin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang thabs dang shes rab kyis zin par bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, they should be embraced by method and wisdom.

original: gos gsum ni bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / chos gos snam sbyar ro //
analyzed: gos gsum ni bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / chos gos snam sbyar ro //
translated: The three robes are the upper robe, the lower robe, and the patched robe.

original: bde bar byin pa ni nan gyis blangs pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar byin pa ni nan gyis blangs pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Given happily means not taken by force.

original: gos kyi rin du sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rin du sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: The price of the cloth should be used as the offering.

original: 'dres par gyur pa'i 'tsho ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pa'i 'tsho ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhi yin pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: A mixed livelihood is a basis for dispute, so it should be abandoned.

original: shi ba dang byis pa btsas pa'i khyim du shid zan dang / dga' ston gyi zas bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: shi ba dang byis pa btsas pa'i khyim du shid zan dang / dga' ston gyi zas bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not eat food at the home of someone who has died or who has given birth, or food offered in celebration,

original: gdung ba dang chags pas g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdung ba dang chags pas g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would be distracted by grief and attachment.

original: yang du ba 'thul ba'i gtsug lag khang rnams su rim gyis zas kyi don du rtag tu bsten cing don du gnyer ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang du ba 'thul ba'i gtsug lag khang rnams su rim gyis zas kyi don du rtag tu bsten cing don du gnyer ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should also avoid regularly and persistently seeking food in smoky temples.

original: de dag la sogs pa bdag gi 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don du bya ba gang byed pa rnams ni mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa bdag gi 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i don du bya ba gang byed pa rnams ni mi rung ba ste /
translated: Any such activities that one does for the sake of fulfilling one‚Äôs own desires are inappropriate,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba thams cad ni gzhan gyi don du bya bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba thams cad ni gzhan gyi don du bya bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the activities of the bodhisattvas are to be done for the sake of others.

original: 'di rnams kyang ;
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang ;
translated: These are also mentioned in the noble S≈´tra on Chanting the Dharma Together:

original: rnal 'byor la ni ji ltar 'jug / ces pa la sogs pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor la ni ji ltar 'jug / ces pa la sogs pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattvas‚Äô spiritual practice?

original: 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams la zhen pa spang ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams la zhen pa spang ba nyid du ston te /
translated: The line the world and so forth teaches the abandonment of attachment to those.

original: 'jig rten rgyu rkyen las byung zhes pa la sogs pas ni rang gi sde pas brtags pa'i phyogs spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyu rkyen las byung zhes pa la sogs pas ni rang gi sde pas brtags pa'i phyogs spangs pa'o //
translated: The line the world arises from causes and conditions and so forth abandons the position imputed by our own group.

original: bsam pa med par zhes pas ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bsam pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa med par zhes pas ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bsam pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The line without thought abandons the thought of apprehending signs.

original: gzhan yang sde snod dag las bshad pa rnams kyi nang nas rigs pas 'thad pa'i don las yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid bsdus nas bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sde snod dag las bshad pa rnams kyi nang nas rigs pas 'thad pa'i don las yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid bsdus nas bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, from among the explanations in the scriptural collections, one should meditate by collecting the perfect suchness of the meaning that is tenable by reasoning.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la sogs pa bstan pa ni dgos pa'i don gzhan dang ldan pas sngar bstan pa dang zlos par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma la sogs pa bstan pa ni dgos pa'i don gzhan dang ldan pas sngar bstan pa dang zlos par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the signs of samƒÅdhi and so on of meditating in that way has a different purpose and is not redundant with the previous explanations.

original: rgyu med pa las zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan dag rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i don rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'i dngos po yod par smra ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan dag rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i don rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'i dngos po yod par smra ba ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúwithout cause‚Äù and so on refer to those who, fearing the view of annihilation, claim that there is an entity that is not produced by causes and conditions, and who thus speak of a middle way free from the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: rgyu med par smra @282b bas ni chad par lta ba skur pa'i mthar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra @282b bas ni chad par lta ba skur pa'i mthar 'gyur la /
translated: Those who speak of ‚Äúno cause‚Äù fall into the extreme of nihilism, the view of deprecation.

original: dngos po yod par smra bas ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod par smra bas ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who speak of ‚Äúan entity‚Äù fall into the extreme of superimposition.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi dngos po sems snang ba tsam ngo bo nyid med par ma rtogs par chad pa'i lta bas 'jigs nas phyi rol la sogs pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa yang sgro 'dogs kyi mthar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi dngos po sems snang ba tsam ngo bo nyid med par ma rtogs par chad pa'i lta bas 'jigs nas phyi rol la sogs pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa yang sgro 'dogs kyi mthar gyur pa ste /
translated: Moreover, those who, not understanding that external things are mere appearances of the mind and are essenceless, fear the view of annihilation, and who therefore cling to external things and so on, fall into the extreme of superimposition.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis su ltung bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis su ltung bzhin du /
translated: Thus, while falling into these two extremes,

original: dbu ma'i don ston pa'o zhes khas 'che zhing rlom sems pa ni shin tu phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i don ston pa'o zhes khas 'che zhing rlom sems pa ni shin tu phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: those who claim to teach the meaning of the middle way and who are proud of this are utterly mistaken.

original: sems tsam du ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni dbu ma'i don phyin ci ma log pa ston te /
analyzed: sems tsam du ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni dbu ma'i don phyin ci ma log pa ston te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMind only‚Äù teaches the unmistaken meaning of the middle way.

original: snang ba med ces pa ni snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa yang don dam par med pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med ces pa ni snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa yang don dam par med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú No appearance‚Äù means that appearance, which has become the essence of mind, does not exist ultimately.

original: skye ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas mtha' gnyis po de dag tu mi brtags par gdams pa'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa 'jug med pas //
analyzed: skye ba dang zhes pa la sogs pas mtha' gnyis po de dag tu mi brtags par gdams pa'o // rnam par rtog pa 'jug med pas //
translated: The passage beginning ‚Äúarising‚Äù and so on instructs that one should not impute those two extremes.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas sems kyi 'jug pa'i chos nyid ma rtogs par re zhig rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa med pa tsam gyis thar par 'dod pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas sems kyi 'jug pa'i chos nyid ma rtogs par re zhig rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa med pa tsam gyis thar par 'dod pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúSince there is no engagement of conceptuality‚Äù and so on explains that it is not tenable to assert that liberation is merely the nonengagement of conceptuality without realizing the reality of the engagement of mind.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su rtogs pa'i sa bon ma spangs pa'i phyir de dag spong bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su rtogs pa'i sa bon ma spangs pa'i phyir de dag spong bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because the seeds of the realization of the duality of apprehended and apprehender are not abandoned, those two are not abandoned.

original: sdong dang yongs su 'dzin pa ni blang bya dang dor bya nyid du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sdong dang yongs su 'dzin pa ni blang bya dang dor bya nyid du rtogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Grasping‚Äù is the realization of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.

original: rnam rtog mi 'jig cing rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog mi 'jig cing rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Conceptualization‚Äù is the noncessation of conceptuality and its engagement through continuity.

original: gzhan yang mu stegs can gyi bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs kyang sems kyi 'jug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin na phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ldog pa'i mtshan mar kyang 'dzin pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang mu stegs can gyi bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs kyang sems kyi 'jug pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin na phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ldog pa'i mtshan mar kyang 'dzin pas /
translated: Moreover, even if one has abandoned the faults of the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô views of self, and so on, if one apprehends the characteristics of the mind‚Äôs engagement, one will also apprehend the characteristics of its reversal, because of their mutual dependence.

original: de dag tu 'dzin pa spangs te /
analyzed: de dag tu 'dzin pa spangs te /
translated: Therefore, one should abandon the apprehension of those.

original: mkhas pa dag gis sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid gzung zhing rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis sems kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid gzung zhing rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The wise should apprehend and realize the mind‚Äôs dharmatƒÅ, suchness.

original: mi skye ba la zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
analyzed: mi skye ba la zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon ston te /
translated: ‚Äú Nonarising‚Äù and so on teaches the benefits of realizing suchness.

original: srid par skye ba dang shi 'pho ba la sogs pa med kyang sems can gyi don du skye ba sna tshogs pa la sogs par ston pa ste /
analyzed: srid par skye ba dang shi 'pho ba la sogs pa med kyang sems can gyi don du skye ba sna tshogs pa la sogs par ston pa ste /
translated: Even though there is no arising or transference in existence, one displays various kinds of arising for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs bsal bar gyur kyang skye ba ston par byed //
analyzed: nyon mongs bsal bar gyur kyang skye ba ston par byed //
translated: Even though the afflictions are removed, one displays arising.

original: rga dang na dang 'chi ba med kyang 'chi 'pho ston //
analyzed: rga dang na dang 'chi ba med kyang 'chi 'pho ston //
translated: Even though there is no aging, sickness, or death, one displays death and transference.

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said,

original: sems la sems kyir gyur nas ni //
analyzed: sems la sems kyir gyur nas ni //
translated: Once the mind becomes the mind,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems kyi chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par gyur nas /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems kyi chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par gyur nas /
translated: By these and other passages, having realized the mind‚Äôs reality just as it is,

original: gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la //
analyzed: gdul bya'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la //
translated: for some special disciples,

original: sems tsam du yang smra ba'o //
analyzed: sems tsam du yang smra ba'o //
translated: he taught mind-only.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan pa ni //
translated: This is clarified:

original: sems rnams la zhes pa la @283a * //
analyzed: sems rnams la zhes pa la @283a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is not seen by the mind‚Äù

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams la sems tsam du smra zhing /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams la sems tsam du smra zhing /
translated: Conventionally, he taught mind-only with respect to the collections of consciousness.

original: don dam par sems med pa dang / med bzhin du kun rdzob tu sems las rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byung bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par sems med pa dang / med bzhin du kun rdzob tu sems las rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byung bar ston pa ste /
translated: Ultimately, he taught that the mind does not exist, and that, although it does not exist, it arises in various aspects from the mind conventionally.

original: gzugs dang dbyibs la sogs pa sna tshogs sems kyi rnam par 'phrul pa nyid du ston cing de ltar rig pa'o //üîΩrnam pa mang po'i gzugs gzhan gyis //
analyzed: gzugs dang dbyibs la sogs pa sna tshogs sems kyi rnam par 'phrul pa nyid du ston cing de ltar rig pa'o // rnam pa mang po'i gzugs gzhan gyis //
translated: He taught that the various forms, shapes, and so on are the mind‚Äôs own emanations, and he knew it to be so.üîΩ‚ÄúThe mind is not seen by the mind‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni ji ltar 'dul ba'i gzugs sna tshogs kyis sems tsam du ston cing /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni ji ltar 'dul ba'i gzugs sna tshogs kyis sems tsam du ston cing /
translated: and so on. The meaning of these passages is that he taught mind-only with respect to the various forms that tame disciples.

original: rdzas su grub pa'i gzugs med pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin de nyid gzugs med pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su ston te /
analyzed: rdzas su grub pa'i gzugs med pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin de nyid gzugs med pa'i gzugs sna tshogs su ston te /
translated: That very formlessness which is established as a substance, the nature of intuition, displays itself as various forms.

original: rmi lam gyi gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the forms in a dream, etc.

original: sems tsam gyi ni rgyu dag dang // zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: sems tsam gyi ni rgyu dag dang // zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The causes of mind-only are the imagined and the relative.

original: de dag shin tu gyur pa ni sems gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shin tu gyur pa ni sems gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: Their complete transformation is the transformation of mind.

original: rang bzhin gnyis ni kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis ni kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The two natures are the imagined and the relative.

original: gzhan dbang don dam par brtags pa yang kun du brtags pa yin pas gnyi ga yang kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin las phye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang don dam par brtags pa yang kun du brtags pa yin pas gnyi ga yang kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin las phye ba'o //
translated: Since the relative is also imagined ultimately, both are distinguished from the imagined nature.

original: rnam pa gzhan du rtog ces pa ni rig pa sgyu ma lta bu las gzhan don dam pa'i skye ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rtog ces pa ni rig pa sgyu ma lta bu las gzhan don dam pa'i skye ba la sogs par rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúotherwise imagined‚Äù refers to the ultimate production, etc. imagined as other than the magical art intuition.

original: rtog pa brtags zhes bshad pa ste //
analyzed: rtog pa brtags zhes bshad pa ste //
translated: The commentary explains: ‚ÄúThe imagined is the imagination of what is unreal.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni gzhan dbang gi rtog pa don dam pa'i dngos por zhen pa ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhan dbang gi rtog pa don dam pa'i dngos por zhen pa ni brtags pa'o //
translated: The clinging to the relative imagination as an ultimate entity is the imagined.

original: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mthong zhing myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mthong zhing myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because on the relative level, thoughts and so forth are seen and experienced.

original: rgyu las byung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba'i gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The dependent nature arises from causes.

original: zhing dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin nyid zab mo tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa ste /
analyzed: zhing dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin nyid zab mo tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ston pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe field, the path, and so on‚Äù teaches suchness from another perspective.

original: sangs rgyas bye brag sum cu drug / ces pa ni sngar bstan pa'i sangs rgyas nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dgu dang / rang sangs rgyas slob pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye brag sum cu drug / ces pa ni sngar bstan pa'i sangs rgyas nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dgu dang / rang sangs rgyas slob pa dang /
translated: The ‚Äúthirty-six kinds of buddhas‚Äù are the twenty-four kinds of buddhas mentioned above, plus the following: the learner and nonlearner ≈õrƒÅvakas, the nine kinds of pratyekabuddhas, the pratyekabuddha in training,

original: sngar bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: and the two kinds of bodhisattvas mentioned above.

original: sum cu drug go //
analyzed: sum cu drug go //
translated: These make thirty-six.

original: de rnams las bye brag tu rang sangs rgyas mi slob pa dang / dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa gang zag rnam pa bcu dang / sems can so so'i sems rgyud rnams ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis gdul bar bya ba'i zhing gi snod yin no //
analyzed: de rnams las bye brag tu rang sangs rgyas mi slob pa dang / dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa gang zag rnam pa bcu dang / sems can so so'i sems rgyud rnams ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis gdul bar bya ba'i zhing gi snod yin no //
translated: From among those, in particular, the ten types of person, except for the pratyekabuddha who is beyond training and the arhat, and the individual mind-streams of sentient beings are the fields that are to be tamed by the buddhas.

original: 'phags pa mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi slob pa ste /
translated: The ƒÅrya who is beyond training

original: gnyis ni re zhig zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas shing /
analyzed: gnyis ni re zhig zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas shing /
translated: The two, for the time being, abide in the uncontaminated realm.

original: ting nge @283b 'dzin gyi myos pas myos pa'i phyir gdul bar bya ba'i zhing ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge @283b 'dzin gyi myos pas myos pa'i phyir gdul bar bya ba'i zhing ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because they are intoxicated by the intoxication of samƒÅdhi, they are not fields that are to be tamed.

original: mthar thug pa la ni de dag kyang sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sngar bstan to //
analyzed: mthar thug pa la ni de dag kyang sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sngar bstan to //
translated: In the ultimate, it was previously taught that they will also become buddhas.

original: 'gro bar de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'gro ba'i gnas rnams su chos kyi sku ye shes kyi bdag nyid dang / de'i ngo bor gyur pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: 'gro bar de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni 'gro ba'i gnas rnams su chos kyi sku ye shes kyi bdag nyid dang / de'i ngo bor gyur pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin the abodes of migrating beings‚Äù and so forth is that the dharmakƒÅya, which is the nature of wisdom, and the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, which is of its nature,

original: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas las ma gtogs pa 'gro ba tha mal ba rnams la gzugs kya sku sna tshogs su snang ba ni sangs rgyas snga ma de dag gi sprul pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas las ma gtogs pa 'gro ba tha mal ba rnams la gzugs kya sku sna tshogs su snang ba ni sangs rgyas snga ma de dag gi sprul pa ste /
translated: Apart from the buddhahood of reality, the various forms of the buddha body that appear to ordinary beings are the emanations of those previous buddhas.

original: sems can rang rang gi dge ba'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyi rgyud las sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can rang rang gi dge ba'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems kyi rgyud las sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mthong ngo //
translated: They are seen as the form of the buddhas from the mind streams of sentient beings, together with their own individual virtuous habitual tendencies.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i mtshan ma dang 'brel pa las /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i mtshan ma dang 'brel pa las /
translated: From the connection with the signs that are seen in that way,

original: mtshan ma sangs rgyas kyi ngo bor nor pa phyin ci log gi rtog pa 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: mtshan ma sangs rgyas kyi ngo bor nor pa phyin ci log gi rtog pa 'jug mod kyi /
translated: the mistaken conception that mistakes the signs for the essence of the buddha occurs.

original: ngo bo'i sangs rgyas ni snga ma de dag tsam du zad do //üîΩda ltar rtog pa yang mtshan ma las gzhan ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ngo bo'i sangs rgyas ni snga ma de dag tsam du zad do // da ltar rtog pa yang mtshan ma las gzhan ma yin zhing /
translated: However, the essence of buddhahood is just those previous ones.üîΩAlso, the present conception is nothing other than the signs,

original: de bzhin nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa las gzhan ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa las gzhan ma yin pa ste /
translated: and suchness is nothing other than the conception.

original: chos can dang chos nyid dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: chos can dang chos nyid dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The phenomena and their reality are inseparable.

original: rang bzhin gyi dang zhes pa la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas ston te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dang zhes pa la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnaturally pure buddhahood‚Äù and so forth teaches the buddhahood of purification.

original: chos kyi sangs rgyas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sangs rgyas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe buddhahood of phenomena‚Äù and so forth teaches the buddhahood of realization.üîΩThe thirty-six buddhas

original: sangs rgyas mang po sum cu drug / rang bzhin gyis ni sangs rgyas yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po sum cu drug / rang bzhin gyis ni sangs rgyas yin /
translated: are naturally buddhas.

original: zhes pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa'i phung po tha dad nyi shu bzhi yang sems kyi snang ba sems nyid yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa'i phung po tha dad nyi shu bzhi yang sems kyi snang ba sems nyid yin la /
translated: The meaning of the above is as follows: The twenty-four different aggregates that were previously explained are the appearances of the mind, which are mind itself.

original: de rnams kyi chos nyid skye ba med pa la sogs pa dang / don dam par ma skyes bzhin du de ltar myong ba ma 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos nyid skye ba med pa la sogs pa dang / don dam par ma skyes bzhin du de ltar myong ba ma 'gags pa ste /
translated: The dharmatƒÅ of those is nonarising and so forth, and ultimately, while not arising, it is experienced as unceasing.

original: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nyid du rgyas par sngar bstan to //
analyzed: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nyid du rgyas par sngar bstan to //
translated: VidyƒÅ and emptiness united is the nature of the buddhas, as was extensively explained above.

original: gang zag rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi sems kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid dang mtshungs shing /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi sems kyi chos nyid kyang de nyid dang mtshungs shing /
translated: The dharmatƒÅ of the mind of the twelve types of individuals is the same as that.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma yang ci rigs par spangs pas /
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma yang ci rigs par spangs pas /
translated: The adventitious stains are also abandoned in whatever way is appropriate.

original: rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnaturally enlightened.‚Äù

original: sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bstan pa'i don kyang gsal bar byed cing /
analyzed: sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bstan pa'i don kyang gsal bar byed cing /
translated: The words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and so on clarify the meaning that was previously taught.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i chos nyid dang chos can de rnams kyang de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par ston te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i chos nyid dang chos can de rnams kyang de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med par ston te /
