translated: It also teaches that the dharmin and dharmatƒÅ of the aggregates and so on are inexpressible as being the same or different.

original: tshig gi don ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of the words has already been explained.

original: nor pa rnam pa gnyis ni brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: nor pa rnam pa gnyis ni brtags pa dang / gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: The two mistakes are the imaginary and the dependent.

original: gsum pa ni yongs su grub pa'o //üîΩgang las nor ba 'byung ba dang // zhes @284a * //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yongs su grub pa'o // gang las nor ba 'byung ba dang // zhes @284a * //
translated: The third is the consummate.

original: pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ma rig pa la sogs pa gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad de /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i don ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ma rig pa la sogs pa gzhan dbang gi rang bzhin bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad de /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúfrom which mistakes arise‚Äù and so on is as follows. From the ƒÅlaya consciousness arise the twelve factors of the dependent nature, such as ignorance, and the eighteen constituents.

original: de dag gi bag chags sam rigs rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bag chags sam rigs rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: From them arise their habitual tendencies or their potentials.

original: gang la brten te 'byung ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi'i skye mched drug la brten te rnam par shes pa'i khyad par rnams 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang la brten te 'byung ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen phyi'i skye mched drug la brten te rnam par shes pa'i khyad par rnams 'byung ba'o //
translated: That which is the basis for their arising is the six inner sense spheres, and the objective condition is the six outer sense spheres.

original: de'i phyir na ngas bshad ces pa ni kun rdzob tu de ltar gnas pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na ngas bshad ces pa ni kun rdzob tu de ltar gnas pas bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I have explained means that because it exists in that way conventionally, it is explained.

original: brtag byar 'jug pa ni shes rab kyi byed pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brtag byar 'jug pa ni shes rab kyi byed pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: Engaging in the investigation means engaging in the activity of wisdom.

original: skar dang skrar gzung zhes pa ni chu la skar ma'i gzugs dang / bar snang la skra shad du gzung ba'o //
analyzed: skar dang skrar gzung zhes pa ni chu la skar ma'i gzugs dang / bar snang la skra shad du gzung ba'o //
translated: Stars and hairs means apprehending the form of stars in water and hairs in space.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni gsum du 'gyur //
translated: By their characteristics, they are threefold.

original: zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas rang bzhin gsum ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas rang bzhin gsum ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: This means that from the perspective of positing characteristics conventionally, the three natures are unmixed.

original: de la dge bar bya ba ma yin //
analyzed: de la dge bar bya ba ma yin //
translated: Among them, the imaginary is not to be made virtuous.

original: zhes pas ni sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba ni dge mi dge la sogs pa'i bag chags kyis bdag nyid du bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ni sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral ba ni dge mi dge la sogs pa'i bag chags kyis bdag nyid du bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The reality of mind, free from conceptual elaboration, is not to be generated by the instincts of virtue and vice, etc.

original: mngon par shes dang dbang gis dag / ces pa ni kun rdzob tu glo bur ba'i dri ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes dang dbang gis dag / ces pa ni kun rdzob tu glo bur ba'i dri ma dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure by the powers and superknowledges, which means that it is pure of adventitious defilements in the relative sense.

original: 'di rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa'i gnas skabs ston te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa'i gnas skabs ston te /
translated: These verses also show the stage of certainty in the buddha lineage.

original: sa bdun pa yan chad do //
analyzed: sa bdun pa yan chad do //
translated: The stage of certain lineage is from the seventh stage on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi sa ni rigs mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi sa ni rigs mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The stage of buddhahood is the ultimate lineage.

original: chos kyi sprin ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The stage Cloud of Dharma is called the tathagata stage.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan yang sngar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan yang sngar bstan to //
translated: The reason for this has been explained above.

original: de dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs //
translated: They are the lineage of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa de'i rigs su nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de'i rigs su nges pa'o //
translated: They are certain in that lineage.

original: lhag ma ste sa drug pa man chod ni de'i rigs su ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ste sa drug pa man chod ni de'i rigs su ma nges pa'o //
translated: The remainder, the six stages below the seventh, are not certain in that lineage.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis thob par byed pa'o //
translated: They are the attainment of the two vehicles of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de'i don ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul zhing mos pa dman pa dag sa drug pa'i gnas skabs na rten 'brel lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa'i don cung zad rtogs shing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos 'ga' zhig mngon du
analyzed: de'i don ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul zhing mos pa dman pa dag sa drug pa'i gnas skabs na rten 'brel lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa'i don cung zad rtogs shing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos 'ga' zhig mngon du
translated: Bodhisattvas of duller faculties and inferior aspiration, when they are on the sixth level, have a slight realization of the forward and reverse processes of dependent arising and have actualized some of the phenomena of samsara and nirvana.üîΩTherefore they are discouraged by samsara and want to attain nirvana quickly, and they interrupt their application to the benefit of sentient beings for a while and remain for a long time in the bliss of concentration.

original: byas pas 'khor ba las skyo zhing myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi sbyor ba re zhig rgyun chad nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la yun ring du gnas pa ni byang chub gnyis po dang chos mthun pas de dag thob par byed ces gsungs pa'o /
analyzed: byas pas 'khor ba las skyo zhing myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi sbyor ba re zhig rgyun chad nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la yun ring du gnas pa ni byang chub gnyis po dang chos mthun pas de dag thob par byed ces gsungs pa'o /
translated: Because this is similar to attaining the two kinds of enlightenment, it is said that they attain them.

original: @284b ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: @284b ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The bliss of concentration is the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: sa drug pa nas thob pa nyid du sngar bstan to //
analyzed: sa drug pa nas thob pa nyid du sngar bstan to //
translated: It was taught above that it is attained from the sixth level onward.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen how should one understand the following passage from the sutra?

original: sa thob 'jigs pa lnga dang bral //
analyzed: sa thob 'jigs pa lnga dang bral //
translated: Bodhisattvas who have attained the levels are free of the five fears.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /üîΩma yin te /üîΩde ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po ma yin pa'i dbang du byas pa'am /üîΩyang na de 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal rags pa med kyang sems can gyi don byed pa'i dka' ba'i spyod pas 'jigs shing sdug bsngal phra mo yod pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhe na / ma yin te / de ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul po ma yin pa'i dbang du byas pa'am / yang na de 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal rags pa med kyang sems can gyi don byed pa'i dka' ba'i spyod pas 'jigs shing sdug bsngal phra mo yod pa 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because that is from the viewpoint of a bodhisattva whose faculties are not dull, or because there is no contradiction in saying that although there is no such gross suffering, there is a subtle suffering that is the fear of the difficult deeds that benefit sentient beings.

original: yang / sems can rgyud kyi bye brag dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni sa bdun pa'i gnas skabs na yang byang chub sems dpa' dbang po shin tu rtul zhing /
analyzed: yang / sems can rgyud kyi bye brag dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni sa bdun pa'i gnas skabs na yang byang chub sems dpa' dbang po shin tu rtul zhing /
translated: Also, the passage beginning The various continuums of sentient beings shows that even in the situation of the seventh ground, there are bodhisattvas whose faculties are very dull, and that there are bodhisattvas who are afraid of the suffering of the difficult deeds that benefit sentient beings.

original: khams dang mos pa shin tu dman pa rnams chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa dang / sa'i go rims dang mtshams sbyor ba la mi mkhas pas mu stegs byed kyi lta ba dang / lam du ltung bar gyur na mi rung zhes de dag rnams la sa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnam par phye zhing gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang /üîΩsems kyi dbang du 'gro ba'i sa //
analyzed: khams dang mos pa shin tu dman pa rnams chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa dang / sa'i go rims dang mtshams sbyor ba la mi mkhas pas mu stegs byed kyi lta ba dang / lam du ltung bar gyur na mi rung zhes de dag rnams la sa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnam par phye zhing gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang / sems kyi dbang du 'gro ba'i sa //
translated: In order to clarify and distinguish the characteristics of the levels and so forth for those whose elements and aspirations are very inferior and who do not know the specific and general characteristics of phenomena as they are and who, being unskilled in the sequence and connection of the levels, might fall into the views of the tƒ´rthikas, the Buddha taught the characteristics of the levels and so forth.üîΩThe seven who are governed by mind

original: bdun po sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: bdun po sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad // ces pa ste /
translated: were explained by the buddhas.

original: de dag la sems kyi tshogs brgyad gnas ma gyur pa snga ma ltar sems can gyi don gyi sbyor ba la skyob dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la yun ring du gnas pas de'i sems dbang du byas te tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: de dag la sems kyi tshogs brgyad gnas ma gyur pa snga ma ltar sems can gyi don gyi sbyor ba la skyob dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la yun ring du gnas pas de'i sems dbang du byas te tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang /
translated: For them, the eight collections of consciousness have not changed state, and so they are protected from applying themselves to the benefit of sentient beings as before and from remaining for a long time in the bliss of concentration.

original: mngon par rtogs pa bul bas de 'dra ba'i skyon dang bcas pa'i sa bdun po rnams bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bul bas de 'dra ba'i skyon dang bcas pa'i sa bdun po rnams bshad pa'o //
translated: The seven stages are explained as having such faults because of the slowness of their realization.

original: gal te de ltar nas bdun pa yan chod sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges par bstan pa 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nas bdun pa yan chod sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges par bstan pa 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it contradicts the teaching that from the seventh stage on one is definitely in the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: de ni phal che ba la dongs te stan pas so //
analyzed: de ni phal che ba la dongs te stan pas so //
translated: That teaching is for the most part.

original: rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chod yin par gsung rab dag las bshad do //üîΩrnam pa gcig tu na 'di rnams kyi don ni sngar bstan pa ltar sa bdun pa yan chod sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa yin na mdo sde 'di dang gzhan dag las kyang sa bdun pa man chod sangs rgyas kyi rigs su ma nges par bshad pa
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa ni sa brgyad pa yan chod yin par gsung rab dag las bshad do // rnam pa gcig tu na 'di rnams kyi don ni sngar bstan pa ltar sa bdun pa yan chod sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa yin na mdo sde 'di dang gzhan dag las kyang sa bdun pa man chod sangs rgyas kyi rigs su ma nges par bshad pa
translated: In all ways, it is taught in the scriptures that from the eighth stage on one is definitely in the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Or, in another way, the meaning of these passages is as previously explained. If from the seventh stage on one is definitely in the lineage of the Buddhas, then it contradicts the explanations in this scripture and others that up to the seventh stage one is not definitely in the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: sems can gyi rgyud kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi rgyud kyi bye brag ste /
translated: It is a matter of the particularities of the mental series of sentient beings.

original: byis pa'i skye bo 'gal zhig de ltar bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur @285a * //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo 'gal zhig de ltar bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur @285a * //
translated: The childish are disciplined by such a teaching.

original: ba dang / kun rdzob tu sa de dag gi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par gzhag pa'i don du bshad pas so //
analyzed: ba dang / kun rdzob tu sa de dag gi mtshan nyid ma 'dres par gzhag pa'i don du bshad pas so //
translated: And it is explained for the purpose of positing the characteristics of those stages without confusion on the conventional level.

original: gzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo dag rtogs par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kho bo ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byis pa'i skye bo dag rtogs par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kho bo ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs su nges pa ste /
translated: Moreover, childish beings, through the pride of manifest realization, think, ‚ÄúI am ascertained in the lineage of the Buddha.

original: bdud kyi las spangs pa'o snyam nas brtson 'grus zhan par 'gyur bas nyes pa de 'dra ba spang ba'i don dus bdun pa man chad du yang sangs rgyas kyi rigs su ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las spangs pa'o snyam nas brtson 'grus zhan par 'gyur bas nyes pa de 'dra ba spang ba'i don dus bdun pa man chad du yang sangs rgyas kyi rigs su ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa'o //
translated: I have abandoned the works of Mara.‚Äù And so they become lazy. In order to abandon such faults, it is explained that even from the seventh stage on, one is not ascertained in the lineage of the Buddha.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs gzhi yang /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs gzhi yang /
translated: The underlying thought behind such teachings is this.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams cung zad mngon par rtogs pa bul ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams cung zad mngon par rtogs pa bul ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Those of dull faculties are connected with faults such as slow realization.

original: ngag lus zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams la sgo gsum gyi mi dge ba'i bag chags mi 'jug cing sa brgyad pa la ni de 'dra ba'i bag chags kyi gnas kun gzhi dang / kun gzhi'i snang ba la sogs pa rmi lam lta bur rtogs shing /
analyzed: ngag lus zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rnams la sgo gsum gyi mi dge ba'i bag chags mi 'jug cing sa brgyad pa la ni de 'dra ba'i bag chags kyi gnas kun gzhi dang / kun gzhi'i snang ba la sogs pa rmi lam lta bur rtogs shing /
translated: The words ‚Äúspeech, body‚Äù and so forth indicate that in those bodhisattvas, the habitual tendencies of nonvirtue of the three doors do not operate. On the eighth ground, they realize that the foundation consciousness, which is the basis of such habitual tendencies, and the appearances of the foundation consciousness and so on are like a dream.

original: rtogs pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi 'chad pas chu bo dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub cing rgyun mi 'chad pas chu bo dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba'o //
translated: And because their spontaneously present and uninterrupted wisdom is like a river, it is similar to a river.

original: sa brgyad dang ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnon po rnams sa dang po la sogs pa'i rjes thob kyi gnas skabs na bzo dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par byed cing /
analyzed: sa brgyad dang ni zhes pa la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnon po rnams sa dang po la sogs pa'i rjes thob kyi gnas skabs na bzo dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par byed cing /
translated: The words ‚Äúon the eighth ground‚Äù and so forth indicate that bodhisattvas of sharp faculties, in the postmeditation period of the first ground and so on, become skilled in all the crafts and sciences and

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du ston pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lus bzung nas sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du ston pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lus bzung nas sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: they teach others accordingly and take birth as universal emperors and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lus 'dzin par byed ces pa dang / sa gnyis pa la gnas pa ni gling bzhi la dbang ba'i lus 'dzin par byed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lus 'dzin par byed ces pa dang / sa gnyis pa la gnas pa ni gling bzhi la dbang ba'i lus 'dzin par byed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The noble ten levels says that a bodhisattva who is on the first level takes on the body of a universal emperor who rules over the Rose Apple continent, and that one who is on the second level takes on the body of a universal emperor who rules over the four continents.

original: stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las kyang de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The ornament of the dense array also states this.

original: sa brgyad dang ni rnam lnga zhes khyad par du gsungs pa ni brgyad pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis rjes su bzung nas sems can gyi don la sbyor ba dang / lnga pa la shes bya thams cad bsdus pa bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas de ltar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad dang ni rnam lnga zhes khyad par du gsungs pa ni brgyad pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis rjes su bzung nas sems can gyi don la sbyor ba dang / lnga pa la shes bya thams cad bsdus pa bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas de ltar bstan pa ste /
translated: The specification that it is on the eighth and fifth levels is made because on the eighth level, bodhisattvas are assisted by the buddhas and then apply themselves to the welfare of sentient beings, and on the fifth level, they have the wisdom that realizes the four noble truths, which subsumes all objects of knowledge.

original: sa gzhan dag la yang de ltar mi slob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag la yang de ltar mi slob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that they do not train in these on the other levels.

original: skye dang mi skye zhas pa la sogs pas mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa spangs par gdams pa'o //
analyzed: skye dang mi skye zhas pa la sogs pas mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa spangs par gdams pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarising and non-arising‚Äù and so on instructs us to abandon the two extremes.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis su bstan pa ni rang rgyal dang nyan thos rnams @285b la bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis su bstan pa ni rang rgyal dang nyan thos rnams @285b la bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus the teaching on the two extremes is for the pratyekabuddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: kun rdzob tu ni dngos rnams yod //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni dngos rnams yod //
translated: Things exist conventionally.

original: don dam du ni rang bzhin med //
analyzed: don dam du ni rang bzhin med //
translated: Ultimately, they are essenceless.

original: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la 'dir bden pa gnyis su dbye ba'i gzhi ni shes bya'i gnas su gyur pa'i spyi tsam yin la /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la 'dir bden pa gnyis su dbye ba'i gzhi ni shes bya'i gnas su gyur pa'i spyi tsam yin la /
translated: Here, the basis for the division into the two truths is a mere general category of objects of knowledge.

original: de dag so so'i mtshan nyid la don dam pa'i bden pa ni rigs pa yul dang yul can gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag so so'i mtshan nyid la don dam pa'i bden pa ni rigs pa yul dang yul can gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The definitions of those are as follows: Ultimate truth is that which is subsumed by the objects and the object-possessors that are reasoning.

original: kun rdzob ni 'khrul pa yul dang yul can gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni 'khrul pa yul dang yul can gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Conventional truth is that which is subsumed by the objects and the object-possessors that are error.

original: de'ang gzhan dag snang ba dang bcas pa'i blo thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de'ang gzhan dag snang ba dang bcas pa'i blo thams cad ni 'khrul pa yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, others say that all minds that have appearances are erroneous,

original: de'i yul can phyin ci log pa'o zhes ston pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i yul can phyin ci log pa'o zhes ston pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: and that their objects are distorted.

original: de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rjes thob kyi gnas skabs na sku dang zhing khams la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yod pas 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa la yang rjes thob kyi gnas skabs na sku dang zhing khams la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yod pas 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since the TathƒÅgata also has appearances of bodies, buddhafields, and so on in the state of post-equipoise, he would have error.

original: gal te nyes pa der gyur du dogs pas rjes thob kyi snang ba med de /
analyzed: gal te nyes pa der gyur du dogs pas rjes thob kyi snang ba med de /
translated: If you fear that error would ensue, then the appearances of post-equipoise do not exist.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig tsam mo zhe na /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig tsam mo zhe na /
translated: It is only the wisdom of meditative equipoise.

original: mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: de la rang ngam gzhan gyi rnam par sbyang zhing snang ba med na ye shes nyid du mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de la rang ngam gzhan gyi rnam par sbyang zhing snang ba med na ye shes nyid du mi 'thad la /
translated: If there is no purification or appearance of itself or others, it is not tenable that it is wisdom.

original: de ltar myong zhing snang ba yang 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar myong zhing snang ba yang 'khrul pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, if it is experienced and appears in that way, it would have error.

original: gal te 'dir ye shes kyi rang bzhin don dam par med pa la /
analyzed: gal te 'dir ye shes kyi rang bzhin don dam par med pa la /
translated: If the nature of wisdom does not exist ultimately,

original: yod pa nyid du myong na 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du myong na 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba las /
translated: if it is experienced as existing, it would be error.

original: de ltar ma myong ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma myong ste /
translated: However, it is not experienced in that way.

original: med pa la med pa nyid du rtogs shing kun rdzob tu myong ba ma 'gags pa tsam yin pas 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: med pa la med pa nyid du rtogs shing kun rdzob tu myong ba ma 'gags pa tsam yin pas 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And since the relative is merely the unimpeded experience of what is nonexistent as nonexistent, there is no delusion.

original: de bzhin du sku dang zhing khams la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang ye shes las tha dad du gyur pa med cing ye shes nyid kyi dngos po bden par yang ma grub pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sku dang zhing khams la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang ye shes las tha dad du gyur pa med cing ye shes nyid kyi dngos po bden par yang ma grub pa la /
translated: In the same way, the features of the kƒÅyas, pure realms, and so forth are not separate from wisdom, and wisdom itself is not truly existent.

original: de ltar yod par 'dzin na 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: de ltar yod par 'dzin na 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ba las /
translated: If one were to grasp at it as being so, that would be delusion.

original: de ltar mi 'dzin cing don dam par med pa la med pa nyid du rtogs shing kun rdzob tu de ltar snang ba ma 'gags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dzin cing don dam par med pa la med pa nyid du rtogs shing kun rdzob tu de ltar snang ba ma 'gags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, since one does not grasp at it in that way, and since one realizes that ultimately it does not exist and that ultimately it does not exist, and since relatively it is merely the unimpeded experience of it appearing in that way, there is no delusion.

original: yang gzhan dag mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes nyid kyang med par khas len pa ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' log par lta ba chen po nyid du sngar rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag mnyam par gzhag pa'i ye shes nyid kyang med par khas len pa ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' log par lta ba chen po nyid du sngar rgyas par bstan to //
translated: Others assert that even the wisdom of meditative equipoise does not exist. This is the extreme of denial, the great wrong view, as was extensively taught above.

original: yang gzhan dag de bzhin gshegs pas 'khrul pa la 'khrul pa nyid du mkhyen pas 'khrul pa ma yin zhes pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag de bzhin gshegs pas 'khrul pa la 'khrul pa nyid du mkhyen pas 'khrul pa ma yin zhes pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, others say that it is not tenable to say that the TathƒÅgata knows error as error and therefore it is not error.

original: de ltar mkhyen kyang snang ba mi ldog cing de yang 'khrul pa nyid yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang 'khrul pa la 'khrul @286a * //
analyzed: de ltar mkhyen kyang snang ba mi ldog cing de yang 'khrul pa nyid yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang 'khrul pa la 'khrul @286a * //
translated: Even though he knows that, appearances are not averted, and that is accepted as error.

original: par mkhyen pas 'khrul pa ldog na de ltar mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: par mkhyen pas 'khrul pa ldog na de ltar mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if error is averted by knowing error as error, then the gnosis that knows that is error.

original: ye shes skyes pa na gzhal bya'i yul mi bden pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i dus na ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes skyes pa na gzhal bya'i yul mi bden pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i dus na ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when gnosis arises, the object of comprehension is not true, and when it does not arise, there is no gnosis.

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang du yang sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i snang ba tsam ni dngos su 'khrul pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang du yang sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i snang ba tsam ni dngos su 'khrul pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore mere appearance, which is not a superimposition of any distinction such as existence and nonexistence, is not actually error.

original: yang bden pa'i dngos po med pa'i myong ba rang snang ba tsam du rtogs pa yang 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang bden pa'i dngos po med pa'i myong ba rang snang ba tsam du rtogs pa yang 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the realization that the experience of the nonexistence of true things is mere self-appearance is not error.

original: de lta na yang phyin ci log gnas ma gyur pa byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i snang ba ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba de kho na nyid la sgrib par byed pa 'ching ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas kun rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang phyin ci log gnas ma gyur pa byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa'i snang ba ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba de kho na nyid la sgrib par byed pa 'ching ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas kun rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the appearances of childish beings, whose errors have not been transformed, are called ‚Äúrelative‚Äù because they are motivated by error, they obscure suchness, and they are the cause of bondage.

original: phyin ci log gnas gyur pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi snang ba ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log gnas gyur pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi snang ba ni /
translated: The appearances of buddhas and great bodhisattvas, whose errors have been transformed,

original: de las bzlog par rigs pa dang rigs pa'i yul yin pas don dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog par rigs pa dang rigs pa'i yul yin pas don dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are the opposite of that. They are the objects of reasoning and are therefore called ‚Äúultimate.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dir don dam pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing shes brjod kyi yul las 'das pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dir don dam pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing shes brjod kyi yul las 'das pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the ultimate is free from all elaborations and is beyond the domain of cognition and expression,

original: ji ltar na rigs pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na rigs pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: how can it be the object of reasoning?

original: gzhan yang rigs pa ni sems kyi rgyu ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs pa ni sems kyi rgyu ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, reasoning is the movement of the mind,

original: de yang kun rdzob nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob nyid du gsungs te /
translated: and that is said to be relative.

original: don dam pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The ultimate is said to be ‚Äúwhere there is no movement of the mind.‚Äù

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis kyang de 'dra ba'i spros pa rnam par bkag pas ye shes dang / shes bya mthun pa tsam la rigs pa'i yul zhes bya ba'i mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul du yul du byas pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis kyang de 'dra ba'i spros pa rnam par bkag pas ye shes dang / shes bya mthun pa tsam la rigs pa'i yul zhes bya ba'i mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul du yul du byas pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Ultimate reality, which is free from all elaborations, is realized by nonconceptual wisdom. Since such wisdom refutes elaborations, it is said that the domain of reasoning is merely the concordance of wisdom and the object of knowledge. It is not that ultimate reality is made into an object in a way that involves signs.

original: / rnam pa gcig tu na don dam pa sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi so so rang rig pa'i tshul du rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: / rnam pa gcig tu na don dam pa sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi so so rang rig pa'i tshul du rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Alternatively, ultimate reality, the luminous nature of the mind, is free from elaborations. It is realized by nonconceptual wisdom in a way that is personally experienced and known by oneself.

original: mtshan ma'i bye brag sna tshogs su bzung zhing spros pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i bye brag sna tshogs su bzung zhing spros pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not realized by apprehending it as various specific signs and elaborating on it.

original: sems kyi rgyu ba don dam pa la med pa nyid du gsungs pa yang de bzhin te de las bzlog nas yod pa nyid du brtags pa ni kun rdzob nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ba don dam pa la med pa nyid du gsungs pa yang de bzhin te de las bzlog nas yod pa nyid du brtags pa ni kun rdzob nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The statement that the movement of mind does not exist in the ultimate is the same: when it is the opposite of that, it is imagined to exist, and it becomes the superficial.

original: des na kun rdzob tu sems kyi rgyu ma 'gags shing phyin ci log gi spros pa gcod pa dang / don dam pa'i dngos po ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: des na kun rdzob tu sems kyi rgyu ma 'gags shing phyin ci log gi spros pa gcod pa dang / don dam pa'i dngos po ma grub pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the movement of mind is not stopped on the superficial level, and the elimination of the fabrications of error and the nonestablishment of the ultimate thing are taught in detail.

original: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa ni don dam pa nyid do zhes @286b rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa ni don dam pa nyid do zhes @286b rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: The union of awareness and emptiness is the ultimate itself.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: so so rang rig mtshan med spyod yul ba //
analyzed: so so rang rig mtshan med spyod yul ba //
translated: The domain of the individual self-cognizance is signless.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: 'dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spros pa gcod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang phyin ci log gi spros pa gcod pa'i ldog pa nas don dam pa'i bden pa yin zhing de nas gtan la phab pa'i don kyang don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyi spros pa gcod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang phyin ci log gi spros pa gcod pa'i ldog pa nas don dam pa'i bden pa yin zhing de nas gtan la phab pa'i don kyang don dam pa yin la /
translated: Here, the inference that eliminates the fabrications of the childish is the ultimate truth from the point of view of the elimination of the fabrications of error, and the meaning ascertained by it is the ultimate.

original: brjod pa dang 'dres rung gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i cha nas ni yang dag pa'i rigs pa ma yin te phyin ci log nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dres rung gi rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i cha nas ni yang dag pa'i rigs pa ma yin te phyin ci log nyid yin zhing /
translated: It is not a correct principle from the point of view of the aspect of superimposition that is suitable to be mixed with expression, because it is just a mistake.

original: de'i yul yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: And its object is the conventional truth.

original: gal te sngar bstan pa ltar khyad par gyi chos su sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i snang ba 'ga' zhig 'khrul pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sngar bstan pa ltar khyad par gyi chos su sgro 'dogs pa med pa'i snang ba 'ga' zhig 'khrul pa ma yin na /
translated: If, as has been taught above, some appearances that are not mistaken do not superimpose a distinguishing quality,

original: de dag kun rdzob tu yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de dag kun rdzob tu yang mi 'thad de /
translated: then they are not tenable even conventionally.

original: de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they do not have the characteristics of mistakenness.

original: de ltar bden mod kyi 'dir mtshan nyid kyang 'khrul pa yul dang yul can dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i snang bar 'dug pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi 'dir mtshan nyid kyang 'khrul pa yul dang yul can dang / des kun nas bslang ba'i snang bar 'dug pa yin la /
translated: That is true, but here the characteristics of mistakenness are the object, the subject, and the appearance that is motivated by them.

original: de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid ni snga ma de la yang yod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid ni snga ma de la yang yod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Since the former also has those characteristics, there is no fault.

original: gzhan yang 'dir shes bya'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir shes bya'i de kho na nyid ji lta ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, here the suchness of objects of knowledge is ultimate truth.

original: de las gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The other is the conventional truth.

original: de dag gnyis su dbye ba'i don ni de kho na nyid du dngos po gcig pa dang tha dad pa las grol ba ste ;
analyzed: de dag gnyis su dbye ba'i don ni de kho na nyid du dngos po gcig pa dang tha dad pa las grol ba ste ;
translated: The meaning of the division into two is freedom from identity and difference in reality,

original: / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of things is not established.

original: des na de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: des na de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is inexpressible as identical or different,

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it is said in the Definitive Explanation of the Intent.

original: kun rdzob tu gnyis su phye ba'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gnyis su phye ba'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the division into two in the conventional is, as previously explained, a different characteristic.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gcig tu bstan pa ni dbyer med pa tsam las dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gcig tu bstan pa ni dbyer med pa tsam las dgongs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of oneness in the Perfection of Wisdom S≈´tras is from the perspective of mere inseparability.

original: gnyis su 'byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes ngo gnyis la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su 'byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni shes ngo gnyis la ltos pa ste /
translated: The reason for the division into two is in terms of the two perspectives.

original: blo 'khrul pa'am 'khrul pas kun nas bslang ba'i shes pa la slong ba'i cha nas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: blo 'khrul pa'am 'khrul pas kun nas bslang ba'i shes pa la slong ba'i cha nas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
translated: From the perspective of a mistaken mind or a consciousness motivated by error, the conventional truth is that which motivates the aspect of the arising of the consciousness.

original: de nyid rigs pa dam pas btsal ba'i ngo na ma grub pas de la ltos te /
analyzed: de nyid rigs pa dam pas btsal ba'i ngo na ma grub pas de la ltos te /
translated: Since that does not exist in reality when sought by means of the holy

original: don dam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: reasoning, it is posited as ultimate in dependence on that.

original: so so'i dbye ba ni rnam pa gnyis gnyis su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: so so'i dbye ba ni rnam pa gnyis gnyis su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The divisions are twofold.

original: de la log pa'i kun rdzob ni snang la don byed nus pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: de la log pa'i kun rdzob ni snang la don byed nus pas stong pa'o //
translated: The false conventional is that which appears but is empty of the ability toüîΩfunction.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni snang la don byed nus pa ste /üîΩ'dir phyi'i don @287a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ni snang la don byed nus pa ste / 'dir phyi'i don @287a * //
translated: The correct conventional is that which appears and is able to function.üîΩHere, the imputation of external objects as different from the mind is the

original: sems las tha dad pa nyid du brtags pa ni log pa'i kun rdzob yin la /
analyzed: sems las tha dad pa nyid du brtags pa ni log pa'i kun rdzob yin la /
translated: false conventional.üîΩIf that were the case, then since it would be established that they function

original: de lta na de dag kyang btung ngoms la sogs pa'i don byed par 'grub pas yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid khyab ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na de dag kyang btung ngoms la sogs pa'i don byed par 'grub pas yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid khyab ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: to satisfy thirst, etc., the definition of the correct conventional would be tooüîΩnarrow.

original: ma yin te 'khrul pa'i bag chags bstan pa'i phyir don du snang ba las /
analyzed: ma yin te 'khrul pa'i bag chags bstan pa'i phyir don du snang ba las /
translated: This is not the case, because the appearance of objects is taught to be theüîΩhabit of error.üîΩThe appearance of the object that is encountered and that functions is the

original: de dang phrad cing don byed par snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dang phrad cing don byed par snang ba sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: nature of the mind.

original: de las tha dad pa'i phyi rol gyi don byed pa ni kun rdzob tu yang med do zhes sngar rgyas par bstan no //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i phyi rol gyi don byed pa ni kun rdzob tu yang med do zhes sngar rgyas par bstan no //
translated: We have already explained extensively above that external objects that are different from consciousness do not exist even conventionally.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa yang rnam pa gnyis las /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa yang rnam pa gnyis las /
translated: Ultimate truth is also of two kinds.

original: rnam grangs kyi don dam pa'i bden pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i spros pa phyogs re bkab pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi don dam pa'i bden pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i spros pa phyogs re bkab pa tsam ste /
translated: The categorized ultimate truth is the mere covering of some of the elaborations of arising and so on.

original: don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: don dam pa dang mthun pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Because it is concordant with the ultimate, it is called the ultimate.

original: spros pa'i phyogs gzhan ma bkag pas phyin ci log tu yang 'gyur ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyang yin te /üîΩde'i phyir ldog pa'i rnam grangs 'ga' zhig nas don dam par 'gyur la /
analyzed: spros pa'i phyogs gzhan ma bkag pas phyin ci log tu yang 'gyur ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyang yin te / de'i phyir ldog pa'i rnam grangs 'ga' zhig nas don dam par 'gyur la /
translated: Because it does not refute other elaborations, it is also the relative because it is mistaken.üîΩTherefore, from some perspectives it is the ultimate, and from some perspectives it is the relative.

original: 'ga' zhig nas kun rdzob tu 'gyur bas rnam grangs kyi don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig nas kun rdzob tu 'gyur bas rnam grangs kyi don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason it is called the categorized ultimate truth.

original: de lta na spros pas gcod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang rnam grangs kyi don dam par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na spros pas gcod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang rnam grangs kyi don dam par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: In that case, is the inference that cuts through elaborations also the categorized ultimate?

original: de ltar 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: That is precisely what we assert.

original: rnam grangs ma yin pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs ma yin pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The non-enumerated ultimate truth is free from all conceptual elaborations and is clear light.

original: 'dir kun rdzob kyi nges pa'i tshig ni de kho na nyid kyi rtogs pa la sgrib par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob kyi nges pa'i tshig ni de kho na nyid kyi rtogs pa la sgrib par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the definition of the conventional is that which obscures the realization of reality.

original: bden pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu bden pas so //
analyzed: bden pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu bden pas so //
translated: It is called ‚Äútruth‚Äù because it is true conventionally.

original: don dam pa ni dam pa rnams kyis don du gnyer zhing gtan la dbab par bya ba yin pas don ces bya la /
analyzed: don dam pa ni dam pa rnams kyis don du gnyer zhing gtan la dbab par bya ba yin pas don ces bya la /
translated: The ultimate is called ‚Äúobject‚Äù because it is the object sought by the holy ones and is to be ascertained.

original: mi slu bas na dam pa'o //
analyzed: mi slu bas na dam pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúultimate‚Äù because it is supreme.

original: don dam par bden pas na don dam pa'i bden pa zhes tshig bsdus te rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par bden pas na don dam pa'i bden pa zhes tshig bsdus te rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúultimate truth‚Äù because it is true ultimately.

original: 'di dag gi spros pa zhib tu ni de kho na nyid kyi sgron ma la sogs pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi spros pa zhib tu ni de kho na nyid kyi sgron ma la sogs pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The elaborations of these should be understood in detail from the Lamp for (the Path to) Enlightenment and so forth.

original: tshig gi don bshad pa la /
analyzed: tshig gi don bshad pa la /
translated: Explanation of the meaning of the words

original: don dam du ni rang bzhin med //
analyzed: don dam du ni rang bzhin med //
translated: In the ultimate, there is no intrinsic reality.

original: ces pa rang bzhin bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa na ri bong gi rva dang khyad par med par 'gyur bas shes bya ji ltar snang ba'i chos nyid don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ces pa rang bzhin bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa na ri bong gi rva dang khyad par med par 'gyur bas shes bya ji ltar snang ba'i chos nyid don dam pa'i bden pa ma yin te /
translated: When one is in a state of negation that is a mere negation of intrinsic reality, one is no different from a rabbit‚Äôs horns. Therefore, the reality of phenomena as they appear is not ultimate truth.

original: des na don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub cing /
analyzed: des na don dam pa'i dngos por ma grub cing /
translated: Thus, it is not established as an ultimate entity.

original: snang zhing rig pa ma 'gags pa ste zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: snang zhing rig pa ma 'gags pa ste zung 'jug sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: It is the unceasing appearance and awareness, the illusion-like union.

original: de las phyin ci log tu nor pa dang nor pas kun @287b nas bslang ba'i blo dang blo'i yul ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de las phyin ci log tu nor pa dang nor pas kun @287b nas bslang ba'i blo dang blo'i yul ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The mind and the objects of the mind that are motivated by error and the errors that arise from that are relative truth.

original: chos rnams thams cad ces pa la sogs pas kun rdzob nyid rgyas par bstan pa'o //üîΩbrjod las byung ba'i dngos po'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu don dang mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa las byung ba'i blo'i spyod yul te /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces pa la sogs pas kun rdzob nyid rgyas par bstan pa'o // brjod las byung ba'i dngos po'i zhes pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu don dang mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa las byung ba'i blo'i spyod yul te /
translated: The line ‚ÄúAll phenomena are . . .‚Äù and so forth extensively teaches the relative.

original: zhen yul rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa'o //
analyzed: zhen yul rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yod pa'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe objects of the mind that arise from expressions . . .‚Äù and so forth teach that the objects of the mind that arise from expressions that accord with the meaning in the relative are the conceived objects, the intrinsic characteristics, which exist in the correct relative.

original: yang na don dam pa dang mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa las de nyid kyi spyi'i rnam par snang ba'i blo 'byung zhing /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa dang mthun pa'i gtam brjod pa las de nyid kyi spyi'i rnam par snang ba'i blo 'byung zhing /
translated: Or else, the mind that perceives the general appearance of reality arises from the discourse that is in accord with the ultimate.

original: des gtan la phab pa'i don goms pa las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des gtan la phab pa'i don goms pa las rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: From the cultivation of the meaning that is ascertained by that, the nonconceptual intuition arises.

original: de'i don du gyur pa'i spyod yul ni de ltar bden pa'o //üîΩlta bas yod pa min zhes pa ni de dag la don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs par lta ba'i sgo nas ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du gyur pa'i spyod yul ni de ltar bden pa'o // lta bas yod pa min zhes pa ni de dag la don dam pa'i dngos po la sogs par lta ba'i sgo nas ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The domain that is the basis of that is thus the truth.üîΩ‚Äú It does not exist by way of the view‚Äù means that it does not exist by way of the view of ultimate things, etc.üîΩ‚Äú It does not exist by way of the view‚Äù means that it does not exist by way of the view of ultimate things, etc.üîΩ‚Äú It does not exist by way of the view‚Äù means that it does not exist by way of the view of ultimate things, etc.

original: rtsig pa med par zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa ston te /üîΩsdong dum la sogs pa med par grib ma mi 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: rtsig pa med par zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa ston te / sdong dum la sogs pa med par grib ma mi 'byung ba ltar /

original: kun gzhi med na 'jug pa'i rnam shes mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: kun gzhi med na 'jug pa'i rnam shes mi 'byung zhing /
translated: ‚Äú It does not exist by way of the view‚Äù means that it does not exist by way of the view of ultimate things, etc.

original: de yod na de rnams 'byung la /üîΩde rnams sam de rnams kyi bag chags kyis kyang kun gzhi dri ma can du byas pas mi mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: de yod na de rnams 'byung la /üîΩde rnams sam de rnams kyi bag chags kyis kyang kun gzhi dri ma can du byas pas mi mdzes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It does not exist by way of the view‚Äù means that it does not exist by way

original: de dag ngo bo'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rgyu dang rgyu 'dra ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rgyu dang rgyu 'dra ba gnyis so //
translated: These are called ‚Äúthe essence of Buddhahood‚Äù because they are the cause and the cause-like.

original: tshig gi don gzhan ni sngar bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gi don gzhan ni sngar bstan to //
translated: The other meanings of the words have been explained above.

original: dang po dang ni bcu par zhes pa ni sa dang po dang bcu pa la zhal la sogs pa bstan pas byin gyis rlob pa ste rgyas par sngar bstan to //
analyzed: dang po dang ni bcu par zhes pa ni sa dang po dang bcu pa la zhal la sogs pa bstan pas byin gyis rlob pa ste rgyas par sngar bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe first and the tenth‚Äù means that the face and so forth are empowered on the first and tenth stages, as was explained above in detail.

original: tshe dang drod dang srog gi dbang po ni rnam grangs nyid du rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang srog gi dbang po ni rnam grangs nyid du rtogs pa'am /
translated: Life, heat, and the faculty of motility are understood to be synonyms.

original: yang na tshe ni srog gi rlung yin la /
analyzed: yang na tshe ni srog gi rlung yin la /
translated: Or else, life is the wind of life,

original: drod ni de dag la brten pa'i drod kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: drod ni de dag la brten pa'i drod kyi khyad par ro //
translated: heat is the special heat that is based on that,

original: rtag tu rlom sems pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: rtag tu rlom sems pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: and the always conceiving is the afflicted mind.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi yul la 'dzin pa de dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas bye brag 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi yul la 'dzin pa de dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas bye brag 'byed pa'o //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses are the mind consciousness that is associated with the apprehension of its own object.

original: sred pa dag ni zhes pa la sogs pas da rnams gcod cing rnam par 'byed pa ni dgongs te bstan pa'i mtshams med pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dag ni zhes pa la sogs pas da rnams gcod cing rnam par 'byed pa ni dgongs te bstan pa'i mtshams med pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúcraving, etc.‚Äù is intended to show that the present is cut off and divided, and to show that it is not a case of the non-existence of the transcendent lords‚Äô intention.

original: bdag ni rdzas dang 'dra bar yod //
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas dang 'dra bar yod //
translated: ‚ÄúThe self exists like a substance.‚Äù

original: ces pa pha rol pos khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: ces pa pha rol pos khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: This is the opponent‚Äôs assertion.

original: de nyid 'gog pa ni phung po rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩbdag tu brtags pa'i rten phung po nyid kyang kun rdzob tsam @288a * //
analyzed: de nyid 'gog pa ni phung po rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste / bdag tu brtags pa'i rten phung po nyid kyang kun rdzob tsam @288a * //
translated: The refutation of that is as follows:

original: du yod kyi /
analyzed: du yod kyi /
translated: The aggregates, which are the basis for the imputation of the self, exist only conventionally.

original: don dam par med na de la bdag yod pa lta ga la srid ces pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par med na de la bdag yod pa lta ga la srid ces pa'o //
translated: How could the self exist ultimately, if it does not exist even conventionally?

original: de lta na sangs rgyas nyid kyis kyang bdag yod par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na sangs rgyas nyid kyis kyang bdag yod par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In that case, did not the Buddha himself say that the self exists?

original: de ni dgongs pa can yin te //üîΩngas ni de dag bar du yang //
analyzed: de ni dgongs pa can yin te // ngas ni de dag bar du yang //
translated: That statement was made with a specific intention.üîΩI have not taught anything

original: cung zad bstan pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: cung zad bstan pa yod ma yin //
translated: to those who are in the middle.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: This is similar to the statement.

original: de'i phyir tshig 'di rnams kyang dbang po lta bur bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig 'di rnams kyang dbang po lta bur bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, these statements are also taught to be like the example of the sense faculties.

original: gang gi rgyu dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan gyis skye bar brtags pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi rgyu dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni gzhan gyis skye bar brtags pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: The refutation of the imagined arising from another is stated by ‚Äúwhose cause and effect, etc.‚Äù

original: gang dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'jig rten rab tu 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'jig rten rab tu 'byung zhing /
translated: Those who assert that the world arises from causes and conditions

original: de yang tshul ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de yang tshul ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does it arise?

original: mtha' bzhi'i tshul gyis 'byung bar rigs pas grub pa'o //üîΩde'i don ni 'bras bu phyis kyi dus su yod pa dang / sngar rgyu'i dus la sogs par med pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir yod med gnyi gar gyur pa dang / sngar ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mtha' bzhi'i tshul gyis 'byung bar rigs pas grub pa'o // de'i don ni 'bras bu phyis kyi dus su yod pa dang / sngar rgyu'i dus la sogs par med pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir yod med gnyi gar gyur pa dang / sngar ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: It is established by reasoning that it arises in the manner of the four extremes.

original: phyis ni med pa ma yin pas gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyis ni med pa ma yin pas gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is that the effect exists at the time of the cause, it does not exist at the time of the cause, therefore it is both existent and nonexistent, and it is neither because it is not existent before and it is not nonexistent later.

original: mtha' bzhi'i tshul dang ldan pa rgyu rkyen las skye bar tshad mas grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi'i tshul dang ldan pa rgyu rkyen las skye bar tshad mas grub ces pa'o //
translated: It is established by valid knowledge that it arises from causes and conditions in the manner of the four extremes.

original: 'di rnams dgag pa ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: 'di rnams dgag pa ni sngar bstan no //
translated: These are refuted as previously explained.

original: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na //
analyzed: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na //
translated: Since it arises from conditions,üîΩetc.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel gyi gtan tshigs te sngar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni rten 'brel gyi gtan tshigs te sngar bstan to //
translated: This is the reason of dependent arising, as previously explained.

original: gang gi tshe na zhes pa la sogs pas skye ba med pa'i tshul de nyid sems tsam gyi tshul la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na zhes pa la sogs pas skye ba med pa'i tshul de nyid sems tsam gyi tshul la sbyar ba'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúWhen one sees that . . .‚Äù and so forth applies the mode of non-arising to the CittamƒÅtra standpoint.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sems tsam zhes pa ni gnas skabs de 'dra ba ni 'jig rten las ma 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sems tsam zhes pa ni gnas skabs de 'dra ba ni 'jig rten las ma 'das pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMere mind of the world‚Äù refers to the standpoint that is not beyond the world.

original: nyan thos zad pa'i ye shes dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bur yod pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos zad pa'i ye shes dang // zhes pa la sogs pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bur yod pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe hearers‚Äô wisdom of elimination . . .‚Äù and so forth teaches that even nirvƒÅ·πáa and so on exist like an illusion.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba ni /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe buddhas‚Äô birth . . .‚Äù

original: mtshan dang de bzhin rtogs pa dang / yang skye ba rnam pa gnyis zhes sngar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan dang de bzhin rtogs pa dang / yang skye ba rnam pa gnyis zhes sngar bstan pa'o //
translated: refers to the two types of birth that were taught earlier: birth as a sign and birth as realization.

original: mtha' bzhi'i sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs ni sngar bstan pa de nyid de skye bar tshad mas grub pa'i phyir de ltar bden no zhes gtan tshigs nyid du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi'i sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs ni sngar bstan pa de nyid de skye bar tshad mas grub pa'i phyir de ltar bden no zhes gtan tshigs nyid du sbyar ba'o //
translated: The reasoning of the tetralemma was taught earlier. Since birth is established by valid cognition, it is a reasoning that goes, ‚ÄúIt is like that because it is true.‚Äù

original: blun po dag gis bzlog ces pa dbu ma'i tshul lugs 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: blun po dag gis bzlog ces pa dbu ma'i tshul lugs 'gog pa'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe fools reject it‚Äù refers to the rejection of the Madhyamaka standpoint.

original: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni skye ba rnam bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir blun po dag gis kun rdzob kyi skye ba zlog par byed pa'o //üîΩrang gi sems ni don rgyud de //
analyzed: yang na 'di rnams kyi don ni skye ba rnam bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir blun po dag gis kun rdzob kyi skye ba zlog par byed pa'o // rang gi sems ni don rgyud de //
translated: Or else, the meaning of these is that the fools, because of being devoid of the four kinds of birth, turn away from the conventional birth.üîΩOne‚Äôs own mind is the continuum of the meaning.

original: ces pa ni sems nyid don gyi rgyud rgyun chags su snang ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni sems nyid don gyi rgyud rgyun chags su snang ba'o //
translated: This is the mind itself, the continuum of the meaning, appearing in continuity.

original: phan tshun ma gyis 'brel pa yi //
analyzed: phan tshun ma gyis 'brel pa yi //
translated: The mutual non-separation

original: bag chags gcig gi @288b rgyu las byung //
analyzed: bag chags gcig gi @288b rgyu las byung //
translated: arises from the cause of a single habitual propensity.

original: zhes pa ni kun gzhi la bag chags bsdus shing sred pa'i srad bus bcings pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun gzhi la bag chags bsdus shing sred pa'i srad bus bcings pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: This is the arising from the cause of the habitual propensities gathered in the fundamental consciousness, bound by the rope of craving.

original: gnyis po ni rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis po ni rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The two are the imagined and the other-dependent.

original: snang ba'i sa bon ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snang ba'i sa bon ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of possessing the seed of appearance,

original: skye mched rnams ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: the sense-spheres are twelve.

original: zhes pa ni kun gzhi la phyi nang gi skye mched du snang ba'i sa bon sems kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun gzhi la phyi nang gi skye mched du snang ba'i sa bon sems kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa yod pa ste /
translated: This is the existence of the seeds of the appearance of the inner and outer sense-spheres in the fundamental consciousness, which are of the nature of mind.

original: de las gzhan bems po'i ngo bor gyur pa ni mi 'thad ces bstan to //üîΩde ltar med bzhin du gnas dang dmigs bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan bems po'i ngo bor gyur pa ni mi 'thad ces bstan to // de ltar med bzhin du gnas dang dmigs bya ste /
translated: It is untenable that anything else, which has the nature of an inanimate thing, is the object of the word.üîΩThus, although it does not exist, the word is used in connection with the internal and external sense-fields, which are the abode and the object of the word.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched dang ldan pa'i tshig brjod pa ni bden pa'i don dang mi ldan pas lo rgyus su nga yis bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched dang ldan pa'i tshig brjod pa ni bden pa'i don dang mi ldan pas lo rgyus su nga yis bshad pa ste /
translated: I have explained it as a story, because it is devoid of the meaning of truth.

original: tshig tsam nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: tshig tsam nyid ces pa'o //
translated: It is mere words.

original: gang la gang gi dngos por yang //
analyzed: gang la gang gi dngos por yang //
translated: In regard to anything, in any way,üîΩIf one imagines the dependent nature, which is like an illusion, to have such an essence, it is not the case that it is not perceived as mere illusion.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la de lta bu'i ngo bor brtags na sgyu ma tsam du mi dmigs pa ma yin pa de ni de ltar bden pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang la de lta bu'i ngo bor brtags na sgyu ma tsam du mi dmigs pa ma yin pa de ni de ltar bden pa'o //
translated: It is true in that way.

original: de las gzhan du yod mod kyi mtshan mar brtags pa ni mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du yod mod kyi mtshan mar brtags pa ni mi bden pa'o //
translated: It does exist in another way, but the conceptualized characteristic is not true.üîΩFrom the beginning, it is endowed with non-existence, etc.

original: thog mar med ldan zhes pa la sogs pas ni dogs pa bsal ba'i tshul gyis sngar gyi don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thog mar med ldan zhes pa la sogs pas ni dogs pa bsal ba'i tshul gyis sngar gyi don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: This verse teaches the same point as before in detail, in the manner of dispelling doubts.

original: de'i don yang rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang thog ma med pa nas gnas pa la /
analyzed: de'i don yang rnam rig sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan dbang thog ma med pa nas gnas pa la /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: The dependent nature, which is like an illusion, has existed since beginningless time.

original: dngos po'i ngo bor rtog pa ni nor pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor rtog pa ni nor pa yin na /
translated: If the conception of it as the entity of things is a mistake,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po bden pa nyid rgyu rkyen su zhig gis 'khor bar bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po bden pa nyid rgyu rkyen su zhig gis 'khor bar bya ste /
translated: then what other thing, true reality itself, would anyone cause to cycle?

original: 'di'i don thub pa chen pos bdag la gsungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don thub pa chen pos bdag la gsungs zhes pa'o //
translated: The Great Sage should explain the meaning of this to me.

original: lan gyi don ni dngos po bden pa gcig ni 'khor ba med kyi /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni dngos po bden pa gcig ni 'khor ba med kyi /
translated: The meaning of the reply is as follows: One thing, a true entity, does not cycle.

original: kun gzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rig pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid 'khor zhes pa'o //üîΩde las rnam pa gzhan yod na zhes pa la sogs pa ni byis pas dngos por brtags pa las gzhan rig pa sgyu ma lta bur yod kyang byis pa'i blos de ltar rtogs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rig pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid 'khor zhes pa'o // de las rnam pa gzhan yod na zhes pa la sogs pa ni byis pas dngos por brtags pa las gzhan rig pa sgyu ma lta bur yod kyang byis pa'i blos de ltar rtogs par mi rung ngo //
translated: The dependent nature, which is like an illusion, cycles.üîΩIf there were something other than that, etc.üîΩmeans that even though there is something that is like an illusion, other than what is imagined to be an entity by a childish being, it is not suitable for the mind of a childish being to realize it as it is.

original: gal te 'phags pa rnams la ye shes sgyu ma lta bu de yod na byis pas brtags pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa rnams la ye shes sgyu ma lta bu de yod na byis pas brtags pa ma yin la /
translated: If that illusion-like wisdom exists for ƒÅryas, it is not imagined by childish beings.

original: med na yang 'phags pa dang byis pa mnyam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: med na yang 'phags pa dang byis pa mnyam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If not, then the noble and the childish would be the same.

original: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pas de dag mi mnyam pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pas de dag mi mnyam pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: The non-equivalence of those is taught by ‚Äúbecause‚Äù and so forth.

original: de ltar na phung po la sogs pa yod par ston pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na phung po la sogs pa yod par ston pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is not tenable to teach the existence of the aggregates and so forth.

original: mkha' la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mkha' la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reply to that is stated:

original: brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni phung po la sogs pa brtan pa dang / de'i 'bras bu @289a * //
analyzed: brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni phung po la sogs pa brtan pa dang / de'i 'bras bu @289a * //
translated: The effect of imputation is the stability of the aggregates and so forth, and the effect of that is

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa'o //
translated: the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

original: gang gi ma byung zhes pa la sogs pas sngar ma byung ba'i 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gang gi ma byung zhes pa la sogs pas sngar ma byung ba'i 'bras bu rkyen rnams kyis skye bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the effect that did not occur previously is produced by conditions,

original: de dag 'brel ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de dag 'brel ba mi 'thad de /
translated: then their connection is untenable.

original: gcig yod pa na cig shos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig yod pa na cig shos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one exists, the other does not.

original: gzhan yang yod med rim gyis kyang 'gal bas med pa 'bras bu'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du red pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang yod med rim gyis kyang 'gal bas med pa 'bras bu'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du red pa med ces pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive, it is not the case that nonexistence is the nature of the entity of the effect.

original: de lta bu yi mdor mthong na //
analyzed: de lta bu yi mdor mthong na //
translated: Seeing that in brief,

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don mdo rnams su bshad pa mthong zhing rtogs na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don mdo rnams su bshad pa mthong zhing rtogs na zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that if one sees and understands the explanation of such a meaning in the s≈´tras, then one will not be confused about the meaning of the nonarising of all phenomena.

original: mu stegs can rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni skye ba dngos por rtogs pa dag / byis pa'i 'khor rnams la rkyen du mas 'bras bu gcig pa dang / tha dad pa skyed pa dang / yang rkyen gcig gis 'bras bu gcig pa dang tha dad pa skyed pa'i gtam rgyud sna tshogs tha snyad pa'i tshad ma la brten nas zer kyang don dam par 'gro ba'i rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni skye ba dngos por rtogs pa dag / byis pa'i 'khor rnams la rkyen du mas 'bras bu gcig pa dang / tha dad pa skyed pa dang / yang rkyen gcig gis 'bras bu gcig pa dang tha dad pa skyed pa'i gtam rgyud sna tshogs tha snyad pa'i tshad ma la brten nas zer kyang don dam par 'gro ba'i rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe tƒ´rthikas‚Äù and so on is that those who understand arising as a thing say to their retinue of fools, ‚ÄúThrough many conditions, a single result is produced, and a different result is produced. Also, a single condition produces a single result and a different result.‚Äù They say various stories based on conventional valid knowledge. But ultimately, they are like the dreams of transmigrating beings and so on.

original: skye ba med pa la de ltar ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la de ltar ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: They do not understand nonarising in that way.

original: 'di'i don ni gzhan dag rgyu mig dang gzugs la sogs pa du ma las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig skye bar 'dod pa dang / yang rgyu gcig las 'bras bu gcig skye ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gzhan dag rgyu mig dang gzugs la sogs pa du ma las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig skye bar 'dod pa dang / yang rgyu gcig las 'bras bu gcig skye ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that others assert that a single result, an eye consciousness, arises from many causes, such as the eye and form, and also that a single result arises from a single cause.

original: de ltar gyi bum pa'i skad cig gcig nyid rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma snga ma gcig las skye ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyi bum pa'i skad cig gcig nyid rang gi rigs kyi skad cig ma snga ma gcig las skye ba'o //
translated: In this way, the single moment of the vase is produced from a single moment of its own type.

original: yang rgyu tha dad bas 'bras bu tha dad pa skyed de /
analyzed: yang rgyu tha dad bas 'bras bu tha dad pa skyed de /
translated: Also, a different effect is produced from a different cause.

original: nas dang sran ma'i sa bon tha dad ba las 'bras bu myu gu tha dad pa skyed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i sa bon tha dad ba las 'bras bu myu gu tha dad pa skyed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a different sprout is produced from a different seed of barley or a pea.

original: rgyu tha mi dad pas kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa skyed de /
analyzed: rgyu tha mi dad pas kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa skyed de /
translated: Also, a different effect is produced from an undifferentiated cause.

original: mig gi dbang po las rang gi rigs phyi ma dang / rnam par shes pa skyed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po las rang gi rigs phyi ma dang / rnam par shes pa skyed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a later moment of its own type and an eye consciousness are produced from an eye faculty.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rigs ni de dag tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rigs ni de dag tsam du zad de /
translated: In this way, the types of cause and effect are exhausted in just those two.

original: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du skyed pa'i tshul so sor bden par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du skyed pa'i tshul so sor bden par 'dod pa'o //
translated: They are asserted to be true in accordance with the way they produce their effects.

original: 'di ni don dam par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ni don dam par mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not tenable ultimately.

original: rgyu mig dang gzugs la sogs la du ma las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: rgyu mig dang gzugs la sogs la du ma las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig skye bar 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that a single effect, an eye consciousness, is produced from many causes, such as an eye, form, and so on,

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu tha dad ma yin pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu tha dad ma yin pa rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: The effect of things would not be different and would be causeless,

original: rgyu tha dad dang tha mi dad gnyis char gyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad dang tha mi dad gnyis char gyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not produced by either a different or an undifferentiated cause.

original: de la dang po 'bras bu tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pas ma byas te /
analyzed: de la dang po 'bras bu tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pas ma byas te /
translated: First, the effect is not different because the cause is different,

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang /
translated: because although there is a difference in the cause in the context of the eye and form,

original: 'bras bu mig gi rnam shes tha dad du ma byung bas rjes su 'gro ba @289b 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mig gi rnam shes tha dad du ma byung bas rjes su 'gro ba @289b 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the effect, eye consciousness, does not arise as different, and so the forward pervasion is mistaken.

original: yang de 'dra ba ni rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: yang de 'dra ba ni rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Moreover, that is not produced by an undifferentiated cause,

original: nas dang sran ma'i sa bon gyi skabs su rgyu la tha mi dad med kyang 'bras bu tha dad du byung bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i sa bon gyi skabs su rgyu la tha mi dad med kyang 'bras bu tha dad du byung bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because although there is no difference in the cause in the context of barley and lentil seeds, the effect arises as different, and so the reverse pervasion is mistaken.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu tha mi dad pa yang rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu tha mi dad pa yang rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Similarly, the effect is not undifferentiated because the cause is undifferentiated.

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su mig gi rgyu tha mi dad med kyang 'bras bu mig gi rnam shes tha mi dad du byung bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su mig gi rgyu tha mi dad med kyang 'bras bu mig gi rnam shes tha mi dad du byung bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the context of the eye and form, the eye‚Äôs cause is not different, but the effect, eye consciousness, arises without difference, and so the forward pervasion is mistaken.

original: yang de 'dra ba ni rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: yang de 'dra ba ni rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Moreover, that is not produced by different causes.

original: nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad ma byung bas rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad ma byung bas rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the context of barley and peas, the cause is different, but the effect does not arise without difference, and so the counter pervasion is mistaken.

original: de la gal te gzhan dag 'di ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la gal te gzhan dag 'di ni mi 'thad de /
translated: In response to that, if others say, ‚ÄúThis is not tenable.
