original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang /üîΩ'bras bu mig gi rnam shes tha dad pa ma byung bas de 'dra ba thun mong ba'i 'bras bu tha dad du mi byed ces pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang / 'bras bu mig gi rnam shes tha dad pa ma byung bas de 'dra ba thun mong ba'i 'bras bu tha dad du mi byed ces pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa'am /
translated: In the context of the eye and form, the cause is different,

original: 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: but the effect, eye consciousness, does not arise without difference, and so that is not a common effect that is different,‚Äù this is establishing what is already established or just a claim.

original: yang nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang /
analyzed: yang nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang /
translated: Moreover, in the context of barley and peas, the cause is different,üîΩbut the effect does not arise without difference.

original: 'bras bu tha dad ma byung ba'i phyir tha dad kyis tha dad mi skyed ces zer na ni gtan tshigs nyid ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad ma byung ba'i phyir tha dad kyis tha dad mi skyed ces zer na ni gtan tshigs nyid ma grub pa'o //
translated: If you say that because the effect is not different, difference does not produce difference, then the reason itself is not established.

original: yang tha dad rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: yang tha dad rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Moreover, difference is not produced by nondifferent causes.

original: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa la /
analyzed: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa la /
translated: Because the reversal is mistaken.

original: nas dang sran ma'i myu gu tha dad pa gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad pa dang ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir tha mi dad kyis ma byas so zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i myu gu tha dad pa gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad pa dang ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir tha mi dad kyis ma byas so zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Having established the difference of barley and pea sprouts as the basis, because the cause is nondifferent and the reversal is mistaken, you say that difference is not produced by nondifference.

original: de ltar 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: This is just what we accept.

original: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad pa lta bu gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad pa lta bu gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Having established the difference of the sense faculty and consciousness as the basis, because the cause is nondifferent,

original: tha mi dad med kyang byung bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes zer na ni gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad med kyang byung bas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes zer na ni gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: you say that because it arises even though there is no difference, the reversal is mistaken. But the reason is not established.

original: de dag gi rgyu dbang po snga ma gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu dbang po snga ma gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cause of those is a single previous sense faculty.

original: yang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Moreover, a nondifferent effect is not produced by a nondifferent cause.

original: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúBecause the opposite is mistaken.‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam shes tha mi dad pa lta bu gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad med kyang byung ba'i phyir tha mi dad kyis ma byas so zhes zer na ni /
analyzed: mig gi rnam shes tha mi dad pa lta bu gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad med kyang byung ba'i phyir tha mi dad kyis ma byas so zhes zer na ni /
translated: If, having taken as the basis the final moment of visual consciousness, you say, ‚ÄúAlthough there is no difference in cause, it is not produced by that which is not different,‚Äù

original: de ltar 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: then you are simply accepting our position.

original: da ltar gyi bum pa'i skad cig lta bu gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad med kyang byung ba'i phyir tha mi dad kyis ma byas so zhes zer na ni /
analyzed: da ltar gyi bum pa'i skad cig lta bu gzhir bzhag nas rgyu tha mi dad med kyang byung ba'i phyir tha mi dad kyis ma byas so zhes zer na ni /
translated: If, having taken as the basis the present moment of the vase, you say, ‚ÄúAlthough there is no difference in cause, it is not produced by that which is not different,‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o //
translated: then the reason is not established.

original: yang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Also, you cannot say, ‚ÄúThe effect that is not different is not produced by a different cause,‚Äù

original: nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang @290a * //üîΩ'bras bu tha mi dad ma byung ba'i phyir zhes zer na ni /
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang @290a * // 'bras bu tha mi dad ma byung ba'i phyir zhes zer na ni /
translated: because, although there is a difference in cause in the case of barley and peas,üîΩthe effect that is not different is not produced.

original: de 'dra ba'i tha dad 'bras bu tha mi dad skyed par mi 'dod pas grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i tha dad 'bras bu tha mi dad skyed par mi 'dod pas grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin la /
translated: Since we do not assert that such a difference produces an effect that is not different, this is simply proving what is already established.

original: skabs der rjes 'gro 'khrul pas skabs gzhan du yang tha dad kyis tha mi dad mi skyed do zhes zer na ni khyab pa ma grub po zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: skabs der rjes 'gro 'khrul pas skabs gzhan du yang tha dad kyis tha mi dad mi skyed do zhes zer na ni khyab pa ma grub po zhes zer ro ;
translated: At that time, because of confusion about concomitance, one might say that even at other times, difference does not give rise to nondifference.

original: /'di ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: /'di ni mi 'thad de /
translated: But this is not correct.

original: dang po mig dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang /
analyzed: dang po mig dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i skabs su rgyu la tha dad yod kyang /
translated: First, although there is difference in the cause in the context of the eye, form, and so on,

original: 'bras bu tha dad ma byung bas phyir rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad ma byung bas phyir rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa'i phyir /
translated: because the effect does not arise as different, there is confusion about concomitance.

original: nas dang sran ma'i myu gu tha dad pa yang rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur zhes 'dir thal ba'i don du 'god pa'o //
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i myu gu tha dad pa yang rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur zhes 'dir thal ba'i don du 'god pa'o //
translated: The point of the reductio is that the different sprouts of barley and peas would not be produced by different causes.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i tha dad pa'am mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i tha dad pa'am mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i lta bu'o //
translated: If difference, like that of the eye, form, and consciousness,

original: tha dad pa rgyu tha dad kyis byas na tha dad khyad par med par mig gi rnam shes la yang yod pas de tha dad pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa rgyu tha dad kyis byas na tha dad khyad par med par mig gi rnam shes la yang yod pas de tha dad pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: is produced by difference in cause, then since there is no difference in difference, why would consciousness not be different?

original: rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid kyang skabs der med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid kyang skabs der med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the cause is not different, it is not different.

original: de 'dra ba'i myu gu tha dad pa ni tha dad dang tha mi dad gnyis char gyis ma byas pas rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i myu gu tha dad pa ni tha dad dang tha mi dad gnyis char gyis ma byas pas rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since such a different sprout is not made by either difference or non-difference, it would be causeless.

original: gal te mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi rigs phyi mar gyur pa'i 'bras bu la ltos te /
analyzed: gal te mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi rigs phyi mar gyur pa'i 'bras bu la ltos te /
translated: In dependence on the later effect of its own type,

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma rnams rgyu'i tshogs pa tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma rnams rgyu'i tshogs pa tha dad pa yin te /
translated: the earlier moments of eye, form, and so on are different collections of causes,

original: rang gi rigs kyi 'bras bu phyi ma bskyed pa la phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi 'bras bu phyi ma bskyed pa la phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not mutually depend on each other in producing the later effect of their own type.

original: thun mong gi 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la ni de rnams rgyu'i tshogs pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: thun mong gi 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la ni de rnams rgyu'i tshogs pa gcig pa ste /
translated: In the common effect, the eye consciousness, they are a single collection of causes,

original: gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang yang mig gi rnam shes mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang yang mig gi rnam shes mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if any one of them is incomplete, the eye consciousness does not arise.

original: de'i phyir mig gi rnam shes la ltos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi rnam shes la ltos te /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the eye consciousness,

original: de dag lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: But they are not different collections, because they are not different in being different.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pas tha dad khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa ma yin pas tha dad khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o //
translated: The reason is not established.

original: nas dang sran ma'i tha dad pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i tha dad pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The difference between barley and beans should be understood in the same way.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i tshogs pa tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad nyid du bskyed cing tshogs pa tha mi dad pas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du skyed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i tshogs pa tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad nyid du bskyed cing tshogs pa tha mi dad pas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du skyed de /
translated: Therefore, a different collection of causes produces a different effect, and an undifferentiated collection produces the same effect.

original: 'di ni mtha' gcig tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtha' gcig tu nges pa'o //
translated: This is a definite conclusion.

original: lhan cig byed pa ni nges pa med de gcig las tha dad pa dang / tha dad pas kyang gcig la sogs pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ni nges pa med de gcig las tha dad pa dang / tha dad pas kyang gcig la sogs pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But there is no certainty about co-existent causes, because one is different from the other, and the other is the same as the one, and so on.

original: mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: 'dir mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i @290b tshogs pa dang / tshogs pa can gyis lhan cig byed pa rnams gcig gam tha dad ces brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i @290b tshogs pa dang / tshogs pa can gyis lhan cig byed pa rnams gcig gam tha dad ces brtag par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should investigate whether the collection of eye, form, and so on, and the co-existent causes are the same or different.

original: gal te tha dad ces zer na de dag 'brel par yod dam med /
analyzed: gal te tha dad ces zer na de dag 'brel par yod dam med /
translated: If you say they are different, are they related or not?

original: gal te med par 'dod na rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyu tshogs pa gcig pa kho na yin pas lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams la mi ltos par thal lo //
analyzed: gal te med par 'dod na rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyu tshogs pa gcig pa kho na yin pas lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de rnams la mi ltos par thal lo //
translated: If you assert that they are not related, then since the collection of causes of a single consciousness is just a single collection, the different co-arisen causes would not be causes, and it follows that they would not rely on each other.

original: gal te 'brel par 'dod na tha dad pa'i 'brel pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gzhan mi 'thad la /
analyzed: gal te 'brel par 'dod na tha dad pa'i 'brel pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gzhan mi 'thad la /
translated: If you assert that they are related, then apart from the relation of cause and effect, a relation of difference is untenable.

original: de las tshogs pa gcig pa tshogs pa can lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa'i 'bras bur khas len dgos pas tha dad dang tha dad ma yin pa rgyu med par thal pa'i nyes pa snga ma nyid so na 'dug go //
analyzed: de las tshogs pa gcig pa tshogs pa can lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa'i 'bras bur khas len dgos pas tha dad dang tha dad ma yin pa rgyu med par thal pa'i nyes pa snga ma nyid so na 'dug go //
translated: Since it is necessary to accept that the collection of different co-arisen causes is the effect of a single collection, the previous error that difference and nondifference are causeless remains.

original: gal te tshogs pa gcig pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa ltos te /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa gcig pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa ltos te /
translated: If you say that the production of the effect of a single collection depends on the different co-arisen causes,üîΩand since they are a single collection, there is no error,

original: yang de rnams tshogs pa gcig pa yin pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: yang de rnams tshogs pa gcig pa yin pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: then that is untenable.

original: de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa gcig pa de la yang brtag pa snga ma nyid mtshungs pas rkyen rnams tshogs pa gcig pa nyid tshe la sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa gcig pa de la yang brtag pa snga ma nyid mtshungs pas rkyen rnams tshogs pa gcig pa nyid tshe la sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the previous analysis is similar to that of the collection, the collection of conditions is not applied to life.

original: mig gi rnam shes rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam shes rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, eye consciousness would be without a cause.

original: bsams pas go par zad do //
analyzed: bsams pas go par zad do //
translated: This is easily understood.

original: gal te tshogs pa dang tshogs pa can gcig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa dang tshogs pa can gcig pa yin na ni /
translated: If the collection and the one possessing the collection are the same,

original: tshogs pa can lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa bzhin du tshogs pa yang tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshogs pa can lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa bzhin du tshogs pa yang tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: then just as the cooperating causes of the one possessing the collection are different, the collection also would be different.

original: tha dad dang gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad dang gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is different and the same.

original: dper na skar ma'i dkar po nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skar ma'i dkar po nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the whiteness of a star.

original: de bzhin du tshogs pa can rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs pa can rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the one possessing the collection also would be one.

original: gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same and not different.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu tha dad pa rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu tha dad pa rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Moreover, an effect that is different is not produced by a cause that is not different.

original: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa yang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad pa yang rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa yang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad pa yang rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, ‚Äúbecause the reversal is mistaken‚Äù means that the difference between the sense faculty and consciousness would not be produced by a non-different cause.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i tha dad pa rgyu tha mi dad kyis byas na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i tha dad pa rgyu tha mi dad kyis byas na /
translated: If such a difference were produced by a non-different cause,

original: gang du rgyu tha mi dad log pa der 'bras bu tha dad ldog par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: gang du rgyu tha mi dad log pa der 'bras bu tha dad ldog par 'gyur ba las /
translated: then wherever the non-different cause ceased, the different effect would also cease.

original: nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu tha mi dad log kyang /
analyzed: nas dang sran ma'i skabs su rgyu tha mi dad log kyang /
translated: But in the case of barley and peas, the non-different cause ceases,

original: 'bras bu tha dad ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but the different effect does not cease.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad pa ni rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tha dad pa ni rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas la /
translated: Therefore, the difference between the sense faculty and consciousness is not produced by a non-different cause.

original: tha dad pa yang skabs der khas mi len pas rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //üîΩyang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang skabs der khas mi len pas rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o // yang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: And since the difference is not accepted in that context, it would be causeless.

original: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don yang de lta ba'i bum pa'i skad @291a * //
analyzed: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don yang de lta ba'i bum pa'i skad @291a * //
translated: Also, the meaning of ‚Äúbecause the reversal is mistaken‚Äù is that a non-different effect is not produced by a non-different cause.

original: cig gcig po de nyid rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas par thal te /
analyzed: cig gcig po de nyid rgyu tha mi dad kyis ma byas par thal te /
translated: It follows that that very single thing is not produced by causes that are not different,

original: tha mi dad dang ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad dang ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because of the error of nondifference and reversal.

original: yang de 'dra ba ni rgyu tha dad pas kyang ma byas pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du rgyu med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang de 'dra ba ni rgyu tha dad pas kyang ma byas pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du rgyu med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, because of being like that, it is not produced by causes that are different, and therefore it is utterly without cause.

original: yang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu tha mi dad rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas te /
translated: Moreover, the effect is not produced by causes that are different,

original: rjes 'gro 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don yang mig gi rnam shes tha mi dad de /
analyzed: rjes 'gro 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don yang mig gi rnam shes tha mi dad de /
translated: because of the error of following. The meaning of that is: the eye consciousness is not different.

original: de nyid rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas par thal te 'gro ba 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu tha dad kyis ma byas par thal te 'gro ba 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that it is not produced by causes that are different, because of the error of going.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i tha mi dad rgyu tha dad kyis byas nas nas dang sran ma'i skabs su yang rgyu tha dad khyad par med par yod pas 'bras bu tha mi dad nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i tha mi dad rgyu tha dad kyis byas nas nas dang sran ma'i skabs su yang rgyu tha dad khyad par med par yod pas 'bras bu tha mi dad nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the nondifference of that were produced by causes that are different, then in the case of barley and peas, because there would be no difference in the causes, the effect would be nondifferent.

original: de'i phyir mig gi rnam shes gcig po de nyid rgyu tha dad dang tha mi dad gnyis char gyis ma byas pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi rnam shes gcig po de nyid rgyu tha dad dang tha mi dad gnyis char gyis ma byas pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because that single eye consciousness is not produced by either a cause that is different from itself or a cause that is not different from itself, it would be causeless.

original: gal te nas dang sran ma'i tha dad pa ni tshogs pa tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te nas dang sran ma'i tha dad pa ni tshogs pa tha dad pa yin la /
translated: If you say that the difference between barley and peas is a difference in their collection,

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa tsam yin pas tha dad pa khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa tsam yin pas tha dad pa khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub po zhe na /
translated: but the difference between the eye and form and so on is merely a difference in their simultaneous causes, as previously explained, then the reason, because there is no difference in their difference, is not established.

original: 'di'i lan ni sngar bstan no //üîΩde ltar rgyu du mas 'bras bu gcig bskyed pa'i phyogs bkag nas yang du mas du ma bskyed pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni sngar bstan no // de ltar rgyu du mas 'bras bu gcig bskyed pa'i phyogs bkag nas yang du mas du ma bskyed pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: The response to that was previously explained.üîΩHaving thus refuted the position that many causes give rise to a single effect, it is also untenable that many give rise to many.

original: rgyu du ma de rnams phan tshun ltos nas 'bras bu re re skyed par byed na ni du mas gcig skyed pa'i phyogs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu du ma de rnams phan tshun ltos nas 'bras bu re re skyed par byed na ni du mas gcig skyed pa'i phyogs su 'gyur la /
translated: If many causes give rise to each effect in dependence on each other, then it would be the position that many give rise to one.

original: ma ltos par so sos re re skyed na yang gcig gis gcig skyed pa'i phyogs su 'gyur na de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ma ltos par so sos re re skyed na yang gcig gis gcig skyed pa'i phyogs su 'gyur na de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: If they generate each other without depending on each other, then they would generate each other, but that is unacceptable.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gang yang rung ba cig gis rang gi rigs phyi ma kho na skyed na rnam par shes pa ma bskyed pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad 'on pa dang long bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po gang yang rung ba cig gis rang gi rigs phyi ma kho na skyed na rnam par shes pa ma bskyed pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad 'on pa dang long bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If any sense faculty such as the eyes generates only a subsequent state of its own type, then consciousness would not be generated, and all reincarnating beings would be deaf and blind.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa gcig nyid skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa gcig nyid skyed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it generates a single consciousness,

original: rang gi rigs phyi ma ma bskyed pas skad cig gnyis phyin chad rnam par shes pa mi 'byung bas yang 'gro ba 'on pa dang long ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi rigs phyi ma ma bskyed pas skad cig gnyis phyin chad rnam par shes pa mi 'byung bas yang 'gro ba 'on pa dang long ba la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: then since it would not generate a subsequent state of its own type, consciousness would not arise after the second moment, and reincarnating beings would again become deaf and blind,

original: dbang po med pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po med pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that consciousness exists without sense faculties.

original: gal te dbang po lta bu gcig gis ni 'bras bu gcig bskyed par khas mi len te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po lta bu gcig gis ni 'bras bu gcig bskyed par khas mi len te /
translated: If you do not accept that a single sense faculty generates a single result,

original: gzhan du bum pa lta bu'i skad cig snga ma gcig nyid kyis 'bras bu'i skad cig ma phyi ma gcig skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du bum pa lta bu'i skad cig snga ma gcig nyid kyis 'bras bu'i skad cig ma phyi ma gcig skyed do zhe na /
translated: In another way, one single previous moment of a vase produces one single subsequent moment of the effect.

original: mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: de yang tha na dbang po'i shes pa du ma la @291b phan 'dogs pa'i phyir gcig gis gcig kho na skyed pa ni gnas skabs gang du yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang tha na dbang po'i shes pa du ma la @291b phan 'dogs pa'i phyir gcig gis gcig kho na skyed pa ni gnas skabs gang du yang mi srid do //
translated: Moreover, since many sense consciousnesses are assisted, it is impossible that one produces only one at any time.

original: yang gcig gis du ma skyed pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yang gcig gis du ma skyed pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Also, it is not tenable that one produces many.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar dngos po rnams kyi tha dad dang tha dad ma yin pa rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar dngos po rnams kyi tha dad dang tha dad ma yin pa rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: As was previously explained, the difference and nondifference of things would be causeless.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood by following the previous explanation.

original: sngar bstan pa'i mtha' bzhir sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs kyang 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i mtha' bzhir sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs kyang 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This is also the reason applied to the four alternatives previously explained.

original: 'on kyang de yis don dam pa'i skye ba 'gog pa las kun rdzob ba ni dgag par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de yis don dam pa'i skye ba 'gog pa las kun rdzob ba ni dgag par mi nus te /
translated: However, it is only ultimate production that is refuted by that reason; it is not able to refute conventional production.

original: kun rdzob la rigs pa'i dpyad pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob la rigs pa'i dpyad pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because rational analysis does not apply to the conventional.

original: 'dir kyang zhes pa'i tshig ni 'gal ba'i rgyan te /
analyzed: 'dir kyang zhes pa'i tshig ni 'gal ba'i rgyan te /
translated: The word here is an ornament of contradiction.

original: de ltar rkyen gyis gcig dang tha dad pa mi skyed par rnam par 'jog mod kyi sgyu ma lta bu'i rten 'brel ni ma gtogs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rkyen gyis gcig dang tha dad pa mi skyed par rnam par 'jog mod kyi sgyu ma lta bu'i rten 'brel ni ma gtogs zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, although conditions are posited as not producing sameness or difference, except for illusory dependent origination.

original: de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dngos por med na /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba la sogs pa dngos por med na /
translated: If arising and so forth do not exist as entities,

original: thog ma nyid du de dag yod par ston pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du de dag yod par ston pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: then it is not tenable to teach them as existing in the beginning.

original: brjod pa'i yul gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i yul gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement the object of expression and so forth.

original: de dag yod par ston pa'i theg pa ni theg pa chen po rtogs par bya ba'i don du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yod par ston pa'i theg pa ni theg pa chen po rtogs par bya ba'i don du bstan pa'o //
translated: The vehicle that teaches their existence is taught for the purpose of realizing the Great Vehicle.

original: mtshan nyid dang ni dngos dbyibs dang // zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po yin la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni dngos dbyibs dang // zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po yin la /
translated: The statement character, entity, and shape is the form aggregate.

original: ming ni ming bzhi'i phung po'o //
analyzed: ming ni ming bzhi'i phung po'o //
translated: Name is the four name aggregates.

original: gang rnams zhes pa la sogs pas sras kyi sa la gnas pa'i gang zag ston te /
analyzed: gang rnams zhes pa la sogs pas sras kyi sa la gnas pa'i gang zag ston te /
translated: The statement those who and so forth teaches the person who abides on the stage of the children.

original: phyag rgya zhes pa ni grol ba nyid du mtshon pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa ni grol ba nyid du mtshon pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma'o //
translated: Seal is a sign and symbol that illustrates liberation.

original: gzugs kyi rnam shes zhes pa la sogs pas der 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log spangs nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i las 'jig par 'gyur na mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa ldog cing /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam shes zhes pa la sogs pas der 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log spangs nas zag pa dang bcas pa'i las 'jig par 'gyur na mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa ldog cing /
translated: By abandoning the error of apprehending form consciousness and so on, contaminated karma will be destroyed, and the apprehension of the two extremes will be reversed.

original: 'khor ba dag kyang med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dag kyang med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And samsara will also be nonexistent.

original: ldog pa'i tshe ni zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshe ni zhes pa la sogs pas don de nyid rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: The line When there is reversal... and so on explains that very point in detail.

original: yod med nyes dang bral ba'i las //üîΩkun gzhi la ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: yod med nyes dang bral ba'i las // kun gzhi la ni rab tu gnas //
translated: The line Karma free from the faults of existence and nonexistence...

original: zhes pa ni mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa dang bral ba zag pa med pa'i las kyi sa bon kun gzhi la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa dang bral ba zag pa med pa'i las kyi sa bon kun gzhi la gnas pa ste /
translated: means that the seed of uncontaminated karma, free from the apprehension of the two extremes, abides in the alaya.

original: des rnam par shes pa khu khrag gi nang du rkyal zhing 'gro ba'i gzugs sna tshogs su ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des rnam par shes pa khu khrag gi nang du rkyal zhing 'gro ba'i gzugs sna tshogs su ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that, consciousness will not fall into various forms that go swimming in blood and semen.

original: yang gzugs dang rnam shes 'brel ba ste gzugs kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i las 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gzugs dang rnam shes 'brel ba ste gzugs kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams kyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i las 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the connection of form and consciousness, that is, the apprehension of the marks of form, will not destroy contaminated karma.

original: de dag 'brel zhes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'brel zhes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are related‚Äù means that they are related to the apprehension of signs.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i las @292a * //
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i las @292a * //
translated: If such an action

original: zhig kyang sems dang lhan cig tu 'khor ba'i lus 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhig kyang sems dang lhan cig tu 'khor ba'i lus 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: were to establish a body that circulates together with the mind,

original: de 'dra ba'i lus ni sems tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir de dag tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur na de ni mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i lus ni sems tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir de dag tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur na de ni mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: then such a body would be related to mind only, and therefore it would always arise in a manner that is not different from it. But that is not tenable.

original: sems dang gzugs su rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang gzugs su rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: It is the conception of mind and form.

original: rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gzugs su snang ba dang gcig dang tha dad las grol ba ste don dam pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gzugs su snang ba dang gcig dang tha dad las grol ba ste don dam pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The appearance of form that has the nature of conception is one with mind and is free from being either the same as or different from it. This is from the perspective of the ultimate.

original: kun tu brtags dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang ni gcig nyid yin la de yang sgyu ma lta bur yod pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: kun tu brtags dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang ni gcig nyid yin la de yang sgyu ma lta bur yod pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe imaginary and the dependent‚Äù and so on teaches that the imaginary and the dependent, which are synonyms, are one, and that they exist like an illusion.

original: de yang don dam par gcig dang tha dad las grol ba'i brtags pa la brtags pa nyid du khong du ma chud na /
analyzed: de yang don dam par gcig dang tha dad las grol ba'i brtags pa la brtags pa nyid du khong du ma chud na /
translated: Moreover, if one does not understand that the imagined is imagined in the ultimate, which is free from identity and difference,

original: yod dang med par ji ltar 'gyur te /üîΩde 'dra ba'i blo'i don gzhan gyi dbang ni yod la /
analyzed: yod dang med par ji ltar 'gyur te / de 'dra ba'i blo'i don gzhan gyi dbang ni yod la /
translated: how could it be either existent or nonexistent?

original: kun du brtags pa ni med do zhes rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa ni med do zhes rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to make the distinction that the other-dependent object of such a mind exists and the imagined does not exist.

original: gzugs dang mi rtag par dbye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no //üîΩgal te brtags pa la brtags pa nyid du shes na ni de ni med la /
analyzed: gzugs dang mi rtag par dbye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no // gal te brtags pa la brtags pa nyid du shes na ni de ni med la /
translated: This is similar to the untenability of distinguishing form and impermanence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod do zhes rnam par dbye ba 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod do zhes rnam par dbye ba 'thad pa'o //
translated: If one understands that the imagined is imagined, then it is tenable to make the distinction that it does not exist and the other-dependent does exist.

original: gzhan yang brtags pa nyid du mthong na de 'dra ba'i dngos por rtog pa'i gzhan gyi dbang kun rdzob tu yang mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang brtags pa nyid du mthong na de 'dra ba'i dngos por rtog pa'i gzhan gyi dbang kun rdzob tu yang mi skye ba'o //
translated: Moreover, if one sees that it is imagined, then the other-dependent that is conceived to be such an entity does not arise even conventionally.

original: yang gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bur mthong na rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa yang de dang tha dad med pas de bzhin nyid sgyu ma lta bur rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi dbang sgyu ma lta bur mthong na rnam grangs kyi kun du brtags pa yang de dang tha dad med pas de bzhin nyid sgyu ma lta bur rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, if the other-dependent is seen as illusion-like, then the categorized imagined nature is not different from that, and so the suchness that is like an illusion is realized.

original: rtog pa rnam par 'jig cing zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan dbang la skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa rnam par 'jig cing zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan dbang la skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' 'gog pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe destruction of conceptualization‚Äù and so on refutes the extreme of nihilism in regard to the other-dependent.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ni gzhan dbang dngos po'i ngo bo don dam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ni gzhan dbang dngos po'i ngo bo don dam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Reification is the conceptualization of the nature of things as ultimate.

original: nga'i chul  ni mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'o //
analyzed: nga'i chul  ni mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'o //
translated: My way is the middle that abandons the two extremes.

original: de ltar nga'i tshul lugs sun 'byin pa dang / mkhas pa rnams lam gcig nas mi 'gro zhing gtam mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar nga'i tshul lugs sun 'byin pa dang / mkhas pa rnams lam gcig nas mi 'gro zhing gtam mi bya ba ste /
translated: In this way, those who repudiate my way and the wise do not travel the same path and do not speak the same way.

original: de dag rjes su mi bzung bar mi nus pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de dag rjes su mi bzung bar mi nus pa'i tshe'o //
translated: When it is not possible to accept them,

original: dge slong gi don ni 'ga' zhig bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phrin las te de dang lhan cig mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi don ni 'ga' zhig bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i phrin las te de dang lhan cig mi bya ba'o //
translated: the meaning of bhik·π£u is the activity of full ordination, and one should not do that together with them.

original: de dag sdud pa ni 'khor dang yid gcugs nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sdud pa ni 'khor dang yid gcugs nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: Gathering them is to make them a retinue and to be friendly with them.

original: gzhan yang rnam par 'jig pa ni yang dag pa'i rtogs pa las nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par 'jig pa ni yang dag pa'i rtogs pa las nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, destruction is that which causes the degeneration of correct realization.

original: mu tig nor bu zhes pa la sogs pas ni dgongs pa can gyi tshig ston te /
analyzed: mu tig nor bu zhes pa la sogs pas ni dgongs pa can gyi tshig ston te /
translated: The words pearl, jewel, and so forth indicate the words of the Buddha that are interpretable in meaning.

original: de las med @292b par bstan pa ni don dam pa la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de las med @292b par bstan pa ni don dam pa la dgongs pa ste /
translated: The statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.

original: nor bu mu tig gser 'byung rnams //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i len du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nor bu mu tig gser 'byung rnams // zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i len du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas ni yod par ston pa'i tshig ste kun rdzob la dgongs pa'o //üîΩgal te de lta na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas ni yod par ston pa'i tshig ste kun rdzob la dgongs pa'o // gal te de lta na /
translated: The statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.

original: ji ltar byis pas brtags pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas brtags pa ltar //
translated: The statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.

original: dngos po rnams ni yod pa min //üîΩzhes bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni yod pa min // zhes bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: The statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.üîΩThe statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.üîΩThe statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.üîΩThe statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.üîΩThe statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.üîΩThe statement there is no pearl, and so on, is from the point of view of the ultimate.üîΩThe statement pearls, jewels, and gold and so on is from the point of view of the conventional.

original: skyon med de /üîΩde ni dngos po'i ngo bo don dam par ma grub pa yin la /üîΩ'dir ni rtog pa'i gzung ba nyid du gyur pa'i brtags pa kun rdzob tu rtog pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa'o //
analyzed: skyon med de /üîΩde ni dngos po'i ngo bo don dam par ma grub pa yin la /üîΩ'dir ni rtog pa'i gzung ba nyid du gyur pa'i brtags pa kun rdzob tu rtog pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa'o //
translated: The statement there is no pearl, and

original: rnam par thar pa gsum spyod ces pa la sogs pas de rnams don dam par med pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum spyod ces pa la sogs pas de rnams don dam par med pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúthey practice the three gateways to liberation‚Äù and so on teaches that these are ultimately nonexistent.

original: 'byor pa ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'byor pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúProsperity‚Äù refers to the prosperity of qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: nga'i bstan la zhes pa la sogs pas ni lung bstan gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: nga'i bstan la zhes pa la sogs pas ni lung bstan gyi khyad par te /
translated: The line ‚Äúin my teachings‚Äù and so on is a special prophecy.

original: khyed kyi lung bstan rnam pa du zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi lung bstan rnam pa du zhes dris pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be connected to the question, ‚ÄúHow many types of prophecy are there?‚Äù

original: 'phags pa'i spyod yul ni rten 'brel gyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul ni rten 'brel gyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The ‚Äúdomain of the noble ones‚Äù is the suchness of dependent origination.

original: gzegs zan ni 'bras kyi gzegs ma tsam la longs spyod pa dka' thub kyi cha 'dzin pa'i drang srong ste /
analyzed: gzegs zan ni 'bras kyi gzegs ma tsam la longs spyod pa dka' thub kyi cha 'dzin pa'i drang srong ste /
translated: KƒÅ·πáƒÅda is a sage who practices austerities and enjoys only a morsel of rice.

original: bye brag pa'i ston pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag pa'i ston pa'o //
translated: He is the teacher of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: 'bras bu med par smra ba ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jig par byed pa'o //üîΩde dag ni rigs mthun pa'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa las /
analyzed: 'bras bu med par smra ba ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jig par byed pa'o // de dag ni rigs mthun pa'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa las /
translated: The ‚Äúnihilists‚Äù are those who destroy the connection between actions and their effects.

original: 'gro ba'i lus dang snod kyi 'jig rten byung la /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i lus dang snod kyi 'jig rten byung la /
translated: They say that the world and the bodies of beings arise from the aggregation of homogeneous subtle particles.

original: rdul phra rab ni rtag pa rgyu med par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni rtag pa rgyu med par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The subtle particle is asserted to be permanent and without cause.

original: rdzas rnams kyis ni rdzas rtsom zhes pa la sogs pas ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas kyis rags pa'i rdzas rtsom la /
analyzed: rdzas rnams kyis ni rdzas rtsom zhes pa la sogs pas ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas kyis rags pa'i rdzas rtsom la /
translated: In the line ‚ÄúThe coarse is composed of the subtle,‚Äù and so on, the subtle particles compose the coarse substance.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi skad cig snga ma phyi ma rnams skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi skad cig snga ma phyi ma rnams skyed pa'o //
translated: The previous and subsequent moments of the qualities of form and so on are produced.

original: dngos po dag gi dngos nyid gzhan //
analyzed: dngos po dag gi dngos nyid gzhan //
translated: The nature of things is different.

original: zhes pa ni rig pa sgyu ma lta bur yod pa gang zag gi bdag med pa ni 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rig pa sgyu ma lta bur yod pa gang zag gi bdag med pa ni 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe nature of things is different‚Äù means that the existence of awareness, which is like an illusion, is destroyed by the selflessness of persons.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba'i rigs sngar ma byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba'i rigs sngar ma byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if a type of transmigrating being arose that had not existed previously,

original: 'khor ba'i thog ma yod par thal ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i thog ma yod par thal ba'o //
translated: it would follow that there would be a beginning of samsara.

original: de ltar 'dod pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Such an assertion is untenable.

original: ma rig pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems nyid kun rdzob tu rgyu med pa mi 'thad la rgyu yang phyi rol gyi dngos po'am /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems nyid kun rdzob tu rgyu med pa mi 'thad la rgyu yang phyi rol gyi dngos po'am /
translated: It is untenable that the mind itself, which is concomitant with ignorance, is the relative, without a cause, and that the cause is an external thing.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes ni mi 'thad pas rang gi rigs snga ma snga ma rnams sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes ni mi 'thad pas rang gi rigs snga ma snga ma rnams sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Since non-erroneous transcendent wisdom is not tenable, the former kinds of one‚Äôs own continuum are prerequisites.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa'o //üîΩmed pa skye @293a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba la thog ma med pa'o // med pa skye @293a * //
translated: Therefore, cyclic existence is beginningless.

original: ba 'gog pa ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
analyzed: ba 'gog pa ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
translated: Refuting the arising of the nonexistent was extensively explained above.

original: gcig po las gcig 'byung na zhes pa ni rtsi rkyang lta bu gcig po las med pa'i re lde gcig nyid 'byung bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gcig po las gcig 'byung na zhes pa ni rtsi rkyang lta bu gcig po las med pa'i re lde gcig nyid 'byung bar 'dod na /
translated: If one thing arises from one thing, if you assert that a single nonexistent rope arises from a single rope,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa rnams las kyang med pa'i re lde ci'i phyir mi 'byung ste ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen 'jim pa'i gong bu la sogs pa rnams las kyang med pa'i re lde ci'i phyir mi 'byung ste ;
translated: why does a nonexistent rope not arise from other conditions, such as a lump of clay?

original: / med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the nonexistent.

original: don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: don zhib tu ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning was explained above in detail.

original: 'tsho ba ni srog gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni srog gi dbang po'o //
translated: Life is the faculty of life force.

original: de lta na sangs rgyas nyid kyis kyang med pa skye ba'i phyogs gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na sangs rgyas nyid kyis kyang med pa skye ba'i phyogs gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In that case, did not the Buddha himself state the position that the nonexistent arises?

original: de ni phyogs snga ma nyid gzhan gyi lugs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phyogs snga ma nyid gzhan gyi lugs bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the opponent‚Äôs position itself, which is taught as the other system.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa yang dngos por zhen pa'i skye bo gang dag rtag tu de ltar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i don du de dang mthun pa'i don bstan pas brid nas skye ba med pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dgos pa yang dngos por zhen pa'i skye bo gang dag rtag tu de ltar 'gyur ba bzlog pa'i don du de dang mthun pa'i don bstan pas brid nas skye ba med pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The purpose of teaching in that way is that any person who is attached to entities is always turned away from that, and by teaching a meaning that accords with that, he is deceived and made to understand the reality of non-arising.

original: gzhan yang yan lag ser skya zhes pa grangs can gyi ston pa drang srong ser skya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang yan lag ser skya zhes pa grangs can gyi ston pa drang srong ser skya'o //
translated: Moreover, the ‚Äúlimb‚Äù Kapila is the teacher Kapila of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: gang gi dngos po zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu rig pa rgyu dang bcas par ston to //
analyzed: gang gi dngos po zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu rig pa rgyu dang bcas par ston to //
translated: ‚Äú Whose entity‚Äù and so on teaches the cognition together with its cause conventionally.

original: dngos po la ni dmigs byas zhes pa ni sems kyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i dngos po gzugs la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po la ni dmigs byas zhes pa ni sems kyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i dngos po gzugs la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Having objectified an entity‚Äù refers to an entity that has become the nature of the mind, appearing as form and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i tshul zhes pa ni 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i tshul zhes pa ni 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don la /
translated: ‚Äú The way of the noble ones‚Äô entity‚Äù refers to the meaning that is to be known by the noble ones themselves.

original: yod par sgro 'dogs pa dang med par skur pa 'debs pa ni nga'i tshul la mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: yod par sgro 'dogs pa dang med par skur pa 'debs pa ni nga'i tshul la mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Superimposing existence and deprecating nonexistence‚Äù is not being skilled in my way.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sems zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas brtags pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sems zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas brtags pa ste /
translated: The so-called worldly mind is a worldly imputation.

original: sems tsam yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems tsam yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not mind only in reality.

original: rmi lam dang 'dra bar skye ba ni gnyis su snang ba sems nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra bar skye ba ni gnyis su snang ba sems nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The arising of mind is like a dream, as it is said: ‚ÄúThe appearance of duality is mind only.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid med pa ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni don dam par ro //
translated: The absence of characteristics is in the ultimate.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas ni /
translated: As for the line beginning ‚ÄúJust as,‚Äù

original: rang rig don dam par yod pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: rang rig don dam par yod pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: it refutes the ultimate existence of reflexive awareness.

original: ji ltar ral gri'i sos rang nyid mi gcod pa dang / mdzub mos rang gi rtse mo la reg par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du sems kyis kyang rang nyid mi rig pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ral gri'i sos rang nyid mi gcod pa dang / mdzub mos rang gi rtse mo la reg par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du sems kyis kyang rang nyid mi rig pa'o //
translated: Just as the edge of a sword cannot cut itself and the tip of a finger cannot touch itself, so the mind cannot cognize itself.

original: 'di'i don yang rang snang bas stong ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don yang rang snang bas stong ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that because it is empty of itself appearing to itself,

original: gal te rang snang bar khas len na ni rang nyid la rnam par 'jog pa dang / des gzhag pa'i rnam pa dang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang snang bar khas len na ni rang nyid la rnam par 'jog pa dang / des gzhag pa'i rnam pa dang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: if you accept that it appears to itself, then there would be two things: the mind itself and the aspect posited by it.

original: gal te 'dir rang la rang gi rnam pa snang ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'dir rang la rang gi rnam pa snang ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that here reflexive awareness is not in terms of an aspect of itself appearing to itself,

original: 'on kyang bems po'am dngos po med pa las log ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bems po'am dngos po med pa las log ste /
translated: But, you say, it is the opposite of an inanimate thing or nonentity.

original: rig pa'i rang @293b bzhin du skyes pa nyid rang rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa'i rang @293b bzhin du skyes pa nyid rang rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is self-awareness, which is born as the nature of awareness.

original: de ltar na dngos po rnams rgyu gzhan med par rang nyid skye'o zhes kyang ci'i phyir na mi brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po rnams rgyu gzhan med par rang nyid skye'o zhes kyang ci'i phyir na mi brjod de /
translated: Well then, why not say that things are born from themselves without any other cause?

original: der yang dngos po ma skyes pa las log nas /üîΩskyes pa'i ngo bor byung ba nyid rang gis skyed pa'am /
analyzed: der yang dngos po ma skyes pa las log nas / skyes pa'i ngo bor byung ba nyid rang gis skyed pa'am /
translated: In that case, having turned away from a non-arisen thing,üîΩit is born as the nature of an arisen thing.

original: rang skye ba'o //
analyzed: rang skye ba'o //
translated: That is self-production or self-arising.

original: gal te der rang gi rang bzhin gcig nyid la bskyed bya dang / skyed byed mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te der rang gi rang bzhin gcig nyid la bskyed bya dang / skyed byed mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But, you say, it is not tenable that a single thing is both that which is produced and that which produces.

original: de bzhin du gcig la rig bya dang rig byed kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig la rig bya dang rig byed kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: In the same way, it is not tenable that a single thing is both that which is known and that which knows.

original: gal te skyed byed gzhan la ma ltos par rang skye ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te skyed byed gzhan la ma ltos par rang skye ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: But, you say, it is not tenable that it arises from itself without depending on another producer.

original: de lta na rtag tu yod pa'am med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na rtag tu yod pa'am med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, it would always exist or not exist at all,

original: res 'ga' bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: res 'ga' bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is contradictory that it sometimes exists and sometimes does not.

original: rig byed gzhan la ma ltos par rang rig pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rig byed gzhan la ma ltos par rang rig pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable that consciousness is reflexive awareness without depending on another cognizer,

original: res 'ga' bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would contradict the fact that it is sometimes not.

original: gzhan yang sems kyis sems ni mi mthong zhes pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / rnam par mi rig pa ste zhes pa la sogs pa mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems kyis sems ni mi mthong zhes pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / rnam par mi rig pa ste zhes pa la sogs pa mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is stated in other s≈´tras that the mind does not see the mind, that it is like an illusion, and that it is nonperceiving.

original: des na sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan dbang yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan dbang yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is untenable that the mind is reflexive awareness.

original: skyed par byed la dgongs zhes pa ni don dam par med pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed la dgongs zhes pa ni don dam par med pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is intended to be a producer‚Äù means that it is intended to be nonexistent ultimately.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pas rnam rtog kun rdzob tsam du yang med na /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pas rnam rtog kun rdzob tsam du yang med na /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf the various aspects‚Äù and so on means that if conceptualization does not exist even as mere convention,

original: sna tshogs kyi don du snang ba yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi don du snang ba yang mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is untenable that the various objects appear.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because the horns of a rabbit and so on would be like that.

original: gal te ma brtags zhes pa la sogs pas sems las tha dad kyi dngos po la sogs par ma brtags pa'i don kun rdzob tu sems kyi ngo bor yod na /
analyzed: gal te ma brtags zhes pa la sogs pas sems las tha dad kyi dngos po la sogs par ma brtags pa'i don kun rdzob tu sems kyi ngo bor yod na /
translated: If, on the other hand, the mind is not examined, etc., the meaning of not examining a thing that is different from the mind is that the mind exists in the nature of the mind in the relative.

original: sems kyang don du snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyang don du snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Then the mind would appear as an object.

original: thog ma med ldan zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu sems med na don du snang ba mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med ldan zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu sems med na don du snang ba mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: Since there is no mind in the relative, the appearance of an object is not tenable.

original: ji ltar da ltar zhes pa la sogs pas don da ltar med pa bzhin du sngon yang med la /
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar zhes pa la sogs pas don da ltar med pa bzhin du sngon yang med la /
translated: Since the object does not exist in the present, etc., it did not exist in the past either.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang med pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang med pas /
translated: And likewise, the mind does not exist.

original: don du snang ba'i sems rgyun gyi 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: don du snang ba'i sems rgyun gyi 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of the mind that appears as an object is not tenable.

original: de ltar na stong ba nyid la sogs par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na /üîΩde bzhin nyid dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na stong ba nyid la sogs par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na / de bzhin nyid dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In that case, the teachings on emptiness, etc., are not tenable.

original: de dag don dam pa la dgongs te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag don dam pa la dgongs te bstan pa'o //
translated: Suchness, etc., is taught with the intention of the ultimate.

original: snang ba med par sems mngon zhes pa ni de kho na nyid du med par sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba med par sems mngon zhes pa ni de kho na nyid du med par sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
translated: The mind is not apparent without appearance, etc. It appears as various things without existing in reality.

original: de 'dra ba'i bye brag thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'o //üîΩgal te thog ma med @294a * //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bye brag thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba'o // gal te thog ma med @294a * //
translated: Such particulars arise from beginningless latent propensities.

original: pa nas don kyang med la /
analyzed: pa nas don kyang med la /
translated: If there were no object from beginningless time,

original: de bzhin du sems kyang med na bye brag rgyas par 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang med na bye brag rgyas par 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: and likewise no mind, then the expansion of particulars would be untenable.

original: don med ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas ni don med na der snang ba'i sems skye ba mi 'thad pa nyid du mtshungs par brtsad pa'o //
analyzed: don med ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pas ni don med na der snang ba'i sems skye ba mi 'thad pa nyid du mtshungs par brtsad pa'o //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúIf there is no object, how does a mind appearing as that arise?‚Äù is that it is similar in that it is untenable for a mind appearing as an object to arise if there is no object.

original: lan gyi don ni don dam par mi skye ba ni 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni don dam par mi skye ba ni 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the response is that it is asserted that ultimately there is no arising,

original: kun rdzob tu ni sems kyi sa bon la sogs pa yod par 'dod pas mi mtshungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sems kyi sa bon la sogs pa yod par 'dod pas mi mtshungs zhes pa'o //
translated: but conventionally the seeds of the mind and so on are asserted to exist, so it is not similar.

original: 'di dag thams cad ces pa la sogs pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ston te tshig gi don ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ces pa la sogs pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ston te tshig gi don ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of the words has been explained previously.

original: 'dus pa mu stegs lta pa ltar //
analyzed: 'dus pa mu stegs lta pa ltar //
translated: The non-Buddhist view is that the collection of parts is the chariot.

original: zhes pas ni bye brag tu smra bas rags pa'i rdzas 'jig pas med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes pas ni bye brag tu smra bas rags pa'i rdzas 'jig pas med par 'gyur la /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika say that gross substances are destroyed and become nonexistent.

original: rdul phra rab ni rtag pa'i dngos por khas len pa mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni rtag pa'i dngos por khas len pa mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable to accept that a subtle particle is a permanent thing.

original: dngos po med pas zhes pa la sogs pas ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs kyis don ston pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pas zhes pa la sogs pas ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs kyis don ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Since there is no thing‚Äù and so on teaches the meaning by way of synonyms such as non-arising.

original: rdza dang snam bu zhes pa la sogs pas yod med kyi mtshan ma phan tshun ltos te brtags pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: rdza dang snam bu zhes pa la sogs pas yod med kyi mtshan ma phan tshun ltos te brtags pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú A pot, a cloth‚Äù and so on teaches that the signs of existence and non-existence are imputed in mutual dependence.

original: med pa med par mi rung ngo zhes pa ni med pa'i ltos pa ma grub na yod pa nyid du rtog pa mi 'thad pa'o //üîΩrgyu med pa ste rgyu med min //
analyzed: med pa med par mi rung ngo zhes pa ni med pa'i ltos pa ma grub na yod pa nyid du rtog pa mi 'thad pa'o // rgyu med pa ste rgyu med min //
translated: ‚Äú Non-existence is not tenable without existence‚Äù means that if the dependence of non-existence is not established, it is not tenable to conceive of existence.

original: zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i phyir don no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i phyir don no //
translated: ‚Äú Without a cause, not without a cause‚Äù means that the meaning is in order to unite.

original: de yang gzhan la snang 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang gzhan la snang 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú That also appears to another‚Äù means

original: rten gzhan po de yang cig shos la brten par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rten gzhan po de yang cig shos la brten par 'gyur na /
translated: that if that other basis also depends on the other,

original: phan tshun rten pa thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan tshun rten pa thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: there would be an infinite regress of mutual dependence.

original: de yang dngos por mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dngos por mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: That also is not tenable as a thing.

original: sgyu ma med pas gnas mthong zhes pa ni sgyu ma'i rnam par snang ba med na /
analyzed: sgyu ma med pas gnas mthong zhes pa ni sgyu ma'i rnam par snang ba med na /
translated: The line the basis is seen when the illusion is not there means that when the appearance of the illusion is not there,

original: shing dang gyo mo la sogs pa'i gnas lugs gnyis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: shing dang gyo mo la sogs pa'i gnas lugs gnyis mthong ba'o //
translated: the basis, such as the wood or the potsherd, is seen as it is.

original: de bzhin du gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gis de kho na nyid bsgribs shing de lta bu'i snang ba med na de bzhin nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gis de kho na nyid bsgribs shing de lta bu'i snang ba med na de bzhin nyid mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similarly, when the obscuration of reality by the error of dualistic appearance is not there, suchness is seen.

original: sems tsam du ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to be mere mind.

original: zhes pa ni don dam par sems kyi ngo bor ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam par sems kyi ngo bor ma grub pa'o //
translated: This means that ultimately it is not established as the entity of mind.

original: de lta na phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it is not tenable to teach that the aggregates and so on exist.

original: bsam pa tha dad la dgongs te bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bsam pa tha dad la dgongs te bstan pa yin la /
translated: It is taught with a different intention.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i don bsgoms kyang thar ba mi 'thob pa'o //üîΩbag chags kyis ni mgo yung bslad //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i don bsgoms kyang thar ba mi 'thob pa'o // bag chags kyis ni mgo yung bslad //
translated: Therefore, even if one meditates on such an object, one will not attain liberation.üîΩThe mind is deceived by latent propensities.

original: ces pa ni bag chags kyis bslad pa'i sems nyid sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni bag chags kyis bslad pa'i sems nyid sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
translated: This means that the mind itself, which is deceived by latent propensities, appears as a variety.

original: rtog pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni rtog ge pa rnams kyis de @294b ltar ma rtogs pa'o //üîΩsems ni 'phags par nyer 'gro zhing //
analyzed: rtog pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni rtog ge pa rnams kyis de @294b ltar ma rtogs pa'o // sems ni 'phags par nyer 'gro zhing //
translated: ‚ÄúBy those who speculate‚Äù means by logicians who do not understand this.

original: zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i go 'phang thob pa na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i go 'phang thob pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind moves toward the noble state‚Äù means that when one attains the noble state,

original: sems kyi mtshan ma zhi zhing gnas gyur ba'o //üîΩgal te 'di kun zhes pa la sogs pas ni thams cad sems yin gyi phyi'i don med na /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan ma zhi zhing gnas gyur ba'o // gal te 'di kun zhes pa la sogs pas ni thams cad sems yin gyi phyi'i don med na /
translated: the signs of the mind are pacified and the mind is transformed.

original: sa la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten la spyod cing 'gro ba la sogs pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten la spyod cing 'gro ba la sogs pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: If everything is mind, as you say, then it is not tenable to engage in and move about in the world of the environment, such as the earth, and so on.

original: lan gyi don ni de ltar rtog pa'i dbang gis brtags pa'i smin pa la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni de ltar rtog pa'i dbang gis brtags pa'i smin pa la spyod pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the response is that one engages in the world of the environment through the power of conceptualization.

original: de yang rang gi sems kyi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rang gi sems kyi snang ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, that is the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: mi brtson rnams la zhes pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa la mi brtson pa'o //
analyzed: mi brtson rnams la zhes pa ni gnyen po bsgom pa la mi brtson pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor those who are not diligent‚Äù means those who are not diligent in cultivating the antidotes.

original: yul las 'byung zhes pa ni yul du snang ba las so ;
analyzed: yul las 'byung zhes pa ni yul du snang ba las so ;
translated: ‚ÄúArising from objects‚Äù means from the appearance of objects.

original: / brtags pa'i ming ni ming bral zhes pa ni chos thams cad ming tsam yin la /
analyzed: / brtags pa'i ming ni ming bral zhes pa ni chos thams cad ming tsam yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe name of the imputed is free from names‚Äù means that all phenomena are mere names.

original: ming nyid kyang ming tsam ste /
analyzed: ming nyid kyang ming tsam ste /
translated: The name itself is just a name.

original: ming gi ngo bo bden pas stong ba'o //
analyzed: ming gi ngo bo bden pas stong ba'o //
translated: The essence of the name is empty of true existence.

original: chos lnga rnams dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni shes par bya ba de tsam ste zhes pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos lnga rnams dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni shes par bya ba de tsam ste zhes pa'i lan du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The five dharmas, etc. should be applied as the answer to ‚ÄúThat much is to be known.‚Äù

original: gzugs med pa yi phung po bzhi //
analyzed: gzugs med pa yi phung po bzhi //
translated: The four aggregates of the formless

original: de dag la ni bgrang ba med //
analyzed: de dag la ni bgrang ba med //
translated: Are not counted.

original: ces pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa 'di dang 'di'o zhes bgrang du med pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa 'di dang 'di'o zhes bgrang du med pa'o //
translated: This means that they cannot be counted as having this or that aspect of color and shape.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs rnam pa mang por 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs rnam pa mang por 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The form aggregate is the many kinds of forms with the characteristics of the different elements such as earth.

original: de yang sems las tha dad pa'i phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid grub pa med pa'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems las tha dad pa'i phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid grub pa med pa'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, because it does not exist as elements and derivatives, it does not have the character of being established as external to the mind.

original: 'on te mtshan nyid gzhan gzugs na //
analyzed: 'on te mtshan nyid gzhan gzugs na //
translated: But if form is a different characteristic,

original: phung po rnams kyis cir mi skye //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyis cir mi skye //
translated: Why is it not produced by the aggregates?

original: zhes pa ni phyi rol rdzas su grub pa'i mtshan nyid las gzhan de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba 'ja' tshon ltar thogs pa med pa de 'dra ba cig gzugs kyi phung po yin na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi rol rdzas su grub pa'i mtshan nyid las gzhan de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba 'ja' tshon ltar thogs pa med pa de 'dra ba cig gzugs kyi phung po yin na /
translated: This means that if the form aggregate were such a thing as appears in a different way from the characteristics of external, substantial establishment, like a rainbow, unobstructed,

original: ming bzhi'i phung po rnams kyis kyang de 'dra bar snang ba'i gzugs ci'i phyir mi skyed de /
analyzed: ming bzhi'i phung po rnams kyis kyang de 'dra bar snang ba'i gzugs ci'i phyir mi skyed de /
translated: why would the four mental aggregates not generate a form that appears in that way?

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams la yang shin tu phra ba'i gzugs yod ces pa la sogs pa sngar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams la yang shin tu phra ba'i gzugs yod ces pa la sogs pa sngar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it was previously taught that even in the formless realm there is extremely subtle form.

original: yul dang dbang po tha dad phyir //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the objects and faculties are different,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyi nang gi skye mched du snang ba'i sa bon tha dad kun gzhi la yod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni phyi nang gi skye mched du snang ba'i sa bon tha dad kun gzhi la yod pa'o //
translated: and so forth, the seeds of the appearance of the inner and outer sense bases exist in the all-base.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni gsum yin zhes pa ni mtshan nyid bsdus nas phye na sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa gsum du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni gsum yin zhes pa ni mtshan nyid bsdus nas phye na sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa gsum du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By means of their characteristics, they are three. If the characteristics are summarized and distinguished, they become the three: mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: snang ba med la ldog par 'gyur ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chod du de rnams gnas gyur ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba med la ldog par 'gyur ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chod du de rnams gnas gyur ba'o //
translated: The reversal of the view of the self in the absence of appearances occurs on the eighth ground and above, when those two have been transformed.

original: @295a * // kun gzhi yid kyi bdag yin te //
analyzed: @295a * // kun gzhi yid kyi bdag yin te //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the self,

original: shes pa nyid ni bdag gi yin //
analyzed: shes pa nyid ni bdag gi yin //
translated: and consciousness itself is mine.

original: zhes pa ni kun gzhi nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis nga yi bar gzung ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun gzhi nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis nga yi bar gzung ba yin la /
translated: The defiled foundation consciousness is apprehended as ‚Äúmine‚Äù by the afflicted mind.

original: yang de 'dra ba'i kun gzhi ni bdag tu sgro btags pa'i gzhir yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang de 'dra ba'i kun gzhi ni bdag tu sgro btags pa'i gzhir yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the foundation consciousness is the basis for the superimposition of the self.

original: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa gnyis kyi sgo nas rgyun 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa gnyis kyi sgo nas rgyun 'jug pa'o //
translated: Thus, the continuum of cyclic existence is perpetuated by means of the two apprehensions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rang nyid la bdag tu 'dzin la /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rang nyid la bdag tu 'dzin la /
translated: Alternatively, the afflicted mind itself apprehends itself as the self,

original: kun gzhi la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and it apprehends the foundation consciousness as ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ma zhugs par zhes pa ni de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo ma zhugs par ro //
analyzed: ma zhugs par zhes pa ni de ltar 'dzin pa'i blo ma zhugs par ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout engaging in‚Äù means without engaging in such apprehensions.

original: sems kyi snang ba shes pa dang sems kyis don gzhan gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang / de'i gzung ba don gzhan du gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi snang ba shes pa dang sems kyis don gzhan gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang / de'i gzung ba don gzhan du gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the appearance of mind is cognized and because the mind apprehends other objects‚Äù refers to the apprehending consciousness and to the apprehension of its object as being other.

original: mthong ba lta bur rnam par brtags zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba lta bur rnam par brtags zhes pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is imagined to be like seeing‚Äù refers to the view of the Lokayatas.

original: don snga ma'i gtan tshigs nyid du sbyar ro //
analyzed: don snga ma'i gtan tshigs nyid du sbyar ro //
translated: The reason for the previous point is applied here.

original: blo yis gang tshe ma mthong zhes pa ni snang ba kun rdzob tsam du yang ma mthong zhing med par 'dzin na skur ba'i lta bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: blo yis gang tshe ma mthong zhes pa ni snang ba kun rdzob tsam du yang ma mthong zhing med par 'dzin na skur ba'i lta bar 'gyur la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen the mind does not see‚Äù means that if one does not see the appearance of mind even as mere superficial reality and grasps it as nonexistent, one will have a nihilistic view.

original: sems kyi dngos po bden par 'dzin na sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dngos po bden par 'dzin na sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one grasps the entity of mind as real, one will have a reifying view.

original: rnam rtog dngos min zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems kyi rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: rnam rtog dngos min zhes pa la sogs pas ni sems kyi rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa nyid ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe conceptualization is not real‚Äù and so forth teaches that the nature of mind is the union.
